example:
Ulagu agase'wa'lapnn Sa'nal.
Yesterday he/she hired Sean.

meanings: to pay for the use of
example:

Lplusang ela'luteg na tujiw poqjiagnimuet.

Agnutg ta'n teliaqap wela'gwe'g.

Mali aq Sa'n agnutmajig.

Gi's nutman agnutmaqan?

Piel agnutmuatl Mali A'nnal ms't goqwei.

Agumegw na waqantewit, gatu mawwigapugsit.

Pas'g newgte' a'gwesn.

Ala aij talwi'tmn?

He/she charged me twenty dollars for helping me, but just so

Amujpa ms't wen nige' aja'sit.

Ula a'jela's'g ntawtig.

A'jelising na So'sepa.

Wen ta u't telia'jelpit?

Goqwei ta na a'jelpuguig?

Ula miti's a'jelpuguit.

a'jelteg.translation: It is in an unusual place
example:
Pata'uti a'jelteg.

Ula me' ajiglu'lg aq ala.
This is better than that.

Me' ula napui'gign ajiglu'sit je mu ala.
This photograph is better than that one.

Pilei a'jijgopilaqan nasa'tu.

A'jijgopilatl ugtue'ml.

A'jijgopilg npitn.

Na we'gwipugwelgl ajioqjeminn ula ajioqjeminaqsig!

Ajipjulatl gina'masinin.
He/she encourages him/her to study.

Ajipjutoq ula's'tn ms't goqwei.
He/she encourages everything to go well.

ajipugwennaji.translation: He/she has more of them than
example:

Tegen tepgunsenitl ajipuna'tew?

Uliajipuna'!
Happy Birthday!

Gisgug me' ajiwinjig je mu ulagu.
Today the weather is worst than yesterday.

Ula tap'tan me' ajiwinjit je mu ala igtig.
This potato is in worst shape than the other one.

Ta'sute'jig ajoqlue'jg.
How many perch did you catch?

Ala magasan eteg.
The store is there.

E'pit ala'latl unjann.
The woman has her child with her.

Wasueg ala'lugweg sipug.
The flower floats on the river.

Tia'm ala'lugwet qospemg.
The moose floats about in the lake.

Lpa'tuj alamatl ujjl.
The boy looks about for his father.

Ngij eliet alame's.
My mother goes to mass.

Gisigu alangualatl ugte'sipowml.
The old man peddles his horse.

Nugumij alanguat qame'g.
My grandmother shops in town (Campbellton).

Giju' alanguetoq ligpenign.
Mother peddles the basket.

Sa'n alangu'sit utapsun.
John sells his belongings.

Ula alapilaqan gesgugg.
This carrier is heavy.

Jugwa'tu ala alapilawemgewei.
Bring that stretcher.

Mijua'ji'j alapit.
The baby looks around.

Llui alapjit wen'ju'su'n.
Louis has an apple in his hand.

Maltele's alapt'g magot.
Theresa looks (shops) around for a dress.

Ngwis ala'q qospemg.
My son swims about at the lake.

Plasua alaqami'g nipugtug.
Frank snowshoes in the woods.

Talui'tut na jipji'j alaqsing?

Pie'l na alaqsutoq na alaqsinm'gewei.
Peters is flying that plane about.

Alaqteget gta'nug.
He/she sails on the ocean.

alasenmat.translation: He/she goes about with a light
example:

Tgei ala'sit.
A cold (virus) is going around.

Alasugwet sisguigtug.
He/she wades in the mud.

Mu gejiam'g ta'n tleiawij na ala'suinu.

Wastewigtug alasumteget.
He/she wades through the snow.

Ntus glapis alateja'sit.
My daughter is finally walking around.

Mijipjewei tepiaq ala'toq.
He/she has enough food with him/her.

Alawe'l wisugwanej.
Let's cook (for ourselves) some peas.

Nugu'gisgu'wei, tesiegsitpu'g amujpa amawe'jitl wesua'tuann.

alawlalatl.translation: He/she is carrying someone on his back
example:

alawlatg.translation: He/she is carrying everything on his back
example:

alawlet.translation: He/she is carrying on his/her back
example:

algltaqanatl.translation: He/she walks about with him on a leash (as a dog)
example:

algwiluatl.translation: He/she is looking about for him/her/it
example:

meanings: go about bent over with buttocks up
go about with buttocks stuck out
example:
Aligjo'gwet ta'n tujiw mewisij.
He/she bend's over when he/she picks berries.

N'mijgamij ali'puluet.
My grandfather is horseback riding.

Alisgatg apt'sqi'gn.
He/she feels around for the key.

Alisqopatl pgu'l.
He/she chews gum.

alisqotg.translation: He/she chews it in his mouth
example:

He/she chews meat.

Amalgewinu alja't.

E'n'gaq alje'maqanaq.

Ge' ala alje'maqanatgw jugwasga'tui.

So'sep pegising'p aq pejialje'map.
Joseph arrived and came to play ball.

Taluisit ala alje'muinu?

So'sep gneg allugwet.
Joseph works in different far away locations

Tami eteg Almamgug?

Ula apaqtugewa'j na alman.

Awanta'si ta'n teluisipnaq na almana'giewa'jo'q Listugujg
i'ale'g'pnaq.

Listuguj.

Alman'tiew pegising.

Jel tmg anmimatl gesgmnaq tewegegw.

alm'stapueg.translation: It shriveled up from soaking in liquid
example:

alm'stapuet.translation: He is shriveled up from soaking in the water

example:

He/she is feeling around in the dark.

alnatl.translation: He/she carries him/her/it about by hand
example:
Erika gesatg alnaj uggajuewjml.

Ngwe'ji'j alo'tasit.

Gajuewj alpatl apigji'jl.

Jo'wio'q na mawigsatg'p alqatg.

Paqo'si alqo'qweg.

E'pite'ji'j alqo'qwet.

Wi'gatign als'g.

Ugti'l alsumatl.

altugwa't.translation: He/she goes about making the sound of footsteps

Aluapt'g ugtoqon.

aluasa'sit.translation: His/her shadow/spirit fades in and out
meanings: fade in and out of view
example:

He/she finds his/her work unsatisfactory.

Ge' angam alugg.

Lmu'j aluggwalatl So'sepal.
The dog follows Joseph around.

Aluggwatg utlugowaqan.
He/she follows his/her work.

Me' gatu gisgug alugwiaq.

Uggwitl alu'latl.
He/she rows his/her mother around.

A'lulatl  pastungewa'tl.
He/she guides an American.

Nji'nmum alu'sat.

amalamatl.translation: He/she thinks he/she looks too weak

amalapt'g.translation: He/she thinks it looks too weak

Nape'wl amaligsatl.

Nata'amalisgnuet.

He/she decorates his/her shirt.

Amallugwatg ugtoqon.

Weliamallugweg na gmulinji'jm.

Mali gesatg amallugwej.

Lpa'tuj amalsawet.

Giju' amaltaqa'latl miti'sl.
Mother decorates the tree.

Amaltaqa'taqan nasi's'g.

Amaltaqa'toq ugtoqon.

amaltaqi'satl.translation: He/she sews a design on him
example:

amaspit.translation: He/she/it is close by but out of immediate reach

example:

amasteg.translation: It is close by but out of immediate reach
meanings: close by but out of immediate reach
example:

a'megenatl.translation: He/she rubs him with rubbing compound
example:

He/she rubs rubbing compound on his/her child.

A'megen'g muino'mi.
He/she rubs it with bear grease.

Negm a'megenusit.
He/she rubs on him/herself.

Amgwesewa'jui lugwatmn (u)la glusuaqn.

amig'pistaqanat.translation: He/she is somewhat hard of hearing
example:

Ula epsaqtejg amip'sit.

Amip'teg lamugwomg.

Ngij amipulg npisun.

Egwija'sit sisguigtug aq amipusit.

Gajuewj amiputoq ugsuguni.

Amisisguapua'q samqwan gisgug.

Amitge'g egsitpu'g.

Amitgig ula mijipjewei.
This food is a bit cold.

amitgit.translation: This item is a bit cold
example:
Ula pu'tai amitgit.
This bottle is bit cold.

Amjaqa'latl Jonial sisgu.
He/she smears Johnny with mud.

Mijuaji'j amjaqa'lsit sisgu.
The baby smears him/her self with mud.

Pasiamjaqamat pasgoqsign.
He/she spreads on a thick layer of jam (for himself/herself).

Giju amjaqamuatl pipnaqan.
Mother spreads bread for him/her.

Amjaqamu'g ula msaqtaqt.
This floor is a mass of colours.

Nti amjaqamugsit.
My dog has mixed colors.

Amjaqatl pentl.
He/she spreads on the paint.

Negm pasi amjaqq pipnaqan.
He spreads it thick on the bread.

Amjaqto'sit weljema'qewei.
He/she is dabbing himself/herself with the stuff that smells good.

Gisigu amjepit.
The old man is tipsy.

Amjimoqpit ugmutputimg.
He/she is stuck in his/her chair.

Mutputi amjimoqteg ga'qanigtug.
The chair is stuck in the doorway.

amjimoqtesg.translation: It is caught and is stuck
example:
Amjimoqtesg sitmug.
It is stuck on the shore.

Put'p amjimoqtesing tajigtug.

amjimoqwa'latl.translation: He/she gets someone/something animate that is lying down stuck
example:
Epite'ji'j amjimoqwa'latl ugtapsute'gann utepaqang..

Amjimoqwa'sit gejigiaq.
He/She is stuck in the corner.

amjimoqwa'toq.translation: He/she caused it to be stuck
example:
Amjimoqwa'toq utepaqan.
He/She gets his/her car stuck.

Tami wigultijig amqoqjaji'jg?
Where is the small toads habitat?

Ge' jugwasgnmui na mesgilg amqwan.
Please pass me that large spoon.

P'tew aq amqwanji'j jugwa'tuwi.
Bring the broth and a spoon to me.

Nutepaqan amsala's'g.
Something is wrong with my vehicle.

Ntue'm amsala'sit.
My pet acts up.

Gisigu'ji'j amsalimatl ute'piteml.
The old man insults his wife.

Ams'tg ta'n teliaq.
He/she hears some of what's going on.

Ams'tmat ta'n teliaq.
He/she hears a bit about what's happening.

Ams'tuatl etlewo'gwennitl.
He/She overhears the person speaking.

Gi's gi'l nemi't amu?
Have you ever seen a bee?

Apje'ji'jg amuwesusi nemitu.
I see a small beehive.

Amuj na teliaq.
It must be true.

Amujpa enmiei, muta gewisin.
I have to go home, because I'm hungry.

Ta'sute'jig anagwe'jg?
How many flounder did you catch?

Ula pata'uti anapig.
This table leans.

Ula l'sg'j tlimultew ta'n tltesgewetesg lien anapi'gang.
This map will tell you what route to take when you go to the bush
camp.

Anapiw qama'tu wasoqonmaqann.
Stand the candles to one side.

Gwitnigtug ma' newte' anapo gisgopa'tim'g.
In a canoe you can't sit on the one side.

Mijipjewei anawtig.
Food is inexpensive.

Anawtit na napuwi'gign.
That picture is not expensive.

Gaqi'sg anesga'latl witapal.
He/she often compromises his/her friend's safety.

Pesoqtesgmai, aq negm pas'g angamit.
I tripped and he/she just looked at me.

Angamsit plu'jaqamatigtug.
He/She looks at himself/herself in the mirror.

Angamsutiei pilei.
The mirror is new.

Angapt'g wi'g.
He/She looks at his/her house.

Telimatl, angita'si ge's mu gelusiwun!
He/she says to him/her, think before you speak!

Iga'toqop mesgi'g angita'suaqan gesgmnaq maja'sigw.
He/she put a lot of thought before he/she left.

Utepaqan ango'tg.
He/she takes care of his/her vehicle.

angua'latl.translation: He/she gives someone an additional amount
example:
Nesaigl angua'latl.
He/She gives him/her an extra three dollars.

Lola petgitmuit angua'taqan.
Lawrence sends me a little extra.

Angua'toq samqwan p'teweigtug.
He/she adds more water to the tea.

Tesigisg'g gijga' angu'lugutieg.
Everyday we do a bit of extra work.

He/she finds it (animate) unattractive, so he/she covers it (animate).

Anguna'toq ugtwi'gatign.
He/She covers her book.

anguopiga'toq.translation: He/she adds length to cord, yarn or string
meanings: add length to cord, yarn, string
example:
Anguopiga'tu jijglue'wjuapi muta pugjig qataqiatew.
I'll add yarn to the length becuase it will run out soon.

Wowgwis ugtanguoweim megwe'g.
The fox's fur is red.

Ugwe'ji'tl angweiwatl.
He/She takes care of his/her younger sister.

Ango'te'n mu gtangwisgaqanm jilo'tmu'n.
Be careful not to injure your wrist.

aniamugwet.translation: He/she is suffering for past wrongs
example:
Aniamugwet  ugjit  ugto'p'la'taqanm.
He/she is suffering for past wrongs

Aniapsuinu a'sutmat.
The penitent one prays.

Maltele's na aniapsuinu'sgw.
Mary Theresa is a missionary.

Aniapsu'latl pata'tegewinu'l.
He/She punishes the sinner.

Ansale'wit na aniapsuinu'sgw.
The female missionary is an angel.

An'stawe'g na mijua'ji'j.
That child is fragile.

an'stawite'lmatl.translation: He/she is unsure of its safety
example:
An'stawite'lmatl ugti'l awtigtug.
He/She fears for his/her dog's safety on the road.

an'stawite'tg.translation: He/she is unsure of it's safety
example:
Ugtawti an'stawite'tg.
He/She is unsure of his/her path.

An'stawpit na wasuego'q.
That flower pot is in an unsafe postion.

An'stawteg ta'n etllugwej.
He/she is working in an unsafe area.

Ansue'g pi'gunaluggw.
It's too bad it's cloudy (cirrus clouds).

Ansuite'lmatl witapal.
He/She feels sorry for his/her friend.

Ta'n gis tla'tegej ansuite'tg.
He/She feels bad about what he/she has done.

Ala antaguej na nitap.

An'taguejgwej teluisit Opra.
The black woman's name is Oprah.

Tami eteg antaguejue'gati?
Where is New Carlisle?

Sepei nemi'g'p antawe's masgwitug etlatalg.
This morning I saw a woodpecker eating on a white birch tree.

Ntwi'gatign apaja's'g.
My letter comes back to me.

Ula ntue'm apaja'sit.
There my horse came back.

Aitejoq apaja'toq nutmi'gn.
He/she just now brought back my ax.

Jijuaqa apajiaq.
Sometimes it comes back.

Apajigsua'latl ugteptaqann.
He/She takes his/her plate back.

Apajigsua'toq ugta'gwesn.
He/She takes his/her hat back.

Telta'siap teluen gti apajipet.
I thought you said your pet came back to life.

Welta'si ta'n teliapajitqwa'majig.
I'm glad their back together.

Apajuggwalatl witape'sgwl.
He/She follows his/her (female) friend back.

Gisigu apajuggwatg ugtawti ta'n wejiep.
The old man retraces his path.

Apalqaqamej mijit.
The chipmunk eats.

Glapis gatu apangimatl ugta'piml.
Finally he/she payed for his/her fishing net.

Sapo'nug na apangitatimg.
Tomorrow is pay day.

Apangitg wela'gwewei.
He/She pays for supper.

apangituatl.translation: He/she gives a payment to him
example:
Susan apangituatl Pie'lal.
Susan pays Peter.

Ge' nmisge'n apangituowei?
Could you go and get the payment?

Gltaqpil na a'papi.
Tie that rope.

A'papi'j ge' jugwa'l?
Would you bring the thread?

Put'p wigit apaqtug.
The whale lives in the sea.

Apaqtugewa'j pejimitugwet.
A European is here for a visit.

Pe'apaqtu'jg etliusge'ap.
I'll fish a short way from the shore.

Pe' gmetug iga'tu na apataqan ugjit wela'gewei.
Put aside that saved portion for the evening meal.

Apatgimatl magasang.
He/She sends him/her back to the store.

Ngij apatgitg mutputi.
My mother sends the chair back.

Apatl'ga't wiguwaq.
He/She walks back home.

apatoq.translation: He/she sets a side a portion (of food)
example:
Ge' apatuap ula lusgnign ugjit Aligja'n.
Let me save this bannok for Alex John.

Gi's apatpa'q.
Already the tide is returning.

Tu'aqann apatta'tl.
He/She hits the ball back.

Apatte'g ta'n goqwei gisintoq.
He/She wins back what he/she lost.

Apatte'mat ugsuliewe'm.
He/She wins back his/her money (for himself/herself).

Lpa jini'w apattesg.
Suddenly it sprung back.

Apattesing ugwitl nemiaj.
He/She darts back when he/she sees his/her mom.

apatto'sit.translation: He/she wins back equal amount for him/herself
example:
Lola apatto'sit.
Lawrence breaks even.

We'gwimilia'petna's'g gisgug.
Well it's very gusty from different directions today.

Apgnualatl unjanji'jl.
He/She pacifies his/her child.

Ma'li apgwa'latl ugtue'ml.
Mary unties her dog.

Apgwa's'g ntmusue'im.
My kerchief becomes untied.

Apgwa'sit nti.
My dog becomes untied.

Apgwa'toq laqpisuti.
She unties the arpon.

Ge' waqama'l na a'pi.
Would you clean that net.

Gisgug a'pia'q Plasua.
Today Frank is fishing with a net.

a'piet.translation: He/she is fishing with a net
example:
Ngwis a'piet.
My son fishes with a net.

Nutat apigji'j?
Do you hear the mouse?

Apigjilu na maqtaweg aq wape'g .
A skunk is black and white.

Mali apigjilu'ta'tl umisl.
Mary skunks her older sister.

Apignajit na toqwaqji'jit tepgunset.
February is a short month.

Lola apigsigtuatl So'sepal.
Lawrence forgives Joseph.

Ula nitap a'pimit.
My friend has a net.

Nuel apipunsit nipugtug.
Noel returns from spending the winter in the woods.

Apistanewj mawglu'lg ugtanguowe'im.
The marten's fur (hide) is very good.

Msaqtaqt apitapueg.
The floor is waterlogged.
Lpa apitapueg ula anguowei.
This fur is waterlogged.

Apitapuet ula pga'wei eptaqan, wasamipgijgwijing samuqwanigtig.
This clay dish is waterlogged, it was in the water too long.

Pipnaqan etlitu apita'q.
The bread I'm making rises.

Gisigu wesamatalg na apita't.
If the old man eats to much he gets bloated.

Nmisge'n apita'taqan ta'n piteg eptaqano'guomigtug.
Get the baking powder that is in the cupboard.

Nitapo'q apja'sitaq qame'g
My friend stayed across the river

Apje'jg lugowaqan gisa'tu gisgug.
I've been able to accomplish little work today.

Apje'ji'jg amuesusi nemitu.
I see a small beehive.

Ntapsute'gan apje'ji'jit.
My doll is tiny.

Apje'jit na apsute'gan.
That doll is small.

apjelmit.translation: He/she is unable to stop laughing
example:
Giso'qon tan etlugwei, lpa apjelmultieg
It's fun where I work, we're always laughing.

Lltanej apjelmultimgewe'l.
Let's make outselves some rice.

Apoqonmui, apjigu'niei.
Help me, I'm bleeding to death.

Musigisg'tug apji'jgmuj alaqsing.
The black duck flies in the sky (above).

apjimatl.translation: He/she causes someone to be speechless
example:
Gisgu'sgw apjimatl maljewe'jl.
The old woman left the youngster speechless.

apjimt'g.translation: He/she is unable to stop crying
example:
Ewle'jit, pana apjimt'g.
Poor him/her, he/she can't stop crying.

meanings: out of breath (as a result of a tantrum)
example:
Enm'no'geg glapis apjitoq.
He/she coughs until he's/she's out of breath.

Apjiw menja'si asugom ajiet.
I always get up at six o'clock.

Ula magot apjoqji'jg.
This dress has a small waist.

Malg'lit apjoqji'jit.
Margaret is slender.

Apli'gmuj na apje'jit wi'sisji'j.
The rabbit is a small animal.

Na'n ajiet aq gi's aplugwet.
It's five o'clock and he/she is already back from work.

Ngwis pipnaqan apnmisg'g.
My son just returned from getting bread.

Nujj apnmisguatl nugumijl.
My father returns from getting my grandmother.

Apo'qatej wigit mitis'igtug.
The woodpecker lives in the trees.

Jiptug pugwelg apoqonmati msntew.
Hopefully he/she will get alot of help.

Awisiw nuta'j apoqonmatimg.
He/she seldom needs assistance.

E'pit apoqonmuatl unjann.
The womand helps her child.

App n'misge'n aps'sqate'gnn.
Go again to get some kindling

App igtig wennju'su'n jugwa'tui.
Bring me another apple.

Mali Ann apsa'latl ugtatla'ieml.
Mary Ann takes her shirt in.

Gimu'tug apsalqigwa'ji'jit na te'sipow.
That horse has somewhat small eyes.

Me' gatu apsalqigwat.
My, he/she has small eyes.

Emma, nuji'j apsalqutnat.
My granddaughter Emma has a small mouth.

Tuma apsa'toq wi'g.
Tom makes his house smaller.

Me' gatu apsatpat ula l'pa'tuj.
This boy has a small head.

Maljewe'j ntus me' aps'gilg aq uggwe'ji'tl.
My little daughter is smaller than her younger sister.

Nsuguis apsgu'lapa'sit aq angamit.
My aunt turns her head and looks at me.

Nga'sites ta'n etliapsgwitg.
Stop at the backwater.

Gisigu ji'nm apsigjat.
That old man has a small bum.

We'gwiapsiptnat na nussaqiget.
That sales clerk has very small hands.

apsi'satl.translation: He/she reduces the size of it/him/her by sewing
example:
Ngij apsi'satl ugtatla'ieml.
My mother takes in her shirt.

apsi's'g.translation: He/she makes it smaller by sewing
meanings: alter to smaller size by sewing
example:
Pe'l apsi's'gp ula a'pi.
I'll sew the net smaller for now.

Lpa tewji apsisgnuet ula e'pit.
This woman's knits very small stitches.

Mijua'ji'j apsisqonat.
The baby has a small nose.

apso'qonigatat.translation: He/she has small legs in girth
example:
Ala gagamit apso'qonigatat.
That one standing over there is slim legged.

aps'sas'g.translation: It is cut into small pieces
example:
Aps'sas'g na ula pipnaqan
This bread is cut into small pieces.

aps'satl.translation: He/she cuts it (fish) into small pieces
example:
Pa'tlig aps'satl plamu'l.
Patrick cuts the salmon into smaller pieces.

aps'sg.translation: He/she cuts it into small pieces
example:
Sulian aps'sg wi'us.
William cuts the meat into small pieces.

Gimu'tug aps'sitat negm.
He/she has smallish feet.

Nitape'sgw etliaps'sqate'get.
My girlfriend is chopping kindling.

Aps'te'g llutaqanatgw.
He/she cuts down the size of the fence post.

A'sisiwnaqaia na aps'tgu'j.
Jump over that narrow stream.

Ntus e'nata ugtapsute'ganna.
My daughter has lost her doll.

Ap'tapegiejit na taltoqsit?
What sound does a turkey make?

aptapjiet.translation: He/she is unable to release a hold
example:
Lpa aptapjiet uttmi'gn.
He/she couldn't let go of the axe.

Mise'l aptaqanet ta'n tujiw pegising.
Mitchell is starved when he arrives.

Aptaqatk nu'gu' pastung.
He/she basically lives permanently in the U.S.

Neli ma'muniw aptegwat.
Nelly has alot of freckles.

Lpa suel aptlama'latl ugjignaml.
He/she almost smothers his/her younger brother.

Epsaqtejgl gepsoqta'teg, na aptlama'toq pugtew.
When he/she closed the draft on the stove, it smothered the fire.

Mawi aptlamig  nate'l.
It is very stuffy there.

Pugtewigtug suel etliaptlamit.
He/she almost sufficates in the fire.

Teligju's'g lpa aptlamsing.
It's so windy it takes his/her breath away.

Apigjilu'l nemiateg na aptluat.
When he/she saw the skunk he/she held his/her breath

aptoqwet.translation: He/she is holding on to something while walking
meanings: lean (by holding on to something) to walk
example:
Pemaptoqwet patawtigug.
He/she walks using the table as support.

apt'pugu'et.translation: He/she is unable to move while standing
meanings: unable to move while standing from standing too long
example:
Nuji'j Emma apt'pugu'et.
My grandchild Emma is stuck in place.

Apt'sqa'muatl Sapatisal.
He/she locks the door on Jean-Batiste.

Wela'gwe'g nignen apt'sqa'map.
Last night I locked my house .

apt'sqata'tl.translation: He/she locks him in or out
meanings: lock out with quick motion or accidentally
example:
Suel pejiapt'sqata'tl uggwitl.
He/she almost accidently locks his/her mother out.

apt'sqate'g.translation: He/she locks it in or out
meanings: lock out with quick motion or accidentally
example:
Gajue'wj apt'sqate'g.
I accidently lock out the cat.

apt'sqa'tl.translation: He/she locks him up or in
example:
Wenn Pie'lal gisiapt'sqa'tl?
Who locked in Peter?

Ento'q apt'sqi'gneg.
He/she has lost the key.

Apt'tesg ula ga'qan.
This door is stuck.

Apt'tesing ga'qanigtug.
He/she is stuck in the door.

apt'tesmatl.translation: He/she caused him to get stuck
example:
Mali umugsnn apt'tesmatl.
Mary gets her shoe stuck.

apt'testoq.translation: He/she causes it to get stuck
example:
So'sep gisiapt'testoq utepaqan niputug.
Joseph has gotten his car stuck in the woods.

Mutt gtaptu'n wanta'siw.
Don't forget your cane.

Apua'latl ugtue'ml.
He/she warms up his/her pet.

Apua'toq wi'us ugjit wela'gwewei.
He/she thaws out meat for supper.

Apugjig maita'tesnu.
We'll be leaving soon.

Apugsign na telui'tut muta pase'g ugtanguoweim elsita'j, na st'ge'
gisue'gl signn alnasg'g.
The name of a lynx apparently comes from the fact that it has thick
fur on its soles, so it is like wearing warm socks.

apu'jenatl.translation: He/she warms him by body heat
example:
Apu'jenatl unjann.
He/she keeps his/her child warm (with his/her body).

apu'jeng.translation: He/she warms it by using body heat
example:
Apu'jenm a'su'n ugjit nnjan.
I warm a blanket (with my body heat) for my child.

apu'satl.translation: He/she warms him/her/it by applying heat
meanings: warm up by using body heat
example:
Negm apu'satl umijgamijl.
He/she warms up his/her grandfather.

Pe'l etliapu's'man npitnn.
I'm warming up my hands.

Aputasga'latl ugwe'ji'tl.
He/she turns his/her little sister up side down.

Nuji'j aputasga'toq pata'wti.
My grand child turns the table upside down.

M'st goqwei aputasgiaq.
Everything is up side down.

Tetujimamunelmit lpa aputasgiet.
He/she laughed so hard he/she fell backwards.

aputasgigwalatl.translation: He/she turns him over using a tool
example:
Aputasgigwalatl miti'sl.
He/she uproots the tree.

aputasgigwatg.translation: He/she turns it over using a tool
example:
So'sep aputasgigwatg t'pgwan.
Joseph turns over the soil.

Ge'sg etliewsitutg na aputasg'tesing.
While showing off he/she flips over.

Gisgug aq sapo'nug.
Today and tomorrow.

Tami tle'iawit ula aqalasie'w?
Where is this Englishman from?

aqalasie'wimatl.translation: He/she says it to him in English
example:
Nnu aqalasie'wimatl wenujl.
The Indian person answers the French person in English.

Aqalasie'wi'sit gisna piluei tli'suti etlie'w'g?
Is he/she speaking English or is he/she speaking a different
language?

Pile'g aqamug gisi'gig, nige' najialaqami'm.
I made new snowshoes, now I'm going snowshoeing.

Gwilu aqamoq welpegoqsit.
Look for a white ash that is nice and striaght.

Glu'lt's na nige' giswe'jituas aqamoqwe'gati.
It would be good for me to find a white ash grove.

Aqantie'umg na atlasmu'ltimgewei na'gweg.
Sunday is a day of rest.

Maita'nej ula aqantie'uti wejgu'aq.
Let's leave this coming week.

Aqantie'wit, a'sutmat newtigisg'g.
He/she observes Sunday, he/she prays all day.

A'qataig nngatign pgwatele'n.
Buy half a pound.

A'qatapit  na ula nitap.
My friend here is half-cut.

Aqatatpa't na ula.
He/she is foolish.

N'mis aqawigalit.
My older sister hides me.

Ta'woqwei algwinmn na aqawigatg.
What you look for is what he/she hides.

Mali, aqjigateg gwile'n.
Mary, look for shade.

aqtamgiaq.translation: It is piled half way with something dry
example:
Aqatamgiaq pas'g na gtul.
That boat of yours is only half full.

aqtamgiet.translation: It is piled half way with something dry
example:
Aqtamgiet wape'jgo'q.
The flour container is half full.

Ula je mu aqtapenug, amujpa iligujua'tu'gw.
This isn't even half full (of liquid), we have to refill it.

Aqtapet ula la'taqsun.
This pail is half full.

Aqtatpa'qewei alame's elien?
Are you going to the midnight mass?

Siwawsi, glapis gtawti inaqaneg aquoqomgwa's'gtetew.
Keep going until your road veers to the right.

Ala' nipugtug enmiaquoqomgwa'sitaq.
He/she goes out of sight (in that turn) in the woods.

Wi'g eteg pas'g gis pmtesgmn aquoqomqeg.
His/her house is located just past the bend.

aqupit.translation: He/she is sitting somewhere and is hidden from view
example:
Aqupit ta'n emgopa'sij.
He/she sits where he/she is hidden.

Aquteg ta'n etlwesgej.
He/she fishes in a hidden area.

Asamaja'latl na ula ugtatlai'ml.
He/she did up his/her shirt fancily.

Malsusan asamaja'toq wi'g.
Mary-Susan really beautifies her house.

Ma' wenn tlimigw ni'n asamajei.
No one would tell me I'm overly fussy.

Asamatteg wi'g.
His/her house is fancy.

A'se'g eteg ta'n goqwei algwilmn.
What you're looking for is in the other room.

A'sei mawteg ugjit nanai'gl.
The other room is included for five dollars.

Pie'l asgaiwatl umisl.
Peter hurts his older sister's feelings.

Nti asgaja't, mu gejiaq ta'n wejiet.
My dog is limping, I don't know where he came from.

Me newgte' teli asga'sit.
He/she still walks with a limp.

Asgate'lmatl ugtusl.
He/she spares his/her daughter's feelings.

Nti gis(i)nisiet, na nige' asgatesing.
My dog fell, now he walks with a limp.

A's'gg ta'n goqwei elaqtuj.
He/she meets whatever is thrown at him/her.

Ntus as'gom tetuje'g.
My daughter is six.

Pugwelgl na, as'gom te'sisga'q te's'gl.
There's alot, there are sixty of them.

Tetujimilo'tg na utepaqan, pas'g asgo'tg.
He/she tinkers with his/her car so much that he/she harms it.

Najia's'guatl ta'n tujiw oqwa'nij.
He/she goes to meet him/her when he/she arrives.

Lpa'tuj asigetg.
The boy instigates trouble.

Asimatl o'pla'tegennin.
He/she encourages him/her to do wrong.

Ne'gasgi'gn telimsegilg amujpa a'sisapegultieg.
The log was so big we had to crawl over it.

Ta'pit a'sisa'sit ala tett.
David goes across (over something) over there.

A'siseget a'gusn llutaqanigtug.
He/she throws the hat over the fence.

Lpajaq mu goqwei, pa nti a'sisiwnaqialit.
Just like nothing, my dog jumped over me.

Gisia'sisiwnaqiatmann wasuegl awtigtug.
I just jumped over some flowers on the road.

Gi's a'sispit na ta'n goqwei.
He/she is already sitting across that thing.

a'sisteg.translation: It is on top of something
example:
Ugtllutaqanm a'sisteg ntiga'taqanmg.
His/her fence is crosses over onto my yard.

Nugu' na wasmiasita'teget.
Enough already, he/she has wreaked too much revenge.

Giju' asiteglulatl nujjl.
My mother replys to my father.

Mu asitemagul geluluteg.
He/she didn't answer when he/she was spoken to.

L'pa asoqomapegit awti.
He/she actually crawled across the road.

Tlia' tmig, asoqoma'q.
Even if it's deep, he/she swims across.

Pompetir asoqoma's'g mgumigtug gesig.
The Bombardier crosses the ice in the winter.

Giju' asoqoma'sit natanguat.
Mom goes across to shop.

Ta'n tujiw niweteg lpa wen gisiasoqomasugwet glapis qame'g.
When the tide is low a person can wade right across the river.

Pie'l asoqomigsma'latl witapal.
Peter pushes his buddy across.

Asoqomigsma'tu'n gtul?
Are you pushing your boat across?

Jaqaliasoqomi'pit ugjit mlageju'mi.
He/she quickly runs across (to Campbellton) for some butter.

Gi's sa'q gi'aspie'was'g asoqomm'taqan ula tet.
It's been a long time since a ferry was used here.

Gmu'j asoqomoqtesg awtigtug.
The wood falls across the road.

Nitap asoqomoqtesing awtitug.
My buddy falls across the road.

Asoqo'mutaqan i'asua's'g'p tet aq qame'g.
The ferry used to cross back and forth from here to Campbellton.

Tuma asoqomu'teget nige'.
Tom ferries across now.

Assma nige' si'st ajiet.
It's now exactly three o'clock.

Alsusit teluisit Maliann.
The boss' name is Mary Ann.

A's'tuo'guomg etlmalie'wijig.
They are getting married at the church.

Asoqo'mutaqan asua's'g tet aq qame'g.
The ferry goes back and forth between here and the other side of 
the river.

Negm elugwet qame'g, na te'sigisg'g asua'sit.
He/she works in town so he/she goes back and forth daily.

a'sugwesugwijig.translation: They meet on water by rowboat
example:
Qospemji'jg etlia'sugwesugwijig.
They row towards each other at the small lake.

Mesgi'g a'su'n weja'tu's'p?
Did you buy a big blanket?

Wigwow gisnu'gwa'q, amujpa a'su'ngewujig.
Those whose home has burned down must be provided for.

Newtitpa'q pas'g telugwet asu'set.
All night he/she has done nothing but pace back and forth.

Me' gatu asu'tesg'g na ga'qan!
Is he/she ever going back and forth through that door frequently!

asu'tesguatl.translation: He/she kicks him/her/it back and forth
example:
Mali asu'tesguatl tu'aqann iga'taqanigtug.
Mary kicks the ball back and forth in the field.

Tegen a'sutmaqan majulgwatg?
What religion does he/she follow?

Gelu'lg wen egsitpu'gl a'sutmaj.
It's good to pray in the mornings.

A'sutmessewatg ms't goqwei ula's'tn.
He/she prays that all goes well.

Ngij a'sutmessewatl witapal.
My mother prays for her friend.

Goqwei tana a't?
What is that?

Atapaqatl ugtapsute'gann gelusinnitl.
He/she winds his/her talking doll.

So'sep atapaqq na'gusetewei.
Joseph winds the clock.

Atel nige' pegising.
She/he has just arrived.

Ejele'g, atgigwa't na wen gisigu'wej.
It can't be helped, one gets wrinlkes as they age.

Lpa sangew atgigwati'l pempugwelgl nsisgug.
Slowly my face is getting more wrinkled.

Atgitemit ta'n tujiw milpuwitegej.
He/she cries whenever he/she has weird dreams.

So'sep atgitemu'latl ugwe'ji'jl.
Joseph makes his kid sister cry.

Na tmg weliatgnewit, toqo tujiw gespu'tuit.
First he/she gives me a fine hand, then he/she defeats me.

Wen atgnewet nige'?
Who deals now?

Najiatie'wit ugsugwisg.
He/she goes to say good-bye at his/her aunt's.

Atiu telimg gesgmnaq maja'siw.
I said good-bye to him/her before I left.

Tami epit na mesgilg atlai?
Where is the large shirt?

Gisgug Pie'l atlaia'q.
Today Peter wears a shirt.

Mu atlaimigw ula gitapenu.
Our friend does not have a shirt.

Pe' nige' atlasmit.
For now he/she rests.

E'pit atlasmu'latl unjann.
The woman rests her child.

Atlasmu'teget gesgmnaq siawa'sigw.
He/she takes a rest period before continuing.

A'se'g eteg pilei atla'wegn.
The new fabric is in the other room.

Nujjo'q i'gu'gung'pnn gaqismilamu'gl atnamgewe'l.
My father used to own all sorts of checker games.

Jugwa'l atnaqang.
Bring the checkers.

Tami epit na atnaqanei?
Where is the checker board?

Atnaqan wi'gas'g pata'utiawegn.
The table cloth is checkered.

Atnaqan wi'gasit pilei atla'i.
The checkered shirt is new.

Atnat gisna lasgugwet?
He/she plays checkers or cards?

Toqwa'q mawimgeto'jig atoqwa'su'g.
A lot of trout are caught in the fall.

Mali Ann aq Pita atoqwa'sue'gejig sipuigtug.
Mary Ann and Peter fish for trout at the river.

E'pit atpi'sewatl unjann.
The woman changes her child's diaper.

Attigna's'g newgt poqtlugweg.
It works hard once it gets started.

Wesamiattigna'sit ula nitap ta'n tujiw elugwej.
My friend strains too much when he/she works.

Gnjan nata' atuasgwa'q?
Does your child know how to swim on his/her back?

Ngwis atuasgweitesing msaqtaqtug.
My son falls backwarks on the floor.

atuasgwesing.translation: He/she is lying on his/her back
example:
Npo'qonigtug atuasgwesing etl giljet.
He/she is lying on the bed reading.

Gelulg a'tugwaqan gis wi'g'g.
He/she has written a good story.

Ala ji'nm mawinta'a'tugwet.
That man is a very good story teller.

Nmijgamij a'tugwewip wela'gwe'g.
My grandfather told me a story last night.

Wejgwa'tegemgeg a'tugwewinu wesgu'tg.
The story teller is speaking about the past.

Tami we'jitness megwe'g atuomg?
Where would one find red sand?

Newtigisg'g mewisi ugjit atuomgoming.
I have been picking strawberries all day.

Atu'tuej ali'pit miti'sigtug.
The squirrel scurries around in the tree(s).

atu'tuejui'sit.translation: He/she imitates the sounds of a squirrel
meanings: imitate the sounds of a squirrel
example:
Getu'atu'tuejui'si.
I want to make squirrel sounds.

Ntlugowinu awana'qiet.
My employee is not able to do his/her job.

Gimu'tug awane'g pas na amgwes tellugwet.
He/she is a bit awkward but it's his/her first time.

awaneiwatl.translation: He/she is awkward in handling someone
example:
Awaneiwatl na ugtue'ml.
He/she is awkward with his/her pet.

Negm na telue's'p awane'jit?
Was it him/her that you said is unskilled?

Tegen na telimi's'p awangiljet?
Which one was it that you told me couldn't read well?

Mawiawaniwsgei na ni'na.
I am a terrible fisher.

Awanlugwet na ula gisi agase'wa'loq.
This new employee doesn't work well.

Awanmila'sit na nujo'mugwet.
That pitcher plays poorly.

Awano'tm pilei mulinji'j.
I am awkward with the new sewing machine.

Alsusit awanta'sit apangituin.
The boss forgets to pay me.

Mesge'i, suel awanta'sualul.
I'm sorry, I almost forgot about you.

Ugta'gwesn gisiawanta'suatg.
He/she has forgotten his/her hat.

Mut e'waw awa'qi'gn pipnaqan tems'mn.
Dont' use a crooked knife when you slice bread.

Wasitpa'q tepgunset awialusing welnmu't.
On a clear night one can see the halo around the moon.

Awije'jg gelu'lg malipqwanj we'jitmg.
One rarely finds a good hazelnut.

Awije'jit ta'n getu'tlugwet na.
There are few who would want to do that kind of work.

Na ala'suinu awisiw pegising.
That traveler seldom comes here.

Ngijaq majasitaq, awna ni'n nagalimg.
My mother has left, instead I am left behind (by accident).

Tapu'gl awti'l a's'gatigl.
Two roads meet.

Awtigetmnej tajigo'ti.
Let us make a path towards health.

Gmetug eteg awti'j majulgwate'n.
Follow the path along the side.

Awtin ta'n tellugwatmn ula?
Are you being paid for doing this?

E'e, egsitpu'gewei gisgatteg.
Yes, breakfast is ready.

Ege'l na igeggwet.
Once in a while something comes over him/her.

Newtitpa'q na egiljeieg.
We read all night.

Ms't wenn egimatl.
He/she counts everyone.

A'tugwaqann egitgl nujigina'muet.
The stories are read by the teacher.

Te'siegsitpu'g egsitpugwatal.
Every morning I eat breakfast.

Wigapu'g ula egsitpu'gowei gisitu.
This breakfast I've made tastes good.

Sapo'nug egsitpugwatalultitesnen ngijg.
Tomorrow we will eat breakfast at my mother's.

Wi'tmui ne'sisgl egsitpu'gwatalmgewe'l.
Name three breakfast foods.

Egsitpu'gwewulgw oqwa'q na'n ajiet.
The morning train gets in at five a.m.

egsitpugwiet.translation: He/she rises early in the morning
example:
Gi'l egsitpugwien te'siegsitpu'g?
Do you get up early every morning?

Nmu'ltes egsitpu'nug.
I'll see you tomorrow morning.

Etlite'lmg egs'pugua'lit.
I think he/she is lying to me.

Mu telianug ta'n teluej, egsuet.
What he/she says is not true, he/she is lies.

Mu getu'nutmuann egsuo'qonn.
I don't want to hear lies.

Usgewinu eguma'toq ugtul.
The fisher anchors his/her boat.

Tami egumig utul?
Where is your boat anchored?

egumit.translation: He/she is on a boat that is anchored
example:
Egumit ta'n etlwesget.
He/she is anchored where he/she is fishing.

egwija'latl.translation: He/she immerses him/her into the water (or liquid)
example:
Eptaqang egwija'laji samqwanigtug.
He/she puts the dishes in the water.

Pe' egwija'tuap na ntul.
Let me put my canoe in the water.

egwijatpa'latl.translation: He/she dips his/her head into the water
meanings: dip the head into the water (or liquid)
example:
Egwijatpa'l'sg ta'n tujiw gusapunn gesispa'tasg.
He/she puts your head into water when he/she washes your hair.

Mali gesatg egwijing samqwanigtug.
Mary likes to be in the water.

Te'siegsitpu'g etlgwitamei sitmug.
Every morning I fish from the shore.

Gi's ntul egwitg sitmug.
My boat is already in the water down at the shore.

Eig negm ugt'pung.
He/she is at his/her seat.

ejaqan'jetesgmat.translation: He/she wears out him/her shoes on one side
meanings: wear out shoe(s) on one side
example:
Ula gisigu pemiet ejaqannjetesgmat.
This old man going along wears down his shoes on one side.

Witapal gaqi'sg ejaqjematl
He/she often belittles his/her friend.

Wijei teliejaqjepit st'ge sqolj.
He/she squats just like a frog.

ejela'latl.translation: He/she has no control over someone
meanings: in no position to do otherwise
example:
Ejela'latl nugu' gisimaja'snnita.
He/she can't help him/her, he/she has left already.

ejela'teget.translation: He/she has no control over it
example:
Ejela'teget, gatu mu gis taliapoqonmuagul witapal.
He/she can't control it, but he/she can't help his/her friend in
anyway.

ejela'toq.translation: He/she has no control over it
example:
Ejela'tu, maja'si pugjig.
I can't help it, I'm leaving soon.

Ta's'gl ejgujgl gisipgwatelmnn?
How many pumkins did you buy?

Gi's newtiwela'gw ejgwe'mat.
He/she has been sobbing all evening.

Mawsiwa'lig na ta'n tujiw ejgwi.
I find it really tiresome when I hiccup.

Mu nemiaq ta'n telapewij, ejigla'go'jing.
I can't see what he/she looks like, his/her face is turned away.

Goqwei wejijigla'let?
Why are you taking him/her away?

Qospemewei mn'tn ejiglamugwiet.
The Lake Mountain fades into the distance.

Ejiglaqsingaq na ula ntplawejmaq.
My partridge has flown away.

Ejigla'sin gisna siawqatmn?
Are you going away or are you staying?

Amuj wegaiugtuit, telgigja'sianeg lpa smtug ejiglateja'sit.
He/she must be angry with me, as soon as I got near he/she
quickly moved away.

Ge'l angam telpugwelg t'pgwan ejigla'toq.
Look at how much gravel he/she is taking away.

Gjitmei ejiglegen na tu'gwesmunei?
Are you really throwing out that pillowcase?

Ejigligsma'latl uggwe'ji'tl.
He/she pushes his/her younger sister away.

Ejigligsmaqals'g ge's pemtugwi'g.
He/she shoves you aside as he/she runs by.

Ejigligsma'toq wilu, muta mu gewisinug.
He/she pushes his/her food away, because he/she is not hungry.

Ejigliwsit ugjit lugowaqan.
He/she moves away because of work.

Ejiglsing'p na nipi gesgmnaq gisapsgnaqeg.
That leaf was blown away before I could catch it.

E'pite'ji'j ejiglta'tl gajuewjl.
The little girl drives away the cat.

Ejiglte'g ta'n te's'g goqwei.
He/she swats away every single thing.

Ala' Pie'l enm'gopit, jel ejiglu'jing.
There sits Peter facing away from us, even bent away.

Ejinpi ta'n pemgopi.
Where I'm sitting is at a low location.

Wesamiejinteg na mutputi, ma' goqwei nmitu.
That chair is too low, I won't see anything.

Ejipewe'g aq wejipeg na wijei ta'n wett'g.
Easterly breeze and easterly wind blow from the same direction.

Tami e'jnt etlugwet?
Where does the agent work?

Jo'j ejoqjematl gesgmnaq gaqewo'gwegw.
George interrupts him/her before he/she finishes speaking.

ela'gipulatl.translation: He/she cuts him/her with a saw
example:
Ta'sijig lasqo'plaq ela'gipulaji?
How many boards is he cutting?

ela'gittoq.translation: He/she cuts it with a saw
example:
Tlimi, goqwei getu'ela'gittoq?
Tell me, what does he/she want to saw?

Amujpa ela'gwi'tegep ta'n ma' wenn migutesguagul.
He/she had to steer to where he/she would not hit anyone.

Ta'n ela'gwi'tm mu' getu' lianug.
It doesn't go in the direction I steer it toward.

Lpa pisuiw ela'gwi'tmuatl.
He/she steered towards him/her for no reason.

Ulo'nug nte'pitem ela'lit bingo.
Tonight my wife is bringing me to bingo.

Anguna'tu tami elalqeg nemitun.
Cover any holes that you see.

Nsugwis elamgo'lajig la'sgug te'siula'gw.
My aunt plays soliatire every night.

Gisgug elamgo'toql pugsugl.
Today he/she stacks wood.

Nugumij mawinta'pisoqila'muet.
My grandmother usually piles the food on the plate.

elangu'sit.translation: He/she goes somewhere to peddle something
example:
Nuvelg elangu'sitaq.
He/she has gone peddling in Nouvelle.

Elanqaiejit na wejiet wennjitia'm ugtlaminug.
Tripe comes from a cow's stomach.

Elanqate'g ligpeta'w ugjit ligpenigenn.
He/she beats white ash into strips for baskets.

meanings: to use for the first time(slang)
example:
Pa'tlia's elapalatl mijua'ji'tl ta'n tujiw signntuaj.
The priest blesses the child when he/she baptizes him/her.

So'sep elapaqta'tl uggwe'ji'jl.
Joseph splashes his younger sister.

Ango'te'n elapaqte'mn aligew gispateg.
Be careful about splashing the dry clothing.

elapaqtesmatl.translation: He/she marks with a chalk line
example:
Elapaqtesmatl ugtapiml ta'n etlwesgej.
He/she throws in his/her line where he/she is fishing

Pisgwa'l'g atoqwa'su te's elapaqtestegei.
I bring in a trout each time I cast a line.

Mu gesispa'tug goqwei, pas'g elapaqto'sit.
He/she didn't wash anything, he/she only splashed his/herself.

meanings: to use for the first time(slang)
example:
Elapatu pilei ntul.
I'm taking my new boat on it's first outing.

Elapetesinaneg mu eimugwaq.
When I glanced over he/she wasn't there.

Tlimi, tami elapin?
Tell me, where are you looking?

elapte'g.translation: He/she walks toward with a cane
example:
Amujpa elapte'matew natgowei puatg.
He/she will have to walk there with his/her cane if he/she wants
something.

Patlig elaptoq wiguwaq.
Patrick's foot prints lead to his house.

E'e, gi's gisite'tm ta'n wen elapuguei.
Yes, I have already decided whom I will vote for.

Ne'gaw telimimg ngij elaq.
I've always been told I resemble my mother.

So'sep ela'q qame'g.
Joseph swims to the other side.

Musigisg'tug elaqalatl tu'aqann.
He/she throws the ball up in the air.

meanings: play for (in cards and board games)
example:
Elaqalsewatl ugjignaml aq gaqi'ntuaj ugsulieweim.
He/she is playing his/her brother's hand and has lost all his money.

Unjann elaqpilatl muta wesamglmuejuwig.
He/she shields his/her child (with a cloth) because there are so
many mosquitoes.

Tuop'ti'l elaqpilgl.
He/she covers the windows.

Elaqpit naqsun n'npo'qoneg.
A bed sheet is spread out on my bed.

Elaqpo'l'gig nmugsng.
I lace-up (tie) my shoes.

Ngwis nige' nata'laqpo'teget.
My son now knows how to lace his shoes.

Goqwei tana elaqpo'tu'n?
What is it that you are binding?

Wi'gatign elaqs'g ntawtig.
Paper flies in my path.

Nuelewumg wiguwaq elaqsing.
At Christmas he/she files home.

Welaptm na a'su'n elaqteg gmpo'qoneg.
I like that blanket spread on your bed.

Elaqtoq wi'gatign maqamigeg.
He/she throws the letter on the ground.

Tami elasga'latl na p'teweio'ql?
In what direction is he/she passing that tea pot?

Inaqaneg elasga'toq pipnaqan.
He/she passes the bread to the right.

Pe'l egel igtigl pu'tail elasgnatl.
Every once in a while he/she hands over another bottle.

Elasgng mtawegn ugjipenug.
He/she points the flag to the east.

Tami elasugwet Pie'l?
Where is Peter wading to?

elasumteget.translation: He/she wades through the snow towards
meanings: wade through the snow towards by foot
example:
Elasumteget nipugtug.
He/she walks to the woods through deep snow.

Elateja'sit magasang.
He/she quickly walks to the store.

Magasang elatejimatl tepaqanigtug.
He/she pulls him/her to the store in the sleigh.

Elatejitoq tepaqanji'j ta'n etlmila'sij.
He/she drags the toy truck/car to where he/she is playing.

Ula lpatujg we'gwielatijig.
These boys really resemble one another.

Nige' wigwaq ela'toq ugtlugowaqan.
Now he/she is bringing his/her work home.

Elatpo'jing, getu'pa'qapt'g.
He/she cranes his/her neck, he/she wants to get a good look.

Elawigatas'gl Jnet gisa'toqol mawultegl.
Quillwork done by Jeanette are the best.

Gisgug nitap elawigateget, sapo'nug gisgatpitaq ntma'gnmg.
My friend is doing the quillwork today, I'll have my mocassins
tomorrow.

Tami elawlen telgi'g na pemapilmn?
Where are you carrying that large load to?

Naqsunn sangew elega'latl.
He/she slowly spreads the bedsheet.

Tuop'ti'l gisgattegl, elegepilewei nige'.
The windows are ready, now I drape them.

Ulo'nug mgumie'jg elagatieg.
Tonight we are playing (some games of) horseshoes.

Ge' gnua'tui ta'n goqwei elegetas'g?
Please tell me what is being raffled off?

Goqwei elegetu'n?
What are you raffling off?

Gi's gi'l mila'sin elege'wi'sgw ugjit pi'gaq?
Have you ever played the "queen of spades" game?

Lisa ugtiaq teluisinipnaq Elege'wi'sgwe'j.
Lisa's old dog was named Princess.

Elege'wit niganega.
Throw the king (card) first.

Nti telo'tasit st'ge' elege'witji'j.
My dog is treated like a prince.

Elego'l'g qasgusi msaqtaqtug.
I spread out cedar on the floor.

Nmis elego'toq wi'gatignei pata'utigtug.
My older sister spreads out paper on the table.

Telnutmamg natgoqwei gistliaq, na negem smtug elenqwe'setew.
Whenever we hear of something happening, he/she will be the first
one there.

Pugwelg gis'letqo'toq pisqa'taqanapi.
He/she has coiled a lot of chain.

E'e, elg gi'l lia.
Yes, you go too.

Elgesewen te'sipow e'w't?
When you plow, do you use a horse?

Elgesg ugtiga'taqan ugjit tap'tang.
He/she plows his/her field to plant potatoes.

Elgete'get gesgmnaq iga'taqug.
He/she hoes the ground before planting.

elg'g.translation: He/she causes a body part to be sore from being on it
meanings: cause soreness from sitting too long
cause body part to be sore (from being on it)
example:
Nmituaq ugsisgw, npa'ji'jitug tetuji(w) mawmunielg'g.
You should see his/her face, he/she must have been naping on it.

Tami elgimulg gi'l?
Where are you being sent to?

Elgimsgwet unpo'qoneg.
He/she sneaks to his/her (own) bed.

Tami elgitmn ula?
Where are you sending this?

Nujigina'muet pualultew elgo'jinn nigantug.
The teacher will want you to face toward the front.

Elgomigtuatl witapal gisinisieteg.
He/she called for assistanse from his/her buddy after his/her fall.

Nuji'j elgusuet nplaqaneg.
My grandchild climbs on my lap.

Mlagejg elguta'laji wowigtug.
He/she pours the milk into the pot.

elguta'tat.translation: He/she pours a drink for self
example:
Ugtejg negm wejilguta'tat.
He/she pours his/her drink last.

Ta's'g samqwan elguta'toq na'te'l?
How much water does he/she pour there?

Nutepaqan eliaq ta'n awti eliaq.
My vehicle goes where the road goes.

Negm eliatl apsute'gann.
He/she makes a doll.

Ta'nug eliet nipugtug?
When is he/she going to the woods?

eligjepilawet.translation: He/she makes the bottom of something
example:
Lipgnign eltmg amujpa tmg eligjepilawemg.
When making a basket one first has to assemble the bottom.

eligjipilg.translation: He/she weaves the bottom of something
example:
Amujpa tmg eligjipilg na ligpenign getuitoq.
He/she has to first weave the bottom of the basket he/she wants to
build.

Etlgi'gassiteg eligjo'gmuatl.
When he/she was teasing him/her, he/she stuck his/her buttocks at
him/her.

So'sep aq Mali'j eligpete'gejig.
Joseph and Mary are pounding the white ash into splints.

Lpa apjiw mtlu'tew ligp'ta'qt'tew wen ugsisgwgug.
Smoke will always go towards ones face.

meanings: liquid dripping down from an opening
example:
Tu'sati'jigtug eligua'laq.
Water is leaking into the enclosed porch.

La'taqsun eligua'lat msaqtaqtug.
The pail drips onto the floor.

Eligua'q mimgwaqanimusiei gmu'j.
The wood of the oak tree has grain.

Weliangamgug ta'n telieliguej na lasqo'plaw.
That is a nice looking grain on that board.

Eligwalaji glitaq gmetug.
He/she pushes the berries to the side.

Gisigu eligwatg wastew ntiga'taqang.
The old man pushes snow onto my field.

Eli'pi magasanji'jg mlagejg natelagig.
I'm rushing over to the varitey store to buy some milk.

Elipqama'tuaj piesgmin witapal.
He/she rolls an ear of corn to his/her friend.

Uggwe'ji'jl qame'g elipqamu'latl.
He/she slides his/her little sister across to the other side.

Utepaqan elipqamu'toq wiguwaq.
He/she slides his/her sled towards his/her home.

Eli'pugwet gigjiw pata'utigtug.
He/she staggers near the table.

Goqwei eliputoq wijinuwang?
What is he/she rubbing towards his/her cheeks?

Eli'satl ugtatli'ml.
He sews his own shirt./She sews her own shirt.

Wo'guma eli'sewaji.
He/she sews for his/her family members.

Nugumij eli'sewet, a'su'nn eltoqol.
My gradmother sews, she is making blankets.

Gi'l eli's'mn aligew.
You sew clothing.

Nsugwis teluet elisgnualatl gisu'e'nitl wesgitl.
My aunt says she is going to knit a warm vest.

Gelu'lg elisgnuaqan gisa'tu'n.
The knitting you have done is nice.

Mali elisgnuatg mesgi'g a'su'n.
Mary knits a large blanket.

Nsugwis elisgnuet tesigisg'g.
My aunt knits everyday.

Nige' elisqanapega'tu ula ligpenigen
Now I'll weave the base for this basket.

Elistmn jijuaqa gi'l!
You are so disobedient sometimes!

Elistuatl ujjl, na na'te'l glusuaqan ugjit Listuguj wejiaq.
He/she disobeys his/her father, that is where the word for Listuguj
comes from.

Tuma elisugwit gampigtug.
Tom paddles to the camp.

Gi's sa'q maligigegt, nige' elita'sitl witapal.
He/she has been teasing a long while, now he/she is counting on
his/her friend.

Mu negm wenn elita'sualagul.
He/she does not count on anyone.

Elita'suatm nsuliewe'im pisgwa'n gisgug.
I depend on my money coming in today.

eli'tuat.translation: He/she has a mustache or a beard
example:
Na ji'nm eli'tuat taluisit?
What is the name of that man with the beard?

Wasapeglawel eljaqatl uggwitnemg, glaman ma' nugu' espenug.
He/she spread spruce gum on his/her canoe, so it will stop the
leak.

Mlageju'mi eljaqq gogosigna'gwigtug.
He/she rubs butter onto the cake pan.

Mijua'ji'jg eltu'tij elmalqei.
The children make a hole.

Wowgwisuo'guomg elmalqe'ji'j wejipisgwa'timg.
The entrance to a fox's den is a small hole.

Te'sigisg'g mewlia'gowei enm'joqteg.
Everyday lunch is setout.

meanings: bent towards something but away from speaker
example:
Elmu'jing, ala elapit.
He/she is turned away, he/she is looking over there.

meanings: carry or pack on shoulder toward
example:
Unjann eln'galatl wigwaq.
He/she carries his/her child home (on his/her shoulders).

eln'gatg.translation: He/she carries it on  shoulder toward
meanings: carry or pack on shoulder toward
example:
Gi's ap tatat eln'gatg!
Again dad carries it on his shoulders!

Gneg eln'get ala e'pit.
That woman carries things for a long way on her shoulders.

Tami elo'lejig na lasqo'plaq?
Where are you putting those boards?

eloqomgiatg.translation: He/she fits a handle on something
example:
Ta'nug eloqomgiatmn ula ligpenigen?
When are you going to put a handle on this basket?

Nuelewumgewe'l miti'sl eloqomgwalatl.
He/she trims the Christmas tree to fit.

Pie'l na nata'eloqomgwatoql tmi'gnatgul.
Peter knows how to trim to fit axe handles.

Na pilei tepaqan eloqosg gi'lewei?
Is that new car sitting out there yours?

Ntue'm eloqosing ntawtig.
My pet is lying in my path.

Weliagamgusinitl lasqo'plawul gis'loqsatl.
The plank he/she just carved looks wonderful.

Nitap gesatg eloqs'g gmu'j.
My friend likes to carve wood.

Tepo'tunej ula wi'gatignn eloqta's'gigtug.
Let's put these books on the shelf.

Miti'sg eloqtesmaji sitmug.
He/she fells the trees toward (in the direction of) the shore.

Eloqtestoq gmu'j ntawtig.
He/she pushed a piece of wood in my path.

Gisgug eloqtnema't negm.
Today he/she has bad breath.

Ap ma' njijaqamij eloqwa'laq na'te'l.
I'll never lay my shadow down there again.

Eloqwa'toq gmu'j megwa'ig iga'taqanigtug.
He/she lays the wood down in the middle of the field.

Wastew elpanigs'g ntawtig.
Show drifts onto my driveway.

meanings: to send by rope or cable
example:
Lpa elpilatl qame'g.
He/she sent him/her by rope across the river.

elpilg.translation: He/she sends it/him/her by rope towards
meanings: send toward by rope or cable
example:
Ugtejg elpilgl usapunn.
He/she ties his/her hair back.

Elpiso'tulatl unjann, amuj tege'g
He/she bundles up his/her child, it must be cold.

Na lo'gsl elpualatl wiguwaq.
He/she wants that log at his/her house.

Na pugsug elpuatg wiguwaq.
He/she wants that firewood at his/her house.

Telgesnuguig ngat amujpa elqamgwejai pata'wti.
My foot is so sore I have to brace myself using the table.

Elqane'jg na lampo'q wesgowita'jig.
Ground fish spend their time at the bottom of the river.

Ugguijg eliet na'te'l najilqawet.
He/she goes to his/her mom's to hang out clothing.

Ula awti'j elqwanig sitmug.
This trail heads to the beach.

Telte'lmg sitmug elqwanipnaq.
I think he/she headed in the direction of the beach.

Ula tett pewatm elsaqas'g lian.
I want the wall to go here.

Epatgwa'tu elsaqas'gigtug.
Lean it up against the wall.

Welielsaqteg na gmu'j gisiilamgo'tu'n.
Those are nice layers of wood that you stacked.

Pilei ni'g elsegni'gan.
My new home is a brick house.

Elsipugtug na Big Cove teluisig aqalasie'wigtug.
Elsipugtug is called Big Cove in English.

Ugtelsita'sim asgaiaj.
His/her instep is bothering him/her.

Mali elsma'latl unjann n'npo'qoneg.
Mary lays her child down in my bed.

Elsma'si muta gispnei.
I lie down because I am tired.

Wesamsespena'q ula tet, ngijg elsumugwai.
It's to noisy here, I'm fleeing to my mother's.

meanings: something long lying along a path
example:
Tal gneg eltaqaiaq ula qasawo'qapi?
How far does this wire go?

meanings: something long lying along a path
example:
Ula a'papi'j eltaqaiet gneg.
This rope stretchs far.

meanings: laying something long along a path
example:
Etug ltaqa'latal na'te'l?
Do you think he/she will lay it along there?

Te'sigisg'g wesgowa'sit eltaqanewet.
Everyday he/she spends his/her time spinning.

Nujinqasui'get eltaqa'q samqwan pugtewigtug.
The firefighter sprays water on the fire.

Mali eltaqa'toqol waio'psgul ewne'gl.
Mary strings on some blue beads.

Pie'l eltaqsewet ugjit ligpenignn.
Peter is cutting strips for the baskets.

Tio'tis aq ni'n eltaqte'geieg gisgug.
Eunice and I are weaving baskets today

Tami elteg ula awti?
Where does this road lead to?

elteja'latl.translation: He/she takes someone by vehicle toward
example:
Utang elteja'latl ugjignaml.
He/she is driving his/her younger brother to town.

Muliang elteja'tu ms't goqwei.
I take (by car) it all to Montreal.

Sulian eltesguatl tu'aqan ni'neg.
William kicks the ball towards me.

Eltuoq mesgi'g pata'uti.
You're (plural) making a large table.

Qasawo'qapi el'tqeg a'se'g.
The wire is coiled in the other room.

A'papi el'tga'latesnu sapo'nug.
We will coil the rope tomorrow.

El'tqo'latl a'papi'l glapis gaq'tqo'laj.
He/she coils the rope until it is finished being coiled.

Mali eltugwi'g uggwijg.
Mary runs to her mother's (place).

Eluatl ugumijl na e'pite'ji'j.
That little girl resembles her grandmother.

Gaqi'sg ugjignaml elue'wa'latl.
He/she fools his/her younger brother often.

Elue'wiaq na ula ugs'tqamu.
This world is crazy.

Elue'wiet na newt poqjiewsitutg.
He's/she's crazy once he/she starts showing off.

Lpa'tuj elue'wipnnatl ugti'l.
The boy causes his dog to be wicked.

Elue'wit gisna sangewe'g gti?
Is your dog bad tempered or calm?

Ms't tami eluggwalatl na ujjl.
He/she follows his/her father everywhere.

Eluggwatg lugowaqan Gepeq.
He/she follows work to Quebec.

So'sep elugowatl  Malial.
Joseph works for Mary.

elugtoq.translation: He/she carries it toward on back or shoulder
example:
Gneg elugtoq utapsun.
He/she carries his/her belongings a long way.

elugtulatl.translation: He/she carries him on his/her back or shoulder(s) towards
example:
Gneg, pas gatu unjann elugtulatl glapis wiguwaq.
Far as it is, he/she carried his/her child all the way home.

E'e, negm elugwalaji gmu'jming.
Yes, he/she is preparing the raspberries.

Nuji'j elu'gwalit aq teluet mmi.
My granddaughter points at me and says grandma.

Wen elugwatg ula tuop'ti?
Who repairs this window?

Mijua'ji'j elu'gwatg ta'n goqwei pewatg.
A baby points to what they want.

Alsusit elugwa'tl unaqapeml.
The boss makes his/her worker work hard.

Nutepanqan elugweg gisgug?
Does my car work today?

Ugtluign elu'gweg oqwatnug.
His/her finger points north

E'e Mali elugwet.
Yes, Mary is working.

Elu'gwet ala ta'n gujj epij.
He/she points toward where your father sits.

Pilei utepaqan elugwetoq.
He/she uses his/her new car for work

elu'gwit.translation: He/she has something stuck in throat
example:
Suel elu'gwi, wasamjaqalatal.
I almost choked, I'm eating to quickly.

Elui'tmasit, ma nugu' naqana'mgw.
He/she has taken an oath, he/she will not drink again.

Llui'tmasuti amujpa wesua'tu'n nige'.
You have to take an oath now.

elu'jing.translation: He/she is bent (at waist) gaping toward
example:
Nmu'ji'j elu'jing ta'n ni'n eliei.
The dog leans toward the direction I am going in.

Elulg gitmuin wi'gatign.
I ask him/her to read the letter to me.

Me' ni'n ata'elusgnawei aq nte'pitm.
I can knead dough better than my wife.

Teleiaq pas'g elusgwatamit wipitl gisa'tuteg.
I found that he/she spit often after his/her teeth were fixed.

Ngwis elutuatl mui'nal.
My son imitates the bear.

Mutt emego'tegew.
Don't treat things/people badly/harshly.

Smtug emego'tg goqwei ignmuj.
He/she abuses anything he/she is given.

Emegwaltugwepit aq gesatg usapunn ta'n telteg.
He/she has messy hair and likes his/her hair the way it is.

Emegwatalg na ula gigmenu.
Our buddy a messy eater.

Ula ji'nm emegwe'g ugjit a'sutmo'guom.
This man acts improperly at church.

Me' gatu emegweiwatl na ugtue'ml.
My word, he/she treats his/her pet badly.

Mesge'g nige', sa'q emisqapit na'gu'setigtug.
He/she is sorry now, for going topless in the sun for so long.

Emisqa'sit gesgmnaq gesispalsigw.
He/she undresses before taking a bath.

Mu ni'n eliew ta'n emisqatesultijig.
I will not go where they strip dance.

Ms't wen emisqe'g ta'n tujiw wesgijinuij.
Everyone is naked when they are born.

Emisqo'tlatl unjann gisimamunimjigalsilitl.
He/she undressed his/her child after the child had dirtied
his/her-self.

Awisiw emittugwalatl umisl.
He/she seldom visits his/her older sister.

Emittugwatg utan ta'n wetape'gsij.
He/she visits the town he/she came from.

Pa'tlia's emittugwet te's Weltamultimg.
The priest visits every Friday.

emlsigtmat.translation: He/she sees or hears a ghost
example:
Telta'sit emlsigtmat ta'n tujiw natgoqwei gujmug nutgeg.
He/she thought he/she was having an apparition when
he/she heard something outside.

Emqatu'atl atlail.
He/she lends him/her a shirt.

Mali emqatui'getoq wi'gatign.
Mary lends out the book.

Emqatui'getoqol ugte'sipowml ugjit lugowaqan.
He/she lends out his/her horse for work.

Emqatuwi'get ugjit goqwei apje'jg.
He/she gives loans for small items.

Metue'g ta'n telsmuj wen emtesgatalg.
It's difficult to feed someone who is a fussy eater.

Emtesgit ugjit wi'g ta'n teliangamgug.
He/she is vain about the appearnace of his/her home.

emtesgite'lmatl.translation: He/she thinks he/she is superior over someone
example:
Emtesgite'lmatl ms't wenn, lpa na negm telqamigsit.
He/she is arrogant towards everybody, he/she is like that.

Nugumij emtoqwalatl uji'jl.
My grandmother worships her grandchild.

Lpa utepaqan negm emtoqwatg.
He/she worships his/her car.

Ge' apoqonmuanej ala etlienaqet.
Let's help him/her spreading the spruce boughs.

Nti gesatg enaqsij tia'muegn.
My dog likes to lay on moose hide.

Ango'ten e'n'jig gtpijjaqang.
Be careful not to loose your mittens.

Apjiw e'n'g ntwi'gignm.
I always lose my pencil.

Engalaji unjang ta'n telpitoqsultnij.
He/she measures the height of his/her children.

Te's weltamultimg engaqan wenaqiaq ta'n tujiw nipugtug etlugwen.
Every Friday is scale (measurement) day when you work in the
forest.

Engatmn ta'n telpita'q?
Are you measuring how long it is?

Engejit na gisgug, mimiges sapo'nug.
Caterpillar today, butterfly tomorrow.

Pilei engemgewei pegwatelmaq ugjit Nuelewumg.
I'm buying him/her a new measuring tape for Christmas.

Ni'n ntlugowaqan, engei.
In my work, I measure.

meanings: to scale(pertaining to pulpwood or logs)
example:
Engewatl witapal.
He/she surveys (land) for his/her friend.

enma'latl.translation: He/she takes someone onward or home
example:
Nige' enma'latl ugjignaml.
Now he/she is taking his/her younger brother home.

Maw wigapugsijig na enmapejig.
Carrots are very delicious.

enmateja'latl.translation: He/she drives someone onward or home
example:
Pie'l enmateja'latl unjann tepaqanigtug.
Peter takes his child home by wagon.

Ala' gitape'sgw enmateja'sit, je pemaluesgl usapunn.
There goes your girlfriend hurrying along, with her hair a-flying.

enmateja'toq.translation: He/she drives it onward or home
example:
Ms't goqwei enmateja'tu gisgug.
I drive everything home today.

enma'toq.translation: He/she takes it onward or home
example:
Ugtlugowaqanm wiguwaq enma'toq.
He/she is taking his/her work home.

enmawlalatl.translation: He/she carries home on back or shoulder
example:
Gispilateg ugtapsute'gann enmawlalatl.
When he/she finished dressing his/her doll he/she carried it home.

enmawlatg.translation: He/she carries it onward or home on back or shoulder(s)
meanings: carry home on back or shoulder(s)
carry onward on back or shoulder(s)
example:
Gisigu enmawlatg mesgi'g munti.
The old man carries home a big sack.

enmejepit.translation: He/she sits facing the other direction
example:
Poligap enmejepit Sa'nal etlagnutmajig.
Paul is sitting with his back to us speaking with Sean.

enmejepuguit.translation: He/she stands with back toward viewer
example:
Ala' enmejepuguit na gi'l getu' glult.
The one with his/her back towards us is the one you need to talk
too.

enmejeteg.translation: It is set facing the other direction
example:
Ala gutepaqannu enmejeteg.
Our vehicle is there facing the other way.

enm'gate'pit.translation: He/she trots or scoots onward or home
example:
Nemi'g'p enm'gate'pit.
I saw him/her scoot home.

Ta'nug enmiaq ugtul?
When is your boat going home?

So'sep enmiet na'n ajiet.
Joseph goes home at five o'clock.

Mu' wejgupa'nug, enmigiaq.
The tide is not coming in, it's going out.

Wen enmigimt gisgug?
Who are you sending home today?

Te's aqantie'uti suliewei enmigitg.
Every week he/she sends money home.

Tal gis enmigjepit ula napui'gign?
How come this picture is backwards?

Nmu'j enmigjesing gigji'w pugtewigtug.
The dog lies facing away near the fire.

Etlite'tm enmigjeteg na legepilaqan.
I think that that shade is on backwards.

enmigjo'gwet.translation: He/she is stooped over facing away
example:
Gi's pana enmigjo'gwet ala ugtiga'taqang etllugwet.
There he/she is stooped over again working in his/her garden.

Wen wigit Enmigtaqamu'g?
Who lives in mainland Nova Scotia?

Enmilugweg glapis gaqoqsmaq.
It will work until it runs out of fuel.

Nuji'j enmilugwet glapis pesgunateg ajiet.
My grandchild works until nine o'clock.

Nsanoqonig gigjiw enmipgowe'g.
It is dangerous along the edge of a cliff.

enmipisgwa't.translation: He/she is in the process of entering
example:
Sapatis enmipisgwa't wiguwaq.
Jean-Baptiste is entering his house.

enmisa'tgwatp'tesing.translation: He/she runs with hair bobbing up and down
meanings: run with hair bobbing up and down
example:
Ala' enmisa'tgwatp'tesing na algwilat.
There goes the one you are looking for with hair bobbing up and
down.

Siggw enmitg mgumi.
The ice goes out in the spring.

Telmamunno'q'g, lpa enmlamit.
He/she is coughing so much, he/she gasps for breath.

enml'ga't.translation: He/she is walking home or onward
example:
Ala' enml'ga't gitapenu.
There our friend is walking home.

Enmnqwe'sei gesgmnaq apaita'tigw.
I'm rushing home before they get back.

Gneg na enmoqowet tia'm
A moose's voice carries a long way.

enmoqtesing.translation: He/she is staggering onward or home
example:
Nitapesgw enmoqtesing.
My (female) friend staggers away.

enm'tesguatl.translation: He/she chases someone home or onward
example:
Nmu'j enm'tesguatl gajuewjl.
The dog chases the cat home.

enmuggwalatl.translation: He/she follows someone home or onward
example:
Te'sigisg'g ala lmu'j enmuggwalatl na lpa'tujl.
Every day that dog follows the boy home.

enmuggwatg.translation: He/she follows it home or onward
example:
Gat'lin enmuggwatg utapsun.
Catherine accompanies her belongings.

Ennma'latl sa'qati'l ntlmaqang.
He/she sticks a needle into my upper arm.

Lpa ennma's'g maqamigeg.
It pokes right into the ground.

Lpa sangew ennma'sit tmoqta'w ta'n tmoqta'wg etlmawamgie'tij.
The log went slowly into the logjam.

Je'n ennma'toq plegu lasqo'plawigtug.
Jane sticks the nail in the board.

Ennmig gmu'ji'j ntpitng.
A splinter is in my hand.

Ta'n tujiw jensi ennmit wastewigtug.
Suddenly he/she is stuck sticking out of the snow.

Ennmta'tl gi'gamgo'nn sisguigtug.
He/she drives the boating pole into the mud.

ennmte'g.translation: He/she drives it in with an instrunment
example:
Pie'l ennmte'g plegu.
Peter hammers in the nail.

Teljaqalnisiaq, lpa na ennmtesg.
It fell so fast, it stabbed right into the ground.

Lpa ennmtesin sisguigtug.
I jammed into and got stuck in the mud.

ennmtesmatl.translation: He/she sticks it into something by force
example:
Lpa ennmtesmatl witapal wastewigtug.
He/she drove his/her friend into the snow.

ennmtestoq.translation: He/she drives it into something by force
meanings: drive it into something by force
example:
Gi's ap ennmtestoq utepaqan wastewigtug.
Again he/she's driven his/her vehicle into the snow.

ennmtestuatl.translation: He/she sticks it into him/her/it by force
meanings: stick it into someone by force
drive it into someone by force
example:
Malpale'wit gisio'plinnmtestuatl sa'qati'l ulluguneg.
The doctor mistakenly stuck a needle in his/her (other person's)
thigh.

enqa'latl.translation: He/she brings someone to a halt
example:
Gast'pl enqa'latl ji'nmul awtigtug.
The cop stops the man on the road.

Na ne'wijig lasqo'plaq ms't enqanapultijig na'te'l.
Those four boards are all beneath the surface there.

Enqanateg na ugjip'sgl etligwegl.
Beneath the surface the roots continue to grow.

We'gwisa'q enqapit magasang.
He/she has been stopped at the store for a long time.

Nqa's'tew gigjiw nignaq?
Will it stop close to my home?

Tia'm enqa'sit ugtawtig.
The moose stops on his path.

Pe'l nige' enqateg, gatu wejo'tmeg lugwatmnen.
For now it is stopped, but we are trying to fix it.

enqa'toq.translation: He/she brings it to a stop
example:
Enqa'tueg lugowaqan.
We are stopping the work.

Goqwei entoq Mali A'n?
What has Mary Ann lost?

E'pit epa'latl unjann tepaqanigtug.
The woman seats her child in the toboggan.

Gigjiw epsaqtejgigtug epa'sit.
He/she sits nears the stove.

Telgu'jip pisgwa'tega, lpa getu'lpa'sualapnn epsaqtejgl.
He/she was so cold when he/she came in, he/she wanted to sit on
the stove.

Mali epa'suatg mutputi aq teluet ula pewatm.
Mary sits on a chair and says I want this one.

epatgupuguig.translation: It is standing and leaning against something
example:
Lgusuaqan epatgupuguig wenji'guomg.
The ladder is leaning up against the house.

epatgupuguit.translation: He/she is standing leaning against it
example:
Pu'tai eptaqano'guomigtug epatgupuguit .
The bottle leans against the cupboard.

Tmg epatgwa'latl tmsaqignigtug napwi'gnn, aq teluet ulpitew ula tet.
First he/she places the picture against the wall, and says it will look
good here.

Epatgwa'toq mutputi gigji'w ga'qanigtug.
He/she leans the chair against something near the door.

Llutaqanigtug epatgwepultijig lasqo'plaq.
The boards are leaning up against the fence.

Ala tapia'ji'jg epatgweteg tuop'tigtug.
That fiddle is leaning up against the window.

Epatgwigsma'latl gejigiaq.
He/she pushes it/him/her against the corner.

Pata'uti epatgwigsma'toq temsaqas'gigtug.
He/she pushes the table against the wall.

Na lo'gs pewalt'p epatuepit llutaqanigtug.
That log you wanted is up against the fence.

Lgusuaqan epatueteg wenji'guomg.
The ladder leans against the house.

Neli etlgina'muet Epegwitg.
Nellie teaches in Prince Edward Island.

Gisigui'sgw epetoqsit, tetujigsnugwat.
The old woman moans, she so ill.

Ngij epgenatl mitiji'tl.
My mother fertilizes a small tree.

A'teli welipgeng ugtiga'taqanm.
Audrey fertilizes her garden well.

Pilei epgenign e'we'n.
Use the new fertilizer.

Gisigui'sgw epipnatg pipnaqan te'sigisg'g.
The old woman makes bread everyday.

Ngij epipnet te's aqantie'uti.
My mother makes bread every week.

epistamit.translation: He/she sops it up with a piece of bread and eats it
meanings:
using a piece of food dipped in
 milk, syrup, or broth and eating it
example:
Pilei pipnaqan aq gastio'mi epistamimg mawiwigapu'g .
Soping  molasses up with fresh bread is delicious.

Ula epit na la'sgw e'nt'p.
Here is the card you lost.

Mutputigtug e'pit epit.
The woman sits on the chair.

E'pite'ji'j ala'latl tu'aqann.
The little girl has a ball.

E'pite's g'pnno'lewigtug etlugwet.
The young woman works in the government.

Nitape'sgw e'pite'su'et.
My female friend is becoming a young woman.

e'pite'su'qamigsit.translation: He/she acts like a young (unmarried) woman
example:
Miamuj e'pite'su'qamigsit, epite's.
Of course she acts like a young woman, she is a young woman.

e'pitewe'get.translation: He/she goes to seek a woman
example:
Nitap (n)ajie'pitewe'get to'q.
My friend says he/she is going to seek a woman.

Eimu'tijig na e'pitewe'smg.
There are those who are woman chasers.

E'pitewultieg mawpugultieg.
We are women and we stand together.

Gapjagwej epitgl ugwa'wml.
The robin is sitting on her eggs.

Ge'gwe'g lta'nej, me' ijga epoqeg.
Let's go upstairs, it's still a little warm.

Gigpesan eppa'q.
The rain is warm.

Ula mlagejg eppaqsijig.
This milk is luke warm.

Eppaqsit jugwa'l.
Bring the warm (liquid) one.

Lpa samqwan epp'teg ala qospemji'jg.
That water is lukewarm at that lake.

Mali epqwalatl witapal ugjit ulo'nug.
Mary is sheltering her friend for tonight.

Gisie'watl segi'gnn ugjiw epqwa's'g.
He/she is able to use a sail cloth for a temporary shelter.

Pilei epqwas'gewei sigunug iga'tutesnen.
We will put on a new roof in the spring.

Epqwatg utepaqan ugjit gesig?
Does he/she shelter his/her vehicle for the winter?

Pugjig epsaqtejg mawsa'l'g.
Soon I will start a fire in the stove.

Epsatl pu'tail gesgmnaq esmawg qopisunn.
He/she warms up the bottle before feeding the baby.

Epseweg na telamu'g gmu'j?
Does that kind of wood gives good warmth?

Ula epsaqtejg epsewet.
This stove gives good heat.

Esgma, pe'l eps'g wi'g.
Wait, he/she is heating up his/her house.

Mutt pisgwa'w, epsgunina'tieg.
Do not come in, we have (dry) tuberculosis.

Ugtepsimgewei'm nepsa's'g.
His/her fever rises.

Nnjan epsimgeweia'sip wela'gwe'g.
My child had a fever last night.

Ango'te'n, epsaqtejg epsit.
Be careful, the stove is hot.

epsmat.translation: He/she he/she keeps his/her place hot
meanings: maintain dwelling at a high temperature
have own place at high temperature
example:
Epsmat ula gitapenu.
Our friend here keeps his/her place hot.

Talwego't na epsmusi?
What is mountain ash used for?

Ewne'g eptaqan.
The plate is blue.
Ula eptaqan mu ewneiug.
This plate is not blue.

Gastio'mi piteg eptaqano'guomg.
The molasses in the cupboard.

Malqutesnu epteg lasup ugjit mewlia'gowei.
We will eat hot soup for lunch.

Eptegwai elg ni'n.
I have freckles too.

Mu pas'g newte' eptegwati eggunmug, lpa eptegwati'l waju'et.
He/she doesn't have one freckle, he/she is full of freckles.

eptoqalatl.translation: He/she leaves him in care of somebody
example:
Eptoqalatl unjann ugsugwisg.
He/she leaves his/her child in the care of  his/her aunt.

Eptoqatgm ntsulieweim pangigtug.
For safekeeping, I leave my money in the bank.

G's'talgeg epugtaqanap.
After he/she finished eating he/she had heartburn.

Epune'g epoqeg.
It is warm downstairs.

Tami epit na e's.
Where is the clam.

Goqwei negm esamqwat?
What is he/she drinking?

Negm esamqwatg qones.
He/she drinks home brew.

Esamuqo'tlatl gatu ugtue'mji'tl ta's'g samqwan.
He/she finally gives his/her little pet a drink of water.

Pita esa'tl nmu'ji'tl.
Peter tells the puppy to go away.

Te's elgitmuj mijipjewei na ese'g.
Each time he/she is sent food he/she refuses it.

Nitap e'se'get Ugpi'ganjeg.
My friend digs for clams at Eel River Bar.

Esetegja'latl ugtue'ml aq siaw'lgesewet.
He/she backs up his/her animal and continues to plow.

Nuji'j gegnu'tmasit esetegjapegin.
My grandchild is learning how to crawl backwards.

Gigj'pugu'tu gnjannaq muta tepaqan esetegja's'g.
Keep a close watch on our children because the car is backing up.

Ntue'm esetegja'sit nutepaqang.
My animal backs up towards my wagon.

Atuen esetegja'toqol mutputi'l.
Anthony moves the chairs backwards.

Esetegjipija'sip utepaqang.
He/she got in his/her car backwards.

esetigsma'toq.translation: He/she pushes it to the side
example:
Ge' esetigsma'tu na tepaqan, a'jelteg na ula gtawtinaq.
Would you push that toboggan aside, it's in our way there.

Apja'tu na mesegit ula tia'muei, me' esge'g!
Bring this moose meat back to the cook, it's still raw!

Ula pugsug pegisitui'tij esgig.
This wood they have brought me is green.

Nenat wen Esgigewa'gig tle'iawit?
Do you know anyone from the Third district?

Ula lpa'tuj esgipa'tl ujjl.
This boy is waiting for his father.

Goqwei etug esgipetoq?
I wonder what he/she is waiting for?

Ula miti's mamunjew esgit.
This tree is very green.

Etue'l pe'l esgmalatl ugte'piteml.
Edward, for now, waits for his wife.

Puniesgmai nugu'.
I'm not waiting anymore.

Goqwei esgmatg ala gaqamit?
What is he/she standing there waiting for?

Esgmoqonit na ga't.
That eel is slimy.

Esgmoqonig na ula megige'g samqwan.
This dirty water is slimy.

Na we'gwisgmoqonit ula gataw.
My, this eel is really slimy.

Me' gatu esgoqsit ula psaqa'gw!
My goodness, this crust is undercooked!

Esgoqteg na ula wius.
This meat is undercooked.

Gisiesg'pujig na sasqale'sig to'q.
Apparently scallops can be eaten raw.

Ntus wigit Esg'soqonig.
My daughter lives in Eskasoni.

Ta'n te'sit wi'sis esg'tamit.
All animals eat raw food.

Esg'tmn ula wius?
Are you eating this meat raw?

Esg'tmm'gewei wigtm pelgoqsas'g.
I find peeled cucumber delicious.

Etug nugu' pas'g newte'tnitl esgutesmatl.
There must be only one left that he/she hasn't broken.

Esgwiaq mijipjewei masqwa'tu.
Put away the leftover food.

Me' esgwiet nme'j?
Is there any fish left?

Ni'n wigi esiamgeg.
I live in Campbellton.

Pe'l esintesgmulap ugtawti.
Let me pack down your path.

Esintesguaji nipi'g gisijigg'pulateg.
He/she packed down the leaves after raking them.

Esipulatl ugtlawo'qgml.
He/she sharpens his/her hunting knife.

Ta'nug esiputoq tmi'gn?
When is he/she sharpening the ax?

Mali wiguaq pisgwa'n na ms't goqwei esmateg.
When you go into Mary's house everything is neat and tidy.

Wasamgaqi'sg esmatl na wisawsulieweiamugsnitl nme'ji'tl.
He/she feeds that goldfish too often.

Na'tami espeg muta msaqtaqt saqpe'g.
There is a leak somewhere because the floor is wet.

Niganpuguit me' espe'g.
The boss is higher in rank.

Ula la'taqsun espet.
This pail leaks.

We'gwiespi'sultijig ula Gepeg we'ita'jig.
These people from Quebec are using high-sounding language.

Gesiesp'pit na ula eptaqan.
This plate is up very high.

UIa lgusuaqan esp'puguig.
This ladder is up high.

esp'puguit.translation: He/she stands on a higher plane
example:
Jugwasga'l na mujgaesp'puguit piglewji'j.
Pass the lamp chimney that is on the highest shelf.

Esp'teg na ula etlugweigw.
It's high up where you and I are working.

Espulqeg ula gisimulqatmn.
This hole you've dug is nice and deep.

Gisigui'sgw essatl ugtatla'ieml.
The old lady dyes her shirt.

Mutt ugsampugwelg e'w'mu essawiaqan.
Try not to use too much dye.

Goqwei nige' ess'g?
What is he/she dying now?

Wesamiessit ula tmato's.
This tomato is too ripe.

Pie'l essu'tmuatl So'sepal ta'n gistliaq wela'gwe'g.
Peter is blaming Joseph for what happened last night.

Ul(a) eta pewalg.
This is the very one I want.
Ap eta goqwei?
Is there any thing else?

etamatl.translation: He/she asks for something of him/her
example:
Nmu'j etamatl e'pite'jitl.
The dog begs the little girl.

Etawaqtmat ula's'tn ms't goqwei.
He/she implores that all goes well.

etawaqtmuatl.translation: He/she asks someone for a favor
example:
Mali etawaqtmuatl ugjignaml.
Mary is asking for a favor from her brother.

Na lpa'tuj we'gwimiltawet ugjit Nuelewumg.
That boy asks a lot of different things for Christmas.

Tami eteg magasan?
Where is the store (located)?

So'sep etegjigsma'latl ugtue'ml.
Joseph pushes his horse backwards.

Wen etegjigsma'toqos ula?
Who pushed this backwards?

Etepna'tl, pasa mu gis siawtesguagul.
He/she caught up, but he/she could not pass by him/her.

Ntlugowaqan geget etepne'm.
I have almost caught up with my work.

Tetujip'teg (l)pa ugs'tqamu etlanqatesg.
It is so hot the earth is shimmering.

Nti mawigsatg etlapenuj.
My dog likes being massaged.

etlapensit.translation: He/she is feeling his/her own body
example:
Mijua'ji'j etlapensit te's gisapaluj.
After a bath the baby touches his/her body.

Gi's p'tewei etlapu'teg?
Is the tea brewing yet?

Gis na Diane etlaqqisewet.
Diane is hollering again.

Ge'l angam ala gapjagwej etlatalg.
Look at the robin eating.

Na gispn etlenmiteg, pa mu gis'punenmigw.
He/she kept laughing, he/she just couldn't stop.

Nsugwis na etlewistoq.
It's my aunt speaking.

Gi'l etli't na apsute'gan?
Are you the one making that doll?

Teliluwa't, lpa tlueg etligmiet.
He/she is so angry, you could say he/she is boiling.

Pugtew etligp'ta'q glapis.
The/a fire is finally smoking.

Tmaqan etligp'ta't.
The smoke is coming from the pipe.

Wela'gwe'g etligtugunip wigwaq.
Last night he/she slept at his/her own home.

Ala wi'sis etligu'niet.
That animal is bleeding profusely

Gagamit etlinisigu'niet gatu gisinqatoq ta'n tel pe'gitnej.
He/she is standing there with blood flowing down but he/she is
able to stop the nose bleed.

Ge's etlintu mu wen eimug pas'g ni'n?
While I'm singing there is no one here but me?

Taluisig na gtapegiaqan etlintuatg?
What is the name of that song he/she is singing?

Etlipiasatl ugtatlaiml gesgmnaq maja'sigw.
He/she is drying his/her shirt before leaving.

Gujmug etlipiasg aligew.
He/she dries the clothing outside.

A'se'g ntatlaim etlipiasit.
My shirt is drying in the other room.

Newtigisg'g etlipiateg, mnaq gispatenug.
It's been drying all day, it is not dry yet.

Npaqam gitaqeg, ge' ijga tliputuwi.
My back is sore, could you rub it for me.

Ugtlmaqan gitaqeg etliputoq.
He/she is rubs his/her aching shoulder.

Sosep etlite'lmatl Malial jugu'enin.
Joseph thinks that Mary will come.

Gisgug gisgattetew etlite'tg.
He/she thinks it will be ready today.

Goqwei etlitoq a'se'g?
What's he/she making in the other room?

Nutepaqan gujmug etllugweg.
My vehicle's engine is running outside.

Etllugwet nige', ma' gis liegw smtug.
He/she is working, he/she can't go there immediately.

Pgu'l etloqsatl.
He/she is cooking fudge.

Ntus etloqs'g petaqan.
My daughter is baking a pie.

Nme'j etloqsit lapue'ligtug.
The fish is cooking in the frying pan.

Goqwei etloqteg? Na we'gwiwelima'q.
What's cooking? It smells so good.

etlsegnatl.translation: He/she is building it (statue) with brick or cement blocks
meanings: construct or build with brick or cement blocks
example:
Etlsegnatl mesginitl pessmgewe'l.
He/she is building a large crucifix out of cement.

etlsegng.translation: He/she is building it with brick or cement blocks
meanings: construct or build with brick or cement blocks
example:
Pie'l etlsegng wiguow.
Peter is bricking his house.

Tal gis etlta'tl na miti'sl?
Why is he/she hitting that tree?

Tele's newtigisg'g etlte'g pepgijete'maqan.
Theresa has been beating the drum all day long.

Natuen nutaq etltemit.
I hear someone crying.

Ugju'snigtug ga'qan etltesg.
The door is flapping in the wind.

Ugjigung etltesing.
He/she injured him/her knee.

Newtitpa'q nmu'j etltoqsit.
The dog has been noisy all night.

e'tmapit.translation: He/she is sitting at the forefront
example:
Ngwis apji'w e'tmapitew ta'n tujiw mijjultimg.
My son is always sitting at the forefront when it's time to eat.

e'tmapuguit.translation: He/she is standing at the forefront
example:
E'tmapuguin ula napui'gignigtug.
You are standing in the foreground of this photograph.

e'tmateg.translation: It is set at the forefront
example:
Wen ala wiguow e'tmateg?
Who's house is that at the front?

etmgwiet.translation: He/she is recovering from an illness
example:
Glapis gatu etmgwiet nitap.
Finally my friend is recovering from his/her illness.
