Etna na nugu' ni'n teluei gaqa'tegei.
Okay then, now I say I'm done.

Etnana negm nisiep wela'gwe'g.
That's the one that fell last night.

Gapjagwej etnesing.
The robin broods.

Ta'n tujiw etoq, na mawigtme'g sisip.
When it's building its nest, the bird is at its busyist.

etoqatesing.translation: He/she is cornered and can't move
example:
Etoqatesing ga'qanitug pegising, ga'qan apt'sqa's'g.
He/she couldn't go on when he/she arrived at the door, the door
was locked.

A' na nige' etoqtalg ula plawej.
Ah! now I'm going to bake this partridge.

Ula go'qoli'gwej etoqtasit.
This chicken is roasted.

Nata'etoqtatm lusgnign.
I know how to bake bannock.

Mali newtiegsitpu'g etoqtet.
Mary has been roasting things all morning.

Mnaq ettenug, me' gatteg.
It's not ripe yet, it is still green (unripe).

Etug talte'ttew?
Do you think he/she will mind?

Etugjel gisgug itga'tew.
Maybe it will arrive today.

Pa'tliatji'jg i'nasgua'tipni etu'gutewe'g.
Monks used to wear scapulars.

Wipit etu'gwesmit.
He/she puts his/her tooth under his/her pillow.

Ula awti etuiw wenji'guoml nige' etegl.
There are houses on both sides of this road now.

etulgomit.translation: He/she carries something under the arm
meanings: hold or carry something under arm
example:
Gi'spana pemietulgomit na tapia'jijg.
There he/she goes whith that fiddle under his/her arm again.

Ta'nug e'watal ula wowul?
When will he/she use this pot?

Gisigu gisiewe'ga'latl a'papi'l.
The old man has just loosened the rope.

Etug ewega'tal unaqapeml?
Will he/she need his/her helper?

A'jijgopilaqan wesumseggteg na ewe'ga'toq.
The bandage is too tight so he/she loosens it.

Weliewe'ge'g ula pilei nutepaqan.
My new vehicle is quite roomy.

Etlite'lmg me' ewegetoq pata'uti.
I think he/she still needs the table.

Etliewe'gisga'latl pile'l ugjigunn.
He/she is exercising his/her new knee.

ewe'gisga'lsit.translation: He/she loosens up his/her bones and muscles
example:
Ewe'gisga'lsit gesgmnaq poqtetugwi'mug.
He/she loosens up his/her body before running.

Ewe'gisga'toq wa'gi gesgmnaq poqtetugwi'mug.
He/she warms up his/her body before beginning to run.

We'gwliewe'g'pit ula wesgit nasgaq.
This vest I'm wearing is nice and loose.

Wasami ewe'g'teg ula ga'qan.
This door is too loose.

Gisigu aptu'n e'w'g pemiej.
The old man uses a cane to walk.

Tami ewi'gat Malia'n?
Where is Mary Ann building her house?

Amujpa ms't ewi'g'mn.
You have to write it all down.

Eigl ewi'gigegl nige', pas'g gelusin aq wi'g'tew ta'n gis tluen.
There are writing programs now, that will write for you as you say
it.

Ge' jugwasga'tu ewi'gigemgewei.
Pass me a notepad.

Ula pilei ewi'gigemgewei weliewi'giget.
This new pen writes well.

ewi'gmuatl.translation: He/she writes a letter to someone
example:
Pie'l ewi'gmuatl umaqtaml.
Peter writes to his brother/sister-in-law.

Te's nemi'g ewi'tatl Malial.
Every time I see him/her, he/she mentions Mary.

Gaqi'sg ewi't'g ugtlgowaqanm qasawo'qigtug.
He/she often mentions his/her work on the iron.

Negm na ewjo'lajig lugowaqanigtug.
He/she transports them to and from work.

Nitap ewjo'toqol pugsugl nipugtug.
My friend transports wood from the woods.

Nugu' ewlamgwiet (u)la gigmenu.
By now our buddy is wearing out.

Gi's sa'q giaspinmu't ewlamsn Listugujg.
It's been a long time since anyone has seen a tornado in Listuguj.

ewlamugsit.translation: He/she is run down in appearance
example:
Ewlamugsit Nastasi, tala'teget etug?
Nancy looks wane, I wonder what's wrong with her?

Ula nitape'sgw ewlapewit.
My friend (female) looks sad.

Ewle'jgl ula wennju'su'nn.
These apples are in poor condition.

Pugwelgig ewle'jultijig ula ugs'tqamu.
There are many who are poor in this world.

Jiptug ewle'juaqan ma' apaja's'tnug.
Hopefully hard times will not return.

Tami tleiawit na ewle'juinu?
Where is that poor person from?

Gisgug telo'tm ewllugwei.
Today I feel that my work is of poor quality.

Gis sa'q ewlmaje'g na e'pit.
That woman has suffered for a long time.

Gimu'tug ewnasa'sit nige'.
He/she misbehaves a bit now.

Ewnasgwa'latl ge's alapega'laj.
He/she made him/her dizzy while swinging him/her around.

Witapal pa ewnasgwatpa'latl ge's etlmila'ti'tij.
He/she made his/her friend dizzy while they were playing.

ewnasgwatpetesing.translation: He/she is confused from a head injury
example:
Ta'n telnisiej lpa ewnasgwatpetesing.
The manner in which he/she fell made him/her really dazed.

ewnasgwetesing.translation: He/she is dizzy from a blow or fall
meanings: dizzy caused by a blow or fall
dazed caused by a blow or fall
confused caused by a blow or fall
dizzy caused by a lot of head movement
example:
Ewnasgwetesing nitap nisieteg.
My friend was dazed when he/she fell.

Mu getu' mnja'sigw muta ewnasgwiet menja'sij.
He/she doesn't want to get up (from lying down) becasue he/she is
dizzy when he/she gets up.

Gisgug na ewnasiaq ula ugs'tqamu.
Today this world is confused.

Nmu'ji'j ewnasiet, uggwitl e'natl.
The puppy is confused, he/she has lost his/her mom.

ewnasimgnajig.translation: He/she picks them up in a disorganized way
meanings: pick up in a disorganized way
example:
Mali ewnasimgnajig na tap'tang
Mary picks up the potatos any old way.

ewnasimgnasit.translation: He/she picks something in a disorganized way
meanings: gather or pick up in a disorganized way
example:
Ewnasimgnasit na natanguaj.
He/she is disorganized when he/she shops.

ewnasimgngl.translation: He/she picks them up in a disorganized way
meanings: pick up in a disorganized way
example:
Ewnasimgngl na gtapegiaqan.
He/she made a poor selection of songs.

ewnasising.translation: He/she lies in an awkward position
example:
Ewnasisin tet, e'we'n ala npo'qon.
You look awkward laying there, use that bed.

Nutepaqan ewne'g.
My car is blue.

Musigisg ewniaq, getu weligisg'g.
The sky is turning blue, it's going to be a nice day.

Mijua'ji'j ewsa'latl ugtapsute'gann aq alilua't, muta gis tlimut
"moqwa".
The young child shakes his/her toy (animal) and is upset because
he/she was told "no".

Ewsa'tugsie'g gmu'j, na wesmugwaieg'p.
When he/she threatened to hit us with a stick, that's when we ran
away.

ewsa'tuatl.translation: He/she pretends to want to hit someone
meanings: lift hand in a threatening motion
raise fist in a threatening motion
example:
Mutt wen ewsa'tuaw.
Don't pretend to hit.

Lpa gitg ngpugugl ewsgwapegl.
Both of my eyes are twitching.

Me' etliewsgwapet na gataw, tlta'sigg me mimajit.
That eel is still twitching, you would think it's still alive.

Tetuji gaqaisg ewsgwit lpa ewlite'lmg.
He/she has sneezed so often I feel sorry for him/her.

Ji'nm ewsimatl uge'pitml.
The man jokes with his wife.

Ewsinpat glamen mijua'ji'j npatew.
He/she pretends to sleep so the baby will fall asleep.

Ewsitutg na ula l'pa'tuj.
This boy is showing off.

Ewt'pasgmnn pile'l magotl.
You are sitting on the new dresses.

Ewt'pasguatl ugtatlaiml aq algwiluatl.
He/she is sitting on his/her shirt and he/she is looking around for it.

Gisiewt'pa'sitl ugtatlaiml nige' winanqepinitl.
He/she sat on his/her shirt, now it is wrinkled.

ewt'pa'sualatl.translation: He/she sits on top of him/her/it
example:
Te's'g ta'n goqwei alagweg, suel ewt'pa'sualatl ugti'l.
There are so many things scattered about, he/she almost sat on
his/her dog.

ewt'pa'suatg.translation: He/she sits on top of it
example:
Goqwei ewt'pa'suatg?
What did he/she just sit on?

Ewupniaq gatu tewjimtu'na'qapneg.
It's calming down now, it was so stormy before.

Nitap'sgw wigit Gaggnawa'gi
My female friend lives in Caughnawaga.

Gajjamu'g na tepaqan.
That car has a weird colour.

Gajjamugsit na g'atlai'm.
Your shirt is an unpleasant color.

Tami wejiet ula gajuewj?
Where did this cat come from?

Tami epit na gajuewji'j.
Where is that kitten.

Mejit ga'l na newt ajietew.
Quarter more and it will be one o'clock.

Mu te'sigw nugu' ta'n gale'mewit.
There are not so many who observe lent anymore.

Ula na tepgunset apjiw gale'mewultimg
This is the month we always observe Lent.

Ge' jugwa'tui na galgunawei?
Would you bring me that hardtack?

Ge' newte' lape'lis galiset wape'g natelmui?
Can you please go and buy a yard of white flannelette for me?

Galiulg na mawi ultejiaq ta'n tujiw gisip'saq.
The sleigh rides smooth after it snows.

Ta'nug Galla'ing elta'ioq?
When are you (plural) going to New Carlisle?

Galqign ms't wen geggung.
Everyone has earwax.

Welamugsit na na'gu'set ta'n tujiw galqwasiej.
The sun is pretty when it's setting.

Newte' telgamlamit.
He/she still breaths.

Nige' Gamso'q eliei (n)ajialapi.
Now, I'm going to Canso to have a look around.

Na nige' ap tlimi, wen wejitoqos Ganata?
Now tell me again, who found Canada?

Taluisit na Ganaties.
What is that Canadians' name.

Ta'sijig ganatie'si'sg pe'ita'jig?
How many young Canadian men are arriving?

Weliangamgusit na Ganatiesui'sgw.
That is a nice looking Canadian woman.

Ula ganatiesui'sgwe'j Muliang wejiet.
This young Canadian woman came from Montreal.

Ngwis mamunganie'wit.
My son has gained a lot of weight.

Wen gapiten ula tet?
Who's the captain here?

Gapjagwej gujmug ale'g.
The robin is hanging around outside.

Ge' jugwa'tui ala megwe'g gapji'j.
Please bring me the red cup.

Ge' jigs'tmnej na gapsgu'j, teliulgoweg.
Let's listen to the little waterfalls, it sounds so nice.

Pesga'sin tet, mu gnegtnug eteg gapsguji'j.
If you follow this trail here, it isn't too far to a tiny waterfall.

Gi's gi'l wejien gapsgwigtug?
Have you been to the waterfall?

Newt qapsgwamgitg peja'lugwen na nugu na qapsgwigtug
siawnisa'lugwetes.
Once you float to the fast water preceeding a waterfall you are
going down the falls.

Gaqalamiei nugu' telsa'q pemtugwi'm.
I'm out of breath, I've been running so long.

Ntue'm glapis gaqalamit.
My pet finally stopped breathing.

Gaqa'latl gatu glapis.
At last he/she is finished it.

Ta'nug nugu'gaqalitetew?
When will this snow be melted and gone?

Nutepaqan lpa nige' gaqalugweg.
My vehicle has now finished working.

Assma nige' pas'g gisgaqalugwet.
Just now he/she is finished work.

Na tel jipaqa'sit, gaqama's'gl usapunn?
He/she got so scared, his/her hair stood on end.

Gigjiw ga'qanigtug gaqama'sit.
He/she stands up near the door.

gaqama'sualatl.translation: He/she is a witness for him/her (at wedding, in court)
example:
Ni'n gaqama'sualg'pnig ala' negmow.
I was a witness for them.

Glapis gaqamgleg iga'taqan.
At last the field is finished burning.

Na gtlo'gsminu geget gaqamglet.
Our log is almost finished burning.

Goqwei gaqamig ala tet?
What's standing over there?

Gaqamit megwa'ig awtigtug.
He/ she is standing in the middle of the road.

Pugwelg gaqamu'tm'gewei nuta'n etlgina'muen.
You need plenty of patience when you are teaching.

Jijuaqa na mesgi'g gaqamutu'n ta'n tujiw niganpuguwin.
Sometimes you have to put up with a lot when you are the leader.

Mali gaqamutuatl Pie'lal
Mary stood up against Peter.

Ga'qan panteteg.
The door is open.

Ge' tliesgmalitesg ga'qaneiigtug.
Would you wait for me at the entranceway.

Gi's gaqanu'gwa'teget Pie'l?
Has Peter finished the burning yet?

gaqanu'gwa'toq.translation: He/she is finished burning it up
example:
Gi's gaqanu'gwa'toq msigu?
Has he/she finished burning the grass?

Gi's gaqapiasit laqsun?
Is the sheet dry yet?

Gaqapiateg ula nugu' nutapsun.
My clothes are finally dry.

Gaqapija'latl ugnepamgeweiml.
He/she hangs up his/her nightgown.

Gaqapija'toq Mi'gmewei mtawegn.
He/she hangs up the Mi'gmaq flag.

Pilei ntatlaim gaqapijing a'se'g.
My new shirt is hanging up on the other side.

Lolaewei wius gaqapitg nignaq.
Lawrence's meat is hanging at my house.

Musigisg'tug alaqsing ga'qaquj .
The crow is flying around in the sky.

ga'qasia't.translation: His/her lips are numb from eating too many rubarb
meanings: lips are numb from eating too many rubarb
example:
Teluejig wesamp'j sewlugewe'g na ga'qasia'tes.
They say that if you eat too many rubarb your lips will turn numb.

Je(l) gi's gaqa'teget?
He/she is finished already?

Se'l's gaqa'toq ugtiga'taqan.
Sailor finished his lawn.

Gaqawa's'g na ula egsitpu'g, gis newtisga'q ajiet.
This morning has gone by fast, it's already 10 oclock.

Gaqawa'sin, pas'g newtigisg'g wesgowa'sin.
You've gone far, you've only been at it for a day.

Gajue'wj winnu mawgaqe'g.
The tongue of a cat has a very rough texture.

Gisigu gaqg'g ugta'gusn.
The old man is wearing out his hat.

Gaqgmai nugu'!
My clothing is all worn out!

Na megwe'nitl atla'il gaqguatl.
He/she has worn out his/her red shirt.

Geget gaqiaq p'tewei.
The tea is almost used up.

Amalwi'gignm gaqiet.
My colored pencil is finished.

Lpa na gaqiga'lsit ta'n tujiw mimajuiu'g apoqonmuaj.
He/she puts in maximum effort when he/she is helping people.

Gaqigjijiatl t'an tela'tegenij.
He/she knows everything about his/her case.

Pie'l na gaqigji'toq nipugt.
Peter knows all about the forest.

Jijuaqa wen nanisgegipunat we'gaw gaqi'gwesmaj.
Sometimes one is fifty years old before they are finished bearing
children.

Gi's gaqi'sg telimul mutt eliew na'te'l.
I have told you often not to go there.

gaqi'sisgegipuna'q.translation: It is so many years old
example:
Gaqi'sisgegipuna'q (u)la wennji'guom gaqamig.
This house has been standing for many years.

gaqi'sisgegipuna't.translation: He/she is so many years old
example:
Gisiguwi'sgw gaqi'sisgegipuna't.
The old woman has lived many years

Tetuje'g lpa gaqjeg.
It's so old, it's brittle.

Tel gisiguit pa' gaqjet.
It's (something animate, e.g. a wooden board) so old it's brittle.

Gi's gaqoqsit ap'tapegiejit?
Is the turkey finished cooking yet?

Pipnaqaneg gaqoqte'g.
The bread is all burnt.

Gaqo'tmaneg wi'gatignei.
I've used up all the paper.

Mesgilgig na ula gaqpesaq.
These smelt are quite large.

Gaqsatl wowl.
He/she burns the pot.

Wen gis'gaqs'g ula pipnaqan.
Who burnt this bread.

Ango'te'n, gi 's ni'n etlgaqsi.
Be careful, I have already burnt myself there.

Gispejigaqsusi sepei.
I accidentally burned myself this morning.

Tami tet etlgaqtaqaiaq ula awti?
Where does this road end?

meanings: the end of (a rope or string)
example:
Nugu' gaqtaqaiet gnjannu.
Our child is totally exhausted (has reached the end of his/her
energy).

Assma nige' gaqta'tl tmoqta'wul.
He/she is finished pounding the log.

Ansue'g, gaqteg ms't goqwei.
It's unfortunate, everything is burnt.

Ryan, nuji'j gaqtesgmat.
Ryan, my grandchild has worn out his shoes.

Nutas'pnig gaqtugwaq wela'gwe'g?
Did you hear the thunder last night?

Gaqi'sg nipg gaqtugwawig.
It thunders often in the summer time.

Wela'gwe'g pewi'g'p gaqtugwewe'sm.
Last night I dreamed of the Thunderer.

Tale'tew ga's oqwa'q egsitpu'nug?
What time will the train arrive in the morning?

Susan gasa'latl napui'gignn.
Susan erases the picture.

Gasapueg na?
Does it wash off?

Ala napui'gn geget gaqgasapuet.
That mural is almost all washed off.

Pe' gwilmap gasa'taqanei waqame'g.
Let me look for a clean dish cloth.

Ga'satl ugtue'ml gisapalateg.
He/she wipes (dries) his/her pet after bathing him/her.

Negm gasa'toq ugwisunm.
He/she erase his/ her name off.

Pe' ga'smap pata'uti.
(Hold on,) I'll wipe the table

Gasg'ptnnaqan tesagl pisoqos'til.
There are one hundred buttons.

gasg'ptnnaqanipuna't.translation: He/she is one hundred years old
example:
Geget ntlamugsis gasg'ptnnaqanipuna't.
My uncle is almost one hundred years old.

Waqame'g ga'sign pewatm.
I want a clean kitchen towel.

Ge' gsistaqanewetes a', mu gasigo's'ti geggunmu.
Would you do a laundry, I don't have a towel.

Ge' jugwa'tui tapu'gl gasigo's'ti'jl.
Please bring me two face cloths.

Gapistneta'gw ula tet.
Wash your (plural) hands over here.

Pie'l na pusgigasplutuatl umijgamijl.
Peter often repeats after his grandfather.

Ge' juwatui na gastio'mi.
Bring me the molasses.

Ala gast'pl maw ni'laje'g.
That constable is very friendly.

Tami nigwejig gastug?
Where do hemlocks grow?

Ga't na maw wigapugsit.
Eel is delicious.

Egsitpu'nug nitap najiga'tewe'get.
My friend is going eel hunting in the morning.

Tami weja'lt na ga'tomiei poj?
Where did you get the eelskin purse?

Gatu talta'sin gi'l?
Well, what do you think?

Gis nemitunn gawaqtejgl?
Have you seen gooseberries?

Gawaqtejgumusi tami iga'taqwalt?
Where are you planting the gooseberry bush?

gawasga'latl.translation: He/she turns someone to the opposite direction
example:
Etlgawasga'latl ugte'sipowml wanne'g.
He/she turned his/her horse around at the cove.

Ula tet pusgigawasga's'g mesgi'gewei tepaqan.
This is where the large vehicle often (regularly) turns around.

Wentanet etlgawasga'sit awtigtug?
Who is that turning at the road?

Ta'n tujiw gawasga'toq mutputi na paqjetesine'n.
When he/she turns the chair around, quickly sit down.

Gi's gawasgega'latl na naqsunn?
Did he/she turn the bedsheet over yet?

Ge' apoqonmui gawasgega'tu ula patawtiewegn.
Please help me turn over this table cloth.

Jaqal(i)gawasgeget na ugtul.
He/she turned his/her boat quickly.

gawasgisma'sit.translation: He/she turns self over while in lying down
meanings: turn self over while in lying down
example:
Gawasgisma'sian etug je(l) ma' njigun tliasgaiwigw.
If I were to turn over (while prone) perhaps my knee will not ache
as much.

Ta'pug na'gweg gawasg'pa'q
The tide changes twice daily.

Gawasg'pa'sit glaman me' ulaptetew.
He/she turns around in his/her seat to see (it) better.

Teluwet nunji gesnuguig, aq gawasg'smtesing.
He/she said, "I have a headache" and he/she turned over quickly.

gawasg'tniaq.translation: The wind changes to the opposite direction
example:
Gisgawasg'tniaq, nige' tege'g.
The wind has changed to the opposite direction, now it's cold.

Gisigawasgui'tmn goqwei?
Can you say anything backwards?

Gawatgug welnigwejig ntiga'taqang.
Spruce trees grow well in my yard.

Gisgug t'satesnu gawi'g.
Today we (you and I) will dye the quills.

Mawimtue'g ligpenigen gawiei eltmg.
It's hard to make a quill work basket.

Mawigsa'luet na gawigsaw nastesing.
It's very painful when a thorn attaches to you.

Gawigso'musi we'jiatesg etligwet ta'n pas tami.
You will find thorn wood growing almost anywhere.

Ge' ltunej tapu'gl gawioqolaqann.
Let's make two quill boxes.

Gegapniet te'siegsitpu'g aq naj'gatawe'get.
He/she rises before dawn every morning and fishes for eel.

Geget as'gom te'sisgegipuna'i.
I'm almost sixty years old.

Tami suliewei geggunas'g?
Where is the money kept (for safekeeping)?

Nti geggunasit l'mu'jo'guomg.
My dog is in the dogshelter.

Wen geggunatl wowul mesginnitl?
Who had a large pot?

Ngweji'j geggunawet ugit nuji'jl.
My sister is my grandchild's godmother.

Negm geggung megwe'g magot.
He/she has a red dress.

Ntus etlgina'masit Mi'gmewei tli'suti.
My daughter is learning the Mi'gmaw language.

Gegina'matimgewei egitmu's'p?
Did you read the book?

Gegina'muatl unjann ta'n telinnui'simg.
He/she teaches his/her child how to speak Mi'gmaq (an aboriginal
language).

Wen gegina'muet ula toqwa'q?
Who is teaching this fall?

Gegna'latl miti'ji'tl ugjit Nuelewumg.
He/she decorates the little tree for Christmas.

Pegijiesgipe'g te's gegna'tieg.
I wait long each time we dress up.

Gegna'toq wi'g ugjit Nuelewumg.
He/she decorates his/her house for Christmas.

So'sep gegnesit getu malie'wit.
Joseph is all dressed up, he wants to get married.

Nsugwis gegno'tlatl mijua'ji'tl.
My aunt dresses the baby.

Geji'g gnua'latal negm lugwalaj.
I know he/she will treat him/her/it properly if he/she works on
him/her/it.

Gast'plewigtug najigegnua'tegeieg.
We are going to inform the police.

Apjiw gegnua'toq ms't goqwei.
He/she always does everything properly.

E'pit gegnua'tuatl unjan ta'n gistla'tegnital miawna'gweg.
The woman informs her child what he/she can do during the day.

Amujpa gegnue'g ta'n telmimajin gtu'ulo'tegen.
You have to live properly if you want to live well.

Glapis gatu ngwis poqjigegnu'giljet.
Finally my son is starting to read properly.

Gegnugwalatl glaman gji'(t)utew gi's gisa'latl.
He/she marks/numbers it so he/she knows it's already done.

Gegnugwatg ugtawti ta'n pemiet.
He/she marks his/her trail that he/she is on.

meanings: mark made to indicate a place
example:
Mali gegnugwatiget aq ninen majulgwatesnen awti.
Mary marks the trail and we will follow the path.

Gegnuimatl uji'jl.
He/she told his/her grandchild the truth.

Geji'g negm gegnu'lugwet.
I know he/she works properly.

Ula nitap mawgegnu'qamigsit ugjit ta'n tetuje'g
My friend here behaves well for his/her age.

Apjiw gegnu'telg wilu.
He/she always buys him/herself proper food.

Gegnu'teluatl gatu na atla'il.
In spite of it all he/she did buy the right kind of shirt.

Gegnu'tmasit natgoqwei piluei.
He/she learns something different.

Nujiginamuet gegnu'tmuatl mijuaji'jl.
The teacher teaches the child.

Gi'gamgo'n ala' tett ge'goqpit.
The boat pole is (lays on top) over there.

Ala ugtul ge'goqteg guntewigtug.
His/her boat lies on top of the rock over there.

Iga'taqanigtug gegpewisg.
There is morning dew on the field.

Ge'gulusgwa'latl witapal nemiateg.
He/she hugged his/her buddy when he/she saw him/her.

E'pite'ji'j ge'gupa'latl ugtapsute'gan umpo'qoneg.
The little girl put her doll on her bed.

Smtug ge'gupa'sit ugplaqaneg.
He/she immediately sits on his/her lap.

Gi's pana ge'gupit na gajuewj nutepaqaneg!
That cat is on my car again!

Ltugwi'e'n ala ge'gupn aq apaja'si
Run to that hill top and come back.

ge'gupuguit.translation: He/she is standing on the top
example:
Nmu'j ge'gupuguit mesgi'g guntew.
The dog is standing on a large rock.

Tami telue's'p ge'guteg mlageju'mi?
Where did you say the butter was (sitting on)?

ge'gutesg.translation: It lands on top of it
example:
Ge'gwe'g wetnisiaq aq ge'gutesg patawtigtug.
It fell from above and it landed on top of the table.

Na tel gisgopa'si nti ge'gutesing nplaqaneg.
As soon as I sit down my dog jumps on my lap.

ge'gwa'latl.translation: He/she places him on the top
example:
Atel gisige'gwa'latl la'taqsunn aq gewiennitl.
He/she had just put the pail on top and it fell over.

meanings: at the top of the falls
example:
Gi's gi'l wejien Ge'gwapsgug?
Have you ever been to Pabineau Falls?

Telo'tm gegwa's'g (u)la na'gu'setewei.
I find that this clock is slow.

Ala pugto'guom ge'gwa's'g mtuiganigtug.
That chimney goes up to the rafters.

Teleiaq gegwa'sit gisgug.
I find he/she moves slowly today.

ge'gwa'toq.translation: He/she places it on the top
example:
Giju ge'gwa'toq pipnaqan pata'utigtug.
Mother placed the bread on the table.

Tami eteg ge'gwatpan?
Where is the top of the head?

Ula nitap wijei telgegwe'g st'ge migjigj.
My friend is as slow as a turtle.

Pugwelg pilei wenji'guom ge'gweia's'g.
A lot of new houses have an upstairs.

Me' negm gegwi'pit je mu ni'n.
He/she runs slower than I do.

Nti ge'gwi'pit ntul.
My dog runs onto my boat

Ge'gwising npo'qonigtug.
He/she lies on top of the bed.

ge'gwisma'latl.translation: He/she lays someone on the top
example:
Sangew unjann ge'gwisma'latl unpo'qoneg.
He/she slowly lays his/her child on his/her bed.

ge'gwisma'toq.translation: He/she lays it on the top
example:
Ge'gwisma'toqol uggwatl.
He/she lays his/her feet on top.

Nitap geitapaqte'g plegu mtui'ganigtug.
My friend drives a nail into the roof top.

Maw geiteget na negm.
He/she is very knowledgeable

Geitmg ta'n telitas'g gisue'gl wenji'guoml.
It is known how warm houses are built.
Gesig wejgu'aq aq geitmg ta'n tliatew.
Winter is on it's way and it is known what will happen.

Me' gi'l geitu'n ta'n teliaq?
Do you know anything about what is going on?
So'sep geitoq Mi'gmawei tli'suti.
Joseph knows the Mi'gmaq language.

Gajuewj gisma'mungejgapa'latl mijua'ji'jl.
The cat has severely scratched that child.

Gajuewji'j gejgapa'toq ugpaqam.
The kitten scratches his/her back.

Wen gisgejgapeta'tl ntue'ml?
Who has scratched my dog?

Gejiatl ta'n telqamigsinij ugtue'ml.
He/she knows his/her dog's temperment.

meanings: enclosed space in corner of room
example:
Geji'gas'gigtug lqapijo'tasi.
Hang your things in the corner closet.

Gejigiaq we'gwamg'tegl wi'gatignn.
The books are stacked up to the corner.

Gejigow ji'g'tlo'q gisigmiet.
The kettle boiled a short while ago.

Gejimoqpi na ula, ge' aja'siap.
I'm sitting in the way, I'll move.

Miamuj natgoqwei gejimoqteg muta mu saputa's'tnug goqwei.
There has to be some obstruction because nothing is getting
through.

Mali gelapaqatl napui'gignn elsaqas'gigtug.
Mary screws a picture onto the wall.

Ta'nug gelapaqamn ga'qan?
When are you going to fasten the door?

Lpa gelapaqta'tl a'papi'l lo'gsigtug.
He/she nailed the rope to the log.

Gelapaqte'g pe' nige'.
He/she attaches it just for now.

Nti geleiwatl nuji'jl
My dog is protective of  my grandchild.

gelg'g.translation: He/she holds it down with his/her body weight
example:
Goqwei wejigelgemn legga'pei ga'qan?
Why are you holding the cellar door down/closed with your body?

gelguatl.translation: He/she holds someone down with his/her body weight
example:
Lpa ngwis gelguit wastewigtug.
My son held me down in the snow with his weight.

Telte'tm ntijin gelgwisge'g.
I think that my thumb is fractured.

gelgwisgetesg.translation: It is sprained (due to fall or strain)
example:
Aliasgaja't, muta sepei gisigelgwisgetesg uggwat.
He/she is limping because he/she sprained his/her foot this morning

Nitap gisgelgwisgetestoq ugtangwisgan.
My friend has fractured his/her ankle.

Nata'geliget ula gti.
Your dog guards well.

gelisga'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her by the hand while walking
meanings: take by the  hand while walking
example:
Gelisga'latl witape'sgwal aq telimatl tami ela'ti'gw?
He/she takes a hold of his/her friend's hand and tells (asks) her
where are we going?

Ge' pisgwa'l'g'p na nmu'j, geget geljit.
Let me bring in that dog, he/she is almost frozen.

Nsugwis gelo'tg ta'n telmimajit.
My aunt takes care of how is lives.

Amujpa wela'gw gelpilatl ugtue'ml.
At night he/she has to tie up his/her animal.

Gelpilg nige' usapun.
Now he/she ties up his/her hair.

geltaqanatl.translation: He/she has him/her by a leash
example:
Na ugtue'ml amujpa geltaqanatl.
His/her dog has to be on a leash.

geltaqpilatl.translation: He/she ties him/her with a rope
example:
Geltaqpilatl ugtue'ml glaman ma' ugsmugwannigul.
He/she ties (tethers) his/her pet so it won't run away

geltaqpilg.translation: He/she ties it up with a rope
meanings: tie it up with a rope
example:
Gisgu geltaqpilg ugtul gigjiw na'taqamtug.
The old man ties his boat close to the shore.

gelta'tl.translation: He/she puts a claim on him/her
example:
Getu'gelta'tl amgwesewa'jl.
He/she wants to claim the first one.

gelte'g.translation: He/she puts a claim on it
example:
Ni'n gi's gelte'g na miti's.
I've already claimed that tree.

Gi's samqwan gelt'g?
Is the water frozen yet?

Gi's gelulatl malpale'winitl?
Has he/she spoken to the doctor yet?

Gelu'lg'p mijipjewei gesp'te'g esmugsieg.
The food they fed us on Saturday was good.

geluluet.translation: He/she requests permission from parents to marry their child
meanings: request permission from parents to marry their child
example:
Ngwis to'q natgeluluet ulo'nug.
My son is going to request permission to marry their daughter
tonight.

gelu'si'ji'jit.translation: He/she is very small and somewhat good
example:
Gelu'si'ji'jit na ula gitapenu.
This buddy of ours is good (at what he/she does).

Mawi awisiw gelusit na ji'nm.
That man rarely speaks.

Nasgu gelu'sit atla'i.
Wear a good shirt.

Magasane'j gelutg ugsuliewei'm.
The clerk asks for his/her money.

Nmu'j gemutmatl gajuewjl ugmijipjewe'im.
The dog steals the cat's food.

Negm na i'gmutnalaji wi'gigng.
He/she is always stealing pens.

Mu gemutnatmugup.
He/she did not steal it.

Ula n'me'juwei tetpaqign na gemutneg?
This fish (weight) scale, does it cheat?

Miamuj eig natuen ta'n gemutnet.
There must be someone who steals.

Ji'nmji'j amgwes gennatl unjann.
The young man is holding his child for the first time.

Negm telte'lmg genn'g ms't goqwei.
I think he/she is holding all of it.

Gepaqs'te'g ta'n telgnegg legetal tu'waqann.
He/she guessed correctly how far he/she could throw the ball.

Me' gatu Ma'li gepa'tat.
Mary is really sounding hoarse.

Gepeg wejiaq (u)la wi'gatign.
This letter is from Quebec.

Gepe'gl ns'tuaqann.
My ears are plugged.

Nsitun gepiet.
My voice is hoarse.

Ngij gepijoqwa'latl ugpojml aq teluet mu nugu' suliewei.
My mother closes her purse and says there is no more money.

Ga'qan gep'joqwa'toq.
He/she closes the door.

Gepi'si ni'n te'siegsitpu'g.
I speak huskily every morning.

Pana jijuaqa teleiasi gepistaqanai!
Really, sometimes I seem to be deaf!

Etug tgeia'tat, tewjigepitnetoqsit.
Maybe he/she has a cold, he/she sounds so nasally.

Pa'tlia's gepjoqiget a's'tuo'guomg.
The priest locks up at the church.

Gepjoqign nuta'tesnu gtu'nespnug na wow.
We'll need a cover if we want to bring that pot.

Gepjoqi'satl ugtatla'iml.
He sews his shirt up./She sews her shirt up.

Susan gepjoqi's'g tu'gwesmun.
Susan sews the pillow closed.

E's gepjoqpit.
The clam is shut.

gepjoqta'tl.translation: He/she plugs it(bottle) up by pounding
example:
Pe'(l) gepjoqte'gp na epsaqtejg, wasamp'teg.
I'll close the stove damper, it's too hot.

Magasan gepjoqteg gisgug.
The store is closed today.

gepjoqte'g.translation: He/she plugs it up by pounding
example:
Wen gisgepjoqte'g na ga'qan?
Who nailed the door shut?

Gepmite'lmatl uggeggusgl.
He/she respects his/her godparent.

Maw glu'lg goqwei Lnueiei gepmite'tmg.
It's really good to respect things pertaining to Natives.

Gepsaqa'latl ugpojml aq teluet: mu ugsentmiw nugu'.
He/she closes his/her purse and says: I have no more money.

Gepsaqa'toq ugtui'gatign aq teluet tepiaq na.
He/she closes his/her book and says that is enough.

Unjann gepsga'latl.
He/she puts his/her child to sleep.

Qopisun gepsgiet.
The new born baby is drifting off to sleep.

Ugte'sipowml gepsoqatl leglansigtug.
He/she locks his/her horse in the barn.

Telte'tm me' gepsoqpit na wiguno'q.
I think that the bean jar is still closed.

Ni'n gepsoqqom ga'qan.
I lock the door.

Tegen ga'qan gepsoqteg.
Which door is shut.

Gepta'l'g ngij wiguaq.
I let my mother off at her house.

Uggwe'ji'tl geptaqalatl umpo'qoneg.
He/she throws his/her little sister off his/her bed.

geptaqtoq.translation: He/she throws it off from the top
example:
Lpa geptaqtoql nutapsunn tepteg'pn utepaqang.
He/she threw off my clothes that were on his/her car.

Me' eig goqwei ta'n gp'ta'tas'gt'tew?
Is there anything else to be unloaded?

gepta'sit.translation: He/she gets down from the top
example:
Gisigu gepta'sit na train asugom ajietewei.
The old man got off that six o'clock train.

gepta'toq.translation: He/she takes it down from the top
meanings: remove from the top or inside
example:
Ta'nug gepto'toq pilei gmu'j?
When is he/she going to unload the new wood/lumber?

Wen geptegesnn na lasqo'plawl?
Who threw that board off?

Geget gep't'g na qospem.
The lake is almost frozen over.

Ta'sugunit gept'gewigu's ajipuna'nn?
What date in November is your birthday?

Wen gisgept'jiegetl na la'taqsunn?
Who just threw that pail off?

Ge's pema'tieg na pesoqtesgmai.
While we were walking along I tripped.

Gisigu gesalatl ugtusl.
The old man loves his daughter.

Gesa'lit sa'qati.
The needle hurt me.

Ula mimajuinu'g nata'musga'tu'tij gesaltimgewei.
These people know how to show their love.

Ewuljewe'jit gajuewj waju'et gesaluejijig.
The poor cat is full of burdocks.

Ntusji'j mawgesaluet.
My little daughter is very loving.

Gesaqeg ta'n etlipqamultigw.
It is steep where we(plural inclusive) are sliding .

Gesaqet na mn'tn.
That mountain is steep.

Natgoqwei mesng muta unji gesnugwaj aq gesaqtiat.
He/she has caught something becuase he/she has a headache and
diarrhea.

Ula wenji'guom mawigsaseg Nuelewumg.
This house shines very brightly at Christmas time.

Na'gu'set gesaset nigegsitpu'g.
The sun is bright this morning.

Na'gu'set gesasit gisgug.
The sun is shining bright today.

Gesateg na gisgug.
It's bright today.

Ntus gesatg ugtlgowaqan
My daughter enjoys her job.

Ge's'g, pe'l esgmali!
Hold on, wait for me!

Telguising'p lpa tluweg gesga'latl nme'jl.
He/she was so hungry, you could say he/she made the fish
disappear.

Npugugwe'l mjege'g gesgamu'g ms't goqwei.
If my glasses are dirty everything looks blurred.

Mu nemiaq na miti's, etug gesgamugsitaq.
I don't see that tree, perhaps it is lost in the blur.

Teljaqalpatl pgu'l lpa gesgamugwa'latl.
He/she ate the fudge so quickly, it disappeared.

Tetujigesigawipsaq lpa ugs'tqamu gesgamugwa's'g.
It's snowing so hard the world is disappearing.

Tala'sitaq ula gigmenu, gesgamugwa'sitaq?
What's happened to our buddy, he/she's disappeared?

Nujimilamugwa'teget gisigesgamugwa'toq goqwei.
The painter can make things disappear.

Mtlu'tew gesgamugwiaq.
Smoke fades.

Napui'gign telsa'qawei lpa gesgamugwiet nugu.
The photograph is so old it's fading away.

Gesgapegiaq na maw mujgajewe'l ligpenignn etlitas'gl.
The very best baskets are made in Gesgapegiaq.

Tami etlgesga'sitaq na wi'sisag?
Where did that animal disappear to?

Gesga'i te's gwilm na awti.
I get lost each time I look for that road.

Ntettuo'qonml telpugwelgl, lpa nsulieweim gesgatesg.
I have so many debts, my money disappears in a flash.

Ta'n tujiw jensi gesgatesingaq.
All of a sudden he/she has dissappeared.

Newt epa'sit na gesga'toq petaqan.
At one sitting, he/she made the pie disappear.

Gesge'g na te'sipow.
That horse is wide.

Gesgelmatl na ugtue'ml.
He/she is reluctant to part with his/her animal.

Suitisl gesgelt'mnn?
Are you reluctent to part with the candies/chocolates?

Ula ji'nm mawgesgiaqasit.
This man has a broad back.

Llutaqanigtug uggwe'ji'tl gesgija'latl.
He/she puts his/her little sister over the fence.

Ala gitpu pas('g) gisgesgijaqsing ta'n eimu'g.
That eagle just flew over where we are.

Gesgija'sianeg llutaqan suel nisiei.
When I went over the fence I almost fell.

Ni'nen gis gesgija'tueg na pata'uti.
We have put that table on top (of other things).

gesgiss'g.translation: It passes over in the air
example:
Goqwei ta na gesgiss'g gignaq?
What is that flying over our house?

gesgissing.translation: He/she passes over in the air
example:
Teltetaqa'sit lpa gesgissing llutaqan.
He/she was in such a rush he/she flew over the fence.

Gesgitlmaqanat na Arnold.
That Arnold has broad shoulders.

Gesgitlmaqasit na ji'nmji'j etllugwet.
That young man working there is broad shouldered.

gesgma'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her through a shortcut
example:
Sulian gesgma'latl uggwe'ji'jl.
William takes his sister through a shortcut.

meanings: make someone see things that are not there
example:
La'sgug ignmaj gesgmaplgigwa'lultew.
If you give him/her cards, he/she will perform magic for you.

meanings: see things that are not there
example:
Lpa gesgmaplgigwa't wen wesamiangapt'g goqwei.
One sees things that are not there if they stare at something too
long.

Nenat wen nata'gesgmaplgigwa'teget?
Do you know anyone who does magic tricks?

gesgmaplgigwa'toq.translation: He/she causes it to vanish by magic
meanings: make someone see things that are not there
example:
Netat ta'n wen gistlgesgmaplgigwa'toq?
Do you know who is able make it vanish by magic?

gesgma'qa'latl.translation: He/she causes him/her to get shivers up his/her spine
example:
Ta'n telia'tugwej, lpa gesgma'qa'lit.
The way he/she tells the story, it gives me the shivers.

gesgma'qiet.translation: He/she has shivers up his/her spine
example:
Teluet gesgma'qiet te's tepa'sit nanamiaqawei.
He/she says that he/she has shivers up his/her spine whenever
he/she gets on a rocking chair.

Gesgma'sin magasang elien?
Do you take a short cut when you go to the store?

gesgma'toq.translation: He/she takes it by a shortcut
meanings: take or bring by shortest route
example:
Nemi'g'p wela'gwe'g po'gs pemgesgma'toq.
Last night I saw him/her take a box through the shortcut.

Tetaqa'si, gesgmnaq apaja'sigw.
Hurry up, before he/she gets back.

Ula awti gesgmteg eliaq nipugtug.
This path is a shortcut  to the forest.

Gesgoqomaqasit na ala enmejepuguit.
The one standing with his/her back towards us is broad beamed.

Gesgugg na tmi'gn.
That ax is heavy.

Gesgulg na ula tia'm.
This is a heavy moose.

Ula gwitn gesgulqeg.
This canoe is wide and deep.

gesgunasit.translation: He/she carries(by hand) a heavy load
example:
Giju' gesgunasit, apoqonmuanej.
Mom is carrying heavy parcels, let's help her.

Gesgustuit ugtwisunm ewi'tma'q.
He/she heard me when I mentioned his/her name.

Gesgustuajig ungi'gug etlagnutmanij.
He/she overhears his/her parents speaking.

Gesguta'tl suitisl etlgmutnatgl.
He/she catches him/her by surprise stealing candy.

Pas'g gesgute'gl na pugsugl gesgmnaq nisianugweg.
He/she caught those chunks of wood just before they fell.

gesgutesg'g.translation: He/she gets there on time before it departs/starts
meanings: get there on time before it departs
get there on time just before it starts
example:
Ulagu gesgutesgmeg train.
Yesterday we were on time for the train.

Assma gesgutesgmai, pas'g tet la'mui.
I'm right on time (for a meal), just put my food here.

gesgutesguatl.translation: He/she catches him/her in the act
example:
Pas'g gesgutesgaq aq na pemaja'sit.
Just caught him/her as he/she is leaving.

Gesiangamatl muta telta'sit nenuatl.
He/she stares at him/her because he/she thinks he/she recognizes
him/her.

Nitap mesng wi'gatign aq nige' gesiangapt'g.
My friend received a letter and now just stares at it.

Mu' piamitge'gtnugup gsin.
It wasn't too cold last winter.

Ula gutepaqan gesigaq.
This sled of yours is fast.

Gesigat na wastewei-lasqo'plaw.
That is a fast snow-board.

Gesigawa's'g na tepaqan.
That sleigh goes fast.

Gesigawa'tieg ela'tieg magasang
We hurried to the store.

gesigawatpi'pit.translation: He/she runs fast with head bobbing
example:
Me' st'ge' nemi'gel Elizabeth pemgesigawatpi'pit.
It's like I can still see Elizabeth running fast with her head bobbing.

Mu teleiwawt gesigawewo'gwet?
Do you find he/she speaks quickly?

Gesigawi'pit na ula, amuj na natanguat.
He/she is scooting along quickly, he/she must be going shopping.

Ango'te'n muta gesigawitg ula tet.
Be careful, because the current is swift here.

Wen na ugtue'ml tewjigesigawitnet?
Who's horse is snorting so much?

Gesigawlamin, peitugwi'mu's'p?
You are breathing hard, did you run here?

Ula mulinji'j gesigawlugweg.
This sewing machine works fast.

Gesigawlugwet na ala aluse'wit.
That's a fast working carpenter.

gesigawta'q.translation: It is making a loud sound
example:
Gesigawta'ql na ula nitap witnn.
My friend here snores loud.

meanings: make loud report (as cannon or gun)
example:
Gesigawtewesigeg na tulgowei
That cannon fires a loud report.

meanings: make loud report (as cannon or gun)
example:
Gesigawtewesiget na ala etlpastelgl guntal.
That one who is smashing rocks with explosives is making a loud
noise.

gesigawtoqsit.translation: He/she makes a loud sound with his/her voice
example:
Nujigtapegiet mawgesigawtoqsit.
The singer has a loud voice

Gesigawweg na jijuejg
That bell is loud.

meanings: makes a loud noise with voice
example:
Gesigawwet na nujgina'muet.
That teacher talks loud.

Nasa'l gesigewe'g.
Put on the winter ones (e.g. boots).

Gesigewigu's na gesigewei tepgunset.
December is the winter month.

Gujjinu gesigsnugwat.
Our father is very ill.

Sugulegaq goqwei na gesima'q.
Anything rotten has a strong order.

gesimaqapsgeg.translation: It is very large and round
example:
Weliangamgug aq gesimaqapsgeg na wasueg.
That flower looks nice and it is large and round.

gesimaqapsg'sit.translation: He/she is very large and round
example:
Gesimaqapsg'sit na ula gulgwi's
This pig is very large and round.

Gesima't na la'taqsun, amujpa waqama'lut.
That pail stinks, it must be cleaned.

Gesimlgigna'tieg ta'n tujiw gismawita'ieg.
We are very strong when we get together.

Gesimt'g, miamuj gesitesing.
He/she is wailing, he/she must have really hurt him/herself.

Ji'nm gesipa'latl ugtue'ml
The man scratches his dog.

gesipatl.translation: He/she hurts someone by biting hard
example:
Wi'sisji'j gesipatl Pie'lal.
The small animal gave Peter a painful bite.

Mui'n e'watl miti'sl gesipa'toq ugpaqam.
The bear uses a tree to scratch his/her (own) back

Pie'l gesipa'tuaj ugti'l ugpaqam.
Peter scratches his dog's back.

Gesipa'tuatl witapal uggatl.
He/she scratches his/her friend's feet.

Eig na jijgluewjuapi ta'n mu gesipguenug.
There is wool that doesn't cause itchiness.

Gesipguit na ula pilei ntmatletm.
This new blouse is very itchy.

Ntsisqon gesipiaq.
My nose is itchy.

Pugwelg ta'n wen geggung na gesipiemgewei.
Many people have ezcema.

Gaqapegwigsipiet.
He/she is itchy all over.

gesipta'tl.translation: He/she scratches him/her with an object
example:
Lpa jig'putaqan e'w'g gesipta'j te'sipowl.
He/she actually uses a rake to scratch the horse.

gesipte'g.translation: He/she gives it a quick scratch
example:
Amaljugwej gesipte'g ugpaqam e'w'g gmu'jij.
The racoon scratched his/her back using a small stick.

Nmu'j gesipto'sit.
The dog scratches him/herself.

Lpa'tu'ji'j gesipualatl nmu'jl.
The young boy wants the dog very much.

Goqwei Mali gesipuatg?
What does Mary want a lot?

gesisewigna't.translation: He/she is very weak from being ill
example:
Nitape'sgw gesisewigna't.
My female friend is very weak from her illness.

Sangew gesispa'latl unjanji'tl.
Slowly he/she washes his/her baby.

Tepiaq telgilg, nige' gesispa'lsit negm.
He/she is big (old) enough, now he/she bathes him/herself.

gesispapalatl.translation: He/she gives him/her a sponge bath
example:
Pas'g gesispapalatl ugti'l.
He/she only sponge bathes his/her pet.

gesispapalsit.translation: He/she washes self slightly and hastily
example:
Gesispapalsit gesgmnaq gegna'sigw.
He/she gives him/herself a sponge bath before dressing.

gesispapatoq.translation: He/she washes it slightly and hastily
example:
Pas'g gesispapatoq usapun.
He/she hastily washed his/her hair.

gesispa'tegemgewei.translation: Cloth or other object used for washing
example:
Ula epit gesispa'tegemgewei.
Here is the cloth you use for washing.

Maw naqajigmig gesispa'tegei.
I never feel like washing the floors.

Gesispa'toq pilei utepaqan te'sigisg'g.
He/she washes his/her new car every day.

Apjiw gesistaqnewet Ta'puowei.
He/she always washes clothes on Tuesday.

Gesita'tl na ugtue'ml.
He/she hurt his/her pet badly.

Gesite'lmatl uggeggusgl.
He/she is really fond of his/her godparent.

meanings: get hurt badly (from a fall or an accident)
example:
Lpatu'j ta'n wejinisiet lgusuaqanigtug na gesitesing.
The boy that fell from the ladder is hurt bad.

meanings: really, especially, or extremely  fond of
example:
Gesite'tg pilei utepaqan.
He/she is really fond of his/her new car.

Ala gesite'wet e'pite's.
That young woman is very attractive.

Tuma gesitewipnet newtitpa'q.
Tom groaned all night.

Gesitowaqji'jit na ula e'pit.
This woman is very short.

Sugulegaq wius mawgesleg.
Rotten meat really stinks.

Apigjilu geslet.
The skunk stinks.

Tal gis Pie'l gesma'latl uggwe'ji'tl?
Why does Peter push his younger sister?

Gesmapewit na ji'nmji'j.
That's a weird looking young man.

Tal gis Pie'l gesmaqaltl uggwe'ji'tl?
Why does Peter shove his younger sister?

Pas'g gesmaqtoq.
He/she just shoves it.

Gesma'toq, pas'g telgi'g, etug ma' pgwanmug.
He/she pushes it, but it's so big he/she might not be able to move
it.

Mnawigsmegej gwitn sipug.
He/she shoves the canoe out onto the river.

Gesmigit na wasuego'q.
That vase is shapely.

gesmi'sit.translation: He/she speaks with a heavy accent
meanings: speak in odd or unusual way
example:
Listugujewa'j maw gesmi'sit.
Listuguj people have a heavy accent.

Gesmjiegetl witapal aq jileiwatl.
He/she shoves his/her friend and injuires him/her.

Witapal apt'tesinniteg gesmoqja'lapnn.
He/she pushes his/her buddy when he/she (the buddy) got stuck.

Lpa gesmoqja'toq utepaqan glapis wiguwaq.
He/she pushed his/her car all the way to his/her house.

gesmoqjeget.translation: He/she gives it a quick push
example:
Telgispnet nugu', pas'g gesmoqjeget.
He/she is so tired, he/she just gave it a quick shove.

Ula ji'nm maw gesm'pisit.
This man dresses very fancily.

gesmtesg'g.translation: He/she moves it by bumping it
example:
Gesmtesg'g ga'qan.
He/she bumps the door.

gesmtesguatl.translation: He/she moves him/her by bumping him/her
example:
Gesmtesguatl witapal glapis ejigla'sinnitl.
He/she kept bumping his/her friend until the friend went elsewhere.

gesnoqowite'tg.translation: He/she does not take it seriously
example:
Ansue'g teligsnoqowite'tg ta'n goqwei wesgo'tg.
It's unfortunate that he/she does not take what he/she is doing
seriously.

Nunji gesnuguig.
My head aches.

gesnuguit.translation: It(knee) is sore or aches me
example:
Gesnuguit njigun.
My knee is sore or aches.

gesnugwaj.translation: It aches or is sore on him/her
example:
Unji gesnugwaj.
He/she has a  headache.

Gespiaqantie'uti gaqaiaq na gesnugwapewit.
When the weekend is over he/she looks sick.

Gesnugwan? Teliewlapewin.
Are you ill? Your face is so wan.

Te's amgwes ellugutimg na gesnugwe'galsit.
Every Monday he/she pretends to be sick.

Mu' welo'tegegw ula ji'nm, lpa gesnugwetoqsit.
This man isn't feeling well, he really sounds sickly.

Gesnugwiangamgusit na maljewe'j.
That young person looks sickly.

Gesoqet na apigjilu.
That skunk has a strong odor.

Gesoqsit na ewuljewe'jit!
He/she got a painful burn, the poor thing!

gespaqami'g.translation: It is the end of the world
example:
Tetujimamuna'sit lpa tlta'sig gespaqami'g.
He/she makes such a fuss, you would think that this was the end of
the world.

Enmenipg eliei Gespe'g.
This summer I'm going to Gespe'.

Gespe'gewa'j oqwa't.
The person from Gaspe arrives.

Gesp'g na ula wa'qan.
This knife is dull.

Esgmatm na gespiaqantie'uti gesgmnaq maja'siw.
I'm waiting until the weekend before I leave.

Tlawo'ql gesplatl.
He/she dulls the knife.

meanings: present day southern western Nova Scotia
example:
Gi's gi'l Gespogwitg wejien?
Have you been to the First District?

Gesp'teg nmultes.
I will see you on Saturday.

Gesp'toq na tmi'gn.
He/she makes the axe dull.

Tal gis gespugua'latl?
How come he/she lies to him/her?

Wennju'su'nl wejiaql Gespugwitg na maw wigapu'gl.
Apples from the Annapolis Valley are very tasty.

Tami wesgowa'sit gespugwitnewa'j?
Where is the person from Gesugwitg staying?

Gespu'tuatl atnaqanigtug.
He/she beats him/her in checkers.

Gespu'tue's'p wela'gwe'g?
Did you win last night?

Gestunepilaqann gi's sa'q giaspie'was'gl ula Ganata.
The gallows haven't been used for a long time here in Canada.

Najiatiewitesg ge's mu maja'siwun.
Come and say good-bye before you leave.

Lpa'tuj getalqa'latl nmu'jl samuqwanigtug
The boy takes the dog out of the water.

Angam, natqogwei getalqa'toq.
Look at him/her, he/she takes something out.

Lpa getalqigwalatl ugtejgewe'l tap'tann maqamigewigtug.
He/she dug the last potato out of the ground.

Amujpa getalqigwatg utepaqan
He/she has to dig out his/her vehicle.

Geta'muaji witapa.
He/she agrees with his/her friends.

Nitap getanatl tia'mul.
My friend is hunting for a moose.

Pegije'g'p getanqigalatl ge'tiapl gesgmnaq pe'sguagweg.
He/she stalked the bull moose for a long time before he/she shot
him.

Gesig getanteget.
In the winter he/she hunts.

Apjiw na lpa'tuj getantoq ugsulieweim.
That boy always works for his money.

Jijuaqa na itew ta'n getanuet.
Sometimes there will be someone who is spiteful

Gmu'j na getapa'q?
Does a stick sink?

Gi's ap getapa'sitaq, mu gejiam'g ta'n goqwei apaja'tew.
He/she has gone underwater again, who knows what he/she will
bring back this time.

Pegije'g getapa't gesgmnaq apajiqo'gwegw.
He/she sank for a long time before resurfacing.

Getapegiet te'sigisg'g pas'g mu' wen jigs'tagugul.
He/she sings daily, but no one listens to him/her.

Ninen getapeieg qospemg.
We dive at the Lake.

Getapeteg qospemg lpa getapetesing sisguigtug.
When he/she dove into the lake he/she dove into the mud.

getapja'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her with bare hands
example:
Getapja'latl witapal aq maja'tijig.
He/she grabs his/her buddy with bare hands and they leave.

getapja'sit.translation: He/she takes it with bare hands
example:
Negm getapja'sit mgumi.
He/she took the ice in his/her bare hands

getapja'toq.translation: He/she takes it with bare hands
example:
Getapja'toq aq smtug mijjit.
He/she takes it with his/her bare hands and immediately begins to
eat.

Nigoqol mu e'wagul, lpa getapsgnatl ga'tal.
He/she didn't use an eel spear, he/she holds the eel barehanded.

getapsgng.translation: He/she take hold of it with bare hands
example:
Getapsgng na gasawo'qapi telitgigg'p.
He/she has a hold of that cold wire with his/her bare hands.

Lpa ms't getemetesultijig.
Every single one was killed.

Me' gatu getgaqamigsit na mimajuinu.
That person is very ill-mannered.

Ta'n wen jagejuatalg mawgetgatalg.
Whom ever eats to clean out (by eating) eats ill-manneredly.

Tal gis etug telgetge'g?
Why do you think that person is so indecent?

Te's esamqwaj amujpa wejit'giet
Each time he/she drinks he/she has to get drunk.

Wesamigsigawa'sit wela'gwe'g na utepaqan getgugjetesg'p.
He/she was going too fast last night

Te's poqtateitoq lpa'tu'ji'j utepaqan, na emigetgugjia'q.
Everytime the little boy starts pulling his sledge, it turns upside
down.

Jini'w getgujeitesing mgumigtug.
Suddenly he/she flips on the ice.

Nuji'j getgunit ulo'nug
My grandchild is sleeping over tonight.

Gesatg getgwi'g na lpa'tug.
Loves to run, that boy .

Sepei nemi'g'p ge'tiap.
I saw a full grown bull moose this morning.

meanings: harvest crops(of roots, tubers, potatoes, carrots, turnips)
example:
Te'sipunqeg mimajuinu'g i'ge'tipna'tipnig pastung.
Every year people used to harvest crops in the US.

Sose'p na negm ge'tipnewinu.
Joseph is the harvester.

Ula e'pit getlamite'lmaji unjang.
This woman trusts her children.

meanings: follow, as in beliving in something
example:
Getlams'tm ta'n te's'g goqwei teluen.
I believe all that you say.

Nnjang na apjiw gtlams'tuitaq
My children will always believe me.

Pie'l na mawigsatg e'w'g "getletug".
Peter likes using "certainly".

Getlewei na ta'n goqwei gistlim'sg.
What he/she just told you is true.

Gjitmei getloqo na teliaq!?
Really, is that certain, is that true!?

Nignaq pegisinaneg gi's getma'lisnaq.
When I got home he/she had already finished all my food.

Na Bio'tigaq getmenejig.
The Beothuk are extinct.

Metua'sit na ta'n telwe'ju'j nugu' wisgoq ula Mi'gma'gig, amuj na
nugu' getmenet.
It's difficult to find black ash here in Mi'gma'gi, it must be almost
extinct.

Llui geget getmeta'jig plamu'g sipug.
Louis has almost wiped out the salmon in this river.

Lpa ms't getmete'gl Jonni.
Johnny wins every single one of them.

Pie'l getmete'mateg, na apoqonmuip ni'newe'g.
When Peter finished his off, he helped me with mine.

Nipugt nu'gwa'g aq ms't miti'sg getmoqsijig.
The forest is on fire and all the trees are burned.

Getmoqtegl ta'n te's'gl mutputi'l.
All of the chairs are completely burned.

Glapis gatu getuapematl ungi'gul.
He/she finally desires support from his/her parent.

Getuapetg ugtalsutmaqanm.
He/she seeks help from his/her prayers/religion.

Amujpa ms't wen getuapsit.
Everyone has to fends for themself.

Nape'w getu'g wejgwapniaq.
The rooster crows at daybreak.

Jijuaqa wen miawna'gweg getugsiet.
Sometimes one gets drowsy in the middle of the day.

Teleiaq nnjan getugsit.
I find that my child is sleepy.

Te's nemi'g na glutmuitew suliewei, getugtnumqwanet.
Each time I see him/her, he/she will ask me for money because
he/she wants a drink.

Nmijgamij getu'muatl nnjann.
My grandfather plays a tune for my child.

Nmijgamij mawigsatg getu'muej.
My grandfather likes to play music.

getu'nmiet.translation: He/she wants or intends to go home
example:
Assma nige' gisgaje'g, getu'nmiet.
He/she is ready just now, he/she wants to go home.

Lpa getu'patl mese'nitl jagejl.
He/she just wants to eat a whole lobster.

Nugumij getu'pgising sapo'nug.
My grandmother is expected to arrive tomorrow.

Teligtutg na lusgnign lpa pene'sugwa't.
He/she wants to eat that bannock so much, he/she is salivating.

Munig getu' unjanit.
Monique is expecting a baby.

gewaqs'g.translation: It is fell by the wind
example:
Lpa lmu'j wiguowji'j gewaqs'g.
The dog's house was blown over by the wind.

gewaqsing.translation: It(tree) is blown down by the wind
example:
Etlite'lmg miti'ji'j gewaqsingaq.
I believe the small tree has been blown down (by the wind).

gewg'g.translation: He/she forces it(that is upright) down with his/her weight
meanings: force it(that is upright) down with one's weight
example:
Lpa'tuj gewg'g llutaqanatgw.
The boy forced down the fence post with his weight.

gewguatl.translation: He/she forces him/her (that is upright) down with his/her weight
meanings: force ...(that is upright) down with one's weight
example:
Ge'sg milguaj glapis gewguatl.
After pushing in many ways he/she is at last able to force him/her
down (with his/her weight).

gewiaq.translation: It falls down from upright position
example:
Lpa jini'w lgusuaqan gewiaq.
All of a sudden the ladder fell over.

gewiet.translation: He/she falls over from a standing position
example:
Suel gewiet (u)la gigmenu, telgispnet.
Our buddy almost fell, he/she is so tired.

Wen gewising nige'?
Who is hungry now?

Gewjatpewji aq gisa'lig gewjia'qiei.
My head being cold is causing me to shiver.

Telo'tm gesigewjia'qiei gisgug.
I find that I'm unusually susceptible to having chills today.

gewjipnewjit.translation: He/she feels his/her hands are cold
example:
Apua'tui npitnnji'tl gewjipnewji.
Warm up my little hands their cold.

Gewjit, ignmu app igtig a'su'n.
He/she is cold, give him/her another blanket.

Wen gisigewsatl na miti'sl?
Who has cut that tree down?

gews'g.translation: It is toppled by the wind
example:
Gews'gl mtawegnn.
The flags are blown over by the wind.

gewtaqsigit.translation: He/she feels his/her feet are cold
example:
Gaqi'sg wen gewtaqsigit gesig.
One often has cold feet during the winter.

Mali gewta'tl ugjignaml.
Mary knocks her younger brother down.

Wen gisgewte'g na mutputi?
Who knock the chair down?

Apjiw negm gisilita'simg giasgilugwen.
He/she can always be relied on to work with precision.

Me' gi'l welnenmn, mu' ni'n geitu ta'n tegen giasgiw.
You know this better, I don't recognize which one is correct.

Ge giasgiwewei telimulnap ni'n.
Let me tell you about the right one.

Ta'n tujiw gaqa'tuan na nmites ta'n telgiaspiaq.
When I'm finished you will see the results.

Nitap giaspiet ta'n telnaqsipisgwa'j.
My friend makes a habit for coming in early.

Jiptug ma ap esgmatmug giaspigisg'gtn ge's mu poqtajigw.
Hopefully he/she won't once again wait until the last day before
getting ready.

Mise'l giasplugwep Nuelewumgeg.
The last time Michel worked was at Christmas time.

Tatujisa'q gi'l giaspiw ugjua'l't samqwano'q?
How long has it been since you last filled the water bucket?

Teleiaq tlawo'q gi'g.
I find the butcher knife is sharp.

Ge's gi'gaj elugwatg, glapis gisa'to'q.
Because he/she persisted in working at it, at last it is done.

E'pite'ji'j gi'gaja'latl ugtue'ml ugjit apaja'sinin wiguwaq.
The little girl forces her pet to return to the house.

Nata'gi'gaja'sit na negm.
He/she is very argumentative.

Ngwe'ji'j gesatg gi'gajeiwij.
My little sister likes to tease me.

Gi'gajie'watl ugtlawo'qoml tlia nige' gesp'nnij.
He/she uses his/her knife inspite of it being dull.

Gi'gajlugwet tlia' mu welo'tegegup.
He/she is working in spite of not feeling well.

Gi'gajims'p gi'l?
Did you reply sarcastically to him/her??

L'patuj gi'gajinmigimatl ugtue'ml wela'gwe'g.
The little boy forcefully sent  his dog home last night.

gi'gajo'tg.translation: He/she uses it in spite of it's condition
example:
Gisa'toq ge's gi'gajo'tg.
He/she got it done because of his/her persistence.

Metua'sit gi'gamgo'n ta'n pegoqsit.
It's hard to find a long straight boat pole.

Wen etlgi'gassit?
Who is teasing?

Wen gi'gassmatl ntue'ml?
Who forcefeeds my pet?

Mesgilg gi'gassuinu na negm.
That one is a real big teaser.

Gelu'sit a'tugwewinu, aq gesatg gi'gataganutg.
He/she is a good story teller and he/she likes to embelish.

Pana ne'gaw gi'gatagnimatl
He/she has always exaggerated what he/she says about him/her.

Gi's ap igtigl pa'tlia'sl etlgi'gatagnutmuatl.
He/she is once again exaggerating to another priest.

gigjagumatl.translation: He/she is closely related to him/her
example:
So'sep gigjagumatl Maliannal
Joseph is closely related to Mary Ann

Gigjapit, etnana wejiugpugugweia'q.
He/she is near sighted, that is why he/she wears glasses.

Ntue'm na gigji'w ale'tew.
My dog will be close by.

Nmu'j pisgwa't aq gigj'pa'sualatl gajuewjl.
The dog comes in and goes to sit close to the cat.

Wen gi'gligjens'pn?
Who tickled him/her?

Ni'n ngatl mawgi'gligsigl.
My feet are very ticklish.

Gatu gi'l, gi'gligsin?
How about you, are you ticklish?

Siawmilita'nej, gigpesa'ji'jg na pas'g.
Let's continue playing, it's just a shower.

Ugs'tqamu wela's'g gigpesan nei'a's'g.
The earth (world) feels good when the rain shows up.

meanings: looks like it's going to rain
example:
Gisgug na we'gwigigpesanamu'g
Today it looks very misty

Gigpesanamugwiaq, masqo'tnej mijipjewei.
Rain clouds are approaching, let's put the food away.

Ma' gujmug gistlatalultiqw, etlgigpesaq.
We won't be able to eat outdoors, it's raining.

gigto'qopugua'sit.translation: He/she turns about while he/she is standing
meanings: turn about while in standing position
example:
Te's gigto'qopugua'si gi's nti wejgu'lapit.
Everytime I turn around my dog is staring up at me.

Teluejig gi'gwaju ma' etegj'pugua'sigul wenn.
They say a badger will not back down from anybody.

Talamugsit na wi'sis gi'gwesu?
What kind of animal is a muskrat?

meanings: muskrat root (cold remedy, mix with liquid or chewed)
example:
Maw wegetu nige' gi'gwesuasgw, telitgeia'tai.
I could really use some muskrat root now, I have such a bad cold.

Ge'ijga'jijg atpugua'si, pasgmuin ngat.
Could you move over a little bit, your standing on my foot.

Ala' Mali neia'sit aq teluet, gijga'tata'n!
Mary comes around and says, right on!

Tugwia'neg gijitpa'qtug eim, lpa mu tami elapiw.
When I woke up I was in total darkness, I could see nothing.

Giju' tami elien?
Mother where are you going?

Gi'l aq ni'n natmila'tinej utang.
You and I should go play in town.

Ta'nug gilew maita'ioq?
When are you (plural) leaving?
Ta'nug gilew maja'tioq?
When are you (two) leaving?

Gi'lewei ula mijua'ji'j?
Is this your(singular) child?

Gilewewei (u)la mijua'ji'j?
Is this your(plural) child?

We'gwisa'q gimamit, glapis na msna's.
He/she has been spying on me for a long while now, I'll eventually
catch him/her at it.

Gimapit pas'g moqwa' goqwei nemitug.
He/she peeks but sees nothing.

Wen algimapt'g ni'g?
Who is peeking at my home?

Algime'g na ula muta aligalaji Nuelewumgewe'g apsute'gang.
He/she is being secretive because he/she is hiding Christmas
presents.

Ge's etlgimelmij na mesnut.
While he/she was laughing to him/herself, he/she got caught.

gimelmugtasit.translation: He/she laughs at self in a secret manner
meanings: laugh at oneself in a secret manner
example:
Sosep pemit aq pemgimelmugtasit, etug goqwei gisio'pla'toq?
Joseph is going by and secretly laughing at himself, I wonder what
he has done wrong?

Gimewistoq gatu nutut.
He/she whispers but is heard.

gimewo'gwet.translation: He/she talks in a low voice
meanings: speak or talk in a whisper
example:
Negm maw gimewo'gwet.
He/she talks in a low voice.

Wen na ala algimiet?
Who is that over there sneaking around?

Wesgowa'sit legla'nsigtug, etlgimilugwet.
He/she is in the barn, working in secret.

Na mawinta'gimsgwet na ji'nm nipugtug.
That man can walk very quietly in the forest.

Nujitia'mue'get gis(i)gimteluatl wi'sisl.
The moose hunter ambushes the animal.

Ala maljewe'j sigu'sgw pas'g nugu' gimtemit.
All that young widow does is cry silently.

Goqwei wejigtu'gimtesg'g?
Why does he/she want to sneaks up on it?

Wije'wi, gimtesguanej.
Come with me, let's sneak up on him/her.

Gimu'tug gigjeiwatl umijgamijl na lpa'tuj.
That boy is somewhat close to his grandfather.

Gisgug pewatmn gina'masuti.
Today you want an education.

Wigumgewigu's gina'matimg wenaqiaq.
In September the time of learning kicks off.

Gina'muo'guomg negm etllugwet.
He/she works at the school.

gina'sit.translation: He/she puts a lot of effort
example:
Nuji'j gina'sit gegina'masit.
My grandchild puts a lot of effort studying.

Ginateja'tieg ta'n tuji'w gisgespu'tueie'g.
We were strutting along after we defeated everyone.

Ginigwejij na maw ginigwet.
Thistle are very prickly.

Ge jugwega na tapu'ginisgwe'g tu'aqan?
Would you toss me that football?

Ngopa'si ala ntulg, ta'n etlginisgwig.
Sit on my canoe, at the pointed end.

Wen ta na telgintewoqsit?
Who is it that is snoring so loud?

Pugwelg lugowaqan ginu gisa'tu'g.
We have accomplished many tasks.

So'sep ginualatl unjann.
Joseph  brags about his child.

Ginuatg ta'n telgina'masij.
He/she brags about his/her studies.

Welgamigsit, pas'g gesatg ginuej.
He/she is nice enough, but he/she loves to brag.

Ula pilei nmu'ji'j ginuowei.
This new puppy is ours.

Gi'nujultieg ugjit ta'n tel gisi ullugutieg.
We are feeling proud of our accomplishments.

Gisigu gipoqamatl ugti'l.
The old man caught a glimpse of his dog.

Pas'g gipoqapt'g ugtwi'gatign.
He/she just glances at his/her book.

Lpa gipoqtelg uggwat ge's etlwaqama'toq na pe'sgewei.
He/she actually grazed his/her foot while he/she was cleaning the
gun.

Wen gisgipoqteluatl na jipji'jl?
Who shot at that bird grazing it?

Gi's gisapniaq gisgug.
It's already daybreak today.

Gisa'latl wesgewigwa'silitl.
He/she caused him/her to smile.

Mu wen pualawt gisanulin.
You don't want anyone to destroy you.

gisapsgnatl.translation: He/she gets a hold of him/her
example:
L'patuj gisapsgnatl ugti'l aq enma'latl.
The boy gets a hold of his dog and takes it home.

gisapsgng.translation: He/she gets a hold of it
example:
Ulta'sites gisapsgnmann na wi'gatignn.
I will be happy if I could get a hold of those periodicals/papers.

Gi's sa'q gisa'tas'g.
It's been fixed for a long time.

Nta'pim elugomiap, aq nige' gisgatpit, gisa'tasitaq.
I took my net in to be repaired, and now it is ready, it has been
repaired.

Ulagu ne'wijig plamu'g gi's'g'pnig.
Yesterday I cooked four salmon.

Ta'n pas'g goqwei gisa'toq negm.
He/she can fix anything.

gise'g.translation: He/she is having a good time
example:
Gisoltie'g Nuelewumgeg.
We had a good time at Christmas.

Wen gi's'g ula, telwigapu'g?
Who cooked this, it's so delicious?

Gisgaja'latl ap'tapegiejinitl glamen giswissugwalatal.
He/she is preparing the turkey so he/she can cook it.

Wela'gwewei gisgaja'tas'g na'n ajiet.
The supper meal is prepared at five o'clock.

Gisgaja'tuap gutapsunnu, smtug maita'nej.
I got our stuff ready,  let's leave immediately.

Gisgaje'g aq pas'g epit maja'sin.
He/she's prepared and good to go.

Gisgajiei ugjit ms't goqwei.
I am ready for anything.

Pilei gutepaqan gisgajoqosg.
Your new car lays in wait.

Gisgatpit a'pi, nige' mnnawa'tinej.
The net is ready now let's go out on river.

Ntue'm gisgatpuguit maja'sin.
My horse is standing ready to leave.

Tmg gisgatta'pni ne'gasgi'gng getuito'q wiguom.
He/she first prepared the poles when he/she wanted to make a
wigwam.

Gi's gistatteg ugtmutputim.
Your chair is already ready (waiting).

We'gwitge'g gisgug.
My it's cold today.

Wen gisiatl ula wesgitji'jl?
Who made this little vest?

Gisigu aq ugte'piteml natanguajig.
The old man and his wife go shopping.

Nutepaqan nugu' gisigu'aq.
My vehicle, at this point, is getting old.

Mu' pas'g ni'n, ms't wen gisigu'et.
It's not only me, everyone is aging.

Ula gisigui'sgw teluisit Mali.
This elderly woman's name is Mary

gisigu'lega't.translation: He/she walks like an old person
example:
Gisigu'lega't nsugwis.
My aunt walks like an old person.

Nesunmann gisigu'lgul.
I have three old canoes.

Ula awti enm'teg, na gisiguo'p wi'g eteg.
The old man's house is located on this road.

gisigu'qamigsit.translation: He/she acts like an old person
example:
Newte'jit wijig'tieg mawgisigu'qamigsit.
One of my siblings really acts like an old person.

Ula nti na gisigu'sgw.
My pet is an old female.

Tapusijig gisigu'sgwe'jg wigijig ala wenjiguomg.
There are two spinsters living in that house.

Poqsawo'q gisigu'smt'p ge's mu nepmugweg.
(The late) Poqsaw was an old animal before he died.

Gi's gisigwegl na te'sipowmann, mna'taqamug.
Those oats are mature, harvest them.

Ni'n ajipuna'i gisigwegewigu's.
My birthday is in August.

Nsugwis pugwelniji no'guma(g) gisigwenaji.
My aunt has raised many members of my family.

Ala ji'nm geggung tmawei ta'n negm gisigweng.
That man has tobacco he grew himself.

Ula nipat na gisigwenign.
My friend is an adopted child.

Ta'nug etug gisigwetes?
When do you think you will be grown up?

Gi's sa'q gislugwet, gatu ne'gaw mu getu' lugwegw.
He/she has been able to work for a long time, but he/she hasn't
wanted to work.

Wesumgegwe'in, gi's gisintue'g.
You were too slow, we already sang.

Gi's gisipiasit na la'taqsun?
Is that pail dry yet?

Gi's gisipiateg na gasigo's'ti?
Is that towel dry yet?

Glapis gatu gisi'satl ugta'piml.
He/she has finally sewn his/her net.

Mali gisi's'g ugmagotm.
Mary sew her dress.

Ta'nug gi'sit tagali'j?
When will the goose be cooked?

Mu ge'itmm'g ta'n wen gisite'lmatl a'pil.
It's not known who invented the net.

Ula ji'nm gisite'tg pilei mila'suaqan.
This man invented a new toy.

Ta'n wen gisitoq ula mutputi nata'lugwet.
Whomever made this chair is skilled at their craft.

Gislassijig nugu' ula glitaq.
These berries are ripe now.

Ula wennju'su'n gislasteg nige'.
The apple is ripe now.

Tegen me' welaptmn, watapteg ula eteg? Gisna ala wisawe'g eteg?
Which one do you like better, the yellow one here? Or the ochre
one over there?

Sapo'nug tliultesgultesg gisoqegigtug.
Tomorrow I'll meet you on the hill top.

Nige' giso'qon wenaqiaq.
Now the fun begins.

Je gi's gisoqsit na plamu?
Is that salmon already cooked?

Gi's gisoqteg na wius?
Is that meat cooked yet?

Pas'g gispasas'g gmu'j pisgo'tu.
Just bring in cured wood.

Etug tepiaq telgispasasij na lasqo'plaw?
Do you think that plank is cured enough?

Gisigigpesaq na gispasatl ugti'l.
After the rain he/she drys his/her dog.

Epune'g epit gispasawemgewei e'w.
Use the dryer that's downstairs.

Gispasg utapsun muta gis gwija't sitmug.
He/she is drying their clothes because he/she fell in the water
down the shore.

Ula jagej na gispasit.
This lobster is dry.

Is our clothing dry yet?
Gi's gispategl gutapsunal?

Jijuaqa mo'qopit gispisun nasgaq.
Sometimes I wear a fancy belt.

E'e, telte'lmg gispisuna'qap.
Yes, I think he/she had a belt on.

Gispnapewit nugu' gigmenu.
Our companion at this time (finally) looks tired.

Npitnn gispnegl
My hands are tired.

Me' gatu gispnei.
My word, I am tired.

gispnetoqsit.translation: He/she has a tired sounding voice
example:
Gispnetoqsit na nujintoq.
The singer sounds tired.

Newtiegsitpu'g atl'get, nige' gispniet.
He/she walked all morning, now he/she is tiring.

Ugtue'ml gispnultl.
His/her pet exhausts him/her.

Wen gista'tl ula lpa'tujl?
Who beat-up this boy?

Giste'g gtapegiaqan na glusitew.
Once he/she has played the song he/she will speak.

Gijuaqa telo'lg teleiut st'ge' gisteju.
Sometimes he/she feels he/she is treated like a slave.

Mu' gejiam'g ta'n tegen nmu'j gisteluaqtl nti'l.
I wonder which dog impregnated my dog.

Gisue'g ula pilei wenji'guom.
This new house is warm.

Gewjiap ulagu, gatu gisu'gm gisgug.
I was cold yesterday, so I'm warmly dressed today.

Gisu'lgw na ni'n elia'sutmai.
The Creator is the one I pray to.

Gaqgisu'pegiaqasneg gsamqwanminu.
All our water has become lukewarm.

Gis na welgisu'paqsinijig na ula mlagejg.
This milk is already lukewarm enough for him/her.

Tgnu waju'pet muta wesamgisu'pisit.
He/she is full of sweat because he/she is dressed too warmly.

Mali apjiw gisu'piso'tlaji unjang.
Mary always clothes her children warmly.

Gi's sa'q giasplugwas'g na awti.
It's a long time since that road has been worked on.

Gi'taqan e'w, maw ulsiputeget.
Use a grindstone, it sharpens very well.

Tami nigwet gi'taqanmusi?
Where does the Staghorn sumac grow?

Gitaqasultitesnu sapo'nug, telgneg gisgug we'ita'igw.
We will ache tomorrow, we have gone so far today.

Ulagu ajiwsiap aq gisgug npaqam gitaqeg.
Yesterday I moved my furniture and today my back is aching.

Gitaqet nji'taqan.
My neck is sore.

Gi's gi'teg wela'gwewei?
Is supper cooked (ready) yet?

Wijig'tijig aq gitg Mi'gmewi'sijig.
They are siblings and they both speak Mi'gmaq.

Tegenn gitmaqann geggunmnn?
Which count sticks do you have?

Nnjan gitnmat ta'n telgina'masij.
My child has difficulty in studying.

gitnmeiwatl.translation: He/she gives him/her a hard time
example:
Gitnmeiwit pilei ntue'm.
My new pet is giving me a hard time.

gitnmo'tg.translation: He/she gives it a hard time
example:
Gitnmo'tg na uggwat, gi's ta'pu temtestoq.
He/she is hard on his/her foot, he/she has broken it twice.

Igtigulagu nemi'g't'p gitpu alaqsing nipugtug.
The other day we saw an eagle flying in the woods.

E'pite's gi'waje'g ta'n witapal maja'sinipnn.
The young woman is listless since her friend left.

Ugtusl pegisinitl, gi's na sa'q giwajeiwatl.
His/her daughter has arrived, he/she has longed for her a long time.

Gi'wajiaq ta'n teluet.
He/she is telling the truth

Gi's sa'q giwajo'tg gina'masuti.
He/she has yearned a long time for an education.

Giwasg aq wasoqotesg na mu wije'tinugul.
Heat lightning and thunder lighting do not go together.

giwattesguatl.translation: He/she is sadden by his/her departure
example:
Wo'guma giwattesguaji natlugweteg pastung.
His/her family missed him/her when he/she went to work in the
United States.

Giwgw na ma'munpepuetestegeg.
An earthquake really shakes things up.

Giwnig na wisawamugsit wi'sisji'j.
The otter is a small brownish animal.

So'sep algigto'qa'latl pile'l uji'jl.
Joseph is taking his new grandchild around.

App giwto'qa's'g, ugjo'te'n msnmn.
When it goes around again, try to catch it.

giwto'qasga'latl.translation: He/she turns him/her to point in opposite direction
meanings: turn around to point in opposite direction
example:
Giwto'qasga'latl aq telimatl nmia.
He/she turns him/her to point in opposite direction and tells him/her
to go home.

giwto'qasga'toq.translation: He/she turns something around to point in opposite direction
meanings: turn around to point in opposite direction
example:
Giwto'qasga'toq aq ilapt'g.
He/she turns it around and looks at it again.

Gigto'qa'sit ta'n telgi'g Listuguj alsalite'wit.
He/she is going all around Listuguj working for charity.

giwto'qatesgatultijig.translation: They (plural) chase each other around in a circle
example:
Mijua'ji'jg gigto'qatesgatultijig gujmug.
The children are chasing each other outside.

giwto'qa'toq.translation: He/she takes it around in a circle
example:
Moqwa' gejiaq ta'woqwei algiwto'qwa'toq.
I don't know what it is that he/she is taking around.

We'gwiewnasgwiei pa telo'tm nunji gigto'qiaq.
I'm so dizzy I feel that my head is spinning.

Giwto'wasit glapis giwto'qiet.
He/she spuns around until he/she is dizzy.

giwto'qigsma'latl.translation: He/she pushes him/her around in a circle
example:
E'pite'ji'j algiwto'qigsma'latl ugtapsute'gann.
The little girl pushes her doll around in a circle.

giwto'qigsma'toq.translation: He/she pushes it around in a circle
example:
Giwto'qigsma'toq ms't tami utepaqan, pas'g mu gisa'tug lugwen.
He/she has pushed his/her car all over, but he/she still can't get it
to run.

Wen gi's giwto'qopega'latl na l'pa'tujl?
Who was swinging that boy around?

Giwto'qopega'toq munti waju'aq mijipjewei.
He/she swings around a bag that is full of food.

giwto'qopia'tijig.translation: They (plural) are sitting in a circle
example:
Giwto'qopia'tijig etljigs'tua'tiji a'tugwewinu'g.
They are sitting in a circle listening to storytellers.

A'su'n e'w'g giwto'qopilatl ugtapsute'gann.
She uses a blanket to wrap the doll.

Qasawo'qapi giwto'qopilg ugtiga'taqanmg.
He/she strings wire around his/her garden/field.

giwto'qopultijig.translation: They are sitting in a circle
example:
Gigto'qopultijig pugte'j muta tegig nige' wela'gw.
They are all sitting around the little fire because it's a cool evening.

Giwto'qoto'sit ula wesgowa'sit.
Here he/she is spinning himself/herself.

giwto'qugwaltultijig.translation: They follow one another in a circle
meanings: follow one another in a circle
example:
Giwto'qugwaltultijig muta mu' wen getu'gs'ga'gw.
They are following each other around because no one wants to get
lost.

Mala pegisingeg giwto'qwa'sit aq apaja'sit.
When he/she got there (our home) he/she turned around and came
back.

Gjiansale'wit teluisit Mise'l.
The archangel's name is Michael.

Negm na gjiaplue'w.
He/she is a rascal.

Tegen gjigan elaqsinn?
Which city are you flying to?

Ntus wigit gjiganji'j teluisig Wisiamgeg.
My daughter lives in a town called Campbellton.

Gjigapa'n na wesgu'tmn wejgwapa'q gisna ennmepa'q.
When you say tide you can be talking about the incoming or the
going out tide.

Gjiga'qaquj ugpi'gunmg gesimqatawe'niji.
The raven's feathers are a very black.

Gjinisgam aq nisgam na wijei elia'sutman.
Great Spirit and God, you are praying to the same diety.

Ta's ajiet gjipa'tlia's esgmaloq?
What time is the bishop supposed to arrive?

Gjipulgewei wesua'lj wen mawgitnmat.
Epilepsy gives one a very difficult time.

Mali na gjisape'wit.
Mary is a patron saint.

Gjitmei elege'wi'sgw taluisit?

Ma ni'n gisnatanguaw glaman gi'l lia.

Glamuejmnaqsi na taliangamgusit?

Geju'l na glapaq eligtuapsin.

Tami etegl na glapaqignn?

Ge' nmisgmui glapaqignei, a'se'g eteg.
Can you get the screwdrived for me, it's in the other room.

Glapis gatu pegisinn.

Mtue'gtes ta'n telwe'ju'j glaptan nige'.

Glatpeta'w na mawmaqalqutnat.

Lisa ugtugwejang epinnipnn glitaml.

meanings: red raspberry (Nova Scotia and parts of New Brunswick)
example:
Glitaweiei pasgoqsign maw wigapu'g.
Strawberry jam is very delicious.

Pugwelg na glmuej nipg.
There are a lot of mosquito in the summer.

Me' wen e'w'g glmuejuapsgw mawsa'taj?

Gloqiejg na mawigsamugsultijig.
Swamp robins are brightly colored.

Pugwelgig gisgug gloqontiejg.
There are many seagulls today.

Nipugtug elien wela'gw na gloqowejg ulnmiates.
If you go to the forest at night you will see the stars clearly.

Tapu'gl glpisunn menuegetas'gl.

Gitpu na Listugujg glu telui'tut.
Gitpu is called glu in Listuguj.

Gi's wettmnn glumge'l sapann?

Ulagu iga'taqwatmi'tipnn glumgul.

Ge'itu'nn gi'l Glusgapewe'l a'tugwaqann?

He/she knows how to tell a good story and spin a tall tale.

Lpa mu gis tluewap newte' glusuaqan.

Welo'teget wen gisgmenie'wij.
You feel good after receiveing Holy Communion.

Njugwi'ji'j wigit gmetug.
My mother-in-law lives beside me.

Gmnie'wi si'st ajiet Se'ta'newumg na'gweg.
I will take holy communion at three o'clock on Saint Ann's day.

Gm'tginu, mnaq ignmuetug aq mnaq naqtmug!
Our territory, we've never given it away and we've never left it!

Ula gmtn teluisit Listugujewei gmtn.
This mountain is called Listuguj mountain.

Jiptug gmu'j gispateg.
Hopefully the wood is dry.

Gi's ms't wen etug weta'ga'toq gmu'je'gaqan Listugujg.
I think that almost everyone has tried lumbering in Listuguj.

Pie'l na gmu'je'get ula tet.

Gasg'ptnnaqan te's'gl gmu'ji'gann.
There are one hundred wooden houses.

Ntue'm gesatg gmu'ji'j atesg'g.
My dog likes to chase after a small stick.

Gmu'jming aq galgunawe'l wigapu'gl.
Raspberries and biscuits are delicious.

Ula na negm mu gmutnes.
This one is not a thief.

gmutta'tl.translation: He/she beats him/her with a stick
example:
Mu e'wmug nipispaqan waqama'laj a'pi'l, awna gmutta'tl.
He/she doesn't use a twig to clean his/her net, instead he/she beats
it with a stick.

gmutte'g.translation: He/she beats it with a stick
example:
Tetujigtu'pisgwa't lpa gmutte'g ga'qan.
He/she wanted to get inside so badly, he/she beat on the door with
a stick.

Gna'ji'jg tam wigultijig?
Where do nits live?

Gna'taqan na, mu gjitmei.
That's a decoration, it's not real.

Gigjiw na mu gneg.
Near is not far.

Mu gne'nug gi's pana app wejgwinei'a'sit.
In a very short time he/she shows up again.

Wenig gneg wetagutijig?

Maw wuljema'jig na gnisgwastu'g.
Evergreen needles always smell good.

Gnugwaqan iga'l ta'n gta'pim epij.
Leave a marker where your net is located.

Mesgilg aq apje'ji'jit gnugwatign e'w't ewi'gigen.
Big and small letters are used for writing.

Gesgmtug go'goming etligwejig.
The thorn berries grow in the field off the road.

Go'gominaqsi'g maw ginigwejig.
The hawthornberry bush is very prickely.

Go'gwejijg na mesgilgig aq apje'ji'jijig.
Spiders are big and small.

Go'gwejijua'pi maw weliangamgug ta'n tujiw na'gu'set saputasej.
A spider web is pretty when the sun is shinning through it.

Go'lail na maw jijjema'q.
Kerosene really smells bad.

Mutt tlitgismiw na'tel, gomgwejg eigig na samqwanigtug.
Don't swim there, there are sucker fish in the water.

Awije'jit esgwiet ta'n gisgitg gomgwejui'gaqan.

gomgwejui'gas'g.translation: It is written in Mi'gmaw glyph writing

Ge' musga'tui na wi'gatign gomgwejui'gas'g?

Gopgej pugwelietew ta'n tujiw pugwelg apigji'j.
Sawwhets will be plentyful when there are plenty of mice.

Mut wanta'siw nespnan go'pigng.
Don't forget to bring the dip nets.

Tel nenujig na ula miti'sg ta'n gopitg gisgewo'latijig.
It is so easy to recognize the trees that the beavers have taken.

Newtipug pas'g telugwet gopitewe'get.
The whole winter the only he/she did was trap beaver.

Go'qoli'gwej aq lasiet gejugwa'tui.
Bring me the chicken and the plate.

Go'qoli'gweji'j algwiluatl uggwitl.
The baby chick looks for it's mother.

Goqqwaja'teget na ugjignaml apigsigtuateg.
He/she did the right thing when he/she forgave his/her younger
brother.

Pas'g gisgoqqwa'latl unjann pemnisieniteg.
He/she grabed his/her child just in time as the child began falling.

Pie'l goqqwa'toq wi'gatign.
Peter grabs the paper.

Etug goqwei algwilg?

Goqwei net wesgu'tmn?

Goqwei ta na?
What is that?

Goqwei ugjit wejilie's'p, gi's ge'itu't'p gepjoqteg?

G'pnno'l na mimajuinu'g.
The government is the people.

G'pnno'lewa'j mesgi'g teluej
The government member has a lot to say.

G'p'tai gisgug gesispa'tueg.
We are washing the ceiling today.

G'p'ta'q lapa'si.
Look up.

Gp'te'snug ugju'sn wett'g.
The wind is from the south.

gs'geltaqan.translation: Valued and protected person or thing
example:
Gs'geltaqan na, telsa'qawei.
That is precious, it is so old.

Teluejig na Pie'l gsigawa'suinu.
They say that Peter is a fast runner.

Gsin ni'n wejia'p Gespe'g
Last winter I was in Gaspe.

Gsinug najinuelewultitesnu Listugujg.
Next winter we will (go to) spend Christmas in Listuguj.

Gsipo'qiwan na jijuaqa ta'n wi'sis etligsipa'lsij.
A scratching place is a tree where an animal will at times scratch
itself.

Tegen gsispa'taqan gi'l e'w't?

Uji'jl na gsite'taqann negm.
His/her grandchild is his/her precious one.

Mila'suaqann eigl gsnqo'qonn, aq eigl giso'qonn.
There are toys that are pointless, and toys that are fun.

Gsnqo'weiei na gutmi'gm.

Qame'g eteg gsnugo'guom.
The hospital is in town (Campbellton).

Nutmai melgignaq gsnugowaqan ala's'g.

Gsnugowinu ela'utaq Mala.

Ta'n tujiw g's'talg, smtug maja'titoqs'p.
As soon as he/she is finished eating, (both of you) leave right
away.

Miamuj na na'tami nipugtug gsu'sgug etligutijig.
Hemlock must be growing somewhere in the woods.

Gsusgwate'gn na ga'qan ugjit si'signi'gn.
A tent flap is the door of the tent.

Tatuji gneg eteg gta'n?
How far away is the ocean?

Gtantaqan pas'g asgo'tmasg ugtajigo'tim.
Hate only hurts your health.

Gelu'sit gtantegewinu maw(i) megite'tasit.
A good hunter is highly appreciated.

Ula gtapegiaqan ginuewei.
This is our song.

Gtigiewinuj awtigtug pemiet.
The drunkard walks along the road.

Gtigiewuti mu' telnmitmeg st'ge' amgwes.
Drunkness is not as visible as it used to be.

Unma'gig we'ita'iegp gtiginipn.
We went to Cape Breton the summer before last.

Gtigipug wejo'tmap te's aqantie'uti alaqami'mn.

Gtigipun pilei tepaqan pegwatelmuimg'p.

Gtigisapo'nug eliei Muliang.
