Mu' migwite'tmu ta'n telugweiap gtigiwela'gwe'g.

Telta'siap gtigulagu mawitaioq.
I thought you had a get together the other day.

Ge' apoqonmui apangitm ula gtuguno'guom.
Would you help me pay for this hotel room.

Gi's gi'l nemi't wape'g gu'gu'gwes?
Have you ever seen a white owl?

Awije'jit ge'itoq ta'n tla'tutew guign nige'!
Very few know what to do with a marrow bone now!

Gujmug najimilita'nej.
Let's go outside to play.

Gi's gi'l nemi't gulgwi'ji'j?
Have you seen a small pig?

Pugjig gulgwi'sg esmujig.
The pigs will soon be fed.

Enm'joqte'g tap'tang aq gulgwi'suei.
The table is laden with potatoes and pork.

Gulgwi'su'mi piteg la'taqsunigtug.

Guljie'wto't Na'gweg na mawsape'wig.
Good Friday is a very holy day.

Gguljie'we'l pugwelgl a's'tuo'guomg.
There are many crosses in the church.

Mesgilg guljiewta'sit epit a's'tuo'guomg.
There is a large crucfix at the church.

guljiewto'sit.translation: He/she makes the sign of the cross
example:
Guljiewto'sit gesgmnaq pisgwa'gw a's'tuo'guomg.
He/she makes the sign of the cross before entering the church.

Gulpatgijg mu ni'n gesalagig.
I don't like maggots.

Gulumatl ugmalpale'witeml.
He/she asks for his/her doctor.

Ngwis mawte'gl gaqi'smilamu'gl gunte'jl.
My son collects all different colors of small pebbles

Welamu'g guntew e'was'g ugjit ta'n ga'qan telpantenmg.
A colorful stone is used to keep the door open.

Mawiguntewapsgeg na sipu teluisig Winpegijuig.
The river called Nepisiguit is very rocky.

Mesgilg guow gaqamit nignaq.
A large pine stands in our yard.

Ge' jugwasga'tui na gups'ji'j, nutai ula tet.
Pass me that little cup, I need it here.

Pu'tail mese'nitl pijiguta'latl.
He/she pours in the whole bottle.

Taluisig na ala gutan?
What is the name of that town?

Gismewlia'gwej ni'n gutana'si.
This afternoon I'm going to town.

Gaqalugwa'n gutang eliei.
When I'm finished working I'm going to town.

meanings: desalt (by soaking in several changes of water)
example:
Ngij gutapigwalaji nme'ji'jg.
My mother desalinates the herring.

meanings: desalt by soaking in several changes of water
example:
Amujpa gutapigwatm ula pejuei gesgmnaq wissugwatmu.
I have to desalinate this cod fish before I cook it.

Nugumij guta'tat p'tewei.
My grandmother pours herself some tea.

Ewuljewe'jit Sapatis, gutatesmatl p'teweio'ql.
Poor Jean-Baptist, he spilled the pot of tea.

Lpa gaqgutatestueg jioqsimusiapu.
We spilled all of the maple syrup.

Wasampugwelg elguta'toq samuqwan.
He/she is adding too much water.

Ryan guteget samqwan msaqtaqtug wela'gwe'g.
Ryan spilled water on the floor last night.

Mise'l teluisip na gwatej itoqolugweieg'p.
Michael is the name of a Mohawk I used to work with.

Gwe'gwiamgeg tlne'p'titesnen ulo'nug.
We will sleep in Port Hood, NS tonight.

We'gwigweltanaianeg mewlia'gwe'g.
I had a feast of a meal at lunch.

Gweso'tmnej plamuwei ugjit ula wejgwipug.
Lets preserve salmon for this winter.

Malsusan gwilgl ugpugugwe'l.
Mary Susan looks for her glasses.

Wen algwiluasit?
Who is searching around?

Gwiluatl weliginitl stoqonn ugjit Nuelewumg.
He/she is looking for a nice tree for Christmas.

Mu na te'sigisg'g gwimu nutuam'g.
One doesn't hear a loon everyday.

Gwi's, ge' jugu'a?
Son, come here?

gwi'sit.translation: Fish leaps out of the water
example:
Sespe'g plamu ta'n tujiw gwi'sij.
A salmon is noisy when it leaps out of the water.

Gwitji'j, ge' ala jugwa'tui?
Son, please bring that over to me?

Wen assutg ula gwitn?

Na'te'l gtu'lien, amujpa gwitna'mn.
If you want to go there, you must go by canoe.

Gi's gi'l gigjamt iap?
Have you seen a moose up close?

Iapjiw me' pegije'g je mu apjiw.
Forever is longer than always.

Na nige' na goqwei wesgu'tas'g wesgu'tm'g iapjiwowei?

Sulian igalatl uggwe'ji'jl.
William defends his younger sister.

Glapis gatu iga'latl unjann aq maja'sitaq.
He/she finally let go of his/her child and he/she left.

Tepaqan iga'q ugjit mijipjewei.
The wagon arrives for the food.

Gi's iga't na ta'n pemliep?
Did he/she arrive where he/she was going too?

Iga'taqwalaji pugwenniji miti'ji'g.
He/she plants many young trees.

Ula iga'taqan na ugjit tap'tang
This garden is for potatoes.

Ne'gaw negm iga'taqatg ugtmaqamigewm.
He/she has always planted his/her land.

Mise'l iga'tegewatl ugumitl.
Michel sows plants for his/her grandmother.

Wen iga'taqugt ula tet?
Who is planting here?

Gelu'lg wen igatg ta'n teligtlams'tasij.
It's good to fight for what you believe in.

Ta'sijig igatne'suinug esgmaljig?
How many racers are you waiting for?

Igatne'we'sm ula te'sipow.
This is a racing horse.

Mujgajewei na igatne'we'sm, te's igatne'wet na gespu'tuetew.
This is a great race horse, every race he/she runs he/she wins.

Ula tet iga'tu mutputi.
Place the chair here.

Wesampteg na nti igeggwet.
It was too hot my dog took sick.

Ignmuatl unjann pepsitelgenin.
He/she allows his/her child to be disrespectful.

Wen ignmuetoqol ula a'gusnn?
Who's giving away these hats?

Jugwal igtigig amqwanji'jg.
Bring the other spoons.

Igto'sit, etug gispnet.
He/she is yawning,  maybe he/she is tired.

Ta'sijig gisiws'tqamutlijg ijipanji'jg?
How many beaver kittens born this litter?

Ilaji'gewatl ugjignaml wejgwiwsinitl.
He/she is preparing for his/her younger brother who's moving here.

Egsitpu'nug maja'sit, aq gi's gaqiilaji'gewsit.
He/she is leaving in the morning, and he/she is already finished
packing.

Gisgug ilajit muta sapo'nug maja'sit.
He/she is getting prepared because tomorrow he/she is leaving.

Goqwei ilajugt'g?
What is he/she preparing for?

Newtigisg'g tetutpit ilajugtuatl witapal.
All day he/she busily prepares for his/her friend's arrival.

E'pit ilaju'latl ugji'nmuml.
The woman packs for her husband.

Pas'g gisila'latl Nuelewumgewe'l miti'sl na ap nisienitl.
He/she just finished reseting the Christmas tree when it fell again.

Pe' ilamg'p ula napui'gign.
Let me just look over this picture.

ilamgo'tasit.translation: He/she/it piles objects in organized fashion
example:
Nujj gujmug etliilamgo'tasit.
My father is outside piling wood.

Ilanqa'latl ugtatla'ieml.
He/ she folds he/she shirt.

Na tmg ilanqa'toq ugtsulieweim toqosi'p maposa'toq.
First he/she folds his/her money and then he/she pockets it.

Gaqigsistaqanewei, amuj pa ilanqo'tasit.
I've done my washing, now I have to do the folding.

Gijga' esgmalanej, pe'l ilapewnusit.
Let's wait for her a while, she is putting on some make-up.

ilapsg'smu'gwet.translation: He/she curls up and goes to sleep
meanings: curl up and go to sleep
example:
Mu' etug piamiulinpagw, tetujigaqi'sg ilapsg'smu'gwet.
He/she can't be sleeping too well, he/she has repositioned
him/herself so often.

Ilapt'g ugtwi'gatign.
He/she looks his/her book over.

Tami tet pmiatew ila'sgugutimg?
Where will the card playing happen?

Ge' jugwa'l na ila'sgw
Please bring that card.

Gi's sa'q mu weleiug, gatu nige' pemiila'sit.
He/she hasn't been well for a long while, but now he/she is getting
better.

Ila'toq ms't goqwei glaman gisgattetew.
He/she resets everything so it will be ready.

Gaqi'sq ilgopa'sit muta gispnet.
He/she often changes position in his/her seat because he/she is
tired.

Na ji'nm (n)ata'ilgwenatl te'sipowl?
Does that man know how to steer that horse?

Maliann ilgweng ugtul.
Mary Ann steers her boat.

Sitmug tlwe'jiates aliilgwi't'g ugtul.
You will find him/her down at the beach steering his/her boat
about.

Gaqi'sq ilisma'sit wela'gw.
He/she changes position (in bed) often at night.

ilisqa'latl.translation: He/she puts it(knee) back in place
example:
Nutuaq ta'n tujiw ilisqa'laj ugji'taqan.
You should hear him/her when he/she limbers-up his/her neck.

ilisqa'toq.translation: He/she puts it back in place
example:
Malpale'wit ilisqa'toq ntlmaqan.
The doctor pops my shoulder back in.

Iljo'qonatl eptaqann ugplaqaneg.
He/she is balancing a plate on his/her lap.

Amujpa iljo'qong ugtul glamen ma pp'taja'qtnug lo'gsigtug.
He/she has to keep his/her canoe balanced so it will not fall off the
log.

Newt gisiiljoqte'g ugtu'gwesmun na tujiw elsma'sit.
Once he/she has fluffed up his/her pillow then he/she lays down.

Gisigu iljo'qwa'latl ugtue'ml.
The old man set his dog straight.

Apoqonmaqap ugtul iljo'qwa'toq aputasg'tesgeg.
I helped him/her right his/her boat when it flipped over.

Iloqomoqwa'latl napui'gignn.
He/she wraps the picture.

Ge' jugwa'tui iloqomoqwa'taqan.
Bring me the wrapping paper.

Gitnmat nitap etliloqomoqwa'toq wigji'jaqan.
My friend is having a tough time wrapping the toy.

meanings: place or put in proper position lengthwise
example:
Iloqwa'latl unjanji'tl npo'qonigtug.
He/she repositions his/her child in the bed.

meanings: place or put in proper position lengthwise
example:
Sangew iloqwa'toq uggwitnm gesgmnaq mnawa'sigw.
He/she carefully repositioned his/her canoe before heading out.

Mali ilpilatl ugtapsute'gann.
Mary dresses up her doll.

Te'sigisg'g ugtul ilpilg.
Everyday he/she reties his/her boat properly.

Gisigu ilpilsit gesgmnaq tego'tmug
The old man gets dressed before he goes to church.

Gaqtesg'geg ap ilpugua'sit aq getu' apaja'sit.
When he/she had finished (the path), he/she reconsidered and
wanted to go back.

ilsaqa'toq.translation: He/she cocks a gun or a trap
example:
Lpa ngutugwa'i'w ilsaqa'toq ugpe'sgeweim telnmiaj wi'sisl.
He/she automaticly cocked his/her gun when he/she spots pray.

Wen gisiilsumut?
Who was sentenced?

Tami pmiatew ilsutaqan?
Where will the trial take place?

Nujiilsuteget nige' wejgu'et, aq negm pqoji ilsutegetew.
The judge is on his/her way here, and he/she will start making
decisions.

Ni'n ilsutm ta'n tla'tega's.
I decide what I will do.

Matle'n ilta'latl ugpojml.
Madelaine closes her purse.

Pe'l iltaqalg'p ula ntue'm gesgmnaq wesmugwagw.
I'll hitch up my horse before he/she runs off.

Ntlamugsis iltaqanatl ugtue'ml (te'sipow).
My uncle guides his horse with the reins.

Iltaqane'walatl ugta'piml gesgmnaq maja'sigw.
He/she is preparing his/her net before leaving.

Wen iltaqane'watg mawio'mi?
Who's organizing the gathering?

Ilta'tu ga'qan ta'n tujiw tewien.
Close the door when you go out.

Lpa jini'w ilteget ga'qan.
Suddenly he/she quickly shut the door.

Iltijieget ga'qan ala pemtu'et.
The one that's going out slams the door.

Ni'n patatujewiptnai, mu telie'wmu inaqanei npitn.
I'm left handed, I don't use my right hand as much.

Me' pugwelg ta'n inaqanmit je mu ta'n patanmit.
There are more right-handers than there are left-handers.

I'nes ala na'tuen wejgwapti'g.
It seems that someone with a cane is coming towards this
direction.

So'sep istua'latl amqwanji'tl.
Joseph sets the spoon crooked.

Ala etlilo'tasit etug istuo'toq ms't goqwei.
I think the one rearranging everthing is making it all crooked.

Pugwelg na mimajuinu eig ta'n ijga'istue'g.
There are a lot of people out there who are a little strange.

Istuig ula gtawtiminu.
This road of ours is crooked.

Nmu'j gigjiw nignaq ale'g istuigatat.
There is a dog near our house that is clubfooted.

Teli-istuigit na t'pgwano'q etug ma' teptesinug epsaqtejgigtug.
The ash bin is so crooked it probably won't fit in the stove.

istu'napui'gatl.translation: He/she takes a crooked picture of him/her/it
example:
Mali gisiistu'napui'gatl uggajuewjml.
Mary has taken a crooked picture of her cat.

istu'napui'g'g.translation: He/she takes a crooked picture of it
example:
Ala nitap pusgiistu'napui'g'gl wenji'guoml.
My friend habitually takes crooked pictures of houses.

Istu'pit na napui'gign.
That picture is crooked.

Gaqawi istu'satl na lasqo'plawl.
He/she really cut the plank crookedly.

Gisiistu's'g na magot etlitoq.
He/she cut the dress he/she is making unevenly.

Istu'teg, ap illugwatmnej.
It's crooked, let's redo it.

Ta'sijig jagejg pewaljig?
How many lobsters do you want?

Ta'n jagejue'geioqos?
When did you two go lobster fishing/trapping?

jageju'patl.translation: He/she cleans it (animate) out by eating
example:
Nitap jagejl jageju'patl.
My friend eats a lobster like a lobster would.

Na pipugwaqan telo'tm wasamjagweg.
I find that horn too loud.

Amujpa jagwen ta'n tujiw gelulj muta gepistaqanat.
You have to speak loud when you speak to him/her because
he/she is deaf.

Nuji'j na we'gwijajigamugsit.
My grandchild looks really healthy.

meanings: creep along in the water like a lobster
example:
Ala put'p pemjajiga'q sitmug.
That whale is swimming along the shore.

Nemi'g'pnaq pemjajiga'sit sitmug.
I saw him/her walking alone the shore of the river.

Nsugwis weljajige'g.
My aunt is very healthy.

Ne'wijig tmoqta'wgw jajigoqpultijig sitmug.
Four logs are sitting alongside the shore.

Ntul jajigteg gtulg.
My boat sits alongside your boat.

Tajigtug sangew pemiet.
He/she goes slowly along the edge.

Na we'gwinta'jampo'qiet na ngwis.
My son really knows how to do somersaults.

Telta'siap nemi'g etljapigwet.
I though I saw him/her winking.

Ji'nmji'j japigwetuatl e'pite'sl.
The young man winks at the young woman.

Tlta'sig na etljapigwetuet, awna ugpugugw na'tala'tegeg.
You would think that he/she is winking, but there's something
wrong with his/her eye.

Maltio'tis pemjaqala'latl ugti'l.
Eunice hurries along with her dog.

Wen tana ala pemjaqala'sit?
Who is that hurrying along over there?

Mali jaqala'toq ugtlugowaqan gisgug.
Mary finishes her work quickly today.

Jaqale'g ala negm, gaqawa'toq goqwei elugwatg.
He/she is fast, anything he/she does is done quickly.

Teljaqallugwet na ji'nm, smtug agase'wa'lug.
That man works quickly, hire him right away.

Jaqalipiasatl amqwanji'tl.
He/she dries a spoon quickly.

Amujpa jaqalipiasm nusapun gesgmnaq maja'siw.
I've got to quickly dry my hair before I leave.

Jijuaqa mimajuinu maw jaqalipnet.
Sometimes a person's illness progresses very quickly.

Wasamjaqali'sit lpa mu nestuwaq.
He/she speaks too fast, I don't understand at all.

Ula npisun gisigsua'tu jaqallugweg.
This medicine I've taken works quickly.

meanings: finish off fast (in boxing, game or cards)
example:
We'gwijaqalta'tl atnaqanigtug.
He/she beat him/her quickly at checkers.

Mali gis(i)jaqalte'g suliewei Ta'puoweieg.
Mary made some fast money on Tuesday.

Sangew pipanimj ja'wa'lie'j etugjel ignmultew jig'ja'wei.
If you ask a grasshopper nicely maybe he/she will give you some
jigaja'wei.

Ula nitap gesalsit ta'n tujiw jawa'taj.
My friend is in his glory when he chews tobacco.

Tami eteg maqtawe'g ja'wei?
Where is the black chewing tobacco?

Etug ta'sunaji je'gaq?
I wonder how many jacks he/she has?

Newtisga'q jel si'st na maw jipatas'g.
Number thirteen is a feared number.

Ula mijua'ji'j na we'gwijenpit.
The child is extremely quiet.

Etlwaqama'tueg weji'guom aq sespagnutmaieg, jensi
gaqwaqama'tegeie'g.
We're cleaning a house and busily talking, before you know it we
are done cleaning.

Ta'n tujiw ms't goqwei jenteg na nutujig jipji'jg.
When everything is quiet you can hear the birds.

I'tluejig Glusgap na jenu.
Some say Glusgap is a giant.

Je mu telimigw wela'gwewei gisgateg.
He/she didn't even tell me the supper is ready.

Je tlia' pas'g tapu'gl, tepiatal.
Even if it's just two, that willl be enough.

Gi's nemi't j'gi'ges ula egsitpu'g?
Have you seen a chickadee this morning?

Jgi'n, apjege'jgel wen ta u't?
Well, who the heck is this?

Talamugsit na jiagewj?
What color is the mink?

Maw jigajiemg na eptegigtug.
One is most uncomfortable in the heat.

jigalugg.translation: He/she/it is paddling or poling singlehandedly
example:
Wane'g wetjigalugum ntul.
I just singlehandedly paddled my canoe from up the mission.

jigapito'jing.translation: He/she has a tooth bared smile
example:
Ta'n getu' tami etlnmu'j, apjiw aljigapito'jintew.
No matter where he/she is seen, he/she will always have a big
forced smile.

Me' gatu mamunji'gata'tl na miti'sl.
He/she trimmed that tree a lot.

Ta'sijig ji'ga'taq gisa'lugwig gisgug?
How many pieces of dressed wood did we do today?

Gisigu ji'gate'g ugtawti ta'n eliej.
The old man blazes his trail as he goes.

Ji'gate'get nigana'sitew aq ginu majulgwatesnu ugtawti.
He/she will go ahead and blaze a trail and we will follow his/her
trail.

Mu na ne'gaw megipta'lam'gig jigawaq ula Listugujg.
It hasn't been that long since many bass have been caught here in
Listuguj.

Jigawepit na ula e'pit pemgopit.
This woman sitting here is quiet.

Jigaweteg na ula wannei.
It's dull at this end of town (in Listuguj the cove end is called
"wanne'g").

Mu ni'n assutmu jigg'putaqan.
I don't own a rake.

Matle'n metuwite'tg jigg'putegen.
Madelaine is not looking forward to raking.

We'gwijigistaqanat na lpa'tuj.
That boy listens very attentively.

Epsit na ji'gitlo'q.
That kettle is hot.

Getu mila'sit na nmu'j etljigmit.
That dog growling wants to play.

Gtue'm ms't goqwei jigmugt'g.
Your dog growls at everything.

Nmu'j jigmugtuatl gajuewjl.
The dog growls at the cat.

Jigni'get na ula gti, miamuj natgoqwei we'jitoq.
Your dog is rooting about, he/she must have found something.

Tetaga'si geget jigpatl na plamu'l.
Hurry up, he/she is almost finished eating the salmon.

Gisigu gisijigpusit wela'gwe'g.
The old man spent all of his money last night.

Jigs'tmu's'p gegnua'tlgeg ta'n tltesgewetes?
Did you listen when you were told how to get there?

Ta'n pas'g wenn jigs'tuatl na lmu'j.
That dog will listen to anyone.

Newtiegsitpu'g etljigtaqawei.
I have been smooth sheening (for basketry) all morning,

Ms't goqwei gisijigt'g.
He/she just ate everything.

Miamuj ji'gutegei newtigisg'g, teliapje'jg gisa'tu.
I must have been day dreaming all day, I have so little done.

Tale'tew jigwapa'n.
What time is the tide.

Jijgluewjuwei maw wigapu'g.
Mutton tastes very good.

Ula jijgluewji'j na wape'g wi'sis.
This lamb is a white animal.

Talamu'gtetew na jijgluewjuapi etlt'sg?
What color will the wool that he/she is dying be?

Jijgluewjuapie'g pijjaqang na maw gisue'gig.
Woolen mittens are really warm.

Telte'tm wesamjijigulqeg ula gwitn.
I think that this canoe is too narrow and shallow..

Jijigwatejg mawinta'pugwelg'pni'g amgwes.
Sand pipers used to be plentiful in the past.

Ula awti eliaq qospemg na maw jijigwe'jg.
This road going up to the lake is very narrow.

Wesamjijigwe'jit na lasqo'plaw.
That board is too narrow.

Gis sa'q gujmug etlapueg, etna na wetjijuwa'qiaq.
It's been rained on outside for so long, that's why it's rusty.

Teli awisiw wisugwat elpa jijiwa'qiet nugu wow.
He/she cooks so seldom, the pot has gotten rusty.

Jijjawignejewei petaqan na maw wigapu'g.
Raisin pie is most delicious.

Telo'tm jijjema'q, etug tami wetoqweg?
I find it stinks, I wonder where the smell is coming from?

Jijjema't na apijliu.
That skunk stinks.

Jijuaqa nuji'jg mittugwalijig.
Sometimes my grandchildren visit me.

Jijuejgl als'tuo'guomg metetaqal tesigisg'g mewlia'gwej.
The church bells ring everyday at noon.

Pugwelgl na jijuejg'ji'jl nastegl ugtepaqanq.
There are many small bells on his sleigh.

Jijuejgwatpl maw gneg wetaptmgl.
One can steeples from far away.

jila'gipulatl.translation: He/she marks it with a saw
example:
Jila'gipulatl lasqo'plawl.
He/she marks the plank with a saw mark.

jila'gittoq.translation: He/she marks it with a saw
example:
Negm pata'uti gis(i)jila'gittoq.
He/she is the one who marked the table with the saw.

jilapa'latl.translation: He/she makes scratch marks on him/her
example:
Wen gis(i)jilapa'latl ntue'ml?
Who has scratched my pet?

jilapaqta'tl.translation: He/she makes a mark on him/her/it
example:
Suel jilapaqte'g na lasqo'plaw, ge' jigalasga'l.
I almost marked that board, point it the other way.

jilapaqte'g.translation: He/she makes a line mark on it
example:
Plegu e'wg'p jilapaqte'geg utepaqan.
He/she used a nail when he/she scratched his/her car.

Natgoqwei algwil'm ta'n jilapa'tegeg.
I'm looking for something to mark with.

Talugwet ta u't, aljilapa'teget!
What is he/she doing here scratching around?

jilapa'toq.translation: He/she makes scratch marks on it
example:
Nti gis ma'mun jilapa'toq ga'qan.
My dog scratched the door a lot.

Wapus pemjilaptoq wastewigtug.
The rabbit is making foot prints in the snow.

Sa'n jilaqami'g wastewigtig, miamuj mu gneg e'imug.
Sean's snowshoe tracks are on the snow, he can't be too far
away.

Telta'siap njignam gis(i)jile'g.
I thought that my younger brother had gotten hurt.

jiloqsa'tl.translation: He/she blazes it with a knife
example:
Jiloqsa'tl miti'sl tlawo'ql e'watl.
He/she blazes the tree with a knife.

jiloqs'g.translation: He/she blazes it with a knife
example:
Pe'(l) jiloqsmap ula glaman nentes.
Let me blaze this so I will recognize it.

jiloqta'tl.translation: He/she blazes it with an axe
example:
Nitap gisjiloqta'tl na ne'gasgi'gnn.
My friend put a blaze on that fallen tree.

jiloqte'g.translation: He/she blazes it with an axe
example:
Gisigu gis(i)jiloqte'g ugpata'utim.
The old man has accidently blazed his table.

Pas'g jilpitaq (u)la Maliano'g, teligsigawa'sit maja'sit.
All Mary Ann left was an impression (of the space she occupied),
she left so fast.

jilsatl.translation: He/she nicks it with a knife
example:
Gisipetjilsatl lasqo'plawl.
He/she accidently nicked the board with a saw.

Jilsemn pipnaqan gesgmnaq etoqtatmu'n.
You score the bread before you bake it.

jils'g.translation: He/she nicks it with a knife
example:
Suel jils'm eptaqano'guom, telme'ga'si.
I almost nicked the cupboard, I'm overdoing it so much.

jilta's'g.translation: It is marked from a strike
example:
Lpa gaqgigto'qijilta's'g nutepaqan.
There are strike marks all around my car.

jilta'sit.translation: It (board) is marked from a strike
example:
Ula lasqo'plaw jilta'sit.
This board is marked.

jilta'tl.translation: He/she makes a mark on it(tree) by striking
example:
Tal jilta'tl na mitis'l, tel gneg gaqaminnitl?
How did he/she manage to graze that tree, it is standing so far
away?

Tetujisa'q newte' eteg lpa jilteg.
It's been in one spot so long that it left an impression.

jilte'g.translation: He/she makes a mark on it by beating or hitting it
meanings: mark or scar on it (by beating or hitting)
example:
Wen gis jilte'g ula gmu'j.
Who marked this wood?

Gitg amujpa ji'matmeg muta gesigawitg.
We both have to paddle because the water is flowing swiftly.

Ula gisigu pegising teluisit Ji'me'j.
This old man who just arrived is named James.

Nata'ji'met ugjit telmaljewe'juip.
He/she paddles well for a youngster.

Mali' jimpegenatl ugtatla'ieml.
Mary wrings her shirt out.

So'sep jimpegnewet egsitpu'g.
Joseph milks in the morning.

Puguspet ntatla'im, amujpa jimpegeng.
My shirt is soaked, I need to wring it out.

Te's'g ta'n goqwei piteg, amujpa jing'ja'latl ugtapsute'gann
gtu'pija'laj.
There is so much stuff in there, he/she will have to squeeze his/her
doll to get it in.

Pie'l pipnaqan gisima'munjing'ja'toq.
Peter has squeezed the bread alot.

Jiniw na'tuen metete'get aq smtug jipaqa'sit.
Suddenly someone was knocking and immediately he/she got
scared.

So'sep na mesgilg ji'nm.
Joseph is a large man.

Ala ji'nmji'j gaqamit maw glu'sit saqpantiej.
That young man standing over there is a really good carpenter.

Ngwis na nugu ji'nmji'ju'et.
My son is a young man now.

meanings: likes the company of men (usually refers to a woman)
example:
Malian na ji'nmue'sm, pusgialtesguajig jinmug.
Mary Ann is a man chaser, she is in the habit of running after men.

Ta'n te'sit ji'nmuit patatujg lta'gw.
All the men go to the left side.

Jami na ngwis mawigtu'ji'nmu'qamigsit.
My son Jamie really wants to act like a man.

Ge' jugwa'tui jinqamistaqanei.
Would you bring me the strainer.

Ni'n na nujjinqamistegei nignaq.
I usually do the straining (through strainer) at my house.

Wen jipalatl go'gwejijl?
Who's afraid of the spider?

Na ewle'jit gajuewji'j mawjipaluejit.
That unfortunate kitten is afraid of everything..

Jipaluet na gtue'm.
Your pet is fearful.

Ula nmu'j gisjipaqa'latl n'njann.
This dog has scared my child.

N'njan oqonitpa'qigtug jipasit.
My child is scared in the dark.

Mu eigtnug ta'n goqwei jipatg.
There is nothing that he/she fears.

Ula mesgilg ji'nm jipguatl mijua'jitl.
This big man makes the baby uneasy.

Gjitmei eig na jipijga'm?
Does the horned serpent really exist?

Gapjagwj mawulamusit jipji'j.
The robin is a pretty bird.

jipji'ju'gisutnat.translation: He/she has a voice like a bird
example:
Gajuewjig alulgwalji muta jipji'ju'gisutnat.
Cats follow him/her around because he/she has a voice like a bird.

Jiptug sapo'nug gis(i)lia's qame'g?
Maybe tomorrow I can go to town?

Ulagu Jipugtug wejieiap.
Yesterday I came from Halifax.

Ala na ji'nm jipugtugwewa'j.
That man is from Halifax.

Nsugwis sapo'nug ela'tieg Jipugtu'jg.
Tomorrow my aunt and I are going to Bouctouche.

Gi's gi'l wejien jipu'ji'jg?
Have you been to the brook?

Glera gesatg nanamiej jitlo'mugwaqanigtug.
Clara likes rocking in the rocking chair.

Nata e'w'mn jitnaqe'gnei?
Do you know how to use an iron?

Iga'taqwalapnn joqjimusi'l nigantug.
He/she planted a white maple in the front.

Na we'gwi pugwelgig jujijg ula tet!
There are really alot of bugs here!

Tlpij juji'ji'j ta'n etlwe'ji'j.
Leave the bug where you find it.

Lagga'p wajuwaq apigji'jg.
The celler is full of mice.

Talawtit laggol?
What is the cost of a cord of wood?

La'gittaqan nuta'tes gtu siputegen.
You'll need a file to do some sharpening.

Wen wigit ula megwe'g lagla'ns?
Who lives at this red barn?

Laglem na ta'n pas'g tami eliaq.
Cream goes with anything.

Nignen laglemamu'g.
Our house is cream colored.

Ala pilei atla'i laglemamugsit.
That new shirt is cream colored.

La'jijjaqang nasa'lates glaman ma gewjipnewjiwun.
Put on the gloves so your hands won't get cold.

Eptaqan aq la'maqan jugwa'tui.
Bring me the plate and the dipper.

Lame'g lgwilmn we'jites.
If you look underneath, you will find it.

Gameg alasit pas'g lame'geweiaq.
She wondering around town in only a slip.

Wen gesatg lame'geweia'q?
Who likes to wear a slip?

Gesipiet ntlamipgigwanm.
My eyeball is itchy.

Nenat wen ta'n egitl lamiptnn?
Do you know anyone who reads palms?

Etlwejituap na suliewei lampo'qigtug.
I found that money on the river bed.

Gi's gi'l nenat ta'n wen etlugwet lamqamu'g?
Have you ever known anyone that works underground?

Gesig me' tepiaq lamqwan lame'g elgaj.
In the winter you are better to wear an undershirt (underneath).

Na ji'nm pas'g lamqwana'q nm'gim.
Send home that man whose only wearing an undershirt.

Ta's'gl lmauawl wegettesg eltu'n na?
How many egg yolks will you need making that?

We'gwiwelp'teg lamuguomg.
It is nice and warm inside.

Ge' jugwa'tui lapai waju'et pgumann.
Please bring me a full tub of blueberries.

Pa'tlia's lapaltnewei e'w'g ta'n tujiw signtegej.
The priest uses holy water when he baptizes.

Lapatign na pas'g telteg ugjit pa'tia's e'wmn.
A holy water sprinkler is only for the priest to use.

Lapalji'jitewei la'maqan jugwa'tui.
Bring me the tin dipper.

Ta'sgl lape'lisl etug ugsua'tutal ltuan pita'qawe'l?
How many yards will it take if I make pants?

Lape'w na mawiegsitpugwiet.
Roosters are early risers.

Sa'qati ignmulg ugjit lapigot.
You are given a needle for smallpox.

Wejgwa'tegemgeg pugwelg'pnig nnu'g lapigotewultijig,
gsnugowanqan apaqtug wejiaqap aq ma'munimsi'weg'p.
In the past many aboriginals had smallpox, an illness that came
from Europe and was very contagous.

Gelu'lg mimei wejitas'g lapilasigtug.
Good oil is made from flax seed.

Ni'n gesalg lapli'signei matlet.
I like a silk blouse.

lapli'signei.translation: Made of satin or silk material
example:
Nasa'lg na lapli'signei atlai gisgug.
I'm putting on the shirt made of satin material today.

Migwite'tm laplusan i'teg'p ugtejg e'jntewigtug.
I remember the jail used to be behind the agent's office.

Wapiewne'g lapol jugwa'tuites.
Bring me the light blue bowl.

Lapue'l waju'et niwetestasijig tap'tang.
The frying pan is full of steamed potatoes.

La'pugtaqan e'w'mn wapusue'gen.
You use a snare to catch a rabbit.

la'pugtaqanigalatl.translation: He/she sets a snare to catch it
example:
Newtipug la'pugtaqanigalaji wapusg.
He/she has been snaring rabbits all winter.

Nipugtug eliei aq najila'pugtaqanigei.
I'm going to the woods to set some snares.

Wen ugtul na lapugwan?
Who's vessel is that sailing ship?

Laputi e'wetes gtu'ulnmi'j tepgunset.
Use a telescope to get a good view of the moon.

E'wmnn laputi'l ta'n tujiw mimiges gwilaj.
You use binoculars to look for a butterfly.

Amujpa welwaqa'mtmg la'qan.
One has to clean a wound well.

Talgilg laqpa'taqan pewalt?
What size shoelace do you want?

Pile'l laqpilaqann gisiepwatelm'gl.
We've just bought new drapes

Giju', tami eteg laqpisuti?
Mom, where is the apron?

Ge' ilanqo'tui na laqsung?
Would you fold those sheets for me?

Lasguaq na pegwatelagig tqo'nug.
I will buy snowshoes in the fall.

Tami eltlasgugutimg ulo'nug?
Where is the card game tonight?

A'netna, nige' mesgi'g lasgugwaqan wenaqiaq.
Well now, the big game playing will start.

lasgugwet.translation: He/she is plays a card game
example:
Na nujilasgugwet etug nepapigwa't.
That card player must be blind.

Na we'gwiwelnat, gelu'sniji la'sgug.
He/she has a good hand, his/her cards are good.

Eptaqan na ugjipenug telui'tut lasiet.
A plate is called lasiet in the east.

Pugwelgig lasqo'plaq ugjietaq ula miti's.
Many boards will be made from this tree.

Na we'giwigapu'g ula lasup.
This soup is most delicious.

Lasupe'ji'tl pijo'tmgl lasupigtug.
Savory is added to soup.

Gesig apjiw la'taqsun i'e'w'g't'p.
In the winter we always used to use a chamber pot.

la'taqsuna'laq.translation: It is equivalent to a pail
example:
La'taqsuna'laq samqwan pisqwa'tu.
Bring in a pail's worth of water.

Latto'law gisna natto'law, tegen gi'l e'wmn?
Bull with an "l" or with a "n", which one do you use?

Ala wenji'guom apjiw legepilaqann nistetal.
At that house the blinds are always drawn.

Lentug aq tia'm wigi'jig nipugtug.
The deer and the moose live in the woods.

Ta's leppie eliaq na elsaqas'g?
How many feet long is that wall?

Lesqe'gn teluegetmg ugjit aligew.
A trunk is used for clothing.

Ula Lesui'p wejiet apaqtug.
This Jewish person comes from overseas.

Lge'gn e'we'n maqamigew gisgaja'tun.
Use a hoe to prepare the earth.

Lgeso'qonn amgwes te'sipowg i'utnmi'tipnn.
Plows used to be pulled by horses.

Lgetu aq sqojui'gan na wijei mijipjewei.
Mushroom and mushroom is the same food.

Lgetue'gej wen amujpa welnenuaji lgetu'g.
If one goes mushroom gathering they should really know
mushrooms.

Lgowaqan natgwilm pastung siggunug.
I will go to look for work in the United States this spring.

Lpa'tuj lgowaqana'latl gisigu'l ge's nepanij.
The little boy bothers the old man while he sleeps.

Mu wellugwenug nutepaqan ge's lgowaqana'tu.
My vehicle is not working as well since I began bothering it.

Lgusuaqann amujpa iga'tas'gl tapu eli'ganig wenji'guom.
Stairs are necessary for a two storey house.

Lgwetug wi'sis mut gigja'siw ta'n tujiw unjanij.
Don't go near a female animal when she has young ones.

Ni'n gisitu tapatanei ligpenign.
I've made a potato basket.

Pugwelg nuta'tes ligpete'gnapi gtuitu'n na tes'gl ligpenignn.
You will need many strips of ash if you want to make that many
baskets.

Ta'sijig lipsoqomgwewjig nemi's'pnig gisgug?
How many grasshoppers did you see today?

Ge' jugwatui na ntlisgnuaqanm.
Could you bring me my knitting.

Giwtaw Listugujg  mn'tng mawuliangamgusultijig.
Around Listuguj the mountains are beautiful.

Na listugujewa'tuet e'pite's wegwi wels'taq.
I like the sound of that young woman with the Listuguj accent.

Gis gi'l apiwesgen Listuguji'jewei sipu?
Have you gone fishing on the Miramichi River?

Gtigipun newisga'q gel lluigneg tetuje'iap.
Last year I was forty seven years old.

Lluigneg te'sisga'q gi's telimimg mut samatu na ugjigi.
Seventy times I've been told not to touch that scab.

Gisiga'tu llutaqan ntmaqmigemg.
I just put a fence on my property.

Llutaqanatgwigtug ugt'pil saqalo'pi.
Tie the ribbon from the fence post.

Lmu'g tala'teget?
What is wrong with the dog?

Tramp teluisit lmu'ji'j.
Tramp is the puppy's name.

Ula nti lmu'ji'jmit.
My dog has puppies.

Talpa'q na lmu'ju'pa'q?
What kind of tide is a neap tide?

Taluisisnaq na i'ltoqopn lnaqanatgul?
What was the name of the guy who used to make ax handles?
Snawei mawglu'lg wejitm'g lnaqanatgul.
Rock maple is really good for making wooden handles.

Lne's mlagejg gaqanmaigwi'g.
It seems we've run out of milk.

Mu nnim welte'lmigw na gtue'm.
Your dog doesn't approve of me.

Lnoqom e'we'n, me' welsipigpa'q.
Use green wood, it's more pliable

Ula lnu wigit lune'gati teluisig Listuguj.
This native person lives in the native community named Listuguj.

Assma na'te'l wejimaja's'g lnue'gati.
The boundary for the aboriginal community starts there.

Lnueiei'l gtapegiaqann ni'n maw(i) uls'tmann.
I really like the sound of Native songs.

Apjiw gawatgw e'w't lnuipi eltmg.
Spruce is always used to make a native paddle.

Ula etlgina'masit welinnui'sit.
This student speaks the native language well.

Me' gatu mimajuiangamgusijig ula lnuoqta'wg.
My goodness these statues look life-like.

Nnu'sgw gegina'muatl unjann ta'n tlinnui'sinital.
The native woman is teaching her child to speak in her native
tongue.

E'pite'ji'j lnu'tesing Pow-Wowigtug.
The little girl dances a native style at the Pow-Wow.

lnu'wi't'g.translation: He/she refers to it by its aboriginal name
meanings: refer to something by its aboriginal name
refer to something in first nations language
example:
Lnu'wi't'g gji'toq glusuaqan lnueiei.
He/she refers to it by its aboriginal name if he/she knows the word
in aboriginal.

Amgwes na a's'tuo'guomg i'lnu a'sutmamg'p.
In the past there used to be Native language masses at the church.

Taluisit na lnu saqama'sgw gisipisgwa't?
What is the name of the female native chief that was just elected?

Te's tapuipunqeg elegetimg ugjit lnu saqamaw.
Every two years there is an election for chief.

"Logowit" na wijei glusuaqan aq "gesgmsingewei".
"Lucky" and "just happened to come across it" mean the same.

Pugwelgig lo'gsig wejiejig na gtnipugtminu.
Alot of logs have come out of our woods.

Getuitu na lo'gsi'gan gigjiw qospemg.
I want to build a log cabin near a lake.

Ge juga'wtui newte' loqomoqwa'taqan.
Would you bring me one wrapper.

Ge' goqqwa'tu na loqte'gn aq tet jugwa'tui.
Grab that trap and bring it me.

loqte'gnigalatl.translation: He/she sets a trap for him/her/it
example:
Nige' najiloqte'gnigalg na apigji'j.
Now I'm going to trap that mouse.

Ni'n aq njignam loqte'gnigeieg te's toqwa'q.
My younger brother and I go trapping every fall.

Metuite'tm tliman ula nitap ta'n tetujiloqtnema'j.
I'm afraid to tell my friend here how bad his/her breath is.

Loqwistaqan eliaq ligpenignigtug.
The hoop is part of the basket.

Lpa ms't goqwei gaqgitm.
I have read every single thing.

Lpa'tujg mawigsatmi'tij nipugtug alta'tij.
Young boys like to roam around the woods.

Lpa'tu'ji'j na nuji'j, teluisit Sulian.
That little boy is my grandchild, his name is William.

Lpa'tujuij gnjan taluisitew?
If your baby is a boy what will his name be?

Lpa'tu'sg aq e'pite'sg gigjeiatultijig.
Young men and young women hang around with each other.

Ta'n wi'sis wejiet, lpa jigaw mijipjeweieg!
Where the animal had been, the food is all gone!

Lpa mu gisite'tmu ta'n teltaqane'was'g.
I am totally unable to figure out how it is put together.

Ula gasigo's'ti lpa wijei aq ala igtig, pana pas'g piltuamu'g
This towel is the same as the other, it is just a different colour.

Ge' jugwasga'tui na l'sg'j, aputasgnmn gi'la.
Would you pass me that map, you have it upside down.

Ls'tgug na gneg ula tet weja'tegemg.
Bear River is far from here.

Tawjiw gi'l lietes ugjit lugowaqan?
How far would you travel for work?

Lugowaqana'teget na nti, ge' a'se'g la'l.
My dog is being a nuisance, please put him/her in the other room.

Mu getu' wanta'siwn gtlugowaqane'gmutim ta'n tujiw natlugwen.
You don't want to forget your tool bag when you go to work.

Lugowaqanit na gitap.
Your friend is troublesome.

Lugowinu pisgwa'tew sapo'nug.
The worker will come in tomorrow.

Lugowinu'sgw pisgwa'tew sapo'nug.
The (female) worker will come in tomorrow.

Pepsitelget na lugs'ji'j.
That little boy is disrespectful.

Mu gesga'weg'p nipugtug muta lu'gwejg ala'tueg'p.
We didn't get lost in the forest because we have a compass.

Lugwetug aq lgwetug na wijei glusuaqan.
Female mammal and female animal mean the same thing (in
English).

Metue'g ta'n pugtew epsaqtejgigtug telitmg mu nu'se'gn
geggunmu'n.
Its difficult to start a fire in a stove if you don't have a poker.

Lusgnign aq gastio'mi maw welpistamimg.
Bannock and molasses is a good spread.

Ta'n tujiw mesa'tamin, meso'tun lusgwatign.
When you swallow you swallow spit.

lu'suesgwewa'sit.translation: She performs the duties of a prospective  daughter-in-law
example:
Pugjig lu'suesgwewa'sit ula gitape'sgwinu.
Soon our female buddy will become a  daughter-in-law.

Ntus etllu'sugwe'sgewit Gesgapegiaq.
My daughter is being a daughter-in-law in Gesgapegiaq.

Poligap lu'sugwewa'sit.
Paul is becoming a son in law.

Mu ms't lutmaqan telianug.
Not all rumor is true.

Na gisigu mawinta'lutmaqaniget.
That old man knows how to spread rumors.

Magasann milamu'gl gjigang.
There are many kinds of stores in the city.

Magasana'sitaq.
He/she went to the store.

Gtigulagu najineiapieg'p magasano'guom pliei.
The day before yesterday we went to check out the new store.

Tami epit nma'gn?
Where is my moccasin?

Ala alma'gna'q, welaptmaqi ugma'gnmg ta'n telwaio'sgwa'tasinij.
That person wearing mocassins, I like the beadwork on the
mocassins.

Ms't magotl ewne'gl inaqaneg iga'tu.
Put all the blue dresses to the right.

Amgwes nemi'g ngwe'ji'j magota'q.
This is the first time I see my younger sister wearing a dress.

Gi's gi'l nemitu'n na telgi'g magu'n?
Have you ever seen such a large block of ice?

Ne'wieg maita'ieg egsitpu'nug.
There are four of us leaving tomorrow morning.

Gi's na suel jilei' ap na majiaqa'lit ngij.
After almost being injured my mother scolded me.

Igtigig majjoqteligng gaqawe'ji'gig, gatu ugtejgewei lpa mu tami
nemiaq.
I found all the other arrows, but the last one, I don't see it
anywhere.

Ni'g tewjisa'qawei lpa msaqtaqt majo'qiaq.
My house is so old that the floor wobbles.

Te's'g ta'n goqwei alapilg, lpa pas'g gisimajo'qiet.
He/she is carrying so much, he/she can only wobble.

Lpa'tuji'j majuggwalatl ugsisl ms't tami.
The little boy follows his older brother everywhere.

Nti majuggwatg nutepaqn te's maja'si.
My dog follows my car each time I go somewhere.

Ntlugowaqnmeg naqtmaneg mala.
I left my work at home.

Poqjimalapi, amujpa ugpugugwe'l gwilmann.
I'm beginning to see poorly, I must explore getting glasses.

Teleiaq mala'sit ula epsaqtejg, ge' iljoqte'g'p.
It seems stove is doing poorly, I'll stoke the fire.

Nugu' tewjiewlamugsit amuj malatalg.
He/she is looking so frail he/she must be eating very little.

Me' gatu malei gisgug, lpa mu goqwei getu lugwatmu.
I'm surprised at my laziness today, I just don't feel like doing
anything.

Gi's gi'l elia'sutman Ma'li?
Have you prayed to the Virgin Mary?

Nuji'j maliapt'g ms't goqwei wenji'guomg.
My grandchild bothers everything in the house.

Nsm malie'wit ula Gesp'teg.
My niece is getting married this Saturday.

Malie'wuti na mu gaqi'sg pisgwa'timg.
One does not go into marriage frequently.

maligatat.translation: He/she has weak legs or feet
example:
Wesam maligatat ugjit llega'n.
He/she is too weak legged to walk there.

Nuji'j maligeiwatl ugti'l.
My grandchild plays with his/her pet.

Malige'wigtug gulgwi'su'mi ugja'tu.
Get the lard from the barrel.

malige'wa't.translation: It is equivalent to a barrel
example:
Ge' malige'wa't te's'g jugwa'tui mimei.
Bring the equivalent of a barrel of oil.

Plasua maligmatl umisl.
Frank teases his older sister.

Lpa'tu'ji'j gesatg maligo'tg utepaqanji'j.
The little boy likes to play with his little car.

maligweg.translation: It grows at a slow pace
example:
Ula wasuegl maligwegl, etug wasamgispategl.
These flowers are growing slowly, perhaps they are too dry.

maligwet.translation: He/she grows at a slow pace
example:
Newte'jit nti we'gwimaligwet.
One of my dogs is growing at a much slower pace.

Mesgi'g na lugowaqan malipqwanjl getantmg gatu maw wigapu'gl.
Gathering hazelnuts is alot of work but they are very
delicious.

Gigjiw nignaq i'nigwepnig malipqwanjmusi'g.
Hazelnut bushes used to grow near my home.

Ula nitap Darrel maw mali'sit.
This friend of mine, Darrel, speaks very poorly.

Ala' ji'nm malja't, etug tala'teget?
That staggering man overthere, what do you think is wrong with
him?

Agase'wa'l maljewe'j ge's ms't goqwei ge'itoq.
Hire a youngster while he/she still knows everything.

Ula ji'nm me' gneg maljewe'juit je mu ugte'piteml.
This man is far younger than his wife.

Mallugweg ula pilei ntul.
My new vehicle works poorly.

Pie'l mallugwet ugjit na telamu'g lugowaqan.
Peter works pooly for that kind of work.

Mut jugwa'lanew na malo'pj ta'n etllugwei.
Don't bring that lazy one where I'm working.

Gisgug malpale'wi'sgw natnmi'g.
Today I'm going to see the doctor (who is female).

Mu' welo'tegew, jiptug natnmi'eq malpale'wit.
I'm not feeling well, perhaps I should go and see the doctor.

Gisigu malqumatl nme'jl te'siegsitpu'g
The old man eats fish every morning.

Telguisin malqutes ta'n pas'g goqwei iga'tuimg.
I'm so hungary I would eat whatever is put in front of me.

Teluejig mals gistlwe'jiaten ala gigjiw qospemji'jg.
They say you can find fling over there near the lake.

Mu' malsnawei tetujimilmenuegm'g st'ge lpa snawei.
Soft maple isn't used for as many things as rock maple.

Maltejjuei aq plegu'l jugwa'tui.
Bring me the hammer and nails.

Pile't'p na maltejjueiatgw sepei.
That was a new hammer handle this morning.

Mu ge'itutigweg ta'n telipnei, maltew wesua'tuimg'p aq
angaptmitip.
When they didn't know what ailed me, they took blood from me
and examined it.

Gis maltewa'lit muta wesamgigjepugui ta'n etlsatl tia'mul.
He/she got blood on me because I stood too close to where
he/she is cutting the moose.

Tetujimamunpe'gitnet lpa msaqtaqt maltewa'toq.
His/her nose bled so much he/she got blood on the floor.

Me' newte' telmaltewiaq na la'qan?
Is the wound still continuing to bleed?

We'gwimaltewiet ntue'm, ta'n tet tami tlpesusitug.
My dog is bleeding a lot, I wonder where he cut himself.

Tala'tegeg na gtpitn, maltewig.
What's wrong with your hand, it's bloody.

Talwaqama'la's maltewit atla'i?
How will I clean the bloodied shirt?

maltewsatl.translation: He/she causes him/her/it to bleed by cutting
example:
Nujitmasaqte'muet gis maltewsatl ji'nmul ge's etlpesgutua'j.
The barber made the man bleed while he/she was shaving him.

maltews'g.translation: He/she causes blood to flow by cutting it
example:
Gismaltews'g ugtluign.
He/she just cut his/her finger causing it to bleed.

maltewte'g.translation: He/she causes it to bleed by striking
example:
Na aluse'wit gis maltewte'g ugtijin.
That carpenter made his/her thumb bleed by hitting it with a
hammer.

maltewtesg.translation: It bleeds as a result of a fall
meanings: bleed as a result of a fall
example:
Gisimaltewtesg nunji nisia'neg.
My head is bleeding from when I fell.

maltewtesing.translation: He/she bleeds as a result of a fall
meanings: bleed as a result of a fall
example:
Sa'lui maltewtesing nisieteg.
Jean-Louis bled as a result of his fall.

maltewtesmatl.translation: He/she causes him/her to bleed by a fall
meanings: cause to bleed by a fall
example:
Lpa'tu'ji'j maltewtesmatl ugjigunn nisieteg.
The little boy's knee is bleeding from his fall.

maltewtestoq.translation: He/she causes it to bleed by a fall
meanings: causes to bleed by a fall
example:
Mali gisi maltewtestoq unji.
Mary fell and bloodied her head.

Telo'tm malugunai ta'n npaqam pestaqa'tuap.
I find my back is weak since I strained it.

ma'munigsalatl.translation: He/she likes or loves him/her very much
example:
Lpa'tuji'j ma'munigsalatl umijgamijl.
The little boy loves his grandfather very much.

Gis ma'munipsaq wela'gwe'g.
It snowed heavily last night.

Ma'muniw welte'lma'titl na ji'nmul.
They think very highly of that man.

Telma'munlaq, jiptug ma' gaqtugwawinug.
It's raining so much, hopefully it won't thunder.

Gi's gi'l nasgmnn pita'qewe'l ta'n mu maposl megwastenugl?
Have you worn pants that have no pockets?

Ngwe'ji'j gismaqa'latl nujjinenal utgnapui'gignml.
My sister has enlarged our father's picture.

Wesammaqalqasit na malige'w, ma gisie'wagw.
That barrel has too large of an opening, we can't use it.

Eig na gajuewj maqalqigwat.
Some cats have large eyes.

Maqamigew ugjit ewi'gamg nugu' metua's'g ula Listugujg.
Land for building is hard to come by here in Listuguj.

Nulugs pejimaqamigewa'sit wela'gwe'g.
My nephew arrived by land last night.

Ge's wejo'tmi'tij gi'gassinew, awna gitg maqana'lsijig.
As they try to out do each other, instead they outwitted
themselves.

Nitap we'gwimaqanat gespu'tuteg, negm ne'gaw telta'sit
mawinta'atnat.
My friend was really baffled when he was defeated at checkers,
he always thought that he was the best player.

Maqanimatl ugjignaml, toqotujiw wesgewe'g.
He/she verbally outwitted his/her brother, then he/she laughs.

Na we'gwimaqapsgegl negla wenju'su'nl.
Those apples are surprisingly large.

Welmaqapsg'sit nugu' na gulgwi's.
That pig is large and round now.

maqapsg'tiat.translation: He/she has a big and round belly
meanings: have a big and round belly
example:
Nitape'sgw etug nugu' unjanit, telmaqapsg'tiat.
My friend must be ready to have a her baby, her belly's so
rotund.

We'gwimaqapsgusuat ala nmu'j ale'g.
That dog hanging around over there has large testicles.

maqa'q.translation: It is big and round in girth
example:
Pas'g maqa'q pugsug gwile'n.
Just look for the large round pieces of firewood.

Ge'l jugwasgnmui na maqatewei.
Pass me the temporary replacement.

Ma' mlawa'siw gisgug wesammaqatgwig.
I'm not going out (by boat) today the waves are to big.

Nitape'sgw tewjimamunganie'wit amujpa maqa'toq ugtoqon.
My friend gained so much weight she had to enlarge her dress.

Miamuj maqatpai, telgi'g nta'gwesn.
I must have a large head, my hat (size) is so huge.

Gaqi'sg maqatu'atl aligal pas'g mu' apaja'tunigul.
He/she lends him/her clothes often, but he/she doesn't bring them
back.

Nutgmann ntpita'qeweiml wesammaqigjai.
My pants don't fit anymore my buttocks is too big.

Mu telta'siwas telmaqigtulit
I didn't think his/her boat was so big.

maqijjigwat.translation: He/she has a big bowel movement
example:
Maqijjigwat na te'sipow.
That horse had a big bowel movement.

We'gwimaqiptnat na e'pit.
That woman has large hands.

Maqisge'gl na pata'uti'l, etug teptestetal?
Those tables are wide, will they fit?

Mutt tlimaw maqisqonat.
Don't tell him/her that he/she has a big nose.

Tetujimaqistaqanat, etug welnutg ms't goqwei?
He/she has such large ears, do you think that he/she hears
everything well?

Te'sipow maw maqitnat.
A horse has very big nostrils.

Maqo'iptnat na etlmulqet.
The one digging has thick arms.

maqo'qonigata't.translation: He/she has big legs in girth
example:
Gi's na maqiptnat ap na maqo'qonigata't na e'pite's.
Not only does she have large hands she also has thick legs.

Welmaqoqsit ula masqwi, glu'sis ugjit gwitn.
The trunk of this birch is big enough to make a canoe.

Miamuj maqsitat, lpa mu tam(i) we'jiagwi mg'nsg ta'n
tepguata.
He/she must have large feet, he/she can't find shoes that will fit
him/her anywhere.

Maqtawamu'g na musigisg, etug getu' gaqtugwawig?
The sky is blackish, you think we'll have a thunder storm?

Ge' jugwa'tui maqtawamugsit ntatla'iem.
Would you bring me my darkish colored shirt.

Talamu'g na, maqtawe'g gisna maqtawiewne'g?
What color is that, is it black or is it navy blue?

Pugwengig gajuewji'jg aq pas'g newte'jit maqtawigjat.
I have many kittens and only one has a black bottom.

We'gaw nipg gaqiaq gujmug ta'n etllugutijig maqtawignegsultijig.
By the time that summer ends those who work outside have dark
tans.

Maqtawi'tuat to'q gatu megwatpat.
He's got a black beard yet he's redheaded.

Ta'n tujiw gujmug etllugwen na mawmaqtawoqsin.
When you work outside you get a dark tan.

Telmamunoqs'g na pipnaqan lpa maqtawoqteg.
He/she cooked that bread so much it is charred.

Jiga'w na mawmaqtunat nme'j.
The bass (fish) has a very large mouth.

Maja'sipnaq muta almasgelget na.
He/she left because he/she is seperated from his/her partner.

Pe' nige' masgeltijig, gatu gisagutitaq na.
For now they hate each other, but they will work it out.

Masgelt'g telui'tuj malo'pj.
He/she hates it if anyone calls him/her lazy.

Ula na gelu'sit masgwe's.
This is a good young birch tree.

Masgwe'simann gesimgwe'gl ta'n tujiw etteg.
Pin cherries are dark red when ripe.

Wigi gigji'w masgwe'simanaqse'gatigtug.
I live near a pin cherry grove.

Mu nugu' telpugwelug masgwe'simanaqsi st'ge amgwes.
There aren't as many pin cherry trees as there used to be.

Tami nigwejig masgwe'simusi'g?
Where do birch genus trees grow?

Masgwi na maw pugwelg ta'n goqwei wejitmg.
There really are lots of things that can be made with birch
bark.

Te'siula'wg masqo'lgig eptaqang.
Every night I put away the dishes.

Nige' masgo'tasi ugjit gesig.
Now I'm storing up for the winter.

Mali-Eselig masqo'toql utapsunn.
Marie-Angelique puts away her clothing.

Gisigui'sgw masquta'tl ugtpojml, jipatg na gmutmugsin.
The old woman hides her purse quickly, she's afraid someone will
steal from her.

Masqute'm ntsulieweim ugjit gitpesanigisg'g.
I save my money for a rainy day.

Pie'l masqwa'latl pile'l ugtatla'ieml.
Peter puts away his new shirt.

We'gwisa'q masqwa'tasit ala' ji'nm.
That man over there has been put away for a long time.

Masqwa'toq utepaqan te's gesig.
He/she puts his/her car away every winter.

Te's apoqnmaq nitap na awna massaqa'sitew aq ma' lugwegw.
Whenever I help out my friend he only takes advantage and
doesn't work.

Toqwa'q lentugg massaqia'tijig
In the fall deer are sexually aroused.

Pana pas'g telugwet almassaqte'get.
All he/she does is go around and instigate things.

Plamuei aq tap'tang aq ma'susi'l na mawigapu'g.
Salmon and potatos and fiddleheads are the most delicious.

Qame'g eliet aq assma nige' pemmatama'sit.
He/she is going across the river and he/she is heading towards the
road now.

matamasumteget.translation: He/she wades through the snow towards the road
meanings: wades through snow towards the road
example:
Tewjimamunipsaq wela'gwe'g amujpa matamasumtegei nige'.
It snowed so much last night I now have to wade through the
snow to get to the road.

Matawe'g te'sigisg'g eliei.
I go to Matapedia daily.

Matgwa'sit elege'wi'sgwal weltesguateg.
He/she bowed when he/she met the queen.

Ms't wen matgwetoq patgulme'sigaqan a's'tuo'guomg.
Everyone bows to the alter in church.

So'sep matgwetuatl Malial aq telimatl ap nmu'ltes.
Joseph nods to Mary and says I'll see you again.

Matlot apaqtug wejiet.
The sailor comes from overseas.

Amujpa ms't wen matnagget ugjit gm'tginu.
We all have to fight for our territory.

Mesgi'g matnaggewaqan wesgowa's'g ugjit Mi'gmewei tli'suti.
There's a big struggle going on for the Mi'gmaq language.

Matnaggewinu'l apnmiatl.
He/she has just returned from seeing the fighter.

Gi's te'sipunqeg matng g'pnno'l ugjit ntsuliewe'im.
For years I've been fighting the government for my money.

Malpale'wit matng gsnugowaqan.
The doctor fights against sickness.

Na wijig'tijig pas'g matntijig.
Those siblings just fight.

Gaqi'sg matntimg wejiaq ugjit wesgewaqan.
Fishing has often caused a time of fighting.

Matnugtesgewei na maw wigapu'g.
Head cheese is very delicious.

Wasam mato'qiaq ula ta'n goqwei.
This thing sways too much.

Pe'l gepta'siap, wesam mato'qiet ula miti's.
I'm going to get off now, this tree sways too much.

mattaqa'toq.translation: He/she pulls on it to make a sound
meanings: pull on to make sound (as bell)
example:
Wen i'mattaqa'toqosnn jijuejgl a's'tuo'guomg?
Who used to ring the bells at the church?

Nme'j mattaqta'tl nta'papiml.
The fish is pulling on my line.

Gesigawmattaqte'g na etligtu'muet.
The musician is really playing hard.

Te's atna'tij matta'tl.
Every time they play checkers he/she beats him/her.

Newtiegsitpu'g etlmatte'g't ligpeta'w, eli'g'tjig ligpete'gnapi'g.
All morning we have been beating the ash to make ash strips.(used
in basket weaving).

Ge' jugwa'tui na plegu'l aq mattejjuei?
Would you bring me the nails and the hammer?

Wen etlmattelg na sa'qawei lagla'ns?
Who's shooting at that old barn?

Pe'sgewei e'w'g pu'tail matteluatl.
He/she is using a gun to shoot at a bottle.

Telmamungaqtugwawig pa maqamigew mattesg.
It thunders so hard that the ground shakes.

Mutt ignmuaw mattesinn, muta ma' gisapsgnaq.
Don't let him/her move about, because I will not be able to
grab
hold of  him/her.

Mu' goqwei nemitug muta pas'g matuapetesing.
He/she didn't see anything he/she only took a glance.

Almatua'sit ala magasanji'jg ula gitapenu, mu geitm'g ta'n goqwei
esgmatg.
Our buddy is wandering about near that canteen, who knows what
they're waiting for.

Ta'n tujiw mui'n matuatalg, malqutal minijgl aq juji'ji'jg.
When the bear snacks, he/she will eat berries and little
bugs.(eg:ants)

Ne'gaw matue'g, gatu gisa'teget.
He/she has always lived marginally, but has endured.

Matues almatuatalg ntiga'taqanmg.
A porcupine is snacking in my garden.

Mnaq ni'n mestmu matuesuei, gatu gi'l?
I've never tasted procupine meat, how about you?

Arn'l mawigsatg almatu'lugwej.
Arnold likes to work at odd jobs.

Pie'l gesatg matu'mimajij.
Peter likes to live simply.

Matu'nmat, gatu te'sijig aq welmimajultijig.
He/she has limited resources, and even though they are many, they
live a good life.

matu'patl.translation: He/she eats a bit of it (fish)
example:
Mu' nnim mesgilug esgwiet na nme'j, pas gatu gina'sit gajuewj
matu'patl.
There isn't much left of that fish, yet that cat is working hard to eat
the scraps that are there.

Nitap matu'te'muatl nnjann usapunn.
My friend trims my child's hair.

matu't'g.translation: He/she eats a bit of it
example:
Pas'g matu't'g wilu muta mu gewisinug.
He/she just picks at his/her food because he/she isn't hungry.

Tm'g mawagnutmajig gesgmnaq najiwse'tigw.
First they talk together before they go fishing.

Nemi'g'pnig pugwelgig mawamg'pultijig a'se'g.
I saw a lot of them piled together in the other room.

Gispategl aq esgigl pugsugl mawamg'tegl.
The green and dryed firewood are piled together.

Nitapaq etlmawa'tajig ugjit ta'n tlataltaq.
My (two) friends are pooling their money to get something to eat.

Ntgwisinaq na witapewijig, pa te'sigisg'g mawe'gig.
Our sons are friends, everyday they hang out together.

Eig wi'us mawgamig
Some meat is really fatty.

Gwilu ta'n tegen mawgamit gulgwi'ji'j aq nma'l.
Find the fattest little pig and take it home.

So'sep maw glu'sit ta'n telmawgiljemg.
Joseph is the best at calculating.

mawgimatl.translation: He/she includes him/her in the count
example:
Mawgimsit telimiteg ta'n tesi'tij.
He/she counted him/herself in when he/she told me how many
they
were.

mawgitg.translation: He/she includes it in the count
example:
Amujpa ms't goqwei mawgitg ta'n pisgwa'q gisgug aq ulagu.
He/she has to add everything that came in today and yesterday.

Amu'g etlmawia'tijig gigjiw amuesusigtug
The bees gather near the beehive.

Te'sigisg'g na'te'l etlmawiejig.
Everyday they get together there.

Na mawglulgl ligpenignn ta'n wejiaql Gesgapegiaq.
The best baskets are the ones from Gesgapegiaq.

Ula ji'nm maw(i)glu'sit ugjit lnu saqamaw.
This man is a very good Indian chief.

Mawio'mi wesgowa's'g.
A meeting is in progress.

We'gwiulitpimawisetesg ula poqwatign.
This umbrella contracts in a neat way.

mawisetesg'g.translation: He/she crumples it with his/her feet
example:
Mawisetesg'gman nta'su'nl, wesamp'teg.
I crumple my blankets, it is too hot.

Mawisetesguatl ugtatla'ieml gesgmnaq panta'tug ga'qan.
He/she crumples up his/her shirt with his/her feet before opening
the door.

Go'gwejij lpa mawisetesintew te's samqwan elapaqto'j.
A spider will actually cringe whenever water is splashed at him/her.

Te's nipg nnu'g mawita'jig na'tami.
Every summer Native people gather somewhere.

Mawiulta'siap nnjan wesgijinuiteg.
I was ecstatic when my child was born.

Mawiulta'suaqan ta'n tujiw mijua'ji'j ugs'tqamuij.
The birth of a child is a joyful occasion.

mawlugwalatl.translation: He/she includes it(stove) in the repairs
example:
Ma'li mawlugwalatl epsaqtejgl te'siula'gw.
Mary cleans the stove every night (at the time she cleans other
things).

mawlugwatg.translation: He/she includes it in the repairs
example:
Newtsiniw ms't goqwei mawlugwatg.
He/she fixes everything all at once.

Pugus na tellugwet te'sigisg'g mawo'laji pu'taig.
Percy spends his days gathering bottles.

Tio'tis mawo'tasit ugjit gesigewei wilu.
Eunice gathers her food for the winter.

Atu'tuej malipqwanjl mawo'toqol ugjit gesig.
The squirrel gathers hazelnuts for the winter.

We'ji'g gatu ntatla'im, mawpisip ala pita'qewe'l gelpilas'g.
I found my shirt, it was bundled together with the pants.

Gawatgw mawpit ta'n snawe'g elagwe'tij.
There is a black spruce where the cedar trees are.

Nespne'n ala mawpitegl wi'gatignn, ge'gutegl pata'utigtug.
Take the bundled books with you, they are on the table.

mawsa'latl.translation: He/she builds a fire in the stove or furnace
meanings: build a fire in the stove or furnace
example:
Gi's ap naqasuenmat na So'sep, amujpa ap mugsa'l'g ula
epsaqtejg.
Again Joseph let the fire die out, I'll have to build another fire in
the stove again.

meanings: start and maintain a fire in a stove
example:
Ta'n tujiw tegiegsitpu'g na Pie'l mawsa'tat.
On cool mornings Peter will start a fire in his stove.

mawsa'teget.translation: He/she builds a fire in a stove or furnace
meanings: make a fire (in stove or furnace)
build a fire (in stove or furnace)
example:
Ngijaq apjiw gesiegsitpu'g mawsa'tegep.
My mom used to always start a fire very early in the morning.

mawsa'toq.translation: He/she puts it in the fire to burn
example:
Gaqmawsa'toq ta'n te's'g wi'gatign we'jitoq.
He/she burns all the paper he/she finds.

E'we'n ula eteg, gi's ms't goqwei mawteg.
Use this one, everything is already included.

Mawte'g ugsulieweim glapis te'p'g wi'g.
He/she is saving his/her money until he/she can afford his/her own
house.

Maw pile'l na algwilmann.
I'm looking for the very new ones.

Ntatla'im maw pisit ligpenigenigtug.
My shirt is included in the basket.

Pewatm ms't goqwei maw piten.
I want everything to be tied together.

Maw winjig gsnugowaqan gisiwjiaq tmaweiigtug.
A very bad sickness can come from tobacco.

Nipgewei tgei maw winjit.
A summer cold is very bad.

Me' newte' teluliangamgusit.
He/she still looks great.

Na we'gwime'ga's'g na ugju'sn.
That wind is really overactive.

Na we'gwime'ga'sit ta'n tujiw wete'gej.
He/she makes a big fuss when he/she wins.

mega'sualatl.translation: He/she makes a big fuss over him/her
example:
Mega'sualatl uji'tl aq teto'qigsalsnnitl.
He/she fusses over his/her grandchild and the child totally
loves it.

Tio'tis teluet Pita'q Ugju'sn mawinta'me'ga'teget.
Tio'tis says that Pita'q Ugju'sn likes to overdo things.

Nuji'j we'gwime'ge'g ta'n tujiw gis magota'sij.
My granddaughter acts very proud after she puts on her dress.

Newte'jit nitap megeng suliewei, negm glutmuatesnu.
One of my friends has plenty of money, we'll ask him/her.

Mui'n megepaji atoqwa'su'g.
The bear ate a large amount of trout.

megeta'ji.translation: He/she has acquired plenty of them(fish)
example:
Megeta'ji na ula atuomgoming, pas'g gejigow wejmaja'sip.
He/she picked a lot of strawberries, he/she just left to pick a short
while ago.

Nitap megete'g suliewei wela'gwe'g.
My good friend won plenty of money last night.

Plasua megete'gl pgumann.
Frank gathers (or has gathered) alot of blueberries.

Amuj megetg pguman, lpa ewnaqutnat.
He/she must have eaten a lot of blueberries, he/she is blue around
the mouth.

Plasua me' megetgl pgumann je' mu ta'n te's'gl gismawte'gl.
Frank eats more blueberries than he gathered.

Anni megite'lmatl umisl.
Annie thinks really highly of her older sister.

Ula nitap mawinta'ginuet aq gimu'tug megitelsit.
My friend here likes to brag and has a somewhat high opinion of
himself/herself.

Se'tane'umg na mawmegite'tas'g ula Listugujg.
The Feast of Saint Ann is very honored here in Listuguj.

Megite'tasit pilei atla'i.
The new shirt is highly prized.

Je me' megite'tg na utepaqan aq ni'n.
He/she thinks more highly of his/her car than he/she does of
me.

Nsugwis megnaji glitaq te's nipg.
My aunt picks strawberries every summer.

Gisigui'sgw megnatl uji'jl aq tepa'latl ugplaqaneg.
The old lady picks up her grandchild and places him/her on her
lap.

Te'siegsitpu'g megng pilei wi'gatign.
Each morning he/she picks up a new paper.

So'sep na nujimgnewet, megnegl wi'gatignn awtigtug.
Joseph is the gatherer, he picks up paper from the road.

Eig wen ta'n tlui'taq me'go'pj?
Is there anyone that you would call a snob?

Gelu'lgl ligpenignn gisitu'un we'wj me'goqomgwejg.
Good baskets can be made using Red osier dogwood.

Mego'tig mijipjewei gisgug.
Food is expensive today.

Wasammego'tit, ma te'paq.
It's too expensive,  I won't be able to afford it.

Tuma megt'g ta'n te's'g goqwei telimuj.
Thomas doubts everything that he is told.

E'pite'ji'j megtuatl a'tugwewinu'l.
The little girl does not believe the storyteller.

meanings: charge a high price for labour
example:
Mu agase'wa'laq na nujintoq muta wesamme'gusit.
I won't hire that singer because he/she charges too much.

Gisigu pemiet megwaig awtigtug.
The old man walks in the middle of the road.

Megwa'luejig megwe'jijig.
Beets make one('s skin) red.

Newte'jit ntgwis megwaltugwat.
One of my sons is red haired.

Megwa'sa'q lpa megwamu'gl guntal.
Migauasha the rocks are reddish in color.

Lpa megwamugsit ula nti, mu gejiam'g ta'n wejiet.
My dog actually looks reddish, who knows were he/she has been.

We'gwimegwapsgeg aq gesnuguig ta'n na amu paqa'lip.
It's really red, round and sore where the bee bit me.

Megwapsg'sultijig ula glitaq.
These berries are red and round.

Mali megwasa'latl ugtnapui'gignnml elsaqas'gigtug.
Mary attaches her picture to the wall.

Megwasa'toq pas'g mu getu' megwasa's'tnug.
He/she attaches it but it doesn't want to stick.

We'jiates napui'gign megwaspit ula wi'gatignigtug.
You will find the picture attached to this letter.

Goqwei megwasteg gtatla'img?
What is attached to your shirt?

Gensi pas'g ugpugugul pegopegl, ugsisgw waju'aq megwa'taqan.
Before you knew it just the eyes were distinguishable, his/her face
full of rouge.

Ge'l angam na e'pijig, gis ma'munmegwa'tasni'g.
Take a look at those ladies, they've piled the rouge on.

Wasoqweg aq megwatetesg.
It is lit and it flashes red.

Newte'git gloqowej nemi'g lpa tluenes megwatetesing.
I see one star that you could say is flashing red.

Malia'n tewjimamunigsipa'toq ugpitn lpa megwa'toq.
Maryann scratched her hand so much that she made it red.

Gwilu megwe'gig.
Look for the red ones.

Megwe'g snawei na gispitoqsitew.
The red maple can be a tall tree.

Tlim gujj jugwa'lan megwe'jijig.
Tell your dad to bring the beets.

Ala ji'nmji'j megwe'saqa'sit te's e'pite'sl gelulj.
That young man blushes whenever young woman speak to him.

Ntlamugsis na megwe'saqsit ji'nm.
My uncle is a man who has a ruddy complexion.

Amuj nti sa'q nepg, muta gi's mejgiet.
My animal must have been dead for long time, because rigor
mortis has already set in.

Sisgu gisiamjaqusiteg, na toqo tujiw mejegamugsit Wapigut.
After she had smeered herself in the mud, that's when Wapigut
(White-Pawed) looked really dirty.

Ge' telimjigapewit, amuj na we'jitutug na'tami mjigei.
His/her face is so dirty, he/she must have found dirt somewhere.

Ge' mna'l na atlai, mejige'g.
Take that shirt off, it's dirty.

Amuj gesatg mejeggumaj, lpa mu' waqampisa'sigw.
He/she likes to wear dirty clothes, he/she wouldn't put on clean
ones.

Mejit newt telimul, pa'si.
I'm telling you one more time, sit down.

Mui'n mejjigwat nipugtug.
A bear defecates in the woods.

Nmu'j teljipaqatesgatl mui'nal lpa mejjilsit.
The dog was so startled by a bear that he/she defecated
him/herself.

Melga'latl pqa'lu'sgwul.
He/she hardens the clay.

Amuj gisiguwitugnaq na tia'mo'q, tetujimelgapegisg ula tia'muei.
That must have been an old moose, this meat is so tough and
stringy.

Lpa'tu'ji'j melgapjitl ugtpu'taiml, mu' getu'legegul.
The little boy has a strong grip on his bottle, he doesn't want to let
it go.

Ala tapusijig ji'nmug gitg melgaqanatpajig.
Those two men are both bald.

Te'plmasewei melga's'g ta'n tujiw gispateg.
Cheese hardens when it dries.

Pqwa'lu'sgw melga'sit ta'n tujiw gispasij.
Clay hardens when it's dry.

Tal mlga'tu ula m'gegn?
How do I harden this leather?

Ge' jugwasga'tui ta'n gi's melge'g.
Hand me the one that's already hard.

Mawmelgiaqasit wen na tellugwej.
One gets very muscular doing that.

Melgigit na lpa'tuj ugjit tetuji maljewe'juip.
That young boy is built solidly for being so young.

Melgignaq na p'tewei gisapu'smn.
That tea you brewed is strong.

Miamuj melgignat, teligsugg na alapilg.
He/she must be strong, what he/she is carrying is so heavy.

Melgiji'nm gisgina'muas maljewe'jl mlgiji'nmuinin.
A strong man can teach a youngster to be a strong man.

Ngwis na mawmelglugwet negm.
My son works really hard.

Melgi'taqanat na nti pe'gw teliapje'ji'jip.
My dog has a strong neck even though he's so small.

Melgita't ta'n wen wigit gjigang gisgug.
A person has to be brave to live in a city these days.

Nti mu weleiug aq melg'jat.
My dog is not feeling well and he/she is constipated.

Tm'g melg'pugua'sit gesgmnaq gesmoqja'tug utepaqan
He/she takes a strong stance before he/she pushes his/her car.

Welta'si telmlg'tqasij ula a'papi, muta gesgujaq ta'n goqwei
wetnnmu'g.
I'm glad this is such a strong rope, because what we are pulling is
heavy.

Miawitpa'qap ngwis melgwisgap aq mu'gisiapajinpagup.
It was midnight when my son had a nightmare and then he couldn't
go back to sleep.

Meluijoqo teliaq na?
Honestly is that true?

Ula iga'taqan nige' memge'g.
This garden is now an uncultivated field

Memgoqte'g ugtiga'taqan gesgmnaq ewi'gagw.
He/she is clearing his/her land before building his/her house.

Egsitpu'nug so'qiet aq poqjimemgoqte'get.
Tomorrow morning he/she is going up to the woods and beginning
to make a clearing.

A'tli aq ni'n gitg mena'gigweieg ntiga'taqaninaq.
Audrey and me pull up weeds in our garden.

Lgusuaqan menagwisg.
This ladder is tipsy.

Menagwising wen ta'n tujiw gaqama'sij gwitnigtug.
One is tipsy or unbalanced when standing up in a canoe.

Ango'te'n ta'n tujiw aja'tu'n na, gimu'tug menaje'jg.
Be careful when you move that, it is a bit fragile.

Nsugwis nugu' menaje'jit.
My aunt is quite frail now.

Mena'latl umugsnn aq ugti'l gisgatpinitl pqojisqotaminin.
He/she takes his/her shoe off and his/her dog is right there ready to
chew.

Sangew menapaqatl piglewji'tl.
He/she slowly unscrewed the lamp globe.

Sangew menapaqq glapaqign.
Slowly he/she unscrews the screw.

mena'piet.translation: He/she removes fish from a net
example:
Te'siegsitpu'g mena'piet aq egimaji ta'n te'suta'j.
Every morning he/she removes fish from the net and counts his/her
catch.

mena'piget.translation: He/she removes a net from the water
meanings: remove a net from the water
example:
Newt gismna'pigei na apjiw waqma'l'g nta'pim.
Once I remove my net from the water, I always clean it.

Nige' menapsg'te'm na mgumi'j gisipsoqtesgmai.
Now I will chip off the protuberance of ice that I just tripped on.

Menaqa unaqa'l na lnuoqta'w.
Pick that statue up properly.

menaqajewa'latl.translation: He/she does something carefully and correctly to him/her/it
example:
Amujpa malpale'wit menaqajewa'latl gisigu'l ta'n teleiwaj.
The doctor has to treat the old man carefully and correctly.

menaqajewa'toq.translation: He/she does it carefully and correctly
example:
Nujigina'muet menaqajewa'toq ugtlugowaqan.
The teacher does his/her work carefully and correctly.

Pana menaqajewei gi'lewei.
Rightfully it's yours.

Me' gatu menaqanaq ula p'tewei.
This tea is very weak.

Gisigu menaqanat gisgug.
The old man is weak today.

Mena'qigwalg pgu tlia' segg'naspij.
I'm scraping off the gum even if it is stuck on really tight.

Ula ntmattejjueim pugwelg plegu gismna'qigwatg.
This hammer of mine has pryed off many nails.

Ula Gesp'teg mena'taqu'tieg tap'tang.
This Saturday we are harvesting the potatos.

Wasammenata't, amujpana apoqonmut.
He/she is too weak, he/she has to be helped.

Ala ji'nm apjiw mena'toq ugta'gusn ta'n tujiw pisgwa'j wenji'guom.
That man takes his hat off whenever he enters a house.

Ngij menawjit nugu' ta'n pemgisigu'ep.
My mother is sensitive to cold now that she is getting older.

Weliangamgug na menigu, taluisig?
That is a beautiful island, what is it called?

Amujpa menigwalatl pu'gowijl gesgmnaq engopa'sig mutputigtug.
He/she has to scrape of the balsam sap before sitting down on the
chair.

Tewji pugwelg sisgu amujpa menigwatg gesgmnaq pisgwa'gw
wenji'guomg.
There is so much mud he/she has to scrape it off before going into
the house.

Nqosi nisqanane'g aq sangew menigwet.
My fingernail is bruised and is growing out slowly.

Amujpa meni'gwet, toqosi'p e'watal psaqa'gul eltoq pugtew.
He/she has to strip off some birch bark, then use it to start a fire.

Menina'latl napui'gignn elsaqas'g.
He/she rips the picture off that wall.

Mnina'tu mussew aq jugwa'tu.
Tear off a piece and bring it over here.

Lpa menipga'latl jagejl ugto'jmg megwastesiniteg.
He/she pulled off the lobster completely when it grabbed onto
his/her toe.

Goqwei menipga'tueg?
What are we to pull off?

Pe' jaqalmnipqwa'l'g'p ula.
Let me quickly remove its bark.

meanings: take off or remove tree bark
example:
Ge' menipqwa'tuap na mussew esgwiaq.
Let me remove that last piece of bark.

Gismewlia'gwej maitaieg aq najimenipqwa'utieg.
We're leaving this afternoon to go and remove (gather) bark from
the trees.

Menjapsgeg pilei nasapaqe'n.
Attach the new doorknob.

Gis tluetes migjigj menjapsg'sit.
You can say that a turtle is dome shaped.

Suel te'siegsitpu'g lluigneg te's ajiet menja'si.
Almost every day I get up at seven o'clock.

menjinoqamatl.translation: He/she  looks at him/her up and down
meanings: look at up and down or from head to toe
example:
Je(l) tmg menjinoqamatl gesgmnaq gelulagweg.
He/she looked him/her up and down before he/she spoke to
him/her.

Ta's'gl menjipuguejgl nuta'nn nige'?
How many posts do you need now?

menj'puguit.translation: He/she is now standing from a lying position
meanings: now standing from a lying position
example:
Mu' nugu' elisinug, menj'puguit.
He/she isn't lying down anymore, he/she is standing.

Gesatm menp'g nqosi'g.
I like to bite my fingernails off.

Miamuj nugu' ms't goqwei gaqipiateg, pe' menqaweiap.
I expect everything is dry by now, I'll bring in the laundry.

Amujpa mensatl gopsgwetmal uluguneg.
He/she has to cut off the lamper-eel from his/her thigh.

Mens'g na a'papi naspit ntulg.
I'm going to cut the rope that is attached to my boat.

Ni'n wejo'tm gi'l mnto'lnin aq gi'l wejo'tmn ni'n mnte'in.
I try to knock you off and you try to knock me off.

Ge' jugwa'tui ala tmi'gn, getu' mnte'm ula psetgun.
Bring me that axe, I want to chop this knot off the tree.

Teljipaqatesing suel winnu ment'g.
He/she was so startled he/she almost bit his/her tongue off.

Ga'qana's'g sewisga's'geg na aluse'wit menuege'g'p.
When the doorway broke he/she needed a carpenter.

Menuegei nige' welitgpa'q samqwan.
Now I need some good cold water.

Menuegetueg Mi'gmewei tli'suti.
We need the Mi'gmaq language.

Jipji'j mesa'latl weti'l.
The bird swallows the worm.

Gi's na ne'gaw me'sapjeta'tl na tu'aqann.
He/she's always had trouble catching the ball.

Me'sapjete'g ugta'gusn pems'g ugju'snigtug.
He/she can't catch his/her hat being blown around by the
wind.

meanings: collaspes as a result of a punch
example:
Matnaggewinu mesaqaneita'tl igtigl matnaggewinu'l.
The fighter flattens the other fighter.

Pas'g newt mesa'tamit aq sinegetl tmletji'jl.
He/she only swollowed once and he/she emptied the glass.

Sangew mesatgwa'latl epsaqtejgl temsaqas'gigtug.
Slowly he/she placed the stove against the wall.

Mesatgwa'tu wenji'guomg glaman nqamasapt'tes.
Put it up against the house so you will see it easily.

Lpa tluegg na te'sipow mesatgwepit na lagalans.
It seems like that the horse is up against that barn.

Altesgasimgewei mesatgweteg wenji'guomg.
The bicycle is leaning against the house.

Mesatgwigsma'latl lagla'nsigtug te'sipowl gesgmnaq
sa'se'wa'tuagweg mgumie'jl.
He/she pushed the horse up against the barn before he/she
changed one of  his/her horseshoes.

Mesatgwisma'toq lgusuaqan wenji'guomg.
He/she lays the ladder up against the house.

Wapigut mijipjewei je mu soqtmug, smtug mesa'toq.
Wapigut (dog's name) doesn't even chew food, she just swallows
it.

Mese'g wenju'su'n pewatm.
I want a whole apple.

Tetujijipaqate'lit lpa mesegei nt'pgum.
He/she starteled me so that I swollowed my gum.

Nulugs etlgina'masit ta'n tlmesegitew.
My nephew is studying to be a cook.

Mesge'g ta'n telswistesmaj wasuego'ql.
He/she is sorry for breaking the flower pot/vase.

Gi's pemgmaneg na mesgmeg.
I've already gone past my prime.

Ni'n wigi mesgi'g wape'g wenji'guom.
I live in a big  white house.

Gimu'tug mesgigji'jit, gatu e'wa's.
It is somewhat large, but I will use it.

Mesgilg na ntgwis ugjit pas'g newtisgegipuna'p.
My son is big for ten years old.

Mesiapo'qajig mlagejg p'teweigtug.
He/she stirs the milk into the tea.

Ntus maw ulte'teget natgoqwei seggw etlmesiapo'q'g.
My daughter is happiest stiring something sweet.

mesiapoqta'tl.translation: He/she stirs it(paint)fast with an instrument
example:
Wesamisigawmesiapoqta'tl sigupaqte'gn.
He/she is stiring the buttermilk too fast.

mesiapoqte'g.translation: He/she stirs it with an instrument
example:
Ta'n tujiw eltoq petaqan mesiapoqte'g samuqwan aq wape'jgl.
Whenever he/she makes a pie he/she mixes water and flour.

Mu getu' msu'lnu nt'tgeim.
I don't want to infect you with my cold.

Gi's ap igtig na'gweg mesie'waq.
Another day and it's drizzling.

E'pite'ji'j gaqi'sg mesimatl ugsisl.
The little girl often tells on her older brother.

Ugjigunn tewjigsnugwatl lpa me'sipmiet.
His/her knee is so sore he/she can not walk.

Carol gismesna'latl ntatlaiml ugjit ni'n.
Carol has repaired my shirt for me.

Gi's mesnatl tu'aqann?
Has he/she had the ball yet?

Amujpa nugu' mesna'toq ugtul muta wesams'peg.
He/she has to mend his/her boat because it leaks to much.

Gisgug mesn'g mesgi'g suliewei.
Today he/she receives the big money.

Te's na siggw pas'g mesni'smi'titl ntawtinal.
Every spring they only patch our roads.

Ntatlaim mesni'sasit, pas'g weliangamgusit.
My shirt is patched, but it looks good.

Mesni'satl mg'snn.
He/she patches a shoe.

Gi's pana nitap wesgowa'sit mesni's'g sa'qawei mtawegn.
There he/she is, my friend is mending the old flag again.

Nuji'j, Mali, amgwes mespatl plamu'l.
My grandchild, Mary, has tasted salmon for the time.

Migwite'tmn mespo'qe'g Matawe'g?
Do you remember when it flooded in Matapedia?

Nitap Pie'l mespo'qet te's siggw.
My friend Peter gets flooded each spring.

mesqana'latl.translation: He/she puts him/her down to the ground or floor
example:
Sangew mesqana'latl qopisunn npo'qonigtug.
He/she slowly lays the infant down on the bed.

mesqana'sit.translation: He/she goes down to the ground or floor
meanings: go down to the ground or floor
example:
Ulagu nemi'g'p ji'nm mesqana'sit maqmigeg aq mu maja'sigwaq.
Yesterday I saw a man go down to the ground and didn't move
again.

mesqana'toq.translation: He/she puts it down on the floor or ground
example:
Mesqana'toq tmg toqojiu nasapaqte'g.
He/she puts it down first and then fastens it.

Mesaqaneiteluatl aq pas'g newte' piluowei e'w'g.
He/she put him/her down with only one shot.

Gigji'w miti'sigtug mesqanepit, esgipa'tl tia'mul.
He/she is crouching near a tree, he/she is waiting for a moose.

Wigwiet aq mesqaniet.
He/she goes limp and collapses.

mesqolit.translation: He/she has it pierced in the body
example:
Maljewe'juianeg mesqoliap plegu ge's alsesagi'm.
When I was young I pierced a nail through my foot while I was
running around barefooted.

messa'latl.translation: He/she misses making a connection with him/her
example:
Mali gisimessa'latl uji'jl, getu' nmiapna.
Mary missed her grandchild, she had wanted to see him/her.

messa'toq.translation: He/she misses making a connection with it
example:
Amujpa tetaqa'si, mu getu' messa'tu goqwei.
I must hurry, I don't want to miss anything.

Gewising na, muta gismes'tesg'g wela'gwewei.
He/she is hungry, he/she just missed supper.

Gisimes'tesgmaieg asoqomutaqan.
We have just missed the ferry.

mes'tesguatl.translation: He/she misses a connection with him/her
meanings: arrive late and miss someone entirely
miss meeting someone because of timing
example:
Mes'tesguatl ta'n telia's'guaj umisl.
He/she arrived to late to pick-up his/her older sister.

Amgwes mest'g tia'muei.
He/she tastes moose meat for the first time.

Telgitaqasi lpa me's'tugwi'm.
My muscles ache so much I'm totally unable to run.

Gisgug mesugtaqanai ugjit plamuei.
Today I am craving for salmon.

We'jituann ntap'sqi'gnml, ula me'su'tug eteg'snn.
I found my keys, they were here in full view.

Metaqapit ala ji'nm etllugwet gujmug.
The man working outside here is bare chested.

metaqapja'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her/it in his/her bare hands
example:
Pe' na metaqapja'latl na wowul, telpsinnitl.
So he/she picks the pot up with his/her bare hands, it's so
hot.

metaqapja'sit.translation: He/she takes it in bare hands
example:
Lpa metaqapja'sit epteg lu'se'gn.
He/she bare handed a hot poker.

metaqapja'toq.translation: He/she takes it in bare hands
example:
Gi's gi'l nemi't wen metaqapja'toq pugtew?
Have you ever seen anyone handle fire bare handed?

metaqapjeta'tl.translation: He/she grabs him/her in his/her bare hands
example:
Metaqapjeta'tl gesgmnaq nisiennigw.
He/she catches him/her with his/her bare hands before he/she falls.

Almetaqapjit na mgumi lpajaq mu' goqwei.
He/she is handling that ice with his/her bare hands as if it were
nothing.

Pi'el metaqasing atuomgigtug.
Peter lays on the bare sand.

metaqateg.translation: It is on a bare surface
example:
Metaqateg maqamigeg, natgoqwei lame'g lega'tu.
It's sitting on the bare ground, lay something under it.

Glapis gatu me'ta'tl na tu'waqnn, ge's wejo'gt.
He/she finally hit the ball that he/she was trying to hit.

Wen gis me'te'g na tuop'ti?
Who is the one that hit that window?

me'telg.translation: He/she successfully hits it with a shot
example:
Ta'n getu'tlgigja'sij, lpa mu me'telmug goqwei.
No matter how close he/she gets, he/she misses.

Gaqi'sg pe'sguatl, pas'g newt me'teluatl.
He/she shot him/her often, but he/she only hit him/her once.

Newte'jit nitape'sgw wigit Metepena'giaq.
One of my female friends lives in Metepna'qiaq.

Ta'n mu miti'sigw gmtn ge'gutnaqatug na teluemg metesegiet.
When a mountain is treeless on top we say it is bare.

Natuen tels'taq metete'get.
I think I hear someone knocking.

metetoqsit.translation: He/she makes repeated sounds with voice
meanings: make repeated sounds (like groaning, chirping or cawing)
example:
Nutat na jipji'j metetoqsit?
Can you hear that bird chirping?

Lpa nutmn metewaqs'g legepilaqan.
You can hear the flapping sound of the window shade.

Jipji'j na metewaqsing?
Is that a bird I hear fluttering?

metewa'sit.translation: He/she makes a sound from moving about
meanings: makes a sound from moving about
example:
Eig na, muta metewa'sit a'se'g.
He/she is here, because I hear him/her moving around in the other
room.

metewatalg.translation: It(horse) makes a sound when eating
example:
Lpa apigji'j nutaq metewatalg!
I can hear a mouse eating!

metewa'toq.translation: He/she makes a sound in handling it
meanings: makes a sound in handling it
example:
Jiniw metewa'toq natgoqwei eptaqano'guomg.
Suddenly he/she is jostling with something in the cupboard.

metewe'g.translation: He/she makes a sound by stirring or bustling about
meanings: makes a sound by stirring or bustling about
example:
Nutaq ngwis a'se'g metewe'g.
