I hear my son stirring about in the other room.

Nutag ntus meteweng a'se'g.
I hear my daughter speaking in the other room.

Je nugu' pe'gustaq metewenmij.
I'm so pleased to hear him/her laugh again.

metewilua't.translation: He/she is heard sounding off in anger
example:
Geji'g wegai'g, lpa nutaq metewilua't.
I know that he/she is angry, I can hear him/her sounding off.

Nutaq gapjagwej metewintoq te'siegsitpu'g.
I hear a robin singing every morning.

Nutaq nti metewjigmit, we'jitoq na natgoqwei.
I hear my dog growling, he/she must have found something.

Nutaq metewo'gwet, pas'g mu gejiaq ta'n goqwei wesgu'tg.
I hear him/her talking, but I don't know what he/she is talking
about.

Gisigu na metewoqsing.
The old man can be heard snoring.

A'se'g nutaq metewtemit.
I hear him/her crying in the other room.

Gi's pana almetgatat na lpa'tu'ji'j.
That little boy is going around barefooted again.

Ula pipnaqan welmetgwasteg aq nugwe'g lame'g, aq
we'gwiwigapu'g.
This bread is nice and crusty and soft inside, and very delicious.

Ula e'pite's gesatg metgwatj.
This young lady likes to go bareheaded.

Wasammetgwe'g ula m'gegn, ma' gisie'wmug.
This leather is too stiff, we can't use it.

Giju', gi'l geggunmn metla'saigl?
Mother, do you have ten dollars?

Je(l) gi's metla'sipuna't gnjannu!
Our child is already ten years old!

Newtisga'ql metla'sipunqegl na gasgiptnnaqan te'sipunqeg.
Ten times ten years is a hundred years.

Gi's metla'sisga'q telimul mutt lliew na'te'l.
I have told you ten times not to go there.

metoqiaq.translation: It(bus) descends (from the mountain) in elevation
example:
Weja'tegemg qospemg na awti metoqiaq.
From the lake the road starts to decend.

metoqiet.translation: He/she descends (from the mountain) in elevation
example:
Ta's ajietew metoqien?
What time will you be going down to the village?

metoqwa'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her to lower land
example:
Gisgug metoqwa'latl unjann sitmug.
He/she is taking his/her child down to the beach today.

metoqwa'toq.translation: He/she takes it to lower land
example:
Metoqwa'toq pugsug ta'n giste'g'p.
He/she is bringing down the wood that he/she cut.

Metoqwiwsit gesig.
In the winter he/she moves down to the community.

Wesammetuamu'g, mu' tami eliew.
It (the weather) looks too bad out, I'm not going anywhere.

Nti gesnugwat, metuamugsit muta geggunatl go'gwejijl.
My dog is sick, he/she looks bad because he/she has cancer.

Awti pemulgwatmi'tij metuatqeg.
They are following a difficult road through thicket.

Metue'g wenjueiei tli'suti ugjit ni'n.
The French language is difficult for me.

We'guimtuuna'q gisgug.
It's really stormy today.

Metuigisg'g ta'n tujiw telmamungigpesaq.
The weather is awful when it rains as much as it is raining.

Metuima'q na ula te'plmasewei.
This cheese has a bad taste.

Metuima't na ula apigjilu.
This skunk has a bad odor.

Lpa'tuji'j metuite'tg nmien nige' gisiamsala'tegej.
The little boy dreads going home now that he had done something
he wasn't supposed to do.

Metu'qamigsi's'p gi'l maljewe'juineg?
Did you have a difficult disposition when you were young?

Njugwi'jij gesatg mewisij ugjit glitaq.
My mother in law loves to pick berries.

Pejigs'ta'gwei mewlia'gowei.
I'm here to mooch (join you uninvited for) lunch.

Geget nugu' mewlia'gweg aq gewisin.
It's almost noon and I'm hungry.

Ge me' ap la'mui, gewisin.
Could you serve me more again, I'm hungry.

Me' goqwei eig ta'n mnaq gaqa'tas'tnug?
Is there anything else that isn't finished yet?

Me' ijga guta'tu, ugju'pega'l na tmlet.
Pour a bit more, fill the glass tumbler.

Naqtmu utapsun, me' pa wejgu'et.
Leave his/her belongings there, he/she is coming anyway.

Me' talein?
How are you (singular)?
Me' talo'ltioq?
How are you (plural)?

Me' talo'teget gujj?
How is your father feeling?

Me' wen wejgu'et?
Is anyone else coming?

Majulgwatmnej gijga' ula mgatawti, mu geitu ta'n eliaq.
Lets follow this footpath for a bit, I don't know where it goes.

Tegen m'gegn e'wmn ugjit pepgejete'gemgewei?
Which hide do you use for a drum?

Gtu'sgen amujpa mgignn gwilmnn.
If you want to fish you have to find the hooks.

Talamugsijig getu' nasgajig mg'sng?
What color shoes do you want to wear?

Ge' jugwa'tui nmugsn aq mg'snapi.
Bring me my shoe and a shoelace.

Epite'ji'j gesatg mg'sna'q.
The little girl likes to wear shoes.

Pewatas'g mgumi tepiaq tlpase'gtn gesgmnaq gisiwsgija'tim'g.
It is necessary for the ice to be thick enough before one can go on
it.

Awije'jit ta'n wen gisimgumie'jo'tlatl te'sipowl.
There are few who can shoe a horse.

Je we'gaw igatne'we'sm mgumie'ja'q
Even a racehorse wears horseshoes.

Mgumie'jg milita'nej.
Let's play horseshoes.

Tuma mgumie'jo'tlatl ugtue'ml.
Tom shoes his horse.

Mgumi'gnn nastegl lagla'nsigtug.
Icicles are on the barm.

Mawinsanoqon na ta'n tujiw mgumi'gnig awti.
It's very dangerous when the road is icy.

Mgumi'gnit lnuoqta'w gujmug gaqamit.
The statue standing outside is icy.

Wejipeg, miamuj na nige' getu gigpesaq.
There's an east wind, for sure now it's going to rain.

E'pite'ji'j pemiet miawe'g awtigtug.
The little girl is walking along the middle of the road.

miawitpa'q.translation: It is the middle of the night
example:
Miawitpa'q na poqjiepsimgeweia'sit.
He/she begins to get feverish in the middle of the night.

Je gi's miawna'gweg aq me' nepat.
It's already midday and he/she is still sleeping.

Migjigj giswigit maqamigeg aq samqwanigtug.
A turtle can live on land and in the water.

Mi'gma'gi na telui'tm'g ula gm'tginu.
Our territory is called Mi'gma'gi.

Ta'n wejgwa'tegemgeg Mi'gmaq tet wigultijig.
From time immemorial Mi'gmaq have lived here.

Ni'n na Mi'gmewa'j aq teluisi Tio'tis.
I am Mi'gmaq and my name is Tio'tis.

Tami weja'tu's'pnn Mi'gmewe'l?
Where did you get the Mi'gmaq ones?

Mu pugwelueg esgwia'tieg ta'n me' Mi'gmewi'sultieg.
There's not many of us left that speak the Mi'gmaq language.

Mu ni'n nenuaq mi'gmuessu.
I don't know any person with supernatural powers.

mi'gmuessue'get.translation: He/she is possessed by the mi'gmuessu
example:
Na mimajuinu gi's sa'q mi'gmuessue'get.
That person has been possessed by mi'gmuessu for a long time.

Tio'tis migua'latl pile'l wi'gignml.
Tio'tis is satisfied with her new pen.

So'sep pilei wi'g aq migua'toq.
Joseph has a new home and he is satisfied with it.

migultiat.translation: He experiences the pregnancy symptoms of partner
meanings: experience (by male) pregnancy symptoms of partner
become irritated (as first child) when mother carries her second child
example:
Ntjignam migultiap amgwesewe'l ugs'tqamuiniteg unjann.
My kid brother had sympathy pains while his first child was being
born.

Ungi'gu etlagnutmannij, migust'g ta'n goqwei ignmuaten
Nuelewumg.
While his/her parents were talking, he/she overheard what he/she
will be given for Christmas.

Ngwis gisimigustuit, nige' ge'itoq ta'n goqwei msntew sapo'nug.
My son overheard me, now he knows what he is to get tomorrow.

Ni'n nuja'gittegei aq negm miguteget.
I'm the sawyer and he/she planes.

Goqwei migutesg'mu's'p?
What did you bump into?

Ala gisigu gisimigutesguatl ntue'ml.
That old fella just ran into my dog.

Tepa'tu migwije'maqan aq wa'qan pata'utigtug.
Put the fork and the knife on the table.

Mu' ms't wen migwite'lmaq.
I don't remember everyone.

Gaqi'sg gisigu migwite't'g ta'n teliaqap maljewe'juiteg.
Often the old man remembers the things that happened when he
was young.

Wapusuei mi'jan nemitu'n ms't tami nipugtug
Rabbit feces is seen all over the forest.

Gis tlimites ta'n eteg mi'jano'guom?
Can you tell me where the washroom is?

Lpa ms't mija'qajg nemituji ulugung.
All the veins can be seen on his/her legs.

Pugwelg'p mijipjewei esgwiaq wela'gwe'g.
Lots of food was left over last night.

Ta'nug mijjulti'gw?
When are we going to eat?

Tmg mi'watmnej ula mijipjewei toqosi'p mijjuaqan unaqiatew.
First we give thanks for this food and then the meal will start.

Ula mijua'ji'j teluisit Je'gopsn.
This baby's name is Je'gopsn.

milamu'g.translation: It is multi-colored or many colors
example:
Milamu'gl wi'gatignn jugo'tui.
Bring me the different colored papers.

milamugsit.translation: It(shirt) is multi-colored or many colors
example:
Milamugsit mimajuinu ula ugs'tqamu.
There are people of different colors in this world.

Njignam So'sep na milaplgigwa'teget.
My brother Joseph is an illusionist.

E'pite'ji'juie'g Mali Ann i'mila'tieg'p.
When we were young girls, Mary Ann and I used to play
together.

Ta'n tujiw ntue'm mila'sualg na tu'aqan e'w'g.
When I play with my dog I use a ball.

Mila'suaqann a'se'g etegl.
The toys are in the next room.

Nuji'j mila'suatg utepaqan gujmug.
My grandchild plays with toy car outside.

Mawinta'mila'teget na nti, amujpa gigj'pugu'tut.
My dog does alot of mischievous things, she must be closely
watched.

Mu' pugwelug nnu ta'n gistluetes milesit.
There are not too many natives that you can say they are rich.

milgusit.translation: He/she has all kinds of dreams
example:
Nitape'sgw we'wimilgusit te'siula'gw.
My female friend has been having all kinds of dreams every night.

Milgwija'sit gesgmnaq poqtamga'sigweg.
He/she had mixed feelings before he/she left on his/her
journey.

Miligjetesgeg na tepaqaneg gesgmnaq naqtesgnugeg.
That vehicle shook a lot before it came to a stop.

Miligjetesing na ula nujiamalgat.
This dancer is dancing about wildly.

Ula nitap mawmiligsnqwat ta'n tujiw gesnugwaj.
My friend is very fussy when he/she is sick.

Lpa mu nestasiw ta'n telinpaj, telmilipusit.
I just don't understand how he/she can sleep, he/she moves about
so much.

Milita'j ma' nmituawji unisqi'g ta'n tujiw alaqsing.
You can't see a humming bird's wings when he/she is flying about.

milita'sit.translation: He/she has different kinds of thoughts
example:
Ta'n tujiw tami pemliej nitap mawmilita'sit.
When ever my friend goes anywhere he/she imagines many things.

Milita'w ma' nmituawji unisqi' ta'n tujiw alaqsing.
You can't see a humming bird's wings when he/she is flying about.

millugwet.translation: He/she does different kinds of work
example:
Millugwet aq ms't goqwei natawo'tg.
He/she does all kinds of work/crafts and he/she is good at all of
them.

miloqsatl.translation: He/she cooks it(chicken) in different ways
example:
Lpa mu' wigapugsigw ula gopit ta'n getu' tlmiloqs'g.
This beaver just does not taste good no matter how many different
ways I cook it.

miloqsawet.translation: He/she bakes a variety of pastry
example:
So'sep na maw glu'sit ugjit miloqsawen.
Joseph is very good at cooking a variety of pastry.

Miloqs'g na wius aq gi'teg teto'qwiwigapu'g.
He/she cooks that meat in many different ways and when it is
cooked it is totally delicious.

Sipu mawmilpegitg ta'n tujiw oq'npa'g.
The river flows in many directions during a flood.

Ntiga'taqn we'gwimilqamigeg.
My garden is very uneven.

meanings: cut in many ways or directions
example:
Telmilsatl na miti'sl, etug goqwei etlitoq?
He/she cuts that tree in so many ways,  one wonders what he/she
is making?

Wej(i)milsm na ula gmu'j muta nnuoqta'w etli'g.
I'm cutting this wood in different ways because I'm making a
statue.

Pe'l milsutegep, gatu poqjiangite'tget gisite'tg'p ta'n tla'taqatitaq.
At first he/she gave multiple instructions, but once he/she began to
think about it it became clear what they should do.

miltoqsit.translation: He/she makes different sounds with his voice
example:
Nata'miltoqsit na nujintoq.
That singer knows how make different sounds.

Miluisig, gatu ta'n getu' tlui'tmn wigapu'g.
It has many names, but no matter what you call it, it's
delicious.

Miluisit na mijua'ji'j, mu' ge'itmm'g ms't nenmen ugtwisunml.
That child has many different names, I wonder if he/she knows all
of his/her names.

milui'tatl.translation: He/she calls him/her by many names
example:
Gisigu milui'tatl, jijuaqa gelu'lg, jijuaqa moqwa'.
The old man calls him/her by many names, sometimes good,
sometimes not.

milui't'g.translation: He/she call it by different names
example:
Milui't'g gesgmnaq migwite'tmug ta'n teluisig.
He/she called it many things before he/she remembered what is it
called.

Apjege'jgel, goqwei etlie'wmn ugjit mima'gwa'taqan?
Just what are you using for a pan greaser?

Lnu teluet ula guntew mimajig.
The native says that this rock/stone lives.

Me' gmijgamij aq gugumij mimajijig?
Are your grandfather and grandmother still alive?

Mu' na ne'gaw naqamase'gtnug mimajuaqan ula Listugujg.
Life hasn't always been easy here in Listuguj.

Pugwelg mimajuinu wigit ula Listugujg.
There are many people living here in Listuguj.

Ani mima'latl wowul.
Ann greases the pot.

Tmg mima'toq pipnaqan gesmnaq eloqtat'mug.
First he/she greases the bread before he/she bakes it.

Na we'gwimime'gig ula tap'tang.
These potatoes are very greasy.

Gelu'lg mimei e'we'n ta'n tujiw mima'tun gutepaqan.
Get good oil to use when you oil your vehicle.

Ula mimgwaqan na we'gwijijema'q.
This perfume smells very bad.

Msaqtaqt wejitas'g mimgwaqanimusiei gmu'j welianqamgug.
A floor made from the wood of the oak tree is beautiful.

mimgwat.translation: He/she wears perfume, lotion or oil
example:
Na toqosi'p mimgwat ula e'pit, lpa a'se'g wejipso't.
Now this woman is really wearing perfume, you can smell it from
the other room.

Gis gi'l nemi't watapsit aq maqtawe'g mimiges?
Have you ever seen a yellow and black butterfly?

mimsit.translation: He/she is covered with grease and oil
meanings: covered with grease and oil (as mechanic)
example:
Mimsi, muta newtigisg'g etllugatm nutepaqan.
I am covered with grease and oil, because I have been working on
my car all day.

Apsute'gan mimugwalg.
I hide the doll.

Mimugwasit, ge'itoq gisio'pla'teget.
He/she is hiding, he/she knows that he/she did something wrong.

So'sep mimugwatoq ta'n tetuje'g.
Joseph hides his age.

Me' gatu welminig.
My word it bears alot of fruit.

Newtiegsitpu'g mewisi aq pugwelte'mann minijgl.
I've been berry picking all morning and I've picked a lot of berries.

Ula miti's mawminit ugjit wenju'su'nn.
This apple tree bears many fruit.

Pie'l petgutesingeg malpale'winitl minua'ltpnn.
When Peter was unconscious a doctor revived him.

Gaqi'sg amujpa minua'toq ugtlugowaqan, muta wesamtetaqe'g.
He/she has to redo his/her work often, because he/she is in too
much of a hurry.

Mnaq gi'sinnigul na uggo'qoli'gwejml, amujpa minuoqsatl.
His/her chicken isn't cooked yet, he/she has to recook it.

Pe' minuoqsmap ula, mnaq gi'tenug.
Let me recook this, it isn't cooked through yet.

Gi's ta'pu minu'p'satl wije'l p'teweio'ql.
Twice he/she has reheated the same tea pot.

Pas'g minu'p's'g wela'gwewei.
He/she just reheats supper.

Te's glusuaqan newt minu'wi't'g.
Each word he/she repeats once.

Ge' jugwasga'tu ala misegnuj?
Would you hand over that rag?

Misegnu'jl e'wen waqama'tu'n gutepaqan.
Use little rags to clean your vehicle.

Nugu' misissiaq na apsute'gan utapsun.
That doll's clothing is getting very ragged.

Nugu' na misissiet nta'papim ta'n etlgaqtaqaiej.
The end my rope is all frayed.

Tam gi'l etlnutmu's'p na glusuaqan, mi'soqo?
Where did you hear this word, mi'soqo?

Mistug na i'e'wasip pi'tisigna'tmg pnasu'lgul.
Oakum used to be used for caulking ships.

Newte' lasgugwaqan eig teluisig mistun.
There is one game that is named ace of spades.

Misuesg wen ugsisgug ne'itanijig.
Ringworms will show up on one's face.

Ta'sijig miti'g iga'taqwaljig?
How many aspens are you planting?

Pugwelgig miti'ji'jg gisiga'taqalgig.
I planted many saplings.

Pas'g Listugujg gmu'j alpuguig tlui'tas'gtetew miti'sg.
Only in Listuguj will standing wood be called trees.

Mali' telimatl witapal: mi'walul ta'n teljugu'en.
Mary tells her friend: I'm thankful that you came.

Mi'watm ta'n teliapoqonmuioq.
I am thankful for your(plural) help.

Ma' te'sipow samuqwagw mjigapu.
A horse will not drink dirty water.

Mjigei iga'tu mjigeio'qigtug.
Put garbage in the garbage container.

Mjijaqamij na pugwelg ale'g Nnue'gatig.
There are many spirits around a native community.

Mlagejg pata'utigtug la'l.
Take the milk to the table.

meanings: add milk (to tea, coffee or drink)
example:
Tetujimamunmlagejua'tat lpa wape'g ugtp'teweiem.
He/she adds so much milk in his/her tea it turns white.

Ge' jugwa'tui mlageju'mi aq pipnaqan?
Would you bring me butter and bread?

Ta'soqsijig pewaljig mlagejuo'qq?
How many bottles of milk do you want?

Ugjignaml mlawa'latl najiwesgenitl.
He/she takes his/her younger brother who is going fishing out to
the water.

Lugowaqan naqamase'g ta'n tujiw melgignewinu toqolugweioq.
Work is easier when you are working with a strong person.

Mnaq ne'w ajiegw.
It's not yet four o'clock.

Pugjig mnnawa'latl ugta'piml.
Soon he/she will take his/her net off shore.

Tami nigwejig mnnoqong?
Where do birch trees grow?

A'papi'l wesua'latl toqosi'p mntawa'latl.
He/she takes the rope and twists it.

Mui'n gesigawmntawaqalatl plamu'l mesnateg.
The bear quickly twisted the salmon when he/she caught it.

Ge's aliwnaqiei na mntawaqtu ngat.
While I was jumping around I twisted my foot.

Mntawa'toq qasawo'qapi.
He/she twists wire.

Wigapugsis na nige' mntmu.
An oyster would be delicious now.

Mntng aq samuqwan mi'watmeg ula newtipunqeg.
We are thankful for the mountains and water this year.

Tuma mntoqopsga'latl Pie'lal.
Tom pinches (and twists) Peter.

Jel tmg mntoqopsga'toql wijinuann toqosi'p angamsit
plu'jaqamatigtug.
First he/she pinches (and twists) his/her cheeks then he/she looks
at himself/herself in the mirror.

Ma'munjew mntoqopsga'tu mntu wijinuann.
Pinch the devils cheeks hard.

Telta'sin mntua'gi gjitmei eig?
Do you think there is a real hell?

Mntuit na ta'n wen.
That person is devilish.

Pa'tlia's e'w'g megwe'g moqopa'q.
The priest uses red wine.

Lpa gitg ngatl moqpegl.
Both of my feet are swollen.

Njigun moqpet aq we'tuguit.
My knee is swollen and its bothering me.

Tegen mussew "moqwa'" mu' nestasiwun?
Which part of "no" don't you understand?

Moqwa' goqwei eignug.
There is nothing there.

Moqwa' wen eimug.
No one is there.

Mpo'qonn tmg pisgwiwsute'n glaman gugguntesnu ta'n eltne'p'ti'gw
ulo'nug.
Move the beds in first so we will have a place to sleep
tonight.

Mqatawapu maw mime'g ta'n tujiw wissugwaluj.
The cormorant is very oily when cooked.

Mu' na msamu mamunwaqantewigw?
Isn't shad really boney?

Msaqa'gw mawwigapugsit pilei pipnaqan.
The crust is most delicious on new bread.

Msaqtaqt pilei gislega'tas'g.
A new floor has been laid.

Te'sipowg na maw wigtmi'tij msigu.
Horses like the taste of hay.

Tu'aqanaq e'n'gaq msigue'gatig.
I lost the ball in the hay field.

Ula aqantie'uti msigue'ga'titesnen te'sigisg'g mu gigpesanug.
This week we will collect/make hay everyday if it doesn't
rain.

Msi'gug jijuwaqa telgilultijig st'ge wennju'su'nl.
Hail stones are sometimes as big as apples.

Ms't pisgwa'tu.
Bring it all inside.

Ms't goqwei jugwa'tu.
Bring everything.

Ms't tami elien Mi'gmewa'j ultesguates.
Every where you go you'll meet a Mi'gmaq person.

Ms't wen jugu'wej, pas mu' gi'l Pie'l.
Everybody come, but not you Peter.

Angam ala wi'sisji'j ge'gupuguit mtasoqg.
Look at the small animal standing at the top of the ledge.

Esp'qapija'tu na Mi'gmewei mtawegn.
Hang that Mi'gmaq flag up high.

meanings: youngest child born in a family
example:
Nmtesan teluisit Lisa.
My youngest child's name is Lisa.

Mtesgm pemtaqaiet maqamigeg.
The snake slithers along the ground.

Mu' ni'n maja'siw newte' mtijin glapis sapo'nug.
I'm not moving an inch until tomorrow.

Maqtawe'g mtlu'tew wettuoq'mig ala mulin.
Black smoke is coming out of that mill.

Gujmug lapa'sin nmites mesgi'g mtugunoqt wejgu'aq.
If you look outside you will see a big storm approaching.

mtugunoqtnugwet.translation:
It(horse) is behaving in a certain way when a storm is
approaching
meanings: behave a certain way when a storm is approaching
example:
Mtugunoqtnugwet ntue'm, etug getu mamunigisgug sapo'nug.
My dog is acting differently, perhaps tomorrow is going to be a
stormy day.

Ula wenji'guom etlitu mesgi'gl mtuigann e'wata.
This house I'm building will use big rafters.

Mui'n na to'q maw wigt'gl pgumann.
A bear apparently really likes blueberries.

Mui'ne'j tami nmi'j ma' uggwitl gneg i'mnigul.
If you see a bear cub somewhere the mother won't be to far away.

mui'newqamigsit.translation: He/she has a temperament of a bear
example:
Njignam So'sep Nuel na maw mui'newqamigsit.
My younger brother Joseph Noel has the temperament of the
bear.

Mui'no'mi na wejitas'g mui'nei wigew.
Bear grease is made from bear fat.

Mujgajewei na ula wenji'guom ngwis gisitoq.
This house that my son built is the best.

Mujpej ugtanguoweim maqtawe'g aq wisawamu'g.
The mink's fur is black and brownish.

Egsitpu'nug Muliang eltaieg.
Tomorrow morning we are going to Montreal.

Gi's ta'sipunqeg qame'g eteg mulin?
How many years has that mill been on the other side of the river?

Nata'e'wmn sa'qawei mulinji'j?
Do you how to use an old sewing machine?

Te's gisipsaq amujpa mulqalatl.
Everytime it snows he/she has to dig him/her/it out.

Jo'n's gesatg mulqatg wastew.
Jo'n's likes to shovel snow.

Ntnmu'ji'jm gesatg mulqetj.
My little dog likes to dig.

Mulumgwej mulqet, wi'gji'j eltoq.
The groundhog digs, he/she is making his/her home.

Witape'sgwal teluisinnitl Munig.
His/her friend's name is Monique.

Munsaiwatl witapal glapis gistesguateg.
He/she coaxed his/her friend until his/her friend gave in.

Ge's munsapitj na nemitoq ta'n goqwei ni'n nemitu.
Because (while) he/she looks persistently he/she sees what I see.

Ge's munsa'j glapis gisguatl.
He/she was so persistent he/she finally convinced him/her.

Munsigsma'latl gatu mu gisa'lagul maja'sinin.
He/she persistently pushes him/her but he/she can't make him/her
move.

Munsigsma'toq na utepaqan mu ellugwenugup.
He/she pushes his/her non-running vehicle persistently.

munsigsmeget.translation: He/she is persistent in shoving it
example:
Tlia' nige' munsigsmegej, lpa mu' gistesgmug.
Even though he/she is persistent in pushing it, he/she is unable to
move it.

munsisapa'latl.translation: He/she perseveres to pull him/her/it through
example:
Newtiula'gw gina'sit, munsisapa'latl gajue'wji'tl.
All night he/she persevered, to help the kitten pull through.

Mali munsisapa'toq nnuweiei tli'suti.
Mary perservers to save the indigenous language.

munso'tg.translation: He/she is persistent in doing it
example:
Mawmunso'tg negm goqwei wesuejo'qwa'toq.
He/she is very persistent in doing whatever task he/she undertakes.

Ge' jugwa'tui tapu'gl munte'jl.
Please bring me two little bags.

Ne'sisgl munti'l tap'tang pgwatelu.
Buy three bags of potatoes.

Ala wi'gatignigtug musgasg'pit na wi'gign.
The pen is is sticking out of that book.

Gijga'jijg musgasg'teg wiguow nipugtug.
His/her home peeks out a little from the forest.

Ala' ji'nm gesatg almusga'toq ugsulieweim.
That man likes to go around showing his money.

musgi'pit.translation: He/she runs out to an open area
meanings: run out to an open area
example:
Musgi'pit aq aqui'pit.
He/she runs out into the open and (then) runs into hiding.

Ntjignam musguaje'g, mu gisa'tug utepaqan lugwen.
My little brother is frustrated, he can't get his vehicle running.

Gajue'wji'j musgumatl Malial ugsisgug.
The little cat licks Mary in the face.

Gajuewji'j pas'g epit musgwatamin.
The kitten is always ready to lick.

Mui'ne'j pas'g epit sismo'qonapu musgwatmn.
The little bear is always ready lick any sweet liquid.

Ge' musiga'l na nuelewumgewei miti's?
Would you undecorate the Christmas tree ?

Ge' la'tinej ta'n musigapsg'g me' na ulialapitesnu.
Let's go to where it's bare so we will be able to have a good look
around.

Ntu'aqanm pilei mesgilg aq musigapsg'sit.
My new ball is big and smooth and round.

Musiga'sit gesgmnaq gesispalsigw.
He/she undresses before he/she takes a bath.

Te's toqwa'q na musiga'toq ugtiga'taqan.
Every autumn he/she clears his/her garden.

Na we'gwimusige'g ula miti's.
This tree is quite bare.

We'gwiuliewne'g gisgug musigisg.
The sky in nice and blue today.

Musigo'latl miti'ji'tl, gaqamno'laji nipi'g muta pas'g gmu'j getu e'w'g.
He/she strips the shrub, he/she takes off all the leaves because
he/she only wants to use the wood.

Mali gegno'tlatl aq musigo'tlatl ugtapsute'gann gaqi'sg.
Mary dresses and undresses her doll often.

Nti gaqimusigo'toq ta'n te's'g gmu'j tu'satig.
My dog has removed all the wood from the shed.

Lo'gsi'gan ltunej ta'n etlmusigta's'g.
Lets' build a log house where the trees have been cleared.

Ula mntn wejgupuguit gaqmusigta'sit.
This mountain facing us is clear cut.

musigte'get.translation: He/she clears the brush or thicket by cutting
meanings: clear brush or thicket by cutting
example:
Musigte'geieg gulaman tet gis pmisgma'titen.
We are clearing the underbrush so one can take a shortcut through
here.

Newtiegsitpu'g etlmusigungete'gei ntiga'taqang.
I've been weeding in my garden all morning long.

Musoq na mawgesipuet.
The horse fly bite hurts the most.

Lpa musqunamu'g na pilei nutepaqan.
My new vehicle is really dark bluish.

Pilei ntatlaim musqunamugsit.
My new shirt is dark bluish.

Ge' ignmui musse'j te'plmasewei?
Would you give me a piece of cheese?

Ge' jugwa'tui mlagejg aq mussew petaqan.
Would you bring me milk and a piece of pie?

Musue'l ta's'gl nespne'n.
Take some handkerchiefs with you.

Nmtesanq maja'sitaq, nige' ni'n aq nte'pitem poqjimusueieg.
My youngest child has gone away, now my wife and I are going to
be missing him.

Gaqinmita'sni'g lugowinu'g, muta ne'w ajiet.
All the workers have gone home, because it's four o'clock.

Pjila'si, ula mutputi eteg.
Welcome, and sit down at this chair here.

Mutt ngopa'siw na mutputigtug
Do not sit in that chair.

Mu nnim na wela'gwewei.
That supper wasn't much.

Ugta'qa'tu na wape'g, muta na gelulg.
Try the white one, because that's the good one.

Ntus pile'g ugna'goqomg ulagu.
My daughter got new skates yesterday.

Na'gu'set gesasit aq welp'sewet gisgug.
The sun is bright and warm today.

Ta's'gl geggunmnn na'gusetewe'l?
How many clocks do you have?

Welina'gu'setewig gisgug.
It is very sunny today.

Gesg na'gweg ugjo'tmnej gaqa'tnenu ugtlugowaqannu.
While it's daylight let's try to finish our work.

Na'gwegewa'm ta'n tujiw aluse'wi.
I get paid daily when I work as carpenter.

Eig wen maw na'jigaj suliewei.
There are people who are very desirous of money.

najiga'te'get.translation: He/she is going to get eels
example:
Maita'ieg sapo'nug, najiga'te'ga'tieg.
We are leaving tomorrow, we are going to hunt eels.

najigluluet.translation: He goes to ask permission to marry his/her/their daughter
example:
William had dressed himself up and has thought about what he will
say because he is on his way to ask her parents permission to
marry her.
Sulian gisiilpilsit aq gisite'tg ta'n tluetew muta najigluluet.

Pie'l nipugtug elasgmit, amuj na najigtanteget.
Pierre is headed to the woods, he must be going to hunt.

Enmietaq najiilajit, getulugwet sapo'nug.
He/she has gone home to get ready, he/she going to work
tomorrow.

La'jijjaqang nespn muta getu'metuigisg'g.
Take along some gloves because the weather is about to get really
wretched (cold).

Ntue'm getutu'wet, amuj na getu'najijjigwat.
My dog wants to go out, he must want to go and defecate.

Wen najilugwetew sapo'nug?
Who will be going to work tomorrow?

najine'iamatl.translation: He/she goes to look in on him/her
meanings: go to take a brief look
example:
Gisigui'sgw najine'iamatl pile'l uji'jl.
The old lady is going to look in on her new grandchild.

najinpat.translation: He/she goes to get some sleep
example:
Enmietaq najinpataq, nugu teligtugsit aq gisgug pita'qeg na'gweg.
He/she has gone home to get sleep, he/she is so tired and today
was a long, long day.

najintugsigtmat.translation: He/she sets out to hunt provisions
meanings: set out to hunt for food
example:
Nti maja'sit aq najintugsigtmat.
My dog is leaving to hunt for food.

Na'jipugtaq'nej maw pugwelpaji glmuejg te's wela'gw.
A bat eats many mosquitoes each night.

Ge' tewa'l'g'p nti, getu'najisgit.
I'm going to let my dog out, he/she wants to go urinate.

Aqantie'umg egsitpu'gl nmiates Jo'ns aq Lulu najitgo'tgig.
On Sunday mornings you will see Jo'nes and Lulu going to church.

Tuma egsitpugwiet muta najitia'mue'get.
Tom is getting up early because he is going moose hunting.

Jonio'q gi's maja'sitaq, najiwsgetaq.
Johnny already left, he's gone fishing.

najsigwet.translation: He/she is going to check traps or nets
example:
Egsitpugwiep sepei, najsigwep.
He/she was up early this morning, he/she went to check the traps.

Ala ji'nmji'j mawnalagit, smtug agase'wa'l.
That young man is very energetic, hire him right away.

Mali na'n te'sipuna't.
Mary is five years old.

Sangew nanama'latl unjanji'tl glapis pemto'gwenij.
She gently rocks her baby/young child until he/she drifts off to
sleep.

Nanama'toq ugtul, tgu'g etliaji.
He/she is rocking his/her boat, he/she is making waves.

Ula sa'qawei nanamiaqawei nma'tu.
Bring this old rocking chair home.

Suel newtigisg'g nanamien jitlo'mugwaqanigtug aq etlisgnuen, getl
ta na mesgi'g gisisgnuatmn.
You have been rocking in that rocking chair and knitting all day,
no wonder you got a lot of knitting done.

Lalamiaqawei ugju'snigtug etllalamo'qiaq.
The rocking chair is rocking in the wind.

Piglewji'j tmg nanamo'qiet gesgmnaq nisiegweg.
Lamp globe swayed first before it fell.

Mijua'ji'j pisgwa't aq pipanigesij nana'n.
The young child walks in and asks for food.

Ms't na'naq geggungig.
I have all the fives.

Ra'ien na'newa'j nuji'j.
Ryan is my fifth grandchild.

Ah, nige' na'newei elugwalg.
Ah, now I'll fix the fifth one.

Pas'g nangl esgwia'n.
I only have five left.

Tmg magasang eliei, gatu gaqanguaian tet nangmiw juguwa's.
First I'm going to the store, but when I have finished shopping I
will come here immediately.

Nango'n menuegetes wa'gwig msu'lg.
You'll need a fine tooth comb if you are infected with head lice.

nango'sit.translation: He/she combs his/her hair with a fine·tooth comb
example:
Amujpa enmiet aq nango'sit, muta wa'gw waju'et.
He/she has to go home and comb his/her hair with a fine tooth
comb, because his/her head is full of lice.

Ngijaq i'wsgu'tg'p ta'n telgi'g lugowaqan nangwe'gemg.
My mother used talk about how much work was involved in
carding moose wool.

nangweng.translation: He/she combs out lice or orther foreign matter
meanings: comb out lice or other foreign matter
example:
Nangweng ugtanguoweim.
He/she delouses his\her animal hide.

Na'nijig gelu'sijig lasqo'plaq geggungig.
I've got five good boards.

Gi's nanipunqeg giaspiwjien Muliang.
It's been five years since I last went to Montreal.

Nanisga'q majulgwatg newisga'q je pesgunateg.
Fifty follows fourty nine.

Nanisga'qal te's'gl eggunmann wi'gatignn.
I have fifty books.

Nanisgegsijig mimajuinu'g peita'jig ugjit mawio'mi.
Fifty people have arrived for the gathering.

nanoqosgl.translation: There are five cylindrical inanimate objects lying flat
meanings: five cylindrical inanimate objects lying flat
five long objects lying side by side
example:
Miamuj mitugwalimg! Nanoqosgl ula tepaqann.
Well I certainly am being visited! There are five cars parked here.

Lpa nanoqosmia'tijig mesgilgig plamu'g.
There were five large salmon lying side by side.

nanoqsijig.translation: They are five cylindrical animate objects
example:
Nanoqsijig pu'taig jugwa'tui.
Bring me five bottles.

Mu nugu' ni'n migwite'lmaq wen nantuan.
I can't remember anyone who hunts for eels in the mud in winter.

nantunatl.translation: He/she feels about blindly or in the dark for him/her/it
meanings: feel about blindly or in the dark
feel around for blindly or in the dark
example:
Gajue'wj nantunatl apigji'tl elmaqegigtug.
The cat is feeling around inside the hole for a mouse.

nantunewet.translation: He/she feels around blindly or in the dark
meanings: feel around blindly or in the dark
feel about blindly or in the dark
example:
Lame'g eptaqano'guomg alnantunewet, gatu mu' we'jitug ta'n
goqwei algwilg.
He/she feels about blindly under the cupboard, but does not find
what he/she is searching for.

nantung.translation: He/she feels around for it blindly or in the dark
meanings: feel around for blindly or in the dark
example:
Miawitpa'q tugwiei aq smtug poqjinantunm ntu'gwesmunm.
I awake in the middle of the night and right away I start feeling
around for my pillow.

Ula aqantie'uti wejgu'aq maita'ieg ugjit nunuguna'q.
This week coming up, we are going away for five days.

Awisiw nanupe'jg wesgijinu'ltijig.
Not very often qunituplets are born.

Ula telte'lmg nme'j napemegw.
I think this fish is male.

Nape'w na mawiegsitpugwiet.
The rooster is an early riser.

Telintawisgnuet na negm, pas'g goqwei angapt'g na gisnapgwetoq.
He/she is such a good knitter that all he/she has to do is look at
something and he/she can make a copy of it.

Nignaq wi'sisg na ms't napioqq.
At my house the animals are all male porcupines.

na'ploqqatijig.translation: They (dual) go in a single file
meanings: follow one another in straight line
example:
Mijua'ji'jg na'ploqqatultijig pisgwita'jig nujigina'muo'guom.
The children go in a single file as they go into the school.

Pas'g napto'sit ta'n goqwei gisintoqop.
He/she just broke even for what he/she lost.

napui'gatl.translation: He/she takes a photograph of him/her
example:
Ntinen te's napui'guj ugpugugl gepjoqwa'toqol.
Every time a photograph is taken of our dog, he/she closed his/her
eyes.

napui'g'g.translation: He/she takes a photograph of it
example:
Ula nitap ms't goqwei getu'napui'g'g.
My friend here wants to photograph everything.

Pilei napui'gigemgewei gisiwja'tu.
I've just bought a new camera.

meanings: trace, draw or copy a picture
example:
Pana ne'gaw negm nata'napui'giget.
He/she has always taken good photographs.

Welpit na ula napui'gign.
This is a nice picture.

Nu'gu puninqaji, maja'tinej nige'.
Stop delaying, let's go now.

Gneg naqalit muta tewjigsigawa'sit pemlga't.
He/she leaves me far behind because he/she walks so fast.

Amujpa naqa'latl aq telimatl ta'n gis tliaq.
He/she has to stop him/her and tell him/her what has happened.

naqamasa'latl.translation: He/she places it (ball) where it can easily be found
meanings: place where it can easily be found
example:
Tami wetlnaqamasa'latl na tu'aqann.
Where did he/she get that ball so quickly.

naqamasa'toq.translation: He/she places it where it can easily be found
meanings: place or  put where easily found
example:
Nige' naqamasa'tug, gulaman nangmwe'jitew.
Now we'll put it in a accessible place, so he/she will find it
immediately.

Ma' gis tluew teto'qinaqamase'g, gatu gisa'tutes.
I can't say it is totally easy, but I will be able to do it.

Naqamaspit na ula samqano'q ta'n epit.
This watering can is easily accessible where it is.

Naqamasteg qaliputi, panta'tu ga'qan aq inaqaneg eteg.
The shovel is easily accessible, open the door and it's on the right.

Ula gitapenu pas'g nugu' te'sigisg'g naqana'mat.
Our friend here now just drinks spirits/alcohol daily.

naqana'pet.translation: He/she draws water from (well or river)
example:
Gisigu naqana'pet nqano'patigtug te'siegsitpu'g.
The old fella draws water from the well each morning.

Samuqwan wetnaqana'q la'taqsunigtug.
He/she ladles the water from of the pail.

Ugtue'ml naqanatl, mu puwalagul taqamoqa'sinin awti.
He/she is holding back his/her dog, he/she doesn't want him/her to
cross the road.

Mtugunoqt naqang gujmugwei lugowaqan.
The storm stops all outside work.

Newtiegsitpu'g gi's wesgowa'sit naqani'get, ma' alam gaqa'tegegw.
He/she has been here bailing all morning, he/she won't be finished
for a long time.

Nti naqa'sit awtigtug iga'j.
My dog stops when he/she arrives at the road.

Naqasua'latl epsaqtejgl gesgmnaq najinpagw.
He/she extinguishes the fire in the stove before going to bed.

naqasua'q.translation: He/she extinguishes the fire with water
example:
Na pugtew se'samgleg'p ala nujinqasui'get gisnaqasua'q.
That fire that was spreading was put out by that firefighter.

Tuma naqasua'toq pugtew, mu' puatmug se'sa's'gn.
Tom extinguishes the fire, he doesn't want it to spread.

naqasueta'tl.translation: He/she beats out the fire on him/her/it
example:
Gisnaqasueta'tl miti'sl gesgmnaq wasamamglennigw.
He/she was able to put the fire out before it burnt the tree too
badly.

naqasuete'g.translation: He/she beats out the fire on it
example:
Waqgaj gisnaqasuete'g pugtew wiguaq.
He/she is barely able beat out the fire at his/her house.

Ge's mu' nepagw Pie'l naqasuetesg'g pugtew.
Peter stamps out the fire before going to sleep.

naqasuetesguatl.translation: He/she stamps out the fire on it (small tree)
example:
Naqasuetesgaq alje'maqanatgw gesgmnaq poqjima'munamglegw.
I stamp out the fire on the base ball bat before too much of it
burns.

Ge' ep'soqwa'tu na ga'qan, ugju'sn gisnaqasuiputualatl
nt'psaqtejgml.
Would you close that door, the wind just blew out the fire in my
stove.

naqasuiputuatg.translation: He/she blows out the fire on it
example:
Naqasuiputuatgl wasoqonmaqnn ajipuna'teg.
He/she blew out the candles at his/her birthday.

So'sep naqatgelsit pipaniman e'pite'sl tua'tinew.
Joseph is shy about asking a young woman to go out.

Gaqamit megwaig awtigtug, gaqinqa'toq ta'n te's'g goqwei.
He/she stands in the middle of the road, bringing everything to a
stand still.

We'gwinqaslugweg ula pilei napgetegemgewei!
This new copier is fast!

Agase'wa'lanej Tuma, muta naqsilugwet negm.
Let's hire Tom, because he works quickly.

Mawnaqsinijgig na'qi ta'n tujiw jilei'.
My body heals fast when I get injured.

Jijuaqa wen mawnaqsinijgit.
Sometimes a person heals quickly.

Naqsinpat, telteto'qwigispnet.
He/she falls asleep quickly, he/she is so totally exhausted.

Pas'g gisipgising, naqsio'pla'latl uggwitl.
He/she just arrived, and he/she has quickly done something wrong
to his/her mother.

Naqsio'pla'toq aq pas'g gisipqojo'tg.
He/she went wrong quickly and he/she just started working
with it.

So'sep naqsipgising ugtlgowaqang te'siegsitpu'g.
Joseph arrives early at his work every morning.

Naqsitetapua'latl na epsaqtejgl.
He/she quickly resolved the issue with the stove.

Naqs'tetapua'toq ta'n te's'g goqwei gisio'pla'tas'g.
He/she quickly corrects every single thing that has been done
incorrectly.

naqs'tesg'g.translation: He/she makes the distance in a short time
meanings: makes the distance in a short time
example:
Naqs'tesg'g na ula nipugtug wejiet.
It didn't take him/her very long to go to the woods and back.

Ni'n ewegetuanig pile'g naqsung.
I need new bedsheets.

Gis naqta'tl gesgmnaq nisiennigw.
He/she was able to halt (the fall) before he/she/it fell.

Newt alsusit gelusiteg lpa naqte'g papuwaqan, aq smtug
apatlugutieg.
Once the boss spoke the fun stopped, and we all went back to
work.

Wen gisnaqt'g ula wi'gatign tet?
Who left this paper here?

Amsgwes nasa'laji nasuaq aq smtug poqtaqami'g.
It's the first time he/she puts on showshoes and immediately he/she
takes off snowshoeing.

Amujpa pilei ga'qan nasapaqam ala eptaqano'guomg.
I have to screw a new door onto the cupboard.

Ango'te'n, mutt ignmatmu na qasawo'qapi nasapaqtestn.
Be careful, don't let that wire get entangled..

Ge's nti etlmila'sit na nasapaqtesing apa'pigtug.
While my dog was playing, he got entangled by the rope.

nasaqomgigwat.translation: He/she fits handles in or on...
meanings: fit handle in or on (axe or hammer)
example:
Glaptan mawinta'nasaqomgigwat.
A blacksmith knows the right way of fitting handles on axes and
hammers.

nasaqomgigwatg.translation: He/she fits a handle in or on something
meanings: fit handle in or on (axe or hammer)
example:
Ntlamugsis etlnasaqomgigwatg pilei nnaqanatgw.
My uncle is fitting a new axe handle.

Goqwei gis nasa'toq nige'?
What did he/she put on now?

Gisitgismiteg jaqalnasegetl utapsunn muta gewjiet.
After swimming he/she quickly got into his/her clothing because
he/she is feeling chilled.

Pie'l nasg'g pilei wasoqwa'taqan.
Peter is wearing a new ring.

nasgoqta'tl.translation: He/she splits it(log) lengthwise (with heavy blow)
example:
Pas newt eleget aq nasgoqta'tl lasqo'plawul.
Just one throw and he/she split the board.

Pugwelg pugsug gisgug gisnasgoqte'meg.
We have split a lot of firewood today.

Mise'l na mawita'nasgoqte'get.
Michael is good at splitting wood.

Qastulastu'g nasgoqwa'l'gig gisgug gulaman gisgatpitaq sapo'nug.
I'm splitting the cedar boughs today so they will be ready
tomorrow.

Nitap gis nasgoqwa'toq wennju'su'n.
My friend can split the apple by hand.

Etu'gutewe'l pa'tlia's nasguatl.
The priest is wears scapular.

Lawrence nasgwa'latl tia'mul apitia'mue'gej.
Lawrence divides (halves) his moose when he returns from
hunting.

Tqope'jg nasgwa'tatijig ms't qogwei.
The twins share everything evenly.

Pie'l gis nasgwa'toq petaqan, negm newte' aq ni'n newte'.
Peter divided the pie, one for him and one for me.

Nasgwina'latl saqalo'pi'l aq nige' toqonaji.
He/she tears the ribbon in half and now he/she has two.

Ge' nasgwina'tu na lusgnign aq a'qataig ignmui.
Would you tear that bannok in half and give a piece to me.

Nasgwine'g na ula napui'gign?
Is this picture torn in half?

Nige' nasgoqs'g ula plamu, toqosi'p a'qataig ignmultes.
I'm going to slice this salmon and then I'll give you half.

Mali' gis nasgoqs'g wennju'su'nnei petaqan
Mary sliced the apple pie in half.

Pilei nasoqwa'taqan pas'g gisiwgja'tu.
I just bought a new ring.

We'gwipugwelg gesaluejit naspit gtatli'mg.
My, you have so many burdocks stuck to your shirt.

Je'g gesatg nasplutuaj ms't wenn.
Je'g likes to repeat after everyone.

Pugwelgig nasqo'plaq ugjietaq ula miti's.
Many boards will be made from this tree.

Pilei nassaputaqan pas gisiwgja'tu.
I just bought a new earring.

Nastaqo'tlatl pile'l ugte'sipowml aq maja'sit
He/she hitches up his/her new horse and leaves.

Ula wi'gatignn tapu'gl mawnastegl.
These two papers are attached to it

We'gwimsgilnitl atoqwa'su'l Pie'l gisnastesmatl umiggng!
What a large trout Peter has caught with his hook!

Ge's eltwesgej nastestoq gmu'j.
He/she hooked a piece of wood while he/she was fishing.

Amujpa nasuoqgmn llutaqan gtu'a'sisa'sin.
You have to straddle the fence if you want to get to the other side.

Gesiegsitpu'g nasuoqguatl ugte'sipowml aq maja'sit.
Early morning he/she straddles his/her horse and leaves.

Jijuwaqa na wen pas'g getu' nasuoqpa'sit mutputi.
Sometimes a person just wants to sit astride a chair.(usually
backwards)

Ala nasuoqpit lasqo'plaw, ge' jugwa'tui.
That board that is sitting astride, would you bring it to me.

Ji'me'j gis nasuoqpugua'sit altesgasimgewei, gisgaje'g igatne'wen.
James is standing astride of his bicycle, he is ready to race.

Ntoqon nasuoqteg mutputigtug.
My dress is sitting astride the chair.

Amujpa gwilugg na'tuen ta'n nata'ilsuteget.
We have to find someone who is a good decision maker.

Wen gisna'tala'latl nti'l?
Who did something to my dog?

Etug gisna'tala'toq utepaqan, mu nige' elugwenug.
He/she has done something to his/her vehicle, it's not working
now.

So'sep na negm mawinta'lugwet.
Joseph is someone who is a very good worker.

Nutaigw matnaggewinu ta'n nata'matnagget.
We need a fighter who knows how to fight.

Gei'tu na'tami eteg, pas'g nugu' mu gisite'tmu ta'n lgwilwasites.
I know it is somewhere, but I can no longer think of where(else)
to look.

Negmaq maja'sitaq natanguataq.
He/she left to go shopping.

Ta'n tujiw tepiaq ligpenignn gisitoq na natangu'sitew.
When he/she has made enough baskets he/she will go peddling.

nata'nmat.translation: He/she is good at whatever he/she does
example:
Nata'nmat, ta'n pas'g goqwei gisa'toq.
He/she is clever, he/she can fix anything.

Tuma na'taqama'latl jagejl.
Thomas brings the lobster to the shore..

Gu'jin wije'w Ji'me'j, muta negm na'taqama'sit.
If you're cold go with James, he's going ashore.

Telgisoltijig alasugulti'tij mu na'taqama'tu'tigup gwitn glapis
gisias'gomajieteg.
They had so much fun wading around they didn't bring the canoe
ashore until after six o'clock.

Na'taqamtug ligtuapsi ugsamtmig ula tet.
Make your way to shore if it's to deep here.

Nti nata'tawet pata'wtigtug.
My dog knows how to beg from the table.

Awanta'si ugwisunm, wanne'ge wigit aq nata'toqtet.
I forget his/her name, he/she lives at the cove end of Listuguj and
is a good baker.

Natawa'm, pas'g mu' getu taqamoqa'mu ula sipu.
I know how to swim, but I don't want to swim across this river.

natawa'qa'latl.translation: He/she is competent in handling it(horse)
example:
Pie'l natawa'qa'latl ugte'sipowml
Peter is skillful in handling his horse.

natawa'qa'toq.translation: He/she is competent in doing or handling it
example:
Ne'gaw na tele'g, natawa'qa'toq ta'n getu' goqwei.
He/she has always been that way, skillful at everything and
anything.

natawatuet.translation: He/she knows how to give a speech
meanings: know how to give a speech
example:
Na pilei nnu' saqamaw natawatuet.
That new chief knows how to give a speech.

Mali na mawinatawe'g ta'n telmimajit.
Mary is very clever, how she lives.

natawia'tugwet.translation: He/she knows how to tell stories
example:
Gilbert na negm natawia'tugwet.
Gilbert knows how to tell stories.

natawinsgu'mat.translation: He/she knows how to answer back
example:
Mu' natawinsgu'magw, pegije'g we'gaw gisite'tg ta'n tluetew.
He/she does not know how to answer back, it takes a while
before he/she can come up with a retort.

Natawintoq, pas'g gatu mawintage'g.
He/she knows how to sing, but he/she is very shy.

Ta'pit, na negm nata'wisugwateget.
David, he is a good cook.

natawitpluteget.translation: He/she is a good law maker
example:
Natawitpluteget gatu awisiw tela'teget ta'n telitplumsij.
He/she makes many promises, but rarely keeps any.

Gwilu na'tuen ta'n natawoqsewet aq agase'wa'latesnu.
Look for someone who knows how to cook well and we will hire
him/her.

Miti'sigtug weliaqjigateg, na'te'l tlmijultinej.
It's nice and shady at the tree, we should eat there.

Gisigu natgimatl pa'tlia'sl.
The old man sends for the priest.

Newte' magasan wetnatgitegemg me' naqamase'g.
Ordering from one store is simpler.

Tio'tis natgitgl pile'l wi'gatignn.
Tio'tis is sending for new books.

natqa'latl.translation: He/she/it removes him/her/it from the water
example:
Mesginnitl nme'jl wejinatqa'latl qospemg
He/she removes a big fish from the lake.

natqa'piet.translation: He/she removes the net from the water
example:
Gesiegsitpu'g metoqiet natqa'piet.
Very early in the morning he/she goes down to the water to
remove nets.

natqapilatl.translation: He/she ropes him/her in from the water
example:
Pegije'g'p we'gaw gisnatqapilg ula nme'j.
It took me a long time to reel this fish to the shore.

natqapilawet.translation: He/she pulls him/her out of water by rope
meanings: pull out of water by rope or fish line
example:
Ula a'papi e'w'g natqapilawei.
I use this rope for pulling these out of the water.

natqapilg.translation: He/she ropes it in from the water
example:
Ms't natqapile'n aq qapijo'tu.
Reel every thing in out of the water and hang it.

natqa'sit.translation: He/she gets out of the water
example:
Natqa'si gatu ni'n, wesamitgig ula samqwan.
I getting out, this water is too cold.

natqa'toq.translation: He/she removes it from the water
example:
Tu'ma natqa'toq ugtul toqwa'q.
Thomas removes his boat from the water in the fall.

Gisgug nattelm ula aqantie'utiewei mijipjewei.
Today I will purchase food for this week.

natteluatl.translation: He/she starts off to purhcase it(shirt)
example:
Assma nige' natteluatl a'papi'l.
He/she is just leaving to buy rope.

Malia'n nattesg'g espe'teg gina'masuti.
Mary Ann is aiming for higher education.

Nattesguatl, pas'g wasmigsigawa'snnitl, mu mesnagul.
He/she chases after him/her, but he/she is too fast, he/she can't
catch him/her.

Natuaqaneg nsugwis etlmalie'wip.
My aunt was married in Eel Ground.

Na'tuen wejgu'et.
Someone is coming.

Natuptoq utapsunuwow.
He/she goes to lug their belongings.

Enmawana'sipnaq natnutuptulatl ugti'l.
He/she was headed up the reserve to go lug his/her dog.

Ge'itu nat goqwei nuta'q, pas'g lpa mu gismigwite'tmu ta'n goqwei.
I know something is missing, but I just can't remember what.

Gis nawn'g nitap gi's maja'sisnaq.
I missed my friend, he/she already left.

Wejo'tg tepnmn gatu ejela'toq, nawn'g.
He/she tried to reach it but couldn't help it and failed to reach it.

Nawnsewatl uggwitl, wesamigsugg ta'n goqwei pema'tunij.
He/she is carrying for his/her mother, what she was carrying is too
heavy.

Na ms't ta'n goqwei pewatmu'gup.
That's everything that we wanted.

Na tmg gi'l lia.
You go first.

Na to'q tliaj.
Well then, let it be so.

Gaqa'tu'n gtlugowaqan, na tujiw gisinmietes.
When you are finished your work, you can go home at that time.

Na'gu'set tligsaset lpa nepapigwa'lit
The sun is so bright it's blinding me

meanings: log (before being cut into specified lengths)
example:
Ne'gasgi'gnei wenjigwom maw weliangamgug.
A house made of logs is very pleasing to the eye.

Ne'gaw ni'n wigi Listugujg.
I have always lived in Listuguj.

Neget pas'g i'ngutujugwa'tui.
Just bring one of those to me at a time.

ne'gigsma'latl.translation: He/she pushes him/her all along the way
example:
Lpa ne'gigsma'latl ne'gasgi'gnn ta'n gis juwigtnasoq.
He/she pushed the log all the way, when he/she could have just
pulled it here.

ne'gigsma'toq.translation: He/she pushes it all along the way
example:
Ne'gigsma'toq utepaqan, muta mu getu' luwenug.
He/she pushes his /her car, because it doesn't want to work.

Negla ma wegetuann glapis sapo'nug.
I will not need those until tomorrow.

Ala negm mawintawitoql ligpenigenn.
He/she knows how to make baskets.

Negmewei na a'gwesn?
Its that his/her hat?

Ala negmow apoqonmultaq.
They will help you.

Ula ms't lapue'lg negmowowe'g.
All these frying pans are theirs.

E'pite'ji'j neia'latl ugtapsute'gann, aq teluet "pilei".
The little girl shows her doll, and says "it's new".

neiamatl.translation: He/she looks in on him/her briefly
example:
Pas'g pegising ujjl atneiamatl aq ap maja'sitaq.
He/she came by and looked in on his/her father and then left.

Tetuji mesgi'g pugtew lpa neiamgleg ta'n wigieg.
The fire was so big, it ablazed near my home.

Lpa telta'siap neiamglet nitap, teligsamu'gl na utapsunn.
I thought that my friend appeared in a blaze, his/her clothes are so
bright.

Milaplgigwa'teget ugmaposmg wetneiamugwa'latl la'sgul.
From his/her pocket he/she made a card appear.

Goqwei na gisneiamugwa'toq ula msaqtaqtug?
What did he/she cause to appear on the floor?

Pas'g neiapt'g wela'gowei aq maja'sitaq.
He/she only checked on supper and he/she left.

meanings: step out from behind somewhere in full view
example:
Te's telta'sij enqalata, gis neiapugua'sinitl.
Everytime he/she thought he/she had left him/her behind, he/she
steps into view.

meanings: come into view with a light source
example:
We'gwiawisiw neiaseniget na na'gu'set, tetujigaqi'sg winigisg'g.
The sun seldom shines through, there's been so much inclement
weather.

Gsnugowaqan neia's'g siggw.
Sickness appears in the springtime.

Pegijiesgmalg't'p gatu glapis neia'sip.
We waited a long time for him/her, but finally he/she showed up.

Neia'taqal pile'l wi'gatignn atel mesnmegl.
I show him/her the books we just received.

Te's Weltamultimg najinemgutijig Taps-eg.
Every Friday they go to have a drink at Taps.

We'gwipa'qala'ig lpa'tuji'j, amgwes nemiatl tia'mul.
The little boy looked very surprised, when he saw a moose for the
first time.

meanings: grandfather (term of respect for old man)
example:
Nemijgami' tami wetagutmu'ti'gw?
Grampa who are we related to?

Negm nemisg'g, gatu ugsampugwelg na wigumugsitesnu aq ginu
elg apoqonmuatesnu.
He/she is going to get it, but if it's too much then he/she will call for
us and we will help him/her.

Pegisin tet, gi'l natnemisgul.
I've come here to get you.

Pile'l ugpuguge'l, nige' welnmiteget.
He/she has new glasses, now he/she sees well.

Ta'n tujiw nmitu'n awti nigtua's'g, ugjipenugewei ugsua'tu.
When you see the road split, take the one going east.

Gi's pana pemnenaqa'sit, tami pmlietug?
He/she's hurrying off again, where could he/she be going?

Mali na negm pusgialinenaqe'g.
Mary is often going around in a hurry.

Nenaq'te'tg aqantie'uti gaqian muta Gesp'teg poqtamgita'jig.
He/she is in a hurry for the week to be over because on Saturday
they are leaving on a trip.

Telte'tmann ne'naqji'jgl, gisipgwatu'n ms't jugwa'tu.
I think they are light, if you can do it, bring all of them.

Amuj na ne'naqji'jit, tetuji apsi'gwes.
He/she must be light, he/she is built so slight.

Nenestawe'g nnjan gisgug.
My child sickly today.

Welneng negm nipugt, ma gsga'gw.
He/she knows the woods well, he/she won't get lost.

Ms't goqwei neng'tesg ta'n tujiw giwgw.
Everything trembles during an earthquake.

So'sep tewji jipaqa'lg, pa neng'tesing.
I frightened Joseph so much that he is trembling.

Nenmue'g ula la'sgw, saqpe'g pata'uti?
This card is damp, is the table wet?

Nenuatl ta'wen gisio'pla'tegenitl aq ma' agnimagul.
He/she knows who did wrong and he/she won't tell on them.

Maljewe'juianeg nujigina'mua'tijig nenuite'lmg'pnig.
When I was young I great respect for teachers.

Nenuite'tm Mi'gmewei tli'suti.
I have respect for the Mi'gmaq language.

Nsugwis nepa'ji'jit te's gismewlia'gweg.
My aunt takes a nap every afternoon.

Te'siula'gw ugumuljin te's ajiet jel aqata'ig unjang nepa'laji.
Every night at eight thirty he/she puts his/her children to sleep.

Ewljewe'jit nugu' ntue'm, nepapigwa't aq gisigu'wet.
My poor dog, he's blind and getting old.

Ma' negm ignmulug goqwei, wesaminpaqt'g.
He/she won't give you anything, he/she is too stingy.

Nepat, pe' mu getu' tugwa'laq.
He/she is asleep, I don't want to wake him/her up for now.

Te's toqwa'g ninen ne'pata'tieg ugjit gesigewei wius.
Every fall we butcher our own meat for the winter.

Ne'pategei ta'n tujiw sigte' u'j?
Am I commiting murder when I swat a fly?

Ta'n ne'pa'tl ula wapusl?
When did he/she kill this rabbit?

Pastung etlugwet aq mesgi'g suliewei ne'patoq.
He/she works in the States and earns big money.

Malia'n mawnepe'g amgwes gistugiej.
Maryann is real touchy when she first wakes up.

Pa'qala'i, mu nutmawas nepgaq!
I'm shocked, I didn't know he/she had died!

Nujinpiteget nepilatl gsnugowinu'l.
The healer heals the sick person.

Nepiseqwit aq Winpegijuig na wijei sipu.
Nepisigwitg and Winpegijuig are on the same river.

Amujpa nepisi, ula tgei mu getu' punajeiwigw.
I have to medicate myself, this cold does not want to leave me.

Negm nepiteget, aq natawinpiteget.
He/she is a healer, and he/she is a good healer.

Wi'sis nepitg la'qan ta'n tujiw musgwatg.
An animal helps the healing when he/she lickes his/her wounds.

Gisigu'sgw pugwelnitl gisneps'tgwa'latl.
The old lady raised lots of children

Te'siegsitpu'g neps'tgwa'toq mtawegn.
He/she rises the flag every morning.

Ta's ajiet nepuitewei alame's?
What time is the funeral mass (taking place)?

meanings: phobia of ghosts and supernatural phenomena
example:
Mu ni'n nesasiw pa!
I am not fearful at all!

E'e, jijuaqa nesawa'utijig, gatu mu te'sigisg'g.
Yes, sometimes they are timid, but not everyday.

Wela'ge'g nte'pitem nipapieg'p muta nesgaweieg'p.
Last night my wife and I were at the wake all night because we 
joined in the breavement.

Mi'walgig ta'n te'sijig minajuinu'g nesguipnig ngijaq nepgeg.
I appreciate all the people who consoled me when my mother
died.

Lpa'tu'ji'j nesigatesgmuatl ugjignaml toqsi'p wesmugwat.
The little boy trips his younger brother and then he runs away.

Gis nesisga'ql na'gwegl pemtesg'gl ula tepgunset.
Thirty days has passed in this month.

nespatalg.translation: He/she is eating while otherwise occupied
example:
Pana mu getu gnuatalug, nespatalg aq elugwet!
He/she just doesn't want to eat properly, he/she eats and works at
the same time!

nespatejimatl.translation: He/she drags him/her along while occupied with something else
meanings: drag along while occupied with something else
example:
Lpa'tuji'j pemtugwi'g aq nespatejimatl ugtue'ml.
There's a little boy running along while dragging his dog.

nespatejitoq.translation: He/she drags it along while occupied with something else
meanings: drag along while occupied with something else
example:
Nipugtug so'qitai'eg aq nespatejitueg ninu'n.
We go up the forest and we drag our food along.

Ula eli'seweg aq nespilugweg etlgitg ta'n te's'g eltas'g.
This sews and at the same time counts how many are made.

Etlmijjit aq nespilugwet.
He/she is eating and working at the same time.

Geggunt na'tuen nespit ta'n tujiw maja'sin?
Do you have someone to house sit when you go away?

Pie'l etlatalg aq nespiw etlgitg wi'gatign.
Peter is eating while he's reading a paper.

Nespnatl ugtue'ml ta'n getu'tet tami eliej.
He/she brings his/her dog wherever he/she goes.

So'sep nespng ugtlgowaqan ms't tami.
Joseph takes his work everywhere.

Ta'n telinsapoqwaj nti, miamuj niwipsguna'tug.
The way my dog is drinking, he/she must have been thirsty.

Natnmi njignam, negm na nessutmalsewet.
Go see my brother, he's the one who interprets.

Amujpa ujjl nessutmasewatl aqalasie'wigtug.
He/she has to interret for his/her father in English.
Mu' na welins'tmug Aqalasie'wigtug, amujpa nessutmalsewg.
He/she doesn't understand English too well, I have to interprete for
him/her.

Mali' nest'g Mi'gmewei tli'suti.
Mary understands the Mi'gmaq language.

Nestuapuguet, etnana wetjigs'taq.
He/she makes sense, that is why I heed his/her advise.

Na e'pit gisiguit aq nestue'g.
That woman is old and wise.

Glapis gatu nti nestu'et.
Finally my dog is maturing.

Pugwelg ta'n goqwei ge'toq aq tlimultew ta'n tujiw nestuita'sij.
He/she knows many things and he/she will tell you when he/she
recollects.

nestu'tesing.translation: He/she comes back to his/her senses
example:
Glapis gatu ula maljewe'j nestu'tesing aq siawa'sit ta'n telgina'masit.
Finally the youngster comes to his/her senses and resumes his/her
studies.

Nesupe'jt'pnig na negmow wijig'tultijiga.
They were triplets, that family of siblings.

Nesutmalsewu'ti na jijuaqa menuegen ugjit wenjuwei tli'isuti.
Sometimes translation is needed for the French language.

Ta'n we'gwigisipgwatu'tij, netaga'ltijig.
As much as they can help it, they embarrass each other.

So'sep alnetaga'sit ta'n tujiw e'pite'sl gelulj.
Joseph acts shy when a young lady speaks to him.

Ula ntu's mawintage'g
My daughter here is very shy.

Lpa'tuji'j ntago'qona'latl umisl te's gisipgwatoq.
The little boy shames his older sister at every opportunity.

meanings: capable of seeing unnoticable or unobvious things
example:
Taie'n na mawne'talqigwat, nemitoq ms't goqwei.
Diane has excellent eyesight, she notices everything.

Ango'te'n ta'n telugwen, muta mawne'tapit ala' ji'nm.
Be careful of what you are doing, because that man over there is
very critical.

Malian na mawne'tata'sit negm.
Mary Ann is a quick thinker.

Saqawe'gl gina'masuti'l pugwelg ne'tata'suaqan we'jitesg.
One will find much wisdom in the traditional teachings.

Mnaq newtipuna'gw jel a'qataigw aq gi's netawet.
He/she isn't a year and a half yet and he/she is able to talk.

netawia'tugwet.translation: He/she knows how to tell stories
example:
Gilbert na negm natawia'tugwet.
Gilbert knows how to tell stories.

Telo'tm eigl na'gwegl netawitoqtei, aq eigl moqwa'.
I find there are days that I know how to cook, and some that I
don't.

Taie'n na mawne'tistaqanat.
Diane has extrememly good hearing.

ne'tma'sit.translation: He/she makes self the center of attention
example:
Ntue'm mawinta'ne'tma'sit, gesatg me'ga'sualuj.
My dog knows how to make himself the center of attention.

Wigumgewigu's tepgunset na netugulimg ugjit gesig.
September is the provisioning month for the winter.

Nesuguna'q netugulip gesgmnaq maja'sigweg.
He/she gathered provisions for three days before he/she left.

Tuma netuisgalajig nmu'ji'jg ta'n gisigwenajig.
Thomas is selling the dogs he raised.

Newtigisig'g netuisgeieg, aq elg gaqatepiaq gisipgwatelmeg.
We've been selling all day, and we have also purchased a lot.

Pie'l netuisgetoq pugsug ta'n mawmujgajewei.
Peter sells the best firewood.

Tuma netuisgewatl So'sepal
Thomas is selling for Joseph.

Pgitagnutmataq na, netutmat.
They will have a long conversation, he/she is asking for money
owed (to him/her).

Gi's ne'w wejiei apnmi'g na malpale'wit.
I've been there four times to see that doctor.

newapalatl.translation: He/she cools him/her off with water
example:
Giju' newapalatl unjanji'jl muta wesampteg.
Mother cools off her child with water because it's too hot.

newapatoq.translation: He/she cools it off with water
example:
Newapatoqol uggwatl.
He/she cools off his/her feet in water.

We'guiwelneweg gisgug.
It's really nice and breezy today.

Gis newisga'qal wi'gatignn gisgitmann ula tepgunset.
So far I have read forty books this month.

Gi's telte'tm na'tam newisgegipunqeg wejimaja'sij tet.
I think it's been about fourty years since he/she left (from here).

newjoqaluesmatl.translation: He/she airs it(shirt) out in the cool wind
meanings: air out in the cool wind
example:
Pas'g newjoqaluesmaji ugnaqsunmg gisgug.
He/she is just airing out his/her sheets today.

newjoqaluestoq.translation: He/she airs it out in the cool wind
meanings: air out in the cool wind
example:
Newjoqaluestoq ugta'su'nm.
He/she is airing out his/her blanket in the cool wind.

Newjoqwa'latl ugtatlaiml gesgmnaq nasa'lgw.
He/she airs out his/her shirt before putting it on.

Newjoqwa'tu a'sun, wigplatewma'q.
Air out the blanket, it smells smoky.

Te's na ne'wowei apangitatimg.
Every Thursday is payday.

Me' gatu news'g ula wenji'guom
My, this house is draughty!

Pas'g newt tlua, sangew.
Just say it one time, slowly.

Mu' gnegtnnug newtaig eliaq gisgug.
One dollar doesn't go very far these days.

Ula nti pas'g newtaqigwat.
My dog has only one eye.

Ta's'gl newtamu'gl gismawo'tu'unn?
How many of the same colour have you collected?

Pas'g newte' pugsug esgwiaq ula gesig.
There is only one piece of wood left this winter.

Pas'g newte'jg suitis esgwiaq, go'qwa'tu.
There's just one candy left, grab it.

Pas'g newte'jit e'pite'ji'j ta'n getu' mila'sit.
There is the only girl that wants to play.

newtigata'lugwet.translation: He/she stands or slides on one leg
meanings: stand or slide on one leg
example:
Newtigata'lugwei, ma' pgitpuguiw...
Sliding on one leg, I won't be vertical for long...

newtigatat.translation: He/she has one leg or foot
example:
Ewle'jit Pie'l, newtigatat nige'.
Poor Peter, he is one-legged now.

Newtigisg'g etliesgmat, mnaq pegisinigul.
He/she has waited all day, the person he/she is waiting for hasn't
arrived yet.

Newtinqana'mai aq mu' gesatmu.
I'm drinking alone and I don't like it.

Pe' nige' newtiptnat glapis ila's'g ala igtig tema'toqop.
For now he/she is one-handed until the other one heals from a
break.

Pg'te'sng ni'n wigi newtipug.
I live in the south all winter.

Newtipunqeg gi's esgmatm, sapo'nug to'q oqwa'qt'tew.
I've waited for it for a year, it's supposed to arrive tomorrow.

Je gi's newtisga'q we'gwigilja'tijig ula mijua'ji'jg.
These little children can already count to ten.

Ula na newtisga'qewa'j pipanimit ta'n teluisi.
He/she is the tenth one to ask me what my name is.

Gegepgusi, newtitpa'q mu welinpaw.
I am underslept, all night long I wasn't able to sleep well.

Gesatm jijuaqa newtlugwei.
I like to work alone sometimes.

Pas'g newtnemi'g wius ta'n wig'tm.
I only like one kind of meat.

Newtugo'pj newtugopit.
The loner sits by themself.

Te's tami nemi'g na lpa'tuj, alnewtugwa'lugwet.
Wherever I see that boy, he's alone.

Newtui'gas'g pewatm.
I want one with a single mark.

Etlnewtui'gasit tet negm.
He/she/it is ace here.

Ula gisigu mu'nugu'newtumqwanegw muta gesnugwat.
This old man does not drink any more because he is sick.

Telte'lmg pas'g nugu' newtunatl.
I think he/she has only one left.

Newugulasultijig na lasqo'plaq epultijig.
Those boards sitting there are moist underneath.

Gwilmn ngaqan ugsuateja'taqanigtug eteg.
If you are looking for the ruler it is in the drawer.

Etug mimajuinu unji me' gesgug aq nangl ngatignn?
Do you think a person's head weighs more than five pounds?

Ni'n ngutei elg getu liei.
I too also want to go.

Me' pugqelia'tijij gisgug ngutiljig je mu amgwes.
There are more bachelors these days than before.

Tuma na nguto'pj.
Thomas is a loner.

Gisipgwatoq, negm nigana'sitew.
If he/she can help it, he/she will go first.

Pie'l lpa na wetaqiet niganawtig'tijig.
Pierre comes from a long line of trail blazers.

Niganigsma'lit gulaman ni'n tmg ugtapa's.
He/she pushes me to the front so I will be scolded first.

Niganigsma'toq gwitn glapis temig samgwan iga'j.
He/she is pushing the canoe ahead until he/she reaches deep
water.

So'sep niganite'tg ta'n tla'tegetew ula wejguaq gesig.
Joseph plans ahead what he will do this coming winter.

Niganpian, jiptug mgniten.
If I sit at the front, hopefully I will be chosen.

Wen niganpuguit ta'n etellugwen?
Who is the boss where you work?

niganteg.translation: It is located at the front
example:
Ula nigantegl tmg e'we'n.
Use the ones in the front first.

Apjiw na ntue'm nigan'tqa'sit ta'n tujiw tia'mue'geieg.
My dog always runs ahead when we go moose hunting.

Ni'g nigantug eteg awtigtug.
My home is in front of the main street.

Ala ji'nm etlewo'gwet na niganus.
That man speaking is the leader.

Jigs'tuanej niganu'sgw etlewo'gwet.
Let's listen to the leader speaking.

Gisgateg, nige' mijultinej.
It's ready, now lets eat.

Pie'l na mawpugwennaji nigoqq.
Peter has the most fishing spears.

Mu ni'n gisapjiw nigoqji'j.
I can't grip a small two pronged spear.

Teleiaq gti nigoqji'juigatat.
It looks like your dog is bow-legged.

So'sep e'watl nigoqol ta'n tujiw gatawe'gej.
Joseph uses a eel spear to fish eel.

nigtua'latl.translation: He/she separates him/her from the rest
example:
Nigtua'latl na te'sipowl ta'n pewalapnn.
He/she separates that horse he/she wanted.

Ula tet etlnigtua's'g awti ta'n eliaq qospemg.
This is where the road that goes to the lake branches off.

Mut nigtuita'new, e'nutultitesnu, aq mu nenmug ta'n eimu'ti'gw.
Don't seperate, we will loose each other and we are unfamiliar
with this area.

Ansue'g na nigtua'tijig muta gi's te'sisgegipunqeg toqa'majig.
It's to bad that they're separating, they've been together so many
years.

Nigtua'toq ugtsulieweim te's gisiapangitatimg.
He/she separates his/her money every payday.

Angwisga'tu ta'n etlnigtuigg.
Add a section at the place where it splits.

Guilu pitoqsit nigtuigit miti's.
Search for a tall crotched tree.

Msigu nige' nigwenm.
I am growing grass now.

Ngijaq nigwenapni wenju'su'naqsi'g.
My mother grew apple trees.

Nte'pitem nigwengl gaqismilamu'gl wasuwegl.
My wife grows all sorts and colors of flowers.

Glapis gatu nigwet na miti's.
Finally that tree is growing.

Ntla'qanm mawgesigaw nijgig.
My wound heals very fast.

Welta'si nti jaqalnijgit.
I'm glad my dog is healing quickly.

Nijinjig plamuowe'g mawwigapugsijig sisla'gwa'luj.
Fried salmon roe is delicious.

Nijipjulit ta'n tujiw mu welo'tegew.
He/she will encourage me when I'm not feeling good.

Ni'lajo'ltijig na etlnussaqig'tijig na magasang.
The staff at that store are friendly.

Witapal nimji'muatl najigina'masinnin.
He/she encourages his/her friend to go study.

Ni'n teluisi Tio'tis
My name is Tio'tis.

Ula wejgu'aq ninasu'nm'gewei elegen?
Are you running in the coming election?

Ninen na gislamgo'tuegl na pugsugl.
We're the ones that piled that firewood.

Ninenewei na mesgigl nmu'j.
That large dog is ours.

Ni'newei na nmu'j wesgumt.
That's my dog that you're talking about.

Ula nipg ms't goqwei weligweg.
This summer everything is growing well.

Te's toqwa'q nipi'g sa'se'wamugwita'jig.
Each autumn the leaves change colors.

Ulo'nug nipia'sutmamg.
Tonight there will be a midnight mass.

Nipi'l wigpatl.
He/she likes cabbage.

Pugwelg na nipispaqan gisigtantu maljewe'juianeg.
I gathered many switches when I was young.

nipispaqanta'tl.translation: He/she beats him/her with a switch
example:
Nipispaqanta'tl ugta'pi'l ta'n telwaqama'latl
He/she cleans the net by beating it with a switch.

Sangew nipispaqante'mn na pugwelg mjegei tuatest'tew.
If you beat it gently with a switch, a lot of the dirt will fall out.

Ta'nug na mawo'tmgl nipmann?
When does one gather bush cranberries?

Nipn wejia'p Unma'gig.
Last summer I went to Cape Breton Island.

Nipnigu's na welp'sit tepgunset.
June is a warm month.

Lpa mu gis tlimulnu ta'n tllugutitesnu nipnug.
I am completely unable to tell you what we will be doing next
summer.

Mu' nugu' pugweltnug nipugt esgwiaq ula gm'tginug.
There isn't much forest left here in our territory.

Mali wetnisa'latl ugtgajuewjml ge'gwe'g.
Mary brought her cat down from upstairs.

Wesua'toq ugta'gwesn aq nisapega'toq.
He/she takes his hat and throws it down.

Suel nisaqalatl, gatu mesnatl.
He/she almost threw it (animate), but caught it in time.

Nisaqann mu nugu' nemitas'gtnugul Listugjug.
Weirs are no longer seen in Listuguj.

Je tmg nisaqtoq gmu'j aq poqt'tugwi'g.
He/she throws the stick down and then he/she starts to run.

Pas'g nisa'si na miti's aq nmia.
Just get down from that tree and go home.

Ms't goqwei nisa'toq gesgmnaq maja'sigw.
He/she takes everything downstairs before leaving.

Pe' nisega'l'g'p ula ntatlaim, gewjia'qiei.
I'm going to pull down my shirt, I'm chilly.

E'pite's i'nisega'toq ugtoqon te's wenaqs'g.
The young woman pulls her dress down each time the wind picks
it up.

Tuma gisiniseget mesgi'g wenju'su'n.
Thomas just dropped a big apple

Pesoqtesgmateg, nisegetl ugtue'ml.
When he/she tripped, he/she (accidentally) dropped her pet.

Teluejig Nisgam wa'so'q engopit aq angweiugsi'gw.
They say God sits in Heaven and takes cares of  us.

Ge' ala angam lpa'tuj nisgusuetl miti'sl.
Look at that boy climbing down that tree.

Tami ula wetnisiaq?
Where did this fall from?

Wenji'guomg wejnisiet aq mu jileiug.
He/she fell off the house and he/she didn't get hurt.

Ge' angam ala lpa'tuj, gisnisigsma'latl wasteweie'jl.
Look at that boy, he has pushed the snowman down.

Pe' amsgwesewei nisigsma'toq utepaqan.
To begin with he/she pushes his/her toboggan down.

Nisnul glapis tluen "ntlamugsis".
I'll hold you down until you say "my uncle".

Nisn'g llutaqan glapis ni'n gisia'sisa'sian.
He/she holds down the fencing until I finish going over it.

Nisnusit gimu'tug muta mu puatmug unji tuasg'ten.
He/she is lowering himself/herself a bit because he/she doesn't
want his/her head to stick out.

Lpa wejniso'piet miti'sigtug apapi'l e'watl.
He/she swung down from the tree using a rope.

Angweiu na miti's, ma'mun nisoqpit.
Be careful of that tree, it's slanting down too much.

nisoqteg.translation: It(something of length) is pointed downward
example:
Ala' nisoqteg awti enm'teg.
That road is going down the hill.

nispilatl.translation: He/she lowers him/her by rope or cable
example:
Gina'sit nispilatl tia'mul gaqapija'lapnn gtigulagu.
He/she is working hard lowering the moose he/she hung there two
days ago.

So'sep getu nispilg mesgi'g guntew
Joseph wants to lower the big stone.

We'gwima'munnisqanane'g njigun ta'n jileiaq'p ulagu.
My knee is badly bruised from when I hurt it yesterday.

Tami ugju'sn wejiaq, gaqiniss'gl ula wi'gatignn.
Where is the wind coming from, all the paper is blowing down.

nissing.translation: He/she is falling (from a higher place)
example:
Ula pi'gun wejnissing ala miti'sigtug.
This feather just drifted out of that tree.

Wen gisnistelg na jipji'jewei wenji'guomji'j.
Who shoot the bird house down.

Miamuj metue'g nisteluj ta'n tujiw alaqsulti'tij.
It must be difficult to shoot them down when they are flying about.

Gis jile'g, nige' etlni'taqa't.
He/she has been injured, now he/she is recuperating.

Lpa'tu'ji'j gina'sit malige'wl niwa'latl, etlwe'watl suppinn.
The little boy is working hard to empty out the barrel, using a pint
dipper.

Toqwa'q sipu mamunniwa's'g.
In the fall the river becomes very dry.

Te's la'taqsun niwa'sij ap ugju'pega'l.
Every time the pail runs dry, fill it up again.

Ugtul gisigtapaqto'gweg, nige' amujgpa niwa'toq.
His/her boat has gotten swamped, now he/she has to empty it.

Nnjan me' niwe'g
My child is still dry.

Ma' gismnawa'tigw nige' muta niweteg.
We can't go out on the bay because the tide is low.

Mali niwiga'satl pile'l ugtgajuewjml.
Mary wipes her new cat dry.

Ge' niwiga'se'n pata'uti?
Could you wipe the table dry?

Niwipsguna's na ula nitap, geget niwa'latl na malige'wji'tl.
My friend is thirsty, he/she has almost emptied that keg.

Gis ap niwoqsitaq ntuwomaq!
I boiled my pot dry again!

Teliangamgug ms't goqwei gaqiniwoqte'g.
It looks like everything is boiled dry.

Ge' nigoqji'ju'ta na nme'j pemsing.
Spear that fish swimming by.

Pie'l na sa'qawei nme'j'gowinu.
Peter is an old fisher.

Nme'ji'jg sisla'gwa'tasijig mawwigapugsijig.
Fried herring is really delicious.

Nme'juaqan maja's'g amgwes ellugutimg.
The fishery starts up on Monday.

Nwis geggunatl mo'qiginitl nme'juo'ql.
My son has a fancy fish bowl.

Ni'n nmi'm teluisit Matle'n.
My grandmother's name is Madeline.

Talamugsit ula nmu'j?
What kind of dog is this?

Nmu'ji'j nepat.
The puppy is sleeping.

Nmu'ji'jmnaqsi'g mawnaqsipanita'jig siggw.
Pussy willows open earliest in the spring.

Nnigmu'j na maw ulp'seweg.
Hardwood provides really good heat.

Amgwes na ta'n te'sit nnu nnui'sip.
It used to be that all Mi'gmaw spoke Mi'gmaw.

Taluisig nnue'gati ta'n gi'l tleiawin?
What is the name of the indigenous community you are from?

Nnueiei'l gtapegiaqann ni'n mawuls'tmann.
I really like the sound of Native songs.

Newte'jit nitape'sgw wigit Nnuei Mnigu.
One of my friend lives on Indian Island.

Welinnui'sit na ala e'pite'ji'j.
That little girl speaks Mi'gmaw well.

Taluisit ala nnu'sgw wejgu'et?
What is the name of that indigenous woman coming towards us?

Ala e'pite's aq ji'nmji'j mawinta'nnu'tesingig.
That young woman and young man are good at native style
dancing.

nnu'wi't'g.translation: He/she refers to it by its aboriginal name
meanings: refer to something by its aboriginal name
refer to something in first nations language
example:
Nnu'wi't'tew glusuaqan gji'toq nnuigtig.
He/she will use the aboriginal word if he/she knows the aboriginal
term.

Etug talsa'q giaspi nnu a'sutmamg?
I wonder how long it has been since a Native mass was held?

Nnu saqama'sgw pilei gispisguto't.
A new female native chief has been elected.

Te's tapuipunqeg elegetimg ugjit pilei nnu saqamaw.
Every two years there is an election for a new chief.

Asgate'lmg, te's gelusij poqjino'q'g.
I feel for him/her, every time he/she speaks he/she begins to
cough.

Lpa nmu'ji'j noqt'g ge's gi'gatatalg.
The little dog chokes while over-eating.

Talamu'g wesua'tu'n npisun?
What kind of medicine do you take?

Gitg npo'qonn lugwatmnej.
Let's make both beds up.

Npuaqan ms't wen sama'l'j.
Death touches everyone.

Ta'n tujiw npuinu elising na wapia'sutmatimg.
When the a deceased person is layed out,we pray through the
night.

meanings: vehicle (boat) used to transport the deceased
example:
Npuinu'ulgw sangew pemiaq.
The hearse goes by slowly.

Nqano'patigtug epit pilei nqana'paqsun.
The new well bucket is at the well.

Nqani'gn mawweljewiaq ta'n tujiw gaqpesawe'gemg.
A dip net is really handy when you go smelt fishing.

Nisgam mijua'ji'j etliws'tqamuip nqani'guomg.
The baby Jesus was born in a manger.

Mu' nugu' nemitu'nn nqano'pati'l gisgug.
You don't see many wells today.

Nsanoqon, mutt liew.
Danger, don't go there.

Nsanoqonig na mgumi, mutt ta'mpas'g tltaqamoqwa'siw na sipu.
That ice is dangerous, don't cross that river carelessly.

Ula mesgilg nmu'j nsanoqonit.
This big dog is dangerous.

Ns'tnaqan ugsugwisl angweiagutal.
The orphen will be looked after by his/her aunt.

Nsugwi', ge' guta'tlap p'tewe'ji'j.
Aunty, let me pour you a bit of tea.

Lpa ntaqo'qon ta'n teliaqap wela'gwe'g.
It's a shame what happened last night.

Sapo'nug egsitpugwia'titaq ntugsuinu'g najintantaqati'tij.
Tomorrow the hunters will be up early to go hunting.

Nuel na ni'n teluisi, mut Christmas tlui'tinew.
Noel is my name, just don't call me Christmas.

Nuelewumg na'gweg ms't nn'jang pe'ita'taq.
On Christmas Day, all my children will come over.

Jipji'j nugjaqa'latl juji'ji'tl.
The bird crushes the little bug.

We'gwigina'sit nugjaqa'toq na wa'w
He/she is putting a lot of effort squashing that egg.

Wen nugjaqsajig pse's'sg nige'?
Who's mincing the onions now?

Lpa nugu' gaqanugjaqta'tl nistesmateg.
He/she completely smashed it to bits when he/she dropped it.

Wen gis nugjaqtesg'gl ula ejgujgl?
Who stomped these squash?

Ango'te'n, mu getu nugjaqtesguawt na gtapsute'gan.
Be careful not to step on your doll, you don't what to crush it.

Tugwia'neg sepei pas'g nugsaqatal esgwiaqapnn epsaqtejgigtug.
When I woke up this morning there was nothing but the embers
left in the stove.

Tmg nugsatl nme'jl, toqoji'w wissugwalatl.
First he/she minces the fish, and then he/she cooks it.

Nugsm nige', gulaman gisgattetew ta'n tujiw wisugwaqan unaqiaq.
I will mince it now, so it will be ready when the cooking begins.
(unaqaiaq means "jumps" but is also used as an expression to
mean "starts")

Amujpa nugta'tl tmg a'papi'l gesgmnaq gisie'wawg.
He/she had to pound on the rope to soften it before using it .

Negm nujinugte'g tia'muei wius.
His job is to tenderise the moose meat.

Pe'l ula nugtesg'map nige' smtug!
Let me crush this with my feet immediately!

Nugtesguatl gastulastu'l gesgmnaq elsma'sigw.
He/she softens the cedar boughs with his/her feet before laying
down.

Nata'lugwet nugtoqtejgwej metua'sit gisgug.
A good house keeper is hard to find these days.

Gisgug gigpesaq, nugu' na lamuguomg etlmilitaieg.
Today it is raining outside, so we are playing indoors.

Mu na pas'g gugumij gistlwi'tawt "nugumi", gisigui'sgw elg na
gisitlwi'tut.
It's not only your grandmother that can be called "nugumi", a
female elder can be addressed that way too.

Nugwa'gipulatl wasapeglawul gesgmaq e'wagw.
He/she grinds down the spruce gum before using it.

Piel ugtlugowaqan na nugwa'gittoq guntew.
Peter's job is to grind stone.

Epsaqtejgigtug etlpsatl, nugwa'latl pgu'l.
He/she warms it on the stove, softening the pitch.

So'sep gis pejnu'gwa'latl umugsnn ge's pugtew maligo'tg.
Joseph accidently burned his shoe while he was playing with the
fire.

Nugwaltugo'n megwe'g ge' jugwasga'tui?
Please pass me the red comb?

Ge's mu tami eliegw, na nugwaltugo'sit aq plu'jaqamat.
Before he/she goes anywhere, he/she combs his/her hair and looks
in the mirror.

Amujpa gijga'saqpejaqamig ta'n nu'gwa'luejgewe'l etligweg.
It has to be a little swampy where cattails grow.

Talta'sin gi'l, etug ms't wigatignei nu'gwa'q?
What do you think, does all paper burn?

Talgis nu'gwa'jig ntaqamg?
How did my snowshoes get burned?

Wesammlge'g na pilei m'gegn, amuj tmg nugwa'toq.
That new leather is too stiff, he/she has to soften it first.

Wen gi's nu'gwa'toq na wenji'guom?
Who burnt that house down?

Mu pualawt pga'w wasamnugwe'g.
You don't want clay that is too soft.

Ntjignam nuja'gitteget muling
My brother is a sawyer at the mill.

Tegen nujagnutmewinu aqase'wa'l's'p?
Which lawyer did you hire?

So'sep na negm nuja'q ugjit Listuguj.
Joseph is the swimmer for Listuguj.

meanings: twitcher (person who by horse or machine, pulls logs from woods)
example:
Ni'n na nujatejo'tasi ula mawpugu'ltieg.
I am the twitcher in this group.

meanings: twitch logs (person who by horse or machine, pulls logs from woods)
example:
Nujatejo'teget amujpa nata'uliangweiwatl ugtue'ml.
A twitcher has to know how to take good care of his/her animal
(horse).

Ntjignam na pas'g telugwet nujatejo'toqol pugsugl.
All my brother has to do is haul firewood.

Ni'n na nujeiaq nsugwi'.
I am in charge of my aunt.

Jaqalinmita'nej gesgmnaq ula gisipgwatelmu'g geljistas'g
nujguma'nug.
Let's hurry home before the frozen goods we have purchased
thaw out.

Angweiu na nnuoqta'w, gis nujgma'tew na!
Take care of that statue, it can melt!

Wen gisinujgmoqsatl?
Who melted it?

nujgmoqs'g.translation: He/she melts it by using heat
example:
Samugqwana'toq sismo'qon gulaman me' gisinqasinujgumoqs'tew.
