He/she adds water to the sugar so it will melt over heat more
quickly.

Gis nujgmoqsit ntlapue'lm, amuj na lapawji'jiteweiutug.
My frying pan melted, it must have been made of tin.

Tewjiuligisg'g, lpa nujgmoqteg wastew.
The weather is so warm, it's even melting the snow.

Mu' nugu' wen ei'mug ta'n nujiaji lasguaq.
There is no one around that makes snowshoes anymore.

Ula ji'nm nujialapit ugjit wenji'guoml.
The man is a watchman for houses.

Ntus to'q getu'gina'masit ta'n tlnujiamalgatew.
My daughter wants to learn to be a dancer.

Ntlamugsis nujiasigetg, Pastung etlugwet.
My uncle is a teamster, he works in the U.S.

Gelu'sit nujielutuet maw giso'qan sigs'tuj.
A good imitator is fun to listen to.

Pie'l na nujiewjo'lajig ta'n gesnugutijig.
Peter is the medical driver.

Ta's ajietew nujiewjo'tasit pegising?
What time is the hauler arriving?

Nujiewjo'teget wigit ge'gwe'g magasang.
The delivery person lives above  the store.

A'selig nujiewjo'toq pugsug nipugtug.
Angelique hauls wood from the woods/forest.

Jijuaqa na wen nujigeluet aq mu' geitug.
Sometimes a person is a matchmaker and isn't aware of it.

So'sep na negm mawgelu'sit nujigina'muet.
Joseph is a very good teacher.

Migwite'tmn amgweseweieg elieneg nujigina'muo'guom?
Do you remember the first time you went to a school?

Game'g pegising gisgug nujigoqwa'luet
Today the wrestler arrives in town.

Ula nujigsmoqja'teget welmawlugweji unaqapemg.
This foreman works well with his/her crew.

Pie'l na negm mujgajewei ta'n nujigtu'muet.
Peter is the best musicial entertainer.

Tatujigaqi'sg gi's ilsum'sg gi'l nujiilsuteget.
How often have you been sentenced by a judge.

Tami tleiawit na nujimila'teget?
Where is that joker from?

Nujimuet ta'n etlugwet Gignu gameg tle'iawit
The counsellor that works in Gignu is from town.

A'tli na nujinapui'giget ugjit Alaqsite'w Gitpu Nujigina'muo'guom.
Audrey is the photographer for the Alaqsite'w Gitpu School.

Welta'si mu nugu'lugowaqan eigtnug ugjit nujine'pateget.
I'm glad this is no longer work for an executioner.

Nujinget pas'g enget sitmug, mu nipugtug.
The scaler just scales by the shore, not in the woods.

Pipanim nujinpiteget apoqonmati.
Ask the hearler for help.

Gisgug nujinqasui'get pegisingp s'gu'ligtug aq gelulapnig mijuaji'j.
Today the firefighter came to the school and talked to the children.

nujins'pit.translation: He/she is a baby sitter or a house sitter
example:
Nujins'pi ta'n tujiw maita'tij.
I am the sitter whenever they leave.

Simon na nigannujintoq a's'tuo'guomg.
Simon is the head singer at the church.

Tegen nujintuisget wettenmaj ula?
From which vendor did you buy this?

Nujintus ma' gisiunjanigw.
A sterile person can't have children.

Mu te's telianug ta'n teluej, gatu ula nujinutmaqaniget
ugta'tugwaqanml mawgiso'qonn.
What he/she says is not always true, but this storytellers tales are
always fun.

Nujipestung pejimittugwep wela'we'g.
The preacher came for a visit last night.

Amujpa jigs'tut nujipetqa'muet ta'n tujiw alje'ma'timg.
One has to obey the umpire when playing baseball.

Mise'l na nujipgwateliget ugjit na magasan.
Michael is the purchaser for the store.

Weljemasiget nujipipnet, pugjig mijulti'gw!
The baker is creating great aromas, soon we eat!

Agase'wa'lanej ta'n gelu'sit nujipipugwet.
Hire a good musican

Ge' nuji'pit llgim maqasang?
Can you send the errand runner to the store?

Gtaptesgi'gnnml ingnmuates nujipi't'pet gtu'siawqatmn.
Give your keys to the bartender if you are going to stay here.

Nujiputaqiget pegising, gisgug ne'pataigw gulgwi's.
The butcher is arriving today, we are going to slaughter a pig.

Sapo'nug pgisintew nujisa'se'wamugwa'teget.
The magician will arrive tomorrow.

Gespteg egsitpu'g najnmi'g na nujitmasaqte'muet.
I going to see the barber Saturday morning.

Nujitu, goqwei getugji'tu'n?
I make it professionally, what do you want to know?

Ula nujitoqtet ta'm pas'g goqwei gisietoqtatg.
This baker can bake anything.
Ula nujitoqtet pas negm eltoqol petaqann.
This baker is the only one who bakes pies.

Pipanimates nujiwsiget ta'n tujiw natnmi'j.
Ask the fortuneteller when you go to see him/her.

Wen nujo'teget ula alame's gisgug?
Who is serving the mass today?

nujo'tg.translation: He/she is in charge of it
example:
Mesgi'g suliewei nujo'tg na ji'nm.
That man is responsible for a large amount of money.

Ntlamugsis na nujumu.
My uncle has gastric tuberculosis.

Geji'g nujumuit, gatu nige' npisun eig ta'n npilgutew.
I know he/she has tuberculosis, but now there is medicine that will
cure him/her.

Smtug qopisun nunat ta'n tujiw pu'tail ugtung pitasga'tuj.
An infant will start to suck as soon as a bottle is put to it's mouth.

Mijua'ji'j gesatg nunatg ugtijin.
The baby likes to suck his/her thumb.

Ala nunmaqeg gmu'jming etligwejig.
At the slight incline raspberries grow .

Gnegg na elnunmaqet ula gmtn.
This mountain slopes for a long way.

Geji'g unji eteg ugtllugowaqang ta'n tujiw alnunmintoq.
I know his/her head is in his/her work when he/she goes around
humming.

Ula mijua'ji'juwei pu'tai pewalt nunmip'sin.
For a baby bottle you need it to be just warm.

Pas'g pewatmn nunmip'ten, mu getu'gaqsusiwun.
You just want it to be moderately warm, you don't want to burn
yourself.

Ms't unnjang gisnusalapnni.
She was able to suckle all her children.

Mut gigja'sualaw nu'sesgw ta'n tujiw unjang eimnij gigji'w.
Don't go near a female bear when her cubs are about.

Nugumijaq nuse'sgwep ugjit ms't unnjang.
My grandmother breastfed all of her children.

Mawmujgajewei to'q mijipjewei ugjit qopisun wen nusej.
It is apparently the very best food for an infant when a mother
breast feds.

Tio'tis na nussaqiget ulo'nug ma' smtug gisinmiegw.
Eunice is the clerk tonight she can't go home right away.

Nitap nutagnat.
My buddy is getting feeble from age.

Egsitpu'nug so'qwita'jig najigtantaqatijig.
Tomorrow morning they are going up to the woods to hunt.

So'qwa'ti'gw najinutapi'gw.
We're going up the woods to scout around.

Mu ni'n wisgualaq ta'n nutapteget telugwej.
I am not envious about the coronor's job.

Goqwei nuta'q nige'?
What's missing now?

Geji'g natgoqwei nuta't, pas'g lpa mu gisimigwite'tmu.
I know he/she is missing something, but I can't remember at all
(what it is).

Ula na negm nutateji'pulatl nujinpitegenitl.
He/she is the one who brings the healer around to where he has to
go.

Ejela'toq na nutateji'putasit, amujpa te'siegsitpu'g na'tuenn nemisg'tl.
The passenger can't help it, every morning someone has to go get
him/her.

Pugwelgig nutateji'putaqatijig ula Listugujg.
There are many deilvery persons here in Listuguj.

So'sep nutateji'putoq pugsug.
Joseph delivers wood.

Ge' gi'l nujo'te'n nu'te'nmaqan gisgug?
Would you take care of the campfire today?

Ntue'm nest'g ugwisunnm ta'n tujiw nutg.
My dog understands his name when he hears it said.

meanings: something has become too large or too small to fit anymore
example:
Ne'gaw welg'g, gat nugu' nige' nutg'g.
He/she has always fit it well, but at this point it no longer fits.

nutgulpapatiget.translation: He/she scrubs on hands and knees
example:
Mu wen pugwelug ta'n nutgulpapatiget.
Not too many will scrub on their hands and knees.

Nutgulpa'sit aq guljewto'sit.
He/she kneels and makes the sign of the cross.

We'guisa'q nutgul'pit na aniapsuinu.
That penentant one has been kneeling for a long time.

Ta'n tujiw pisgwat a's'tuo'guomg nutgulpugua'sit aq guljiewto'sit.
Whenever he/she enters the church he/she genuflects and makes a
sign of the cross.

Nutmaiap e'e, gatu gi'l, gi's nutman?
Yes I heard about it, how about you, have you heard yet?

Ngwis nutnewetew ula wejgu'aq aqantie'umg.
My son will be assisting at mass this comming Sunday.

Telte'tm nutoqto'guomg etlinqatmapneg.
I think I left it in the kitchen.

Jugu'wetew na glapis nutpet aq pipanimugsitesnu ta'woqwei
pewatmu'g.
The bartender will eventually come and ask us what we want.

Nutpipnet aq nujitoqtet na wijei
Bread maker and baker are the same.

nutqwa'latl.translation: He/she gives insufficient amount to him/her
example:
Gneg nutqwa'latl ula samuqwano'ql je mu ala amgwesewe'l.
He/she put much less in this water can that in that first one.

Pipnaqan gisitoq pas'g na nutqwa'toq salawei
He/she made bread but didn't put in enough salt.

Geji'g nutqwe'g ta'n telqamigsij, gatu ejele'g, telmaljewe'j.
I know he/she behaves immaturely, but that can't be helped,
he/she is so young.

So'sep nutqelg ns'tuo'qon ugjit mu lien etlinsanoqonig.
Joseph has insufficent intelligence to stay away from dangerous
places.

Telte'tm nutqwijijigwe'jg.
I think it's not narrow enough.

Nutqwijijigwe'jit na ula lasqo'plaw, ma' etug teptesinug na'te'l.
This board is not narrow enough, it might not fit there.

Elsegni'gan nutsegnewet wi'g.
The brick house is the bricklayer's home.

Pie'l gejigow gisnutuatl tia'mul.
Pierre heard a moose a while ago.

o'plagnutmajig.translation: Those two are having a disagreement
example:
Ula nitapaq gisio'plagnutmajig.
These friends of mine have had a disagreement.

Gisio'pla'latl aq je mu ge'itug.
He/she has done him/her wrong and he/she doesn't even know it.

Jipatg o'plapuguen, muta amsgwes telpugwelnitl jigs'tatl.
He/she is afraid to say the wrong thing because it is the first time
so many are listening.

Gisgug ms't goqwei opla's'g.
Everything went wrong today.

We'gwiopla'sit ula pgu etli'g, lpa mu melga'sigw.
The fudge I'm making is going very wrong, it will not harden at all.

Talio'platalg etug mimajuinu?
How would a human being eat improperly?

Gi's ap gisio'pla'teget ula nitap.
My friend did something wrong again.

Gisio'pla'tu aq mu gegnu'lugwenug.
I have done it incorrectly and it doesn't work properly.

Gisio'plisqatesg ntangwisgaqanm aq nige' we'guiwe'tuguig.
I just sprained my wrist and it's hurting a lot.

Gi's nisiei aq njigun o'plisqatesing.
I fell and sprained my knee.

Gjiga'qaquj gisio'plisqatesmatl un'sqe'l, ma' pe'l alaqsinug.
The raven has sprained it's wing, it won't be flying for a while.

Aliasgaja't, etug gisio'plisqatestoq ugmaqaqjigeweim.
He/she is limping, he/she must have sprained his/her big toe.

O'pliwenaqto'si ta'n etlla'sgugutieg.
I mistakenly raised the pot where we were playing cards.

O'pl'ta'tl tu'aqann, awna ugtejg elta'tl.
He/she struck the ball incorrectly, instead throwing it to the back.

Geji'g o'pl'te'g na gtapegiaqan, pa mu' welta'tnug.
I know he/she is playing that tune wrong, it just doesn't sound
good.

o'plwi'tatl.translation: He/she names or calls him/her wrongly
example:
Negm na gi's o'plwi'tatl, mu' na negm teluisigw So'sep.
He/she called him by a wrong name, his name is not Joseph.

o'plwi't'g.translation: He/she calls it by the wrong name
example:
Te's teluej o'plwi't'g, muta lpa mu gistestug.
Every time he/she says it he/she says it incorrectly because he/she
just can't pronounce it.

Mu gewisinug, gi's ms't goqwei oqo jigtug.
He/she is not hungry, because he/she has already eaten all that was
there.

oqolema'sit.translation: He/she puts something in his/her mouth
example:
Telignmuteg Usgijipnewl na smtug oqolema'sitl.
As he/she was given the host he/she immediately put it in his/her
mouth.

Oqolumgwa'sit aq teluet mu ni'n gis tela'tegew na.
He/she bows his/her head and says I can't do that.

meanings: process of being covered with snow, soil, etc.
example:
Gesigawipsaq, pas'g gisipgisin aq gi's ntawti oqonaliaq.
It's snowing hard, I just arrived and my tracks are already covered
with snow.

meanings: process of being covered with snow, etc.
example:
Tetujima'munipsaq lpa nti oqonaliet wastewigtug.
It snowing so heavily that my pet is being covered by the snow.

Sangew oqonisgwa'latl mijua'ji'tl a'su'nigtug, wejo'tg mu tugwa'lan.
He/she gently covers the baby in a blanket, trying not to awaken
him/her.

Lpa te'siula'gw oqonisga'toq utepaqan.
He/she covers his/her vehicle every night.

Mali oqonisqopilatl unjann aq enma'latl.
Mary wraps up her child and takes him/her home.

Oqonisqopilg wius wigewigtug aq sangew etloqs'g.
He/she wraps the meat in a layer of fat and cooks it slowly.

Me' gatu oqonitpa'q ula engopin, goqwei ugjit wassoqwa'tu'n na
wasoqan?
It's awfully dark where your sitting, why don't you turn on that
light?

Telguising, lpa suel oqonitpaqaiet.
He/she is so hungry, he/she almost faints.

Pas'g na'n ajiet aq gi's oqonitpaqamugwiaq.
It is only five o'clock and it is getting dark already.

Oqonoqopisaqan e'w'g unjann alapilaj.
He/she uses receiving blanket when carrying his/her child about.

oqonoqopiso'tlatl.translation: He/she places a hood on him/her
example:
Amujpa tmg oqonoqopiso'tlul gesgmnaq gujmug tewa'lulnu.
I have to place a hood on you before I take you outside.

Welioqopisieg gisgug muta tege'g.
We are well bundled up today, because it is cold.

meanings: fungal growth on damp or decaying matter
example:
Oqoqiaq nugu' la gmu'j, etug wasamsa'q eteg saqpejaqamigtug.
This wood is moldy, it must have been in the damp for too long.

Oqosgijigueg na ula ta'n wesgowa'si.
It's sticky here where I'm at.

Oqosgijiguet na ula gastio'mio'q.
This molasses container is sticky.

Oqote'tut! Ula mijipjewei elagweg, apoqnmalsultigw.
Friends! The food is here, help yourselves.

Oqoti, tami elien?
My dear, where are you going?

oqotqomatl.translation: Tease about member of opposite sex
meanings: tease about a potential romantic partner
example:
Te's nemiaj witapal na oqotqomatal na'tuwenn
Each time he/she sees his/her friend, he/she teases him/her about
someone.

Oqtatqa'toq ugtul te's gesig.
He/she puts his/her boat in drydock every winter.

Ta's ajiet pugtewulgw oqwa'q?
What time does the steamship arrive?

Mu ntul etenug ta'n etlioqwasa'tuap.
My canoe in not where I beached it.

Ta's ajietew gji'nmum oqwa't?
What time will your husband arrive?

oqwatg.translation: The wind is blowing from the north
example:
We'gwioqwatg gisgug!
My, the wind is from the north today!

Waqatasgl oqwatnug wetasegl.
Aqasgo'tgurora borealis shine from the north.

Gi's gi'l etligtugunin oqwatqiganigtug?
Have you ever slept in a lean-to?

Nemi'geg taqatu ni'n, pa'ge'g'p.
Well when I saw him/her, he/she was sober.

Pa'gewumg na pa'gewumgewei elugwatm'g.
One does one's Easter duty (confession) at Easter time.

Mutt gwijiwnaqiew na'te'l wasampagwe'jg.
Don't jump in (the water) there it's too shallow.

Gisipa'itepega'sit ntsamqwano'gom.
My water container overflowed.

Ango'te'n, geget pa'it'pega's'g mimei!
Be careful, the oil is almost overflowing!

Ula pajijiglulg e'we'n.
Use this extremely good one.

Ula nitap telta'sit pajijiglu'sit aluse'wit.
My friend here thinks that he/she is an extremely good carpenter.

Pejipajijigsma'latl na gisa'latl nisienitl.
He/she accidently pushed him/her too far and caused him/her to
fall.

Pajijigsma'tu'tij na pilei tepaqan.
They're advertising hard for that new car.

Teluet tetujipilei utepaqan lpa pajijipilei.
He/she says his/her vehicle is so new that it's newer than new.

Goqwei telue's'p pajijiwinjig?
What did you say is the worst?

Mut mgnaw na, pajijiwinjit, ala igtig ugsua'l.
Don't choose that one, it is in extrememly bad shape, take the
other one.

Mawita'pajjaqamat na, mutt gtlams'tmu ms't goqwei telim'sg.
He/she likes to lay it on thick, don't believe everything he/she tells
you.

Ni'n na mawintawitu pa'le'wei lasup.
I make really good barley soup.

Melgapjiann paltaqann ta'n tujiw tepa'si gwitn.
I hold the gunwales tight when I get on a canoe.

meanings: kind of tree (related to poplar grows near water)
example:
Maw wi'guima'q gmu'j ta'n wejiaq pa'migligtug.
There is a strange smell that comes from the Balm of Gilead tree.

Gisgug ta'n gistliaq pana wijei aq ulagu.
What happened today is the same as yesterday.

Pasgoqsigne'l pu'tail pana'latl aq smtug amjaqamat.
He/she opens a jam bottle and immediaely starts to spread it on
(for himself/herself).

Lpa ga'qan ngutugwa'iw pana's'g.
The door opened by itself.

Ula epsaqtejg tet elpana'sit.
The stove opens this way.

Taliulm'tu'n, pana'tu ga'qan na etlimtete'get?
Would you be so kind as to open the door for whoever is
knocking?

Gispanawijqanewet ula nitap sepai, mu eitnug guntew mu
aputasga'tug.
My friend did a thorough search this morning, there isn't a rock
that he did not overturn.

paneta'q.translation: The sun begins to shine through the clouds
meanings: sun beginning to shine through clouds
example:
Poqjipaneta'q, etug getu uligisg'g.
It's starting to clear up, perhaps it will be a nice day.

meanings: horse drawn winter sleigh on runners
example:
Mu na nugu' wen nemiamg alteja'lugwet pangeji'jigtug.
One no longer sees anyone riding around in a pung.

Lpa smtug pangwenatl ugti'l gujmug wejieniteg.
He/she immediately started to groom his/her dog as soon as it
came in.

Malpale'wi'sgw na jijuaqa pangwenewet.
The nurse sometimes delouses.

Panianug ugjo'tmnej lugwatmnenu tuop'ti'l.
Next spring lets try to get the windows done.

paniaq.translation: It is the end of the snow period
example:
Tetujiuligisg'g lpa tlta'sig paniaq nugu'.
The weather is so nice you would think that is the end of the snow
period.

Panigisgiaq glapis gatu!
Finally it clears up!

panjasgiet.translation: He/she/it spreads his/her/its legs while in lying position
meanings: legs outspread while in lying position
example:
Loqosma'sij aq panjasgiej nmu'j, na pewat umusti gjigapa'tas'tnn.
If a dog lies down and spread its legs, it wants its tummy to be
scratched.

Wela'gul gepsoqatl ugtue'ml llutaqanigtug aq egsitpu'g eliet aq
pansaqatl.
He/she locks his/her animal into the paddock/fence every evening
and in the morning he/she goes there and unlocks him/her.

Te'sigisg'g negm pansaqq ga'qan.
Every day he/she unlocks the door.

Amjimoqteg pgijoqign, amujpa pansatl na la'taqsunn.
The lid is stuck, he/she has to cut the bucket open.

Getu' pans'g elmaqei tu'satigtug glaman tuop'ti gisiga'tew.
He/she wants to cut a hole in the shed so he/she can install a
window.

Gisipanta'latl mlagejuo'ql
He/she opened a milk bottle.

Telpanta'toq ga'qan, u't ta wejgu'lapinitl!
As he/she opened, here he/she was looking at him/her!

Ala' epit pu'tai gi's pantepit.
That jar over there is already open.

Panteteg na ga'qan?
Is that door open?

pan'tqa'sit.translation: He/she comes running out of the woods
meanings: come running out of the woods
comes running out into the open
example:
Sa'q algwilaqat, jensi nipugtug wejpan'tqa'sit.
We were looking for him/her for a long time, suddenly he/she
came running out of the woods.

Jipji'j na pantuna'sit te's ungi'gul gigja'snij.
A baby bird opens its mouth whenever its parent is near.

Telpa'qalaig, lpa pantunepit.
He/she is so surprise, he/she has his/her mouth agape.

Telpa'qalaig nutmateg, lpa gjitmei pantuno'jing.
He/She was so surprised when he/she heard the news, his/her
mouth really was gaping open.

Gina'sit etlpanuijgatg utepaqan.
He/she is busy going through everything in his/her car.

panuijgo'latl.translation: He/she examines him/her/it in an inquisitive manner
example:
Panuijgo'l'g'tjig ula napui'gigng gatu mnaq we'jitueg ta'n goqwei
algwilmeg.
We have dug through these photographs but have not found what
we are looking for.

panuijgo'tasit.translation: He/she examines in an inquisitive manner
example:
Wetme'g panuijgo'tasit, mu geitug ta'n goqwei algwilg.
He/she is busy searching for something, he/she doesn't know what
he/she is searching for.

papga'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her down the coast
example:
Gisgug papga'latl gisigu'l, me' mnaq to'q wejienigul papge'g.
Today he/she is taking the old man down the coast, he has never 
gone there before.

papga'lugwet.translation: He/she drifts down the coast (by water)
example:
Negmaq papga'lugwepnaq sepei.
He/she drifted down the coast this morning.

Egsitpu'nug egsitpugia'titesnen ta'n telpapgitaieg.
Tomorrow morning we will leave early to go down river.

papga'toq.translation: He/she takes it down the coast
example:
Teluet getu' papga'toq ta'n te's'g ligpenigan gisitoq.
He/she says that he/she wants to take every basket he/she makes
down river.

Ula nitape'sw tleiawit papge'g.
My friend is from down the coast.

papge'gewa'j.translation: A person from down the coast
example:
Telte'tm migwite'tmaqal uggwitl na papge'gewa'j.
I think I remember the mother of that person from down the coast.

papge'gewi'sgw.translation: A female from down the coast
example:
Ula papge'gewi'sgw alguiluatl ugtlamugsisl.
This woman from down the coast is looking for her uncle.

Nuji'j gesatg papij.
My grandchild likes to play by herself.

Ula papitaqan sa'qawei, gatu me' newte' telie'was'g.
This toy is old, but it is still in use.

Ugjua'lates na pa'pnji'j gesgmnaq poqti'sewewun.
Fill the bobbin before you start sewing.

Papqwa'tueg masgwi.
We strip off birchbark from the birch tree.

Papuaqan mesgi'g unaqiatew ta'n telinqase'g gtapegiewinu'g
peita'tij.
Big fun will begin as soon as the singers arrive.

paqaiatgweitesing.translation: He/she falls flat on a surface
meanings: slam into the ground  or other surface
example:
Wen gispaqaiatgweitesing?
Who fell flat on the ground?

Paqaiatgweitesmatl amgwanji'tl aq poqjimajia'qteget.
He/she slams down the spoon and begins to scold.

Jel tmg paqaiatgweitestoq ugtgaliputim toqsi'p teluet, "enmiei".
First he/she slams down his/her shovel and says, "I'm going home".

Tetujipa'qala'ig lpa pas'g gaqamit aq pantuno'jing.
He/she was so surprised that he/she just stood there with his/her
mouth open.

Pe'l mesgi'g pa'qalaiwaqan amsgweseweieg nutmateg.
There was a lot of surprise when he/she first heard about it.

Ugtue'm gisipqa'lit sepei.
Your dog bit me this morning.

Nti maljewe'j aq me' paqa'luet.
My dog is young and he/she still bites.

Gigjipa'qamajeiwatl pile'l ugtue'ml.
He/She closely examines his new animal.

Angweiu, ula na ji'nm mawpa'qamajo'tg ms't goqwei.
You have to careful of that guy, he's very meddlesome with
everything.

Pa'tlia's pas'g pa'qapugua'latl wenn aqantie'umg nige'.
The priest just hears confessions on Sundays now.

Etlagnutmaie'g, gestleiaqap natgoqwei getu' pa'qapuguatg.
As we were talking I got a real sense that there was something
he/she wanted to confess.

Enmietaq a's'tuo'guomg, telwet ajpa'qapuguet.
He/she is gone to the church, said he/she was going to confess.

Pa'qapuguo'ti'l pas'g pemiaql Gesp'teg.
The confessions are only done on Saturday.

paqasa'latl.translation: He/she places him/her/it in the water
example:
Uggwisl paqasa'latl sipug, toqosi'p telimatl nige' gegina'mul tgismin.
He/she puts his/her son in the river, then tells him/her now I will
teach you to swim.

paqasaqalatl.translation: He/she throws him/her in the water
example:
Lpa paqasaqalatl ugtue'ml sitmug
He/she actually threw his/her pet into the water at the beach.

paqasaqtoq.translation: He/she throws it in the water
example:
Pe' tmg samugwane'l mila'suaqann paqasaqtoqol toqotuji'p negm
sangew egwija'sit.
First he/she threw in the water toys, then he/she slowly went into
the water.

Nti pegisulgeg qospemg lpa smtug paqasa'sit aq poqta'q.
When we arrived at the lake my dog went right into the water and
started swimming.

paqasa'toq.translation: He/she puts it in the water
example:
Gisgug paqasa'toq pilei ugtul.
Today he/she will launch his/her boat.

Poqjinujguma'q mgumi na mawinsanoqon paqasiemg.
When the ice starts to melt is the most dangerous time for falling
into the water.

meanings: cause to fall into water, river or lake
example:
Pe'l paqaste'map ntul gesgmnaq niwetestnug.
I'm going to launch my boat before the tide goes out.

pa'qastmat.translation: He/she easily picks up news and gossip
meanings: easily pick up news and gossip
example:
Mali na negm mawpa'qastmat ta'n teliaq ula tet.
Mary, shes the one who knows all the latest news here.

Te's goqwei seggw paqa'toq, na welgwijing.
Every time he/she bites into something sweet, he/she is happy.

Elgigto'qiepnaq enm'pa'qe'g.
He/she went rolling downhill.

Paqo'si nigweg sitmug.
Seaweed grows down by the shore.

paqsipgeitelua'tl.translation: He/she shot and kills him/her/it instantly
meanings: shoot and kill instantly (with gun or bow and arrow)
example:
A' na nige' wen paqsipgeitelua'tl igtigl?
Okay, so who shot and instantly killed the other one?

Ge's etlpaqsipgelmitj lpa ugtsaqpigu'un guta'tigl.
He/she was laughing so hard his/her tears started to flow.

Ta'n tujiw mijua'ji'j jipaga'sij na paqsipgetemit.
When the child is scare he/she will bursts out crying.

Ta'n getu tami elien paqtaqamigt, uliangamgutew.
No matter where you go in the wilderness, it will look wonderful.

Paqtaqamigtug aligs'go'ltipnig, gatu sepei we'ju't'pnig.
They were lost in a deserted area, but this morning they were
found.

Pilei wenji'guom paqtaqawa'q ge's sigue'g.
A new house is echoey while its empty.

Tepgunset paqtasep wela'gwe'g.
The moon was shining bright last night.

Nisego'tuann legepilaqann, telo'tm wasampaqtateg.
I am pulling down the window shades, I find it's way too bright.

Gi's ap poqjipugweliet paqtesm ula gm'tginug.
There are beginning to be a greater number of wolves here in our
territory.

Gisgug tewjima'munpaqtlusg'teg lpa pesetu'n sisgu.
Today the tide is so low that you can even smell the mud.

Ta'sigisg'tew Paqtngeg wesgowita'ioq?
How many days will you (pl.) spend in Afton?

Mu newtugwa'lugwegw paqt'sm ta'n tujiw getantoq wilu.
A wolf won't hunt alone for his/her food.

paqtuneitesing.translation: He/she falls flat on the face
example:
Ge's So'sep pemipqamij na paqtuneitesing.
While Joseph was skating along he fell flat on his face.

Metue'g ta'n telpma'timg muta telpasaliteg.
It's hard to get around becuase the snow is so deep.

Nuta't tmasaqte'mugsin ula lpa'tuj, wasampasaltugwat.
This boy needs to have his hair cut, his hair is just too thick.

Mimajuinu ta'n pasatapat ma' gis sa'se'wa'tuawt ta'n teliangita'sij.
A person who is thick headed, you can't change their way of
thinking.

Lasqo'plaw ta'n welpase'g gwiluanej.
Let us look for a plank that is nice and thick.

Pas'g gi'l jugu'a.
Only you come here.

Mut e'waw na malige'w, pasge'g, ma goqwei gnnmug.
Don't use that barrel, it is busted, it won't hold anything.

Mu na gene'nug pasgesetmat.
It doesn't take long before he/she lights up.

pasg'g.translation: He/she/it sits or lies on it
example:
Sa'q uggwat pasg'g, nige' sa'qati'ju'aq.
He/she has been sitting on his/her foot for a long time, now it feels
like pins and needles.

Wen gispasgija'latl ntue'ml?
Who ran over my dog?

Goqwei wesgo'tg, etlpasgija'toq?
What is it that he/she is squeezing?

So'sep ugtatla'iml gisipejpasgina'latl.
Joseph accidently ripped his shirt.

Wen gispasgina'toq na wi'gatign?
Who tore up that paper?

Talgis pasgine'g ula atla'wegn?
Why is this fabric torn?

P'teweio'q enqalg's gujmug toqo waju'pes samuqwan,
etlpasginoqjing.
I didn't realize that I left the tea pot outside and that it was full of
water, the water freezing cracked it.

pasginoqsit.translation: It (plank) is cracked from excessive heat.
example:
Tewjip'sit epsaqtejg lpa pasginoqsit p'teweio'q.
The stove was so hot, the teapot cracked.

pasginoqteg.translation: It is cracked from excessive heat
example:
Na gatu amsgwes nemitu plu'jaqamati pasginoqteg!
Now that is the first time I see a mirror crack from heat!

pasgipiasit.translation: It(plank) splits or cracks from dryness
example:
Tetuji sa'qewei ula nnuoqta'w lpa nugu' pasgipiasit.
This statue is so old, it has cracked from dryness.

pasgipiateg.translation: It is split or crack from dryness
example:
Nsi'l tewji gispategl, lpa pasgipiategl.
My lips are so dry, they are cracking (from the dryness).

pasgoqjing.translation: It (bottle) is cracked or split from excessive cold
example:
Pu'tai enqalg'snaq gujmug, aq pasgoqjingaq.
I accidently left a bottle outside, and it shattered from freezing.

Ugsua'lanej ula glitaq aq ltunej pasgoqsign.
Let's take these berries and make jam.

Ntp'teweio'gm gispasgoqsit.
My teapot cracked from over heating.

Pgumann pasgoqtegl ta'n tujiw pgumanei pasgoqsign eltmg.
Blueberries burst open from the heat when making blueberry jam.

pasgoqt'g.translation: It cracks or splits from excessive cold
example:
Tetujitge'g lpa mgumi pasgoqt'g.
It's so cold that the ice all cracks.

Gisigu pasg'sa'latl utmaqann.
The old man lights up his pipe.

Ala gispategl aps'ta's'gl ewe'n pasg'sa'tun pugtew.
Use those chopped up dried kindling when you light the fire.

Gisigu pasg'sematl utmaqann.
The old man lights his pipe.

Newt gs'talg na sangew pa'sitew aq pasg'setmatew.
Once he/she has eaten then he/she will relax and have a smoke.

pasg'setmuatl.translation: He/she lights up (a cigarette or pipe) for him/her
example:
Tmg Pie'l pasg'setmuatl So'sepal utmaqann toqosi'p gmu'j
apajiga'toq pugtewigtug.
First Pierre lights Joseph's pipe then he puts the stick back into the
fire.

meanings: pop (as log on fire or as corn)
example:
Mu pewatmu'n pugsug ta'n pasg'teg muta pusalji'tl alaqs'tal.
You don't want wood that pops because cinders will fly about.

Jijuaqa wajupeg pugsug, na pa'sg'teg pugtewigtug
Sometimes the firewood is so moist, it expodes in the fire.

pasguatl.translation: He/she/it has his/her/its weight on him/her/it
example:
Ango'te'n ta'n telpa'sin, mu getu pasguawt.
Be careful how you sit down, you don't want to put your weight
on him/her/it.

Ala' na ji'nm eig maw pasi'tuat.
That man over there is very thick bearded.

Wesampaspit wesgijiamugua'taqan ula pata'utigtug.
The paint is too thick on this table.

passoqsatl.translation: He/she thickens it by boiling or cooking
example:
Siawoqs na pgu, amujpa gijga' me' passoqs't.
Continue to cook that fudge, you have to make it a bit thicker.

Amujpa ula lpa'tuj temasaqte'mut muta wesam pastegl usapunn.
This boy has to have his hair cut because it is too thick.

Nunji tewjigsnuguig lpa getu' pastesg.
My head aches so badly it feels like it's about to burst.

Segapja'si, pastesintew na nisegen.
Grasp it tightly, it will burst if you drop it.

Newt ula lgowaqan gaqiaq etug apatlugwei ap pastung.
Once this work is over I think I'll go back to work in the United
States.

Pastungewa'gi eliei sapo'nug.
Tomorrow I 'm going to the U.S.A.

Pastungewa'j oqwa'tew sapo'nug.
The American will arrive tomorrow.

Ula na pastungewi'sgw ta'n pegising'p sepei.
This is the American woman who arrived this morning.

Nnjan patalapit.
My child is cross·eyed.

patanapjit.translation: He/she is holding with the left hand
example:
Patanapjitl tu'aqann.
He/she holds the ball with his/her left hand.

Patatujg lasgnmu muta patang na negm.
Hand it to him/her on the left side because he/she is left-handed.

meanings: item used for or  by left hand
example:
Negm e'w'g patanjuei ta'n tujiw e'wi'gej.
He/she uses his/her left hand when he/she writes.

Wijig'tijig aq gitg patanmijig.
They are siblings and both are left handed.

Pas'g Se'sus gisi apigsigtltal gpata'taqannml.
Only Jesus can forgive you of your sins.

Mijua'ji'j pata'teget? Moqwa', mijua'ji'j na mu pata'tegegw.
Does a child sin? No, a child does not sin.

Amujpa na we'jitmg ta'n teliapigsigtuj pata'tegewinu.
One has to find a way to forgive a sinner.

Ge' gi'l e'we'n na patatuj.
Will you use the left one.

Ge' gi'l ngopa'si patatujg.
You go sit on the left side.

Patatujge'g llia.
Go leftward.

Ge'gutnaqatug pgisi'n, patatujge'l ligtuapsites.
When you get to the top, go leftward.

Mut wanta'siw pata'wti lugwatmn.
Don't forget to set the table.

Je jugwa'tui newte' patawtiewegn?
Would you bring me one tablecloth?

Pa'tlia's etlia'sutmat patgulme'sigaqanigtug.
The priest is praying at the alter.

Pa'tlia's pegising te's aqantie'umg aq alame'siget.
The priest arrives every Sunday and celebrates mass.

Lpa mu nugu' eimu'ti'gw pa'tlia'si'sgwaq Listugujg.
There are no more nuns living in Listuguj anymore.

Ula pa'tliatji'j teluisit So'sep.
This (religious order) brother's name is Joseph.

Newtisga'q jel lluigneg te'sugunit Si'gowigu's na Pa'tligs'te'wumg.
The seventeenth of March is Saint Patrick's Day.

Ula negm na maw pawa'sit
His/she is the slowest one of all.

Mu wen eimug ta'n pawnigwet ula Listugujg.
There's no one who tans hides here in Listuguj.

Pe' esgipe'ii, mutt tami liew.
Hold on, wait for me, don't go anywhere.

Emma gesatg pegaja'laj ugtapsute'gann.
Emma likes to keep her doll neat.

Pana ne'gaw na telqamigsit, pegaja'toq ta'n te's'g goqwei elugwatg.
He/she has always been that way, every single thing he/she does is
done properly.

Me' gatu pegaje'g na lpa'tuj.
My that boy is neat and tidy.

pegajeiwatl.translation: He/she/it keeps him/her/it in good shape or condition
meanings: keep in good shape or condition
example:
Emma pegajeiwatl ugtapsute'gann.
Emma keeps her doll in good shape.

Negm ultetew ugtlugowaqan, muta pegajilugwet.
His/her work will be good, because he/she works neatly.

pegajo'tg.translation: He/she keeps it in good shape or condition
meanings: keep in good shape or condition
example:
Pegajo'tg ta'n we'gwigisipgwatoq ta'n te's'g utapsun.
He/she is as careful as he/she can be with all of his/her possessions.

Nige' nutai pega'g plegu.
Now I need a straight nail.

Newtigisg'g t'pgwanigtug etlmila'sit, lpa nugu pegaqamqiet.
He/she had been playing all day in the dirt, now he/she is
completely grimy.

Amujpa pegatnmai ta'n poqjinewta'ma'p, mu' wen eimug ta'n
lsu'tmua's.
I have to keep things neat and tidy now that I live alone, I have no
one to blame the mess on.

Mali wiguow na maw pegatteg.
Mary's home is always so neat.

Te'sigisg'g newt gisipgijoqwa'toq maqasan, gijga'pegaja'teget.
Each day once the store is closed, he/she tidies up a bit.

Pegije'g na we'gaw ula gitapenu ap'ja'sij.
It's taking a long time for our friend to return.

pegijiesgmalatl.translation: He/she waits for him/her/it a long time
example:
E'e, pegijiesgmalg'p, gatu glapis oqwa't.
Yes, I waited a long time for him/her, but eventually he/she
arrived/landed/docked.

pegijiesgmatg.translation: He/she waits a long time for it
example:
Pegijiesgmatg na ugtsuliewaim.
He/she is waiting for his/her money for a long time

pegijipnet.translation: He/she suffers from a long term illness
example:
Go'gwejijl na wen geggunaj, na maw pegijipnet
When one has cancer, they suffer a long time.

Ngwis, Lola pegising sepei.
My son Lawrence arrived this morning.

pegisitoq.translation: He/she brings or arrives with it
example:
Eig wen ta'n gisiapoqonmuitew pisgo'tu ula tawoqwei pegisitu?
Is there anyone who can help me carry in the stuff that I brought?

pegisulatl.translation: He/she brings or arrives with him/her/it
example:
Atel nige' pegisulatl witapal.
He/she just now brought his/her friend.

meanings: take a long time to unfold
example:
Pegitapegsig na ula a'tugwaqan.
My, this is a long story!

pegitapematl.translation: He/she is useful to him/her for a long time
example:
Pegitapematl na wi'sisl gisine'pa'tl, te's'g tawoqwei weja'tuaj.
He/she has had a lot of use from that animal he/she slew, he/she
has gotten so many things from it.

pegitapetg.translation: It is useful to him/her for a long time
example:
Me' gatu pegitapetg na gwitn, lpa te'sigisg'g e'w'g.
He/she gotten a lot of use out of that canoe, he/she uses it daily.

Gtigiwela'gwe'g pegitapiap.
I stayed up late the other night.

Nmuj na mawpegitawsit.
A dog lives a long life.

Ugjo'tes gisgug mu ugsamipgitewo'gwen.
Today I will try not to speak for too long.

Ula nitap na mawinta'pe'gitnet.
My friend here has frequent nose bleeds.

Gesitlo'tm pegitqatm, gatu atel ulagu pegisin.
It feels like I've been here a long time, but I only arrived yesterday.

Nugu' na pegittemit e'pite'ji'j ujjl maja'sinnij.
The little girl cries a long time when her father goes away.

pegittoq.translation: He/she/it is taking a long time to return
meanings: is taking a long time to return
example:
Ula nitap na maw pegittoq ta'n tujiw tami eliej.
My friend here takes a long time whenever he/she goes anywhere.

Pegn'g ta'n elien, nespne'n ula wasoqonmaqan.
It is dark where you are going, take this candle with you.

Na toqosi'p welpegoqsit ula matjoqtelign.
Now this arrow is really straight.

Mut sama'tu, peguig st'ge' ta'n goqwei!
Don't touch it, it is as sticky as anything!

Gisimaliapt'g gastio'mi, nige' peguit.
He/she has been playing with molasses, now he/she is sticky.

meanings: clean dress or gut (as fish, chicken)
example:
We'gwipugwelgig ula gaqpesaq gisipegwaja'l'gig.
I have just gutted a large amount of smelts.

pe'gwamatl.translation: He/she is pleased to see him/her/it again after a long time
meanings: pleased to see again after a long time
example:
So'sep pe'gwmamatl witapal, gi's sa'q nu nemiagul.
Joseph was pleased to see his friend, its been long since he seen
him.

pe'gwamu'g.translation: It is nice to see again after a long time (has passed)
meanings: it is nice to see again after a long time
example:
Nitap teluet pe'gwamu'g Listuguj,
My friend says it is nice to see Listuguj again after a long time.

pe'gwamugsit.translation: It is nice to see him/her/it again after a long time (has passed)
meanings: it is nice to see again after a long time
example:
Miamuj pe'gwamugsit, tewji sa'q mu nemi'tiwoq.
I guess it is nice to see him/her again, you haven't seen each other
for such a long time.

pegwang.translation: He/she/it is able to lift the weight of it
meanings: able to lift the weight of
example:
Me' pegwanm gmu'j gismawsa'tegen.
I can still lift the firewood to keep the fire going.

pe'gwapt'g.translation: He/she is pleased to see it again after a long time
meanings: is pleased to see again after long time
example:
Lpa pe'gwapt'g wi'g, tewgisa'q maja'sit.
He/she is really pleased to see his/her home, he/she has been gone
so long.

Gisipgwatelg pilei utepaqan.
He/she has just purchased a new car.

Negm apjiw pegwateliget ugjit ms't wenn Nuelewumg.
He/she is the purchaser for everyone at Christmas time.

Amgwes Tio'tis pegwateluatl pile'l aswega'taq'n.
This is the first time Eunice buys a new coat.

Negm telta'sit pegwatoq ta'n telgigpesaq.
He/she thinks he/she caused it to rain.

pegwigwalatl.translation: He/she is able to pry it loose
example:
Pegije'g wesgowa'sit, gatu glapis pgu'l pegwigwalatl.
He/she worked on it a long time, but at last he/she was able to pry
the gum loose.

pegwigwatg.translation: He/she is able to pry it loose
example:
Waqqaj pegwigwatmeg ntulninen ta'njiw apjimoqtesgeg
guntewigtug.
We barely were able to pry our boat loose when it got stuck on
the rocks.

Smtug pegwi'satl ugtatla'ieml.
He immediately patches his shirt./She immediately patches her
shirt.

Getupgwi'sm smtug muta wanta'suatesg.
I want to patch it right away otherwise I will forget to do it.

Gaqapeigwapit, lpa mu' we'jitug.
He/she looked all over, he/she just couldn't find it.

Tuma gaqipeigwaqatg ula Listugujg.
Thomas has stayed here and there in Listuguj.

Gisgug piltuamugwa'tu na pejigisgiaq.
Today I'm changing the color of that ceiling.

pejigluluet.translation: He comes to ask permission from parents to marry their daughter
meanings: comes to ask permission from parents to marry their daughter
example:
Poligap pejigluluep ugjit ntusl ugpitn.
Paul came to ask for my daughter's hand.

Suel pejigu'ta'tl, gatu mesnapnn gesgmnaq nisiennigweg.
He/she almost knocked him/her/it over, but caught him/her/it
before he/she/it fell.

Lpa'tu'ji'j pejigu'te'g la'sguei wenji'guom.
The little boy accidently knocked down a house of cards.

Ge's etlmila'ti'tij ugjignaml, na pejijing'ja'lut.
While he/she was playing with his/her brother, he/she got squeezed
unintentionally.

meanings: arrive unannounced or unexpectedly or by surprise
example:
Pa'qala'iwit na ngwis pejila'siteg wela'gwe'g.
My son surprised me last night with an unexpected visit.

Pejilugwet tet, ulagu atel oqwa'p.
He/she is here to work, he/she just arrived yesterday.

Peji'pit te'siegsitpu'g, najip'teweie'mat.
He/she drops in every morning, for tea.

Pejipug, gatu ma' na gne'nug siggwitew.
Winter has arrived, but before you know it will be spring time.

Pastung na wejiet, Listugujg pejipunmit te'sipug.
He/she comes from the U.S.A, and comes to Listuguj to
experience winter every year.

pejipunsit.translation: He/she comes here to spend winter
example:
Te's Wigmgewigu's Tuma pejipunsit ula Listugujg.
Every September Thomas arrives in Listuguj for the winter.

Ge'sg alnenaqa'si suel peji'taqamai.
As I was rushing about, I almost tripped.

peji'taqane'ita'tl.translation: He/she slaps him/her on the neck
example:
Lpa jiniw Pita peji'taqane'ita'tl ugjignaml ge's etlgi'gaja'sinij.
Peter suddenly slapped the back of his brother's neck while he
was arguing with him.

Gisipejitmsatl a'papi'l.
He/she just accidentally cut the rope.

Ango'te'n, mu getu pejitmsmu'n gtluign.
Be careful, you don't want to accidentally cut your finger.

pejiwsit.translation: He/she moves here to settle down
example:
Ne'gaw telta'siap pas'g natmitugwet, u'ta pana pejiwsit.
All this time I thought that he/she was just here for a visit, but
he/she has moved here to settle down.

Mali pejo'laji witapaq wiguwaq.
Mary brings her friends to her home.

Ula etlgispasewet pejoqsatl ugtalaiml.
This one doing the drying accidently burns his/her shirt.

Gis pejoqs'g ugtpitn ge's maligo'tg pugtew.
He/she has accidently burned his/her hand while playing with fire.

Gisgug pejo'toql mutputi'l.
Today he/she brings the chairs.

Waspu'g na to'q mawwigpa'tiji peju'g.
Seal apparently really like to eat codfish.

Egsitpugwiep sepei, naj'pejue'getaq.
He/she left early this morning, to fish for cod.

Gisgug pejuei gis wissugwaieg
Today we cooked the codfish.

Gisipguatu'n pe'l esgma, ma' pgijeiu.
If you can help it wait a while, I won't be long.

Pelagwet na me' pegitawsit aq mimajuinu.
A parrot lives longer than a person.

Gi'sipela'latl ugti'l ta'n tujiw maja'siteg
He/she forgot his/her pet when he/she left.

Telte'tg natgoqwei pela'toq, pas'g mu migwite'tmug tawoqwei.
He/she thinks he/she has forgotten something, but can't remember
what it could be.

Sangew etlpelgoqo'latl ne'gasgi'gnn.
He/she is slowly peeling a log.

Sangew pelgoqa'toq wenju'su'n.
Slowly he/she peels the apple.

Na'nieg wesgowitaieg, etlpelgo'qiga'tieg.
There are five of us doing the debarking.

pelgoqsatl.translation: He/she peels something animate with a knife
example:
Gujmug etlplgoqsatl wenju'sugapunn.
He/she is peeling a turnip with a knife outside.

Ninen ntlugowaqaninen na pelgoqsewa'utieg.
Our job is to peel.

pelgoqs'g.translation: He/she peels it with a knife
example:
Nasgua'tatinej lugowaqan, ni'n a'qataig pelgoqsm aq gi'l a'qataig
pelgoqsmn.
Let us share the work evenly, I peel half and you peel half.

pelgoqta'tl.translation: He/she strips it(tree) off with a sharp tool
example:
Sa'q wesgowa'sit etlpelgoqta'tl na tmoqta'wul, tmi'gn e'w'g.
He/she has been striping the bark off that log with an axe for a
long time.

pelgoqte'g.translation: He/she strips it off with a sharp tool
example:
Pe' l pelgoqte'g gmu'j ge's mu eltug tmi'gnatgw.
First he/she strips the wood before he/she makes an axe handle.

Pelqa'latl psaqa'gul.
He/she peels the bark.

We'gwimesgi'g ugjigi wejipelqa'toq uggwatg.
What a large scab he/she just peeled off of his/her foot.

Me' gatu pelsit na ula pent.
This paint is very thick.

Mu ge'itu tepian ta'n telpelteg, gatu ta'n tujiw na guta'tu'g nmitesnu.
I don't know if it is thick enough, but when we pour it we will be
able to tell.

Pe'l ap ta'n tujiw apaja'ti'gw, siawa'tesnu ula.
Whenever we come back, we'll continue with this.

Pe'l tmg gi'l lia.
You go first.

Tapusieg pema'gwi'tegeieg aq mu geitueg ta'n ela'tieg.
There are two of us steering and we don't know where we're
going.

Ala negm pema'latl wowl, pipanim.
That person over there carrying the pot, ask him/her.

Te'siegsitpu'g nemi'g pemamgwe'get.
Every morning I see him/her poling along here.

pemanatl.translation: He/she is in the process of doing away with him/her/it
example:
Gisigu pemanajig apigji'jg.
The old man is doing away with the mice.

pemang.translation: He/she is in the process of doing away with it
example:
Mawiansue'g wen goqwei pemang.
It is always sad when someone is in the process of destroying
something.

Me' pemanguaieg, apataqte'multesg ta'njiw gaqanguaieg.
We're still peddling along, I'll call you back when we are done.

Tewja'sit nitap, pas pemapaqtesgeg utepaqaneg.
My friend is going so fast, his/her car just seemed to streak by.

Jini'w ge'sg pemiei, pemapaqtesingaq!
Suddenly as I was going along, he/she/it streaked by!

pemapaqto'sit.translation: He/she is going along splashing self
example:
Lpa'tu'ji'j pemiet aq pemapaqto'sit sitmug.
The little boy is going along at the beach and splashing himself.

Gi'lewei na ula mijua'ji'j pemapegit?
Is this your child crawling along?

pemapilatl.translation: He/she is carrying him/her along in hand
meanings: carry along in hand (by of rope, handle, etc.)
example:
Mali pemapilatl pile'l ugtapsute'gann.
Mary is carrying her new doll along.

pemapilawet.translation: He/she is carrying by rope or handle
meanings: carry by scruff of neck (as cat)
example:
Pemapilawet no'q gesgujaq tawoqwei pemapilg.
The person carrying (by handle) is carrying something very heavy.

pemapilg.translation: He/she carries it along in hand by rope or handle
meanings: carry along in hand (by rope, handle, etc.)
example:
Nitap wejgu'et aq pemapilg mijipjewei.
My friend is headed this way and he/she is carrying some food.

Wen na ala pema'q?
Who is that swimimg along?

Tewapa'sianeg lpa mu nenmu tawoqwei pemaqs'g.
When I looked out the window I couldn't at all recognize what
was flying by.

Ge' ala pemaqteget, segi'nn gis nasa'lasna ugtulg.
Look at him/her sailing by, he/she has attached a sail to his/her
boat.

Nulugs na negm apjiw pematalg.
My nephew, he always eats on the go.

As'gom te'sijig pema'tega'tijig.
There are six pallbearers.

Ala lpa'tu'ji'j lpa pematejimatl ugti'l.
That little boy is practically dragging his dog along.

Plasua pematejitoq ugpugsugm.
Frank is dragging his firewood along.

Goqwei ta na ala pema'toq.
What is that he/she is carrying.

pematpe'pit.translation: He/she is running along with head abobbing
example:
Gi's ntus pematpe'pit.
My daughter is already running along with her head abobbing.

Elatqegigtug pema'timg na telui'tm'g pematqaiei.
When one is walking through a thicket one would say: pematqaiei
(I am walking through a thicket).

pemawlalatl.translation: He/she carrys him/her along on the back
example:
Gisigu pemawlalatl ugti'l.
The old man is carrying his dog on his back.

pemawlatg.translation: He/she carries it along on the back
example:
Gi's ap So'sep najiwsget, muta umigg'n pemawlatg.
Joseph is going fishing again, because he's carrying his fishing gear
on his back.

Mu assma geitug ta'n telialteja'laj, gatu pemeiwatl, giseiwatal na
glapis.
He/she doesn't really know how to operate it, but he/she is figuring
it out (by operating it), he/she will be able to do it properly at
some point in the future.

pemelmit.translation: He/she is passing by and laughing
example:
Gejigow ula Pie'lo'q pemelmipnaq.
Pierre passed by laughing a while ago.

Gisipgwatoq pmg'tew gesgmnaq ula newtipunqeg gaqianug.
If he/she can help it, he/she will have passed it before the end of
this year.

Gesigawigwet na ula Ji'me'j, gi's ugsisl pemguatl ta'n telpitoqsinij.
James is growing fast, he's already passed the hight of his older
brother.

Gina'sit pemgwi't'g na gwitn muta maqatgwig.
He/she has to work hard to steer that canoe because of the big
waves.

Te'sigisg'g na'n ajiet pemiaq.
It goes by every day at five.

Ula gitape'sgw pemiet.
Your girlfriend is going by.

Wejo'tg gsigawa'sin, gatu ejela'toq, pemigegwi'pit.
He/she tries to go fast, but can't help it, he/she goes along slowly.

Wejgwateja'lut ala San-Pie'l aqq utepaqan pemigp'ta'q.
John-Peter is driving towards us and his car is blowing smoking.

Ula maljewe'j pemiet teliawanigtmat, pas'g pemigp'ta't.
The youngster walking by smokes so awkwardly, he/she is just
making smoke.

pemijajiga'sit.translation: He/she is moving or walking along the shore
example:
Sepei Pie'l nemi'g'p sitmug pemjajiga'sit.
I saw Pierre going along the shore this morning.

pemijajigisugwit.translation: He/she is paddling along the shore
example:
Plasua pemijajigisugwit ala qospemji'jg.
Frank is paddling along that small lake.

pemiji'met.translation: He/she is paddling or rowing along
example:
Aqantie'uti pmiji'm'titaq.
They will be paddling along for a week.

pemimqapsgeg.translation: It is becoming larger and rounder
example:
Npipnaqanm pemimqapsgeg, na weliapita'q.
My bread is becoming large and round, it's rising well.

pemimqapsg'sit.translation: He/she is becoming larger and rounder
example:
Pemimqapsg'sijig nugu ula glitaq, mgnanej.
These berries are really getting big and round, let's pick them.

Pemtesgasit aq pemintoq.
He/she is going along cycling and singing.

Te's nemi'g Pa'tlig na pemi'pit, etna amuj gsatmutug ali'pij.
Each time I see Patrick he's running along, he must like running
around.

pemipqamig.translation: It is sliding or coasting along
example:
Pemipqamig na tepaqan aq mu' wen teppigw.
The sled is sliding along and nobody is onboard.

pemipqamit.translation: He/she is coasting or skating along
example:
Pemipqamianeg telaqtmulnap npitn gatu mu nemi'wt'p.
When I went skating by I waved at you but you didn't see me.

Sitmug pemi'pugwet So'sep, ta'n tami ugjietug?
Joseph is staggering along the shore, where could he have come
from?

Igatne'suinu pemi'puluet awtigtug.
The jocky is riding along the road.

Pe'l apoqonmulnap pemqama'sin, telsesupe'g tet.
Let me help you as you stand up, it is so slippery here.

Pemisiawaqtegetaq ula, telteg'pneg mgnin.
S\he just went sailing by, s\he was supposed to pick me up.

Pemisiawa'sit na ula gitapinu aq mu naqa'sigw.
Our friend is passing by and not stopping.

pemisiawtemit.translation: He/she is passing by and crying
example:
Gi's pana wijei e'pite'ji'j pemsiawtemit.
That same little girl is going by crying again.

pemisqoqitugwi'g.translation: He/she is running up the hill
example:
Nigatne'suinu pemisqoqitugwi'g aq nis'tugwi'g te'sigisg'g.
The runner runs up and down the mountain everyday.

Pemisuwianeg nemi'g'pnig sitmug peita'jig.
As I paddled by I saw them arrive at the beach.

Etug ta'sipunqeg pemit ula sipu?
I wonder how many years this river has been flowing by.

Gi's ap pemitge'g.
It's getting cold again.

Gesitlo'tm pemitgiaq, pe' epsaqtejg najiangamg'p, etugjel pugtew
peminqasua's'g.
I find it is getting chilly, I'll go check the stove, maybe the fire is
dying out.

Anguna na mijua'ji'j, pemitgiet.
Cover that child, he/she is getting cold.

Je gi's pemtma's'g mgumi aq pas'g nige' Apignajit.
The ice is already breaking up and it's only February.

Angweiu, pemitma'sit na etlie'w't.
Be careful, the one you are using is starting to break off.

Na nige' ne'wewa'j nemi'g pemitqoju'tugwi'g.
Now that's the fourth one I've seen runing up the stairs.

So'sep pemiwigwa'smugwet awti'gug.
Joseph is whistling along the road.

Nemi't ala sqolj pemja't
See that frog hopping along?

pemji'malatl.translation: He/she is paddling or rowing him/her along
example:
Mali pemji'malatl witape'sgwal.
Mary is rowing her friend along

pemji'matg.translation: He/she is paddling or rowing it along
example:
Malia'n aq Sapatis pemji'matmi'tij gwitn, pi'tawa'tijig.
Marian and Jean Baptiste are paddling the canoe along on their
way up the coast.

pemji'met.translation: He/she is paddling or rowing along
example:
Gesigawa'sit newtugwa'lugwet pemji'met.
S\he is going fast, paddling along by her\himself.

Gi's ap peml'ga't na wijei ji'nm.
That same man  is walking along again.

Ulagu gisa'tuap aq poqtlugweg'p, aq gisgug me' pemlugweg.
I fixed it yesterday and it began working, and today it's still
working along.

Nemi'g'pnaq awtigtug pemlugwet, miti'ji'jg pemtmastaqta'pni.
I saw him/her working along the road, he/she was trimming small
trees.

pemn'galatl.translation: He/she is carrying him/her on the shoulder
example:
Tala'teget gti, pemn'galt.
What is wrong with your dog, why are you carrying your dog on
your shoulders.

pemn'gatg.translation: He/she is carrying it on his/her shoulder
example:
Ge' apoqnmu ala ji'nm mpo'qon pemn'gatg.
Would you help that man carrying a bed on his shoulder.

pemn'get.translation: He/she is going by with a shoulder pack
example:
Plasua so'qwiet aq pemn'get.
Frank is going up the mountain with a shoulder pack.

Pana ne'gaw na tele'g, ma na newte'gtnug ta'qwei pemo'tg
newtsini'w.
He/she has always been like that, he/she will always be doing
more than one thing at a time.

Pempa'q na ula, me' glu'gt'tew jaqaliasoqoma'ti'gw.
The tide is rising, it would be better if we go across fast.

pempa'sit.translation: He/she is in the process of sitting down
example:
Ala nemi't pempa'sit, na negm getu'glult.
See that person over there about to sit down, that is the one you
want to speak to.

Pempega's'g me' na ula ntul, amuj na espeg.
The water is still rising in my boat, there must be a leak.

Ula samqwan ta'n pempegitg mejigapua'q.
This water that is flowing along is dirty.

Gejigow nemi'g'pnaq sitmug pempilg ugtul.
I saw him\her down the shore a while ago towing his\her boat
along.

Pas'g ne'w ajiet aq gi's pem'pisgiaq.
It's just four o'clck and it's already dusk

pempugua'sit.translation: He/she is starting to get on his/her feet
meanings: start to recover from bad times
example:
Atel pempugua'sij, ap sesupa'lugwetaq.
As s/he starts to get her/his footing, s/he begins to slip again.

pemqo'gwet.translation: He/she is floating or drifting along
example:
Ge' angam ala giwnig, pemqo'get aq nespatalg.
Look at that otter, s/he is floating along while eating.

pemqo'qweg.translation: It is floating or drifting along
example:
Nemitu na ngwitnm pemqo'qweg.
I see my canoe is floating along.

Goqwei na wejipmsaqas'g tet glapis ala ga'qanigtug gmetug?
Why is there a wall from here to beside the door?

pems'g.translation: It passes by in the air
example:
Ula pems'gl gtui'gatignn.
Your papers are flying by here.

Ala gwitn ta'n pemsiawqo'qweg wenewei'?
The canoe that is floating by (away), who does it belong to?

Pemsiawqo'qwet, tla'sij.
He/she is floating by, let him/her be.

Te's nemi'g na'tam se'g pemsing.
Every time I see him/her, he/she is hurrying on his/her way to
somewhere else.

Pemsulatl ugti'l, mu gejiaq ta'n eliej.
He/she is hurrying by with his/her dog, I don't know where he/she
is going.

Pemsutmi'titl utapsunual.
They hurry by with their belongings.

Gi's pana ula San Pie'l utepaqan pemta'q.
As usual here's John Peter's car going by making noise.

Nemi's'p na mtesgm pemtaqaiet?
Did you see that snake slithering along?

pemtemit.translation: He/she is going by and crying
example:
Gi's ula plgoq pemtemit.
Again here comes the lover weeping.

Sa'n wiguow gispmtesg'g ge's alapij.
Sean passed his house a long time ago while he was looking
around.

Gi's ap Mali pemtesguatl ugti'l
Again Mary is chasing her pet.

Gi's geji'g'pnig pmto'gutitaq, ma' na telmaljewe'jg
gistlipgitapulti'gw.
I knew they would fall asleep, when they are that young they aren't
able to stay up that late.

pemtoqsit.translation: He/she is prattling or gabbing by
example:
Lpa'tu'ji'j lpa pemtoqsit tetujigi'nujing gisiala'sij.
The little boy is prattling along he's so happy to be walking around.

Wen ta u't pemtugwi'g?
Who is this person running along?

pemtulgomit.translation: He/she is going with something tucked under the arm
meanings: going with something tucked under the arm
example:
Algimiet aq pemtulgomit ula pilei mila'suaqan, getu najimila'sit na
ala witapal wiguaq.
He/she is sneaking about and going along with the new toy tucked
under his/her arm, he/she wants to go play at his/her buddy's
house.

We'gwims'gi'g na wa'w gispenatg.
That's a huge egg she just layed.

Penatmuigu's na Pa'ge'wumgewei tepgunset.
April is the Easter month.

Nti na smtug pene'sugwa'tew nmi'sg goqwei etlmagutmn.
My dog will immediately drool if he/she sees you eating anything.

Pene'sugwati waju'pet ala mijua'ji'j, amuj na wipitl wespaiatl.
That child is wet with drool, his\her teeth must be bothering
him\her.

Ni'nenewei wenjitia'm gispenetgwit sepei.
Our cow gave birth to a calf this morning.

Ala' ji'nm nemi't ma uleiug, muta ms't wenn penoqwite'lmatl.
That guy you see over there will not have a good life, because he
looks down on everyone.

Pepga'gipulg nugu' la amqwanji'j, telgaqi'sg ga's'g.
I'm making this spoon thinner, I wipe it so often.

pepga'gittoq.translation: He/she grinds it down to make it thin
example:
Amujpa pepga'gittoq na gmu'j, mu teptestnug ta'n etlpuatg.
S\he has to file down that piece of wood, it doesn't fit where s\he
wants it to.

Nujimilamugwa'teget amujpa pepga'latl ugpent'ml gesgmnaq
e'wagw.
The painter must thin his/her paint before he/she uses it.

Ni'n tlueg me' gijga' pepga'tu.
I would say thin it out a bit more.

Ta'n telpiamgisigu'wei na telpiampepgatugwei.
The older I get the thinner my hair gets.

Ge' jugwa'tui na wi'gatign ta'n mawpepge'jg
Please bring me the thinnest paper.

Wesampepge'jit na, ula me' pase'g pewalt.
That one is too thin, you need this thicker one.

Lpa gjitm pepgijatpat ula nme'j.
This fish really does have a flat head.

pepg'te'muatl.translation: He/she thins out his/her hair by cutting
example:
Gis ma'mun pepg'te'muatl ugti'l, nige' nmu'j gewjit.
He/she thinned out (cut) his/her dog's hair, now the dog is cold.

Mu pas'g pepsite'lgegw, neng elg gepmite'taqan.
He/she is not always disrespectful, he/she also knows about being
respectful.

Pugwelg eig gisgug ta'n pepsitelmatl gisigu'l
There are many today who are disrespectful to elders.

pept'sgna'sit.translation: He/she puts on shoes and socks.
example:
Amujpa peptisgna'si ge'sgmnaq tewiew.
I have to put my shoes and socks on before I go out.

Giwgw telignaq, lpa eptaqano'guom pepuegej.
The earthquake is so strong, it shakes the cupboard.

Je tmg pepuegetl ugpu'taiml gesgmnaq esamqwagw.
S\he shakes his\her bottle before s\he takes a drink.

Tetujiw ma'mun gaqtugwawig lpa wenji'guom pepuetesg.
It thunders so loudly the house trembles.

Telgu'ji, lpa pepuetesin.
I'm so cold, I'm actually shaking.

Tetujisa'q sma'gnisuit, lpa nugu' peqanqasita'teget.
He's been a soldier so long, he's become flatfooted.

Gisgug ijga'ji'g pesa'ji'jg.
Today it's lightly snowing a bit.

Pe'talaji, waqama'laji, toqo tujiw pesa'laji.
He/she catches them (fish), guts them, then skins them.

Ta'n tujiw pesanagig na mu telitge'gtnug.
When there is a snow mist it isn't as cold.

Ulagu pesaqap.
It snowed yesterday.

Nmu'j pesa'tl wapusl aq smtug poqjigwiluatl.
The dog smells a rabbit and immediately begins to look for it.

Ge' nugu' gujmug iga'tu na wius, wijei telipsetu.
Would you please put that meat outside, I can still smell it.

pesga'latl.translation: He/she leads or takes him/her off the trail or the road
meanings: lead off the trail or road
example:
Pesga'latl gigjiw lagla'nsigtug.
S\he takes him\her off road near the barn.

Pesga'qiputeg gmu'j ta'n nastestmgewei eteg.
The wood is worn off around the hook .

pesga'sit.translation: He/she leaves or goes off the trail or the road
meanings: go off the trail or road
leave off the trail or road
example:
Ta'n tujiw inaqaneg nmitu'n awti pita'q, na'te'l pesga'si.
When you see a long road on the right, turn off there.

pesga'toq.translation: He/she leads or takes it off the trail or the road
meanings: lead off the trail or road
example:
We'gwigitnmat pesga'toq utepaqan ugtawtig.
S\he had a hard time taking his\her car of the road onto his\her
road.

Nujigtantegewinu pilei ugpe'sgeweim.
The hunter has a new gun.

Getu' pe'sg'g, pas'g awano'tg pe'sgewei.
He/she wants to shoot it, but is awkward with a gun.

Enma'ti'gw? Je gi's pesgiaq!
Shall we go home? It's getting dark already!

Mawginteweteg ula pe'sgewei ta'n tujiw pe'sgigeg.
This gun is loud when when it shoots.

Alipe'sgiget ugjit mu goqwei.
He/she is going around shooting for nothing.

Siawmajulgwate'n ula awti pemien glapis ala mitis gaqamit
gispmtesgaj, inaqaneg nmitesg pesg'teg awti'j, ugt'tesgewa na'te'l.
Continue on this road until you are past that tree over there, on the
right you will see a path leading off, go that way.

Jijuaqa esgig gmu'j pe'sg'teg nu'gwa'tu'n.
Uncured wood sometimes fires (makes a sound) as a gun when
you burn it.

Ta'n tujiw pesoqtesgmateg, suel pe'sguatl witapal.
When he/she tripped, he/she almost shot his/her buddy.

Pesgunateg te'siniji lmu'ji'jg gisigs'tqamua'laji nti sepei.
My dog gave birth to nine puppies this morning.

Pesgunateg te'sinsga'q te's'gl pewatmann.
I want ninety (items).

Mali gisgitmat glapis pesgunateg te'sisga'q.
Mary is able count up to ninety.

Ge' ni'n pesgutuo'lnap.
Let me shave you.

Ngwis pesgutue'g unji te's nipg.
My son shaves his head every summer.

Teliangamgug mnaq pesgutuo'siwun gisgug.
It looks like you haven't yet shaved today.

Wenjitia'm aq te'sipow gitg pesgwatalgig.
The cow and the horse both graze.

Pesgwete'gemgewei weljewiaq ugjit pita'q msigu.
The sickle is handy for tall grass.

Etug mu eigtnug na'gweg la nti mu pesgwiegw.
I don't think there's a day that my dog doesn't shed.

Amujpa tmg pesigte'getes ugtu'mugsa'tegen.
You'll have to split wood first if you want to start a fire.

pesi'gugwet.translation: He/she works at a river drive
example:
So'sep pesi'gugwet te's nipg.
Joseph works on the river drive every summer.

Suel pesigweita'tl gesg etliewsitutmi'tij.
He/she almost slaps him/her in the face as they showed off.

pesipga'latl.translation:
He/she severs, cuts, splits or breaks off a thread or rope with
force
meanings: sever, cut, split, or break off (thread, rope) with force
sever, cut, split, or break off (thread, rope) with tool
example:
Na te'sipow wesamnaqamaspesipga'latl na a'papi'tl.
That horse breaks that rope too easily.

Gi'ls'p na pesipga'toq ula?
Are you the one who broke this (wire)?

pesipgeget.translation: He/she breaks a rope, string or chain in two
meanings: break (rope, string or chain) in two
example:
Gis'pesipgegei ntpisga'taqanapim ge's matuig'tnnm.
I just broke my chain while I was lightly pulling at it.

pesipgegetl.translation: He/she breaks a rope or cable
example:
Sangew ugtnmnej, mu' getu' pesipga'laqwig a'papi'g.
Let's pull it gently, we don't want to break the ropes.

pe'sit.translation: He/she has something in the eye
example:
Goqwei na gispe'sit?
What does he/she have in his/her eye?

Wasamiwjo'tg gsigawa'sin, ejele'g pesoqopsga'sitew ta'n goqwei
alapilg.
He/she is trying too hard to be fast, it is a forgone conclusion that 
he/she will drop what he/she is carrying.

pesoqopsg'ta'tl.translation: He/she misses in swinging (like a ball)
example:
Gi's ap Pie'l pesoqopsg'ta'tl tu'aqann.
Again Peter missed hitting the ball.

pesoqopsg'te'g.translation: He/she misses it in swinging (like a rock)
example:
Welta'si ta'n telpesoqopsg'te'm ntijin.
I'm glad that I missed hitting my thumb.

Lpa'tuj gaqi'sg pesoqta'tl tu'aqann.
The boy often misses hitting the ball.

We'gwigaqi'sg pesoqte'g na guntew etlte'g.
S\he often misses that rock s\he is hitting.

meanings: fail to shoot something aimed at
example:
Wejo'tg migutelmn, gatu pesoqtelg.
He/she tries to hit it, but misses the shot.

meanings: fail to hit someone aimed at
example:
Gi's ta'pu pesoqteluatl, nige' na mui'nal pemtesgatl.
He's missed hitting him/her twice, now that bear is chasing after
him.

pesoqtesg'g.translation: He/she fails to meet or come into contact with it
meanings: fail to come into contact with it
example:
Gis pesoqtesg'gl na awti'l ta'n a's'gatigl.
He/she missed the intersection of the two roads.

Gesitlo'tm te's ngat maja'tu, natgoqwei piluei pesoqtesgmai.
It seems that every time I move my foot, I trip over something
else.

Nitap gisipejipsoqtesgmaq, nige' wegaiugtuit.
I accidently triped my friend, now he's mad at me.

pesoqtesguatl.translation: He/she fails to come into contact with it
meanings: fail to come into contact with it(ball)
example:
Te's getu' tegtesguatl tua'qan So'sep pesoqtesguatl.
Everytime that Joseph trys to kick the ball he misses it.

Nqon pesqai'gpusit muta nmug'sn wesampilei.
My heel is chafed because my shoe is too new.

Plu'jaqamati nugu'gaqtaqaiaq, poqjipesqaiaq ugtejg.
The mirror is at the end of its days, it's beginning to peel in the
back.

Gtigulagu na'gu'setewigtug etlinpap, nige' pesqaiet.
The other day s\he slept in the sun, now his/her skin is peeling.

Pe' pesqa'l'g'p la wapus gesgmnaq geljismawj.
Let me skin this rabbit before you freeze it.

pesqata'tl.translation: He/she scrapes it with an instrument
example:
Pesqata'tl miti'sl, na teliawtiget.
He/she marks (scrapes) the tree, thats how he/she makes his/her
trail.

pesqate'g.translation: He/she scrapes it with an instrument
example:
Mjegei wejipesqate'g wowigtug.
He/she scrapes (with instrument) dirt off the pot.

Gisipsoqtesgmat aq pesqatesmatl ugjigun.
S\he just tripped and s\he scraped his\her knee.

Tami etlpesqatestoqos na uggwat.
Where did he/she scrape his/her foot.

Mu welpesqojiguenug ula, ap piltuei ugjo'tmnej.
This one isn't sticky enough, let's try a differnet one.

Amuj gi's sa'q tltmutugunn na suitisl, lpa ms't tami pesqojiguet na
lpa'tuj.
That little boy must have been eating candies for a long time, he is
sticky everywhere.

Pesqo'lanej ula plawejg ne'pataji.
Let's pluck these partridges he/she harvested.

Ala Tuma gis'pesatl pile'l a'pi'l.
Tom just accidentlly cut the new fishing net.

Gisi pessm pilei pata'wti.
I accidentally cut the new table.

pessmgewei.translation: Holy picture or medal or crucifix
meanings: holy picture or medal or crucifix
example:
A's'tuo'guomg wejiet aq nige' alnasguatl pessmgewe'l.
He/she just came from the church and is now wearing a metal.

So'sep gisipestaqa'latl ugji'taqann wela'gwe'g.
Joseph strained his neck last night.

Telgina'sit ji'met, lpa pestaqalsit.
He/she worked so hard at paddling, he/she strained
himself/herself.

Ulagu gis'pestaqa'tu npaqam.
Yesterday I strained my back.

Ge' aja'tu na pu'tlaqann, jijuaqa pe's'tetal.
Would you move those wood shavings, they might catch fire.

Se'tane'umg na mesgi'g na'gweg pestie'wumg.
The Saint Anne's Day is a big feast day.

Amsgwes na petman mu gisigtantu'n gilu.
In the old days you starved if you couldn't hunt for (gather) your
food.

Pestmo'qon mu nugu' nemitas'gtnug ula Listugujg.
Starvation is not seen anymore here in Listuguj.

Ula pa'tlia's ta'n eig nige' nata'pestung.
The priest that is here now is a good preacher.

Pugwenitl gaqpesawl pe'talatl sepei.
He/she caught many smelt this morning.

petaptu'sit.translation: He/she comes with the aid of a cane
meanings: comes with the aid of a cane
example:
Pa'qalai petaptu'sin, telpita'q awti!
I am surprised that you walked (with your cane) here, it is such a
long way.

Nige' gegina'masi ta'n telitmg wenju'su'nei petaqan.
Now I'm going to learn how to make an apple pie.

Gisigsuates muse'j na petaqanji'j?
Can I take a piece of that small pie?

petasenmat.translation: He/she comes walking with a light or a torch
meanings: come walking with light or torch
example:
Tuma petasenmat ta'n eimu'tieg.
Thomas comes walking with a light to where we are.

petasit.translation: He/she is blinded by a glare of light or the sun
meanings: blinded (by glare of light or sun)
example:
Lentug petasij, ma matpugua'sigw.
If a deer is blinded by the glare of a light, it will not move.

Lpa nmu'j petatejitoq wilu.
The dog arrives dragging his\her food.

petawlalatl.translation: He/she comes carrying or lugging him/her on back
example:
Sulian pegising aq petawlalatl ugti'l.
Sulian arrives and he is carrying his dog.

petawlatg.translation: He/she comes lugging or carrying it on his/her back
example:
Na we'gwipugwelg ta'woqwei petawlatmn.
You really carried alot over here.

Megwgutat na petawletew Nipi A'sutmamg.
The Red Dressed one will arrive carrying (on his back) at
Christmas.

Glusuaqan petgitg, wejgwita'jig.
He/she sent word, they are coming.

Nitapaq petgnejig Muliang sepei.
My friends arrived in Montreal this morning.

Ejela'toq, pejgutatestoq, tlia' nige' sangew pema'toq.
He/she couldn't help it, he/she spilled some of it, eventhough
he/she was carrying it very slowly and calmly.

Smtug petguta'tl plamu'l newt gistepa'laj ugtulg.
S\he knocks out the salmon as soon as s\he gets it into his\her
boat.

Malia'n gisipetguteget gastio'mi.
Mary Ann accidently spill some molasses.

petna's'g.translation: There is a gust of cool wind
example:
Getltana gewjien, petna's'g!
No wonder you feel chilled, a cool gust of wind is passing through.

Petqa'matimg wesgowa's'g ula egsitpu'g.
The mediation is on going this morning.

Petqwasit ta'n goqwei elsu'tmuj.
He/she denies what he/she is being blame for.

petta'tl.translation: He/she strikes or hits him/her unintentionally
example:
Ge's So'sep alegej na tu'aqanatgw, na petta'tl uggwe'ji'tl.
As Joseph was tossing around the baseball bat, he accidentally hit
his younger sister.

pette'g.translation: He/she strikes or hits it unintentionally
example:
Geju't na ta'woqwei etliwjo't tqatmn, gatu mu na ge'itmg
ta'woqwei pette'tew.
We know what he/she is trying to hit, but one doesn't know what
he/she will hit unintentionally.

Lpa'tu'ji'j pettemit aq ujjl telimatl gisnisiet.
The little boy arrives crying and tells his dad that he fell.

Wela'gwe'g pegisin, petteppi Tiotis utepaqang.
I got here last night, I arrived in Eunice's car.

Ugjignaml gis'pettesguatl.
He/she accidently bumped his/her kid brother.

Petu'niaq lpa mu tami elapim'g!
When the fog rolls in one cannot see anything!

petuptoq.translation: He/she lugs it here on his/her shoulder
example:
Etug petuptoq wilu ugjit aqantie'uti.
I think s\he luged his\her in food for the week.

Pualatl uggwe'ji'tl wije'ugun.
S\he wants his\her sister to accompany him/her.

Suel te'sigisg'g wi'g pewa'q.
He/she sweeps his/her home almost every day.

Gisgug na pas pewaqs'te'gei aq ma' piltu'lugwew.
Today I'll just be trashing and do nothing else.

Tami weja'tu'n na pewaqs'te'gnei?
Where did you get that thrasher?

Pewaqtesmatl ugtatlaiml aq etawet me' suliewe'ji'j tuwatja'qtnn.
He/she shakes out his/her shirt and implores the universe that a
wee bit of coin falls out.

Ms't pewaqtestuapnn ntaligaml sepei.
I shook out all my clothes this morning.

Ntus gaqi'sg milpewat.
My daughter often has weird dreams.

Telo'tm te's na maqasan pisgwai, natgoqwe'tew piltuei ta'n we'jitu
pewatm.
It seems to me that each time I go into that store, I will find
something else that I want.

Te'siula'gw nte'pitem pewi'g.
I dream about my wife every night.

Nujiwaqama'teget pewi'get te'siegsitpu'g.
The janitor sweeps the floors every morning.

Pe'l agnutmulnap pewitaqan ta'n wela'gwe'g pewituap.
Let me tell you about the dream I dreamt last night.

Ms't wen pewiteget.
Everyone dreams.

Gisigu sipeliw pewitoq maljewe'juiteg.
The old man often dreams of his youth.

Gisiga'taqatmann pewoqiajgewe'l.
I just planted nasturtiums.

Ge' gwiluanej megwe'g pga'w.
Let's look for some red clay.

Etug ta'sijig pijjaqang ugjiaten ula newte' pgegn?
How many mittens do you think can be made with this one hide?

Te'sipowg gu'gunj na pugwemn pgenign.
If you have horses you have a lot of fertilizer.

Pugwelgl pgesignn mawi'smn gisites a'su'n.
If you sew lots of pieces of cloth together you can make a blanket.

Natanguaigw nespnnmnej pgesign'ji'j, gulaman gisnmitesnu ta'n
tegenn welwije'tigl.
When we go shopping let's take a small sample of the cloth, so we
can see what things go well together.

Segg'nasa'tu na pgijoqign, glamen ma' gutatesinug na pu'tai.
Tighten that lid, so the bottle won't spill out.

Ge' jugwa'tui tapusijig pgu'g.
Would you bring me two sticks of gum.

Me' aq newte' pguman nuta'tes gtuitu'n petaqan.
You'll need more than one blueberry if you want to make a pie.

Na we'guultegpa'q ula pgumanapu!
My this blueberry juice is nice and cold!

Taliulm'tu'n gnua'tui ta'n pgumanaqsi'g etliguti'tij?
Would you be so kind as to tell me where blueberry bushes grow?

Tio'tiso'q najipgumane'gepnaq.
Eunice is gone to get blueberries.

Wigapu'g, gatu ni'n tlueg me' ta's'gl pgwejijgl angua'tu.
It's good, but I would suggest adding a bit more cinnamon.

Teluejig ula mlageju'mi me' piamglu'lg aq igtigl.
They say that this butter is better than the others.

Gjitmei mu gejiaq ula piamglu'sin aq igtig.
Really I don't know if this one is better than the other.

Ala piamiaq lusgnign nespnmnej.
Let's bring that leftover bannock with us.

Pas'g newtaig piamiet.
He/she has only one dollar left.

Geitaqal newte'tnitl me' piamigsalatl je mu igtigl.
I know that he/she likes one of them more than the other.

Ula nitap piamigsatg alisugwij gwitnigtug je mu wesgej.
My friend here prefers to paddle his canoe around instead of
fishing.

Mali me' piamite'lmatl ugtgajue'wjml je mu ugtnmu'jml.
Mary thinks more of her cat than her dog.

Amujpa na negm mgntew tawoqwei piamite'tg.
He/she will have to be the one to choose what is more important
to him/her.

Piamiw metla'saigl telawtit na wi'gign.
That pencil cost more than ten dollars.

Ni'n wigtmann seggul piesgminn.
I like sweet corn.

Ta'sunjig pi'gaq?
How many spades do you have?

Ntue'm waju'et piggwig.
My dog is full of fleas.

Mu gejiaq nti piggwin.
I don't know if my dog has fleas.

Ulwaqama'lates na piglewji'j gesgmnaq e'wawj.
Clean the lamp globe well before you use it.

pigsa'q.translation: It is cloudy from dust or smoke
example:
Pas'g Tuma utepaqan pempigsa'q.
You could just see the dust from Thomas's car.

pigsa't.translation: He/she/it makes a cloud of dust or smoke or steam
meanings: cloud of smoke or dust or steam from...
example:
Pigsa't na epsaqtejg, etugjel gmu'j etlamgleg saqpejaq.
That stove is smokey (smoking), maybe the wood that is burning
is damp.

Nti mawigsoqwet ta'n tujiw pittij.
My dog really stinks when he farts.

Gitpuowei pi'gun na mawmlgignaq npisun.
An eagle feather is very strong medicine.

Gi's nemi't pi'gw alaqsing?
Have you ever seen a night hawk flying about?

Ne'wijig nmu'jig nignaq aq pugwelg pi'gwatign.
There are four dogs at my house and lots of shed hair.

Me' gatu ntgajue'wjm pi'gwatignmit.
My! My cat sheds hair.

Ugmaposmg pija'latl ugtapsute'gann.
He/she puts his/her present in his/her pocket.

Wen gispija'lut wela'gwe'g?
Who was put into jail last night?

Pas'g nige' enmipijapegitaq utepaqang.
Just now he/she just crawled under his/her car.

Ta'n tujiw weti pija'sij maqamigeg, ma' nugu'nmiaw't.
When a worm goes into the ground and you not see him again.

Ula pija'tu nmaposmg gulaman ma' wata'suatmu.
I am putting this in my pocket so I won't forget it.

Pas'g nugu'pijatpo'jing nqano'pati, mu geitug ta'n tela's'geg
samqwaneg.
He just looks down into the well, he doesn't know where the
water has gone.

Wen gispijeget guntew nqano'patigtug?
Who threw that rock in the well?

Goqqwa'tu gesgmnaq pijianug.
Grab it before it falls in.

Sepei elmaqegigtug gisipijiet.
He/she fell into a hole this morning.

Ula ji'nmji'j teluisit So'sep maw pijigatat.
This young man named Joseph is very long-legged.

Lpa na telitas'g, pijigiaq.
It is made that way, it curves in.

Pijigiet na lasqo'plaw gisnasa'lt.
That board you just put on is curved inwards

Pijigsma'latl umisl gulaman gisitqopitaq.
He/she pushes his/her older sister in so they can sit together.

Pijigsma'toq pipnaqan epsaqtejgigtug.
S\he pushes that bread into the stove.

E'pite'ji'j pijigwalatl ugtapsute'gann muntigtug aq maja'sit.
The young girl squeezes her doll into the bag and leaves.

Ejele'g pijigweg, mu tam se'g eigtnug ta'n ligwetew.
It is growing inward, there is no where else that it can grow.

Ntqosi pijigwet ntmaqaqjigeweimg.
My toenail is growing into my big toe.

Tami weja'tu'n na pilei pijimaqan?
Where did you get that new funnel?

Amujpa na'tal gnnm'g ula t'pgwan gisna pijipgwiatew.
This gravel has to be held back some how or it will cave in.

Sugulegat lo'gs pijipgwiet elmaqegtug.
The rotted log is falling into the hole in small pieces.

"Amujpa pijiptnan" wipapal telimatl, "gtu'tepnin".
"You have to have a long reach" he/she tells his/her friend, "if you
want to reach me".

Moqwa, ma' gis tluem'g pijisqonat.
No, it wouldn't be true to say that he/she has a long nose.

Nemi's'p na tia'm ta'n telpijistaqanaj?
Did you see how long eared that moose was?

Telnenaqe'g lpa petnnmisguteg smtug pijiwnaqaiep tepaqanigtug.
He/she was in such a hurry that when the vehicle arrived to pick
him/her up he/she jumped into the vehicle.

Nt'pijjaqang pile'g aq megwe'gig
My mittens are new and red.

Welpiniji na ugtpijaqang ala alpijaqana'q.
Those are nice looking mittens on the one wearing mittens.

Recording by jwm

Goqwei getugjitu'n ula pilegn?
What are you planning to make with this new cloth?

Pile'g nipi'g glapis poqjigutijig.
New leaves are finally growing.

Tuma na pile'sm gast'pl.
Thomas is the rookie police officer.

Piligan na gisita'tij, tqo'nug pisgwiwsultitaq.
They have built themselves a new home, they will move into it in
the fall.

Piligana'gamigt eliwsi tqo'nug.
I'm moving to the new campsite in the fall.

Pilijilta's'g pilei ntpata'wtim.
There are newly blazed marks on my new table.

Pilimang na mawwigapugsijig wisugwaluj mu pelgoqsasi'tigw.
New potatoes are really delicious when cooked without peeling
them.

Ntijin lpa pilse'g ta'n migute'map.
My thumb is numb from where I hit it.

Gisipilsimatl witapal, nige' mu gelulti'gw.
He/she spoke falsely of his/her friend. now they're not talking.

piltuamatl.translation: He sees something strange about him/her
example:
So'sep piltuamatl ugti'l, etug mu negmewe'l.
Joseph see something different about his pet. perhaps it's not his
pet.

Piltuaptm ula, etug mu wijei.
I find this one looks different, I don't think it is the same.

Piltua's'g usgaqan aq ulagua.
The fishing turned out differently than yesterday.

Piltua'sit aq ta'n telta'siap.
He/she turns out differenty then what I thought.

Piltu'lugweg ta'n gislugomiap.
It works differently since I had it fixed.

Pie'l ugtlugowaqan, na nige' piltu'lugwet.
Peter's job, now he does different work.

piltu'wi'tatl.translation: He/she calls him/her by different name
example:
Telte'tm piltu'wi'tatl muta awanta'suatmuaj ugtwisunm.
I think he/she called him/her by a different name because he/she
forgot his/her name.

piltu'wi't'g.translation: He/she calls it by a different name
example:
Ula nitap mawpugwelg ta'n goqwei piltu'wi't'g.
My friend here names many things differently.

Piluamugwiaq ugs'tqamu wejgwiula'gw.
The world changes color when evening arrives.

Piluamugwiet ula sewlugowei, etug mu nugu' gelu'sigw.
This rhubarb has changed appearance, it is probably no longer
good.

Nti mawpilu'assit ta'n tujiw wen pilue'l pisgwa'nij.
My dog acts silly when someone new comes in the house.

Mego'tigl na nige' piluowe'l, mu st'ge' amgwes.
Bullets are expensive now, not like at one time.

Pie'l maja'sit aq najipi'mat.
Peter is leaving to go hunting waterfowl.

Pipanigesi e'e, pas'g mu te's asitemim'g.
I ask, yes, but I don't always get answered.

Pimanimatl witapal, gatu mu asitemgugul.
S\he asked his\her friend, but s\he doesn't answer him\her.

Mawuljewiet pi'pi nipugtug.
A peavey is handy in the woods.

Pipnaqan ta'n ngijaq i'gisitoqopneg na mawmujgajewe't'p.
The bread that my mother used to make was the best.

Pipnaqane'ji'tl na alamgistu'un pipnaqnigtug gesgmnaq etoqtatmu'n.
You sprinkle caraway seeds on bread before you bake it.

Pipnaqsign mlageju'mia'tas'g getutmn?
Would you like a piece of buttered bread?

Pipnaqsignji'jl esm'g'pnig jipji'jg sepei.
I fed the birds small pieces of bread this morning.

Nitap mawgitnmeiatl uggwatl, muta mawpipqoqsitat.
My friend has problems with his/her feet, because he/she has
many bunions..

Poqwa'lamgewe'l apje'ji'jgl, piptoqopsgegl, wisqegl aq
gesimgwe'gl ta'n tujiw etteg.
Choke cherries are small, round, sour and dark red when ripe.

Ntue'm telpiptoqopsg'sit pajaq tu'aqan.
My animal is as round as a ball.

Welpiptoqwa'q ula gmu'j ugjit ligpenignn.
This wood is a good cylindrical shape for making baskets.

Piptugwagig tuop'ti miamuj tepiaq telimtue'g ta'n telitmg.
