It must be quite difficult to constrict a circular window.

Piptugwagit tepgunset nige' wela'gw.
The moon is round tonight.

pipua'smugwet.translation: He/she blows a horn or whistles
example:
So'sep tewjiulo'teget pa pempipua'smugwet.
Joseph is feeling so good, he is whistling away.

Eig wen tet ta'n nata'te'g pipugwaqan?
Is there anyone here that knows how to play the horn?

Egsitpu'gl na pipugwaqane'j tugwimaji sma'gnisg.
The bugler wakes up the soldiers in the mornings.

Nuji'j gisiwja'toq pilei pipugwaqan'ji'j.
My grandchild just bought a new whistle.

Mu ni'n gejiaq pipugwes ta'n teliangamgusij.
I don't know what a pipugwes looks like.

Gi's nemi't pipugwe'si's ula siggw?
Have you seen a sparrow hawk this spring?

pipugwet.translation: He/she makes music on a horn or a wind instrument
meanings: make music on horn or wind instrument
example:
Wela'gwe'g pipugweiap ugjit gisigultijig.
Last night I sang for the elders.

Pis aq piggw na wijei juji'ji'j.
A flea and a flea is the same insect.

pi'sano'tlatl.translation: He/she puts a diaper on him/her
example:
Gitg unjanua pi'sano'tlatiji.
They both diaper their children.

Pugwelgl gisites pisaqqann e'wmn suspanignapu.
You can make a lot of bubbles using soapy water.

Ula suspanign eltoq pugwelg pisew.
This soap makes a lot of suds.

Pqojipisewiaq na punte'e'n.
When it begins to get foamy stop whipping it.

Welpisewiet ula suspanign.
This soap gets good and foamy.

Ta'n telgilg nmu'j na telpiampisewtuna't.
The bigger the dog the more foam he/she has in his/her mouth.

Telte'lmg ula pisga'taqanapi tepignatew gnnmn.
I think this chain is strong enough to hold it.

Pugwengl wisawsulieweie'l pisga'taqanapi'ji'jl.
He/she has many gold chains.

Gi's pisgiaq aq mnaq ntus pegisinug mala.
It is getting dark and my daughter hasn't come home yet.

Ntus pisgwa't aq nti pisguije'watl.
My daughter comes in and my dog comes in with her.

Pgijoqwa'tu ga'qan, pisgulaq.
Close the door, the rain is getting inside.

Wijig'tijig pisgulgwaltijig.
The sibblings follow each other in.

Lpa pisguggwatg mijipjewei.
He/she/it followed the food inside.

Ge' p'soqa'tu na ga'qan, pisgupanigs'gt'tew.
Would you close that door, the snow will drift inside.

pisgwa'latl.translation: He/she brings or takes him/her inside
example:
Ntus pisgwa'latl ugti'l te'siula'gw.
My daughter brings her dog indoors everynight.

Nti na pisgawpitew glapis pisgwa'luj.
My dog will stare into the house until someone lets him in.

Tami wejipisgwa'q na samqwan?
Where does that water comes in?

Pe'l pisgwaiap, poqjitgiaq.
I'm going in, it's getting chilly.

pisgwa'toq.translation: He/she brings or takes it inside
example:
Gi's wen pisgwa'toq utapsun?
Has anyone brought in their belongings.

pisgwetesg'g.translation: He/she tracks it (mud, snow, water) inside
example:
Na we'gwipugwelg wastew pisgwetesg'g ula lpa'tuj.
Thats a lot of snow that boy has tracked in here.

Lpa tu'aqann pisgwetesguatl wenji'guomg.
He/she actually kicked the ball into the house.

Ne's'sijig pile'smug pisgweto'jig.
Three new candidates were elected.

Ntluignn tewjigsnuguigl lpa pisgwigiaql.
My fingers are so sore they are curving inward.

Pewals'p na tlpisgwigien?
Did you want it/him/her to curve in that way?

Nti algi'nujing, gispiswi'putoq wilu.
My dog is all proud of himself, he just brought his food into the
house.

Nuji'j gis'pisgwiwsit wela'gwe'g nignaq.
My grandchild just moved in to my place last night.

Apigjilu pisit la'taqsunigtug.
The skunk is in the pail.

Pilei pismuti gisgug oqwa'tew.
The new mattress will arrive today.

pi'snalatl.translation: He/she pack a pipe with tobacco
example:
Gisigui'sgw gisipi'snalatl utmaqann.
The old woman just packed tobacco into her pipe.

So'sep te'sigisg'g pi'snsit aq wetmat.
Every day Joseph packs his pipe and smokes.

Ula pisoqos'ti'l tet nasi'se'n.
Sew these buttons on here.

Ge' nma'l aq sm, wesampisoqotalg ugjit ni'n.
Would you take him\her home with you and feed him/her, he/she
eats too much for me.

Alpisoqqoweiegsit na ula nitap.
My friend here is just being greedy.

Nipitl elugwatmuimg'pnn aq sa'qatia'limg'p, me' newte'
telpissagutnai.
I had dental work done and I was given a needle, my mouth is still
numb from it.

Pisse'g ngat, wesamsa'q tepgopi.
My foot is numb, I've been sitting on it too long.

Witapal telimatl, pilsiei aq mu welo'tegew
He/she tells his/her friend, I feel numb and I don't feel good.

pistamit.translation: He/she sops up gravy, molasses etc. with bread
meanings: sop up (e.g., gravy, molasses) with bread
example:
Ginitaieg pistamultieg, telwigapu'g tawoqwei gisoqsmugsieg.
We eagerly sopped up the food that had be prepared for us, it
was so delicious.

meanings: bread spread or sop (fat, molasses, etc.)
example:
A' na ulataltes nige', gaqatepiaq pistamun.
I'll have a good meal now, there are plenty of things to sop up.

Pisuilsu'tmaqan na maw winjig
A false accusation is the worst.

Goqwei wejipisuilsu'tmatioq, wijig'tioq!
Why are you falsely accusing one another, you're siblings!

Pisuimatl ugjignaml gulamen ugtapenital.
He/she falsely accused his/her younger brother to get him into
trouble.

Pisuiw pegisin, gaqa mes'tesgmaneg ta'n te's'g goqwei.
I've arrived for nothing, I've missed every single thing.

Pitalqeg na ula elmalqei gisitu'tij.
This is a deep hole they made.

Ango'te'n, mu puwatmu'n pitamgletestn.
Be careful, you don't want it to flare inward.

Nsanoqonig na ta'n tujiw tqa'la'j pitamgletesing.
It's dangerous when a wick flares inward (karosene lamp).

Pita'q na gmu'j pematejitu'n.
That stick you are dragging is long.

L'tqa'mu'g alapilujig pitaqanigtug.
Arrows are carried around in an arrow pouch.

Ta'n we'gwigjiji'g pita'qaweia'qap sepei.
As far as I know he\she had pants on this morning.

Ge' nasa'tuapnn ntpita'qaweiml.
I'm going to put my pants on.

Amgwes na tett pitaqso'ltipnig pa'tlia'sg.
In the past the priests here wore long robes.

Lasqo'plaw pitasg'pit elmalqeg.
The board is sticking into the hole.

Aptu'n pitasg'teg poqwatigno'qigtug.
The cane is in the umbrella stand.

Pi'tawa'si egsitpu'nug.
I'm going up river in the morning.

Pi'tawa'latl witapal aq telimatl najiwesgenej.
He/she takes his/her friend up river and tells him/her let's go fishing.

Nemitaqapneg ugtuluow, pempi'tawa's'g'p.
I saw their boat, it was going up river

Egsitpu'nug pi'tawa'sitew nujj.
My father is going up river in the morning.

Pie'l pi'tawa'toq ugtul muta getu wesget sapo'nug.
Peter takes his boat up river because he wants to go fishing
tomorrow.

Pie'l teluep pi'tawe'tew gisgug.
Peter said he would go up river today.

Ntus tepqatgig pi'tawgewa'jl.
My daughter is married to a guy from up river.

Mali na pi'tawgowi'sgw.
Mary is from up river.

Ntmaposmg telte'tm piteg, pe'gwilmap.
I think it is in my pocket, let me look for it.

Pitgimatl witapal ta'n etlinsanoqonig.
He/she sends his/her friend to where it is dangerous.

Sangew pitgmalatl ugsamqwano'qgml.
He/she slowly fills his/her water jug.

Mali mu gesatmug ta'n teliaq, na pitgmatg utepaqan aq maja'sit.
Mary doesn't like what is going on, so she loads up her car and
leaves.

pitgmewatl.translation: He/she loads or fills for him/her
example:
Tlta'sig aqantie'uti maja'snnitl ula etlpitgmewatl.
You would think the person he/she is packing for is going away for
a week.

Pitiasit na wasoqn gisnasa'l't.
That is a bright bulb you just put on.

Pisgwitaieg wenji'guom ta'n mawpitiateg.
We walked in to the brightest house.

Pi'tisignta'tl malige'wl gulaman ma' nugu' s'pennigul.
He/she caulks the barrel so it won't leak anymore.

Newtiegsitpu'g etlpitisignte'meg ntul, gulaman ma' nugu' s'penug.
We've been caulking my boat all morning, so it won't leak
anymore.

Pitlanji'jg pugwelgig la'mui, ni'n mawwip'gig.
Give me lots of the green beans, I like them a lot.

Ula nitap we'guiulsipisga'sit, telpito'qiptnat.
My friend can reach really far, his arms are so long.

Pitoqoluat, pa jaq na e'pite'saq i'ala'tieg'pnaq.
She has a long neck, just like that young woman I used to go out
with once.

pitoqpit.translation: He/she/it sits or is set underneath
example:
Ala pitoqpit, ge' ugjeiu gistuateja'lan?
Try to slide that out from underneath?

Me' gatu pitoqsit ula lpa'tuj.
My, this boy is tall.

Wenji'guom gi's pitoqteg'p gesgmnaq nemitu'tigweg.
The house was burning underneath before they saw it.

Ula na e'pitji'j nujipi't'pet.
This young woman is a bar tender.

pitqasawet.translation: He/she loads a gun with gunpowder and ramrod
example:
Mu pugwelug ta'nuwen nugu' nata'pitqasawet.
Not many know how to load a gun with gunpowder and ramrod
anymore.

Gis tepiaq telsa'q mu pitqonaw.
It's been a long time since I wore high heels.

Mu tet nemiawt pittalu.
One does not see cougars around here.

Pittaq awti eltaigw, jiptu ma' ugsamwinigisg'tnug.
We are on a long journey, hopefully the weather won't be too bad.

pittaqapegisg.translation: It is a long enclosed structure
example:
Pitaqapegisg na ula gi'g.
This is a long house you have here.

pittaqpisit.translation: He/she is tethered by a long rope, chain
meanings: tethered (by long rope, string, chain, twine)
example:
Nti mesgilg aq amujpa pittaqpisit gujmug.
My dog is large and he/she has to be tethered by a long rope
outdoors.

Jipalg ula a'papi gijga' ugsampittaqsin.
I'm afraid that this rope might be a bit too long.

Gi's sa'q giaspimila'si pitto'tultimg.
It's been a long time since I played auction forty five.

Mali pituega'latl ugs'tqanji'jml.
Mary lines her jacket.

Pituega'taqan e'wmn ta'n tujiw mawi'smn na me' mlgigna'tutew.
If you use a lining when you sew it together, it will be stronger.

Lapli'sign e'w'g pituega'toq ugtoqon.
She uses silk to line her dress.

M'gegne'l pitu'gunn etliatl.
He/she is making a leather hooded cape.

Pituiptnnaqanaigl na mesgi'g suliewei ugjit ni'n.
A thousand dollars is a lot of money to me.

Etliamjimoqiep ala pitui'w miti'sg.
He/she got stuck between those trees.

Geitaj pitu'gmijgamij ugtwisunm?
Do you know your great-grandfather's name?

Mu ni'n nenuaqapnaq pitu'nugumijaq.
I did not know my great-grandmother.

Me' mnaq ugs'tqamu'lti'gw pitu'nuji'jg.
My great grandchildren aren't born yet.

Ula ji'nm wejgu'et na ugpitnn mawpiwgsmigl.
The man that's approching has very hairy hands.

Gesig apjiw wi'sisg me' piwgsmultijig.
Animals are always bushier in the winter.

Jigtmu'gl na piwiaqapnn wigunn.
We're going to finish the left over beans.

Plamuwei piwiges mawimjega'tegeg.
Salmon scales make a mess.

Mawi'smn piwsignn, gisites gelu'lg a'su'n.
If you sew scrapes of cloth together, you can make a nice blanket.

Tami elo'tuann piwtignn?
Where should I put the peelings?

Na we'gwiweltesguioq, smtug pjila'tigw.
You have come at a good time for me, come right in and sit down.

Sangewita'mg, pjili'w negm nigana'sij.
It's slow going, especially when he/she is leading.

Plamu'g oqwa'jig Nipnigu's.
Salmon arrive in the month of June.
Plamu wegnamgo'sit.
The salmon digs a place in which to deposit her spawn.

Ta's ajietew najiplamugutioq?
What time will you (plural exclusive) be going to fish for salmon?

Pnamuj na peta'lugwetew Pnamujuigu's.
Tommy cod will arrive in January.

Plasua na mujgajewei nitap.
Frank is my very best friend.

Gis sa'q giaspnnmi'g plawej tami.
It has been a long time since I've seen a partridge anywhere.

Mu na loqte'gnigalam'g plawe'si's
Young partridge are not to be trapped.

Pugwelgl mesgi'gl aq apje'ji'jgl plegu'l we'jituann.
I find lots big and small nails.

Pugwelt'tal plegu'jl wegetu'gul.
We will need a lot of tacks.

Plegu'ji'j wejimna'tu nmugsng.
I took a small nail out of my shoe.

Plesg na maw mejiga'tu'titl wenji'guoml.
Pigeons make a real mess on houses.

Amuj na plgoqq, telseggntijig.
They must be sweethearts, they're holding each other so tight.

Ge' jugwa'tui na mesgi'g plos.
Bring me that big brush.

plu'jaqamat.translation: He/she looks in a mirror (at self)
example:
Mejijg newt plu'jaqamat gesgmnaq tewiegw egsitpu'g.
He/she looks in the mirror one more time before heading out in the
morning.

Ge' jugwasgnmui na plu'jaqamati, taliulm'tu'n.
Would you pass me that mirror, please.

Lisa, ntus, pmetug wigit.
Lisa, my daughter, lives beside me.

Pnamujuigu'sg na mawitge'g.
It's very cold in January.

Ta'n tligtnutugneg na pnasu'lgweg?
I wonder what that vessel looked like.

Nti na goqwei wigapu'g pesetoq, smtug na pne'sugwati wenaqiaq.
When my dog smells something delicious, right away the drool
starts.

Egsitpugwatalapnn poggwitewe'l.
I had buckwheat pancakes for breakfast.

Jijuaqa na mawulipta'mamg po'gwinigtug.
Sometime you catch a lot fish in a lagoon.

Telte'tmann wi'gatignn ala'toqol ugpojmg.
I think he/she has the papers in his/her pouch.

Ponjn natgimg'p, tepietew na ugjit gesig.
I ordered a large molasses barrel, it will be enough for the winter.

Getu po'qatl lasqo'plawl pas'g mu po'qign eggunmug.
He/she wants to drill the board but he/she doesn't have a drill.

Wen gis po'q'g npata'wtim?
Who accidentally drilled my table?

Ulagu newtigisg'g po'qigep, nugu' siwa'l'j.
Yesterday he/she spent all day drilling, he/she is fed up with it.

Getu' po'qatl lasqo'plawl pas'g mu po'qign geggunmug.
He/she wants to drill a hole in the board but he/she doesn't have a
drill bit.

Nuji'j poqjiatgitemit te's uggwitl maja'sinij.
My grandchild starts to cry, everytime his/her mom leaves.

Pujig poqjigtapegia'tijig, pas'g pe'l esgmala'titl ula gaqewo'gwenin.
They will start singing soon, but first they are waiting for this
person to finish speaking.

Gi's poqjigwitamultijig sitmug?
Did they start fishing down at the shore yet?

Poqjigwitna'pnaq asugom ajieteg.
He/she started of by canoe at six o'clock.

Glapis gatu poqjilugweg ula npisun wesua'tuap.
Finally the medicine I took is starting to work.

Sapo'nug poqtlugwet ntjignam.
My brother starts working tomorrow.

meanings: start of cool draft or breeze
example:
Mu geitu ta'n wejiaq, gatu telo'tm poqjineweg.
I don't know where it is coming from, but I feel a cool draft.

Tami eimu's'p poqjintimgeg?
Where were you when the fighting started?

Taluisit na e'pite's poqjintoq?
What is the name of the young woman who just started to sing?

Na'tam ne'w ajiep poqjiwsgeteg.
It was about four when he/she began fishing.

Mu gis'punelmigw newt poqjiws'ggewe'geg.
He/she couldn't stop laughing once he/she started.

poqjiwsit.translation: He/she moves or vacates a residence
example:
Nitap poqjiwsit sapo'nug.
My friend is moving tomorrow.

Maljewe'juianeg i'tlta'siap poqomaqan'sgul gisie'wm'gl ugjit
wasoqonn.
When I was young I thought that cattails could be used for
torches.

Ge' najigtantunej poqonaqalusgul.
Let's go and find wigwam poles.

poqtamga'latl.translation: He/she carries him/her away or take him/her along
example:
Poqtamga'latl, tlia' mnaq gisite'tmug ta'n eliej.
He/she leaves taking him/her along, even if he/she hasn't decided 
the destination yet.

poqtamga'sit.translation: He/she sets off on a journey
example:
Ugti'l nespnatl te's poqtamga'sij.
S\he brings along his\her dog when ever s\he goes somewhere.

poqtamga'toq.translation: He/she carries it away or takes it along
example:
So'sep maja'sit aq poqtamga'toq ms't utapsun.
Joseph is leaving and taking all his belongs.

Poqtamgiet wisgipgo'q, sigua'lanej aqtamgiej.
The ash can is starting to fill-up, let's empty it when it's half full.

poqtamgwe'get.translation: He/she starts off poling a boat
example:
Poqtamgwe'gepnaq sepei.
He/she started off poling a boat this morning.

Etug ula nmu'j wa'gwit, muta poqtapa'teget.
Maybe this dog has fleas, because he's/she's starting to scratch.

Miti'sl poqtatejimatl, nugu' pgising ta'n eliej ma' newte'jit nipi
naspigw.
He/she drags away the tree, by the time he/she arrives at his/her
destination not a single leaf will be attached to the tree.

Gi's pana unjann poqtatpematl.
Already he/she is beginning to nag at his/her child.

Lola wenaqa'latl unjann aq poqtawlalatl.
Lawrence picks up his child and carries him/her away.

Te's'g newtsini'w poqtawlatg, etug ma gneg ugjiegw.
He/she is leaving with so much stuff all at once, I don't think he/she
will be able to get too far.

Jel tmg seg'pilgl ugpita'qaweiml gesgmnaq poqtawlegw.
He/she first tightenes his/her pants before he/she starts lugging the
load.

Nuji'j pas'g tapuipuna't aq gi's poqtewo'gwet.
My grandchild is just two years old and he/she is already begining
to speak.

Poqtigimateg unjann gaqatepiaqap mijipjewei ignmuaj nespnmnin.
When he/she sent off his/her child he/she provided plenty of food
for him/her to bring along.

Poqtisugwi na ge'sgmnaq sa'sewgwija'siw.
I'm going to start paddling before I change my mind.

Nti gesatg poqt'tesg'g ms't goqwei.
My dog likes to chase everything.

Migwite'tgeg tawoqwei getu pipanimapnn, poqt'tesguapnn.
When he/she remembered what he/she meant to ask him/her,
he/she ran after him/her.

Te's nti nemiaj ngwisl na pqotuggwalatal.
Whenever my dog sees my son he'll begin following him.

Nti getu' poqtuggwatg ms't goqwei.
My pet wants to follow everything.

Nitap poqwajite'tg tepa'sin gwitn.
My friend mistrust's getting on a canoe.

Ninen apje'ji'jultie'g poqwa'lamgewei mawpugwelg'p.
When we were small the choke cherry was plentiful.

Telpoqwa'lat, waqaj gis glusit.
His/her throat is so dry, he/she is barely able to speak.

Ugpitni'sewen nuta'tes poqwas'tiei.
If you're sewing by hand you'll need a thimble.

Tala's'gsneg ntpoqwatignmeg?
Where did my umbrella go?

Panianug Potloteg najimitugutinej.
Next spring let's go visiting in Chapel Island.

Gi's mesp't puggwana'tasit pqalmawj?
Have you tasted smoked blacksalmon?

Pqa'lu'sgw na apjiw megwe'g Epegwitg.
The clay is always red in Prince Edward Island.

Tam wejiet ula pqwa'w?
Where does this bark come from?

Psa'mun gegnuoqsas'g mawwigapu'g.
Brisket is delicious when cooked right.

Mu geitm'g psan gisgug?
I wonder if it's going to snow today?

Psanji'j gisiga'q wela'gwe'g.
We had light snow last night.

Psaqa'gw na st'ge' miti's ugtanguoweim.
The bark is like the tree's fur (skin).

Psesgw na gismawe'wmn npisunigtug.
You can use mint along with medicine.

Mawwigp'gig sissla'gwa'tasijig pse's'sg.
I like the taste of fried onions.

Jiglo'tu na psetgunn awtigtug.
Take those branches away from the road.

Psetgunatgw alie'wg ugjit ugtaptu'n.
He/she's using an old tree branch for a cane.

Amgwes na psew seie'g'p ta'n telie'was'g, mu na pitenugup
qasawo'qigtug.
In the past gun powder was used loose, it wasn't packed in metal.

Ignnmuates nugumij ala tia'mue'l psg'sann, negm wigt'gl.
Give the moose shoulders to my grandmother, she enjoys the taste
of them.

Ps'guigu's na ni'n ajipunai.
I have my birthdy in July.

Psgweso'qon na mawuljewiaq ugjit pita'q msigu.
The scythe is very handy for tall grass.

Amgwes na Pastung i'sowa's'g'p psi'gwaqan.
The river drives used to be in the states.

meanings: organ taken from pig to predict weather
example:
Psigweta'w wejiet gulgwi'sigtug.
This organ is from the pig.

Pemisugwij majuggwatew psitn.
As he/she canoes he/she will follow the river channel.

Ala atoqwa'su pema'q psitnu'jigtug.
There's a trout swiming in the little channel.

Ge' jugwa'tui go'qoli'gwe'juei p'tew.
Bring me some chicken broth.

Pe' p'tewei guta'tnnap.
Let me pour tea for you.

Tio'tis asma nige' etlp'teweie'mat.
Eunice is having her tea break right now.

Welamugsit na peteweio'q
That's a beautiful teapot.

Ge' ntuisgmi tapuijig puesu'g wenju'su'nnl?
Would you sell me two bushels of apples?

Wesgowa'sit nige', plamu'g etlpuggwana'laji.
He/she is at it now, smoking the salmon.

meanings: place, apparatus or utensil for smoking meat, etc...
example:
Ge' gisgaja'tunej na puggwana'taqan ugjit sapo'nug.
Let's get that smoker ready for tomorrow.

Puggwana'tasit nme'j mawwigapu'gsit.
Smoked fish is very good (taste).

Puggwana'teget ugjit ula wejgwipug.
He/she is smoking food for the coming winter.

Ms't ala wius getu' puggwana'toq.
He/she wants to smoke all of that meat.

Ge' jugwa'tui na puggwanaw.
Please bring me that smoked fish.

Etug eig wen ta'n mu talte'tmug puglie'wei mesn'g?
Is there anyone who doesn't mind when they get a pimple?

Pu'gowijuigl ntpita'q'weiml nipugtug apllugwei.
My pants are full of sap I just come back from working in the
woods.

Wela'gwe'g pugtew gisituap, nige' pas'g pugsaqatew esgwiaq.
Last night I made fire, this morning there is only ember left.

Pugsaqte'gna'tas'g wenji'guom mawuliangamgug.
A cedar shingled house has a great look.

Pugsetew na mawinqamase'g ta'n telpeigwa's'g.
It is very easy for soot to go every where.

Mutt nngopa'siw na'te'l, wesampugsetewig.
Don't sit there, it's too sooty.

Nujiwaqama'toqol pugto'guoml pugsetewit.
The chimney cleaner is all sooty.

Pugsigna'qewit na gajue'wj, lpa wijei aq apugsign.
That cat is hairy, just like a lynx.

Pe'l ta's'g pugsug pisgwo'tuap.
I will just bring in some firewood.

Mawulp'sewet pugsugei epsaqtejg.
A wood stove gives a nice heat.

Tami wejipoqtamgleg na pugtew?
Where did that fire start from?

Mawintago'ltijig na pugteweie'jg ta'n tujiw we'ju'j wisgipgigtug.
Black crickets are very shy when they are found in the ashes.

Gaqisimilamu'g putewijg putewijguo'guomg.
There are many different kinds of liquor at the liquor store.

Pugtewit na gesaset aq pita'q ugsuguni.
The comet is very bright and has a long tail.

Pugtewu'lgw na apjiw pipugweg ta'n tujiw oqwa'q .
A steamship always blows it's horn when it is coming in (to port).

Ulagu waqama'tuap ntpugto'guominen.
I cleaned our chimmney yesterday.

Pugto'guome'j na wetagutg ta'n ja'wa'lie'j wetapegsij.
The cricket comes from the same family as the grasshopper.

Migwite'tm newte' a'tugwaqan ta'n pugulatmujg
elisgnuatmua'tipnn tesipowgw ugsuguniwal miawitpa'q.
I remember one story where dwarves braided the tails of hourses
in the middle of the night.

Gisipipgitawsitesg pas'g newte'jit puguluan gu'gunj.
You can live a long life with just one kidney.

Matues ugpugumaqanm na gawi'g.
The porcupine's weapon is quills.

Nti na mawpugunesit, na miamuj gistlui'tieg puguna'w.
My dog is very bushy, so I suppose I could call him/her a hairy
animal.

Ni'n nti mawpugunesit.
My dog is very bushy.

Tami nmi'j pugu'sgw, jugwa'tuites.
If you see a dead dry yellow birch anywhere, bring it to me.

Migwite'lmg ntlamugsis pugwaja'lateg gopital.
I remember when my uncle dressed a beaver.

Sepei na pugwalesg peita'pnig.
The swallows arrived this mornng.

Pugwatqasig na ula sa'qawei awti.
This old road is bushy.

Welpugwatqasit ula miti'ji'j.
This little tree is nice and bushy.

Wapusue'gei na ta'n etlpugwatqeg.
I'm going to hunt rabbits in the thicket.

Nuji'j telimit, ge' pugwei pipnaqan smi.
My grandson tells me, can you give me a piece of bread.

Pugwelgig mimajuinu'g peita'jig ugjit Se'ta'neumg.
Many people have arrived for St. Anne's Day.

Na we'gwipugweliaq mijipjewei ta'n wejiei!
My, there is lots of food where I came from!

Jiptug me' pugwelietew nme'j panianug.
Perhaps there will be more fish this spring.

pugweliganig.translation: It has many buildings or houses
example:
Na welpugweliganig ula utanji'j.
This village has many bulidings.

pugweliget.translation: There are many living together in a group
example:
Amgwes na mawpugweligemg'p.
One time we would live together in large groups.

Mu ma'munsmug umtijin, gatu pugweligu'niet.
He/she didn't cut his/her thumb very badly, but he/she is bleeding
profusely.

Ges'pugwelijuig na salawei.
The salt is flowing excessively.

Ntsamqwano'qm pugwelijuit.
My water bottle flows extensively.

pugwellugwet.translation: He/she does a lot of work
example:
Pugwellugwet gisgug ji'mn, emangwe'g gmu'jeg.
The man did a lot of work today, there's a lot of wood piled there.

Telte'lmg negm pugwenng ta'n te's'g goqwei.
I think he/she has lots of every thing.

Pugwennatl na telamugsinitl a'papi'l.
S/he has plenty of that kind of rope.

Pie'l pugwistina'gewit.
Peter has a hairy body.

Mu etug ugs'tqamug eimug pui'gn ta'n tepjignatal nti'l ta'n
telpi'gwatignmij.
I don't think there is a broom on earth that can keep up with the
way my dog sheds hair.

Ge' jugwasga'tui na pui'gnji'j.
Would you pass me that little broom.

Pujite'lmatl ugta'piml ulipta'manin.
He/she trusts that his/her fishing net will get a good catch.

Me' pujite'tg na ula sa'qawei utepaqan.
He/she still trusts his/her old vehicle.

Puljain tet ta'pu na'gweg pemiaq.
The train passes here twice a day.

Puljainawti'l na apjiw mawultepaqtegl.
Railroads are usually nice and straight.

Lpa Daniel mu getu'punajeiwagul ugjignaml.
Daniel just doesn't want to stop pestering his brother.

punajimatl.translation: He/she stops lecturing or berating someone
example:
Glapis gatu gisite'tmi'tij punajimtinew.
They have finally decided to stop nagging each other.

Glapis gatu punajo'tgeg na wigji'jaqaneg.
He/she has finally left that toy alone.

puna'latl.translation: He/she leaves or separates from someone
example:
Glapis So'sep gispuna'latl ugpu'taiml.
Finally Joseph can leave his bottle alone.

Ma' jiptug punalti'gw.
Hopefully they will not seperate.

Natnmiates ta'n tujiw punatalg.
Go see him/her when he's/she's done eating.

Malia'n puna'toqeg ugtlugowaqaneg.
Mary Ann has quit her job.

Gisa'lugsieg, lpa mu gis punenmultiweg.
Because of him/her/it, we couldn't stop laughing.

Pe'l tla'sij, punewentew na.
Let him/her be, he/she will stop talking.

Glapis nujigina'muet punewistoq.
Finally the teacher stops talking.

Ugta'tugwaqannmual teliuls'tmaqal, lpa mu pualaqig
punewo'gutinew.
Their stories are so compelling, I don't what them to stop talking.

Gisgug So'sep punlugowatl wenujl.
Today Joseph stops working for the Frenchman.

Punlugwe'g sa'qewei nutepaqaneg.
My old vehicle has stopped working.

Ugmalpale'witeml gistlimtl amujpa punlugwet tapu'gl aqantie'uti'l.
His/her doctor has told him/her he/she must stop working for two
weeks.

Pie'l nugu' punqatg nipugtug.
Peter finally stops living in the woods.

puntalatl.translation: He/she casts a spell on someone
example:
Mu gejiaqig me' i'mu'tinew mimajuinu'g ta'n gisipuntala'titl wenn.
I don't know if there are people that can cast a spell on someone
anymore.

Teluejig ala gisigui'sgw nata'putat.
They say that that old woman knows how to cast a spell.

puntatg.translation: He/she casts a spell on it
example:
Wen puntatmutug ula wenji'guom?
Who would have cast a spell on this house?

Mijua'ji'j mu puntemigw glapis ungi'gu nemiateg.
The baby wouldn't stop crying until he/she saw his/her parents.

Teluejig na gisigu'ji'j to'q puowin.
They say that that old man is a shaman.

Pana ne'gaw tele'g, pusgenmit aq gise'g.
He/she has always been that way, he/she laughs easily and is fun.

Malia'n welgwijing aq pusgenmit.
Mary Ann is happy and laughs often.

pusgialagnutg.translation: He/she usually goes around spreading rumors
example:
Pusgialagnutg Restigouche Drive-Thru.
He gossips at the Restigouche Drive-Thru.

pusgialigs'ta'gwet.translation: He/she frequently visits at meal-time for free meals
meanings: frequently visits at meal-time for free meals
example:
Nitap na pusgialigs'ta'gwet.
My friend usually likes to visit around meal-time.

Amujpa gigj'pugu'tut muta pusgigjipulgwet.
He/she has to be closely monitored because he/she is prone to
epileptic seizures.

So'sep pusgigsatg'p wetmatj.
Joseph used to like to smoke.

Pusgilugwet na muling.
He/she usually works at the mill.

Pusgimt'g muta musuwalaji wo'guma.
He/she cries (repeatedly) because he/she misses his/her family.

Ewe'n na wape'g, pusgiullugweg.
Use the white one, it usually works well.

Pusgiullugwet ta'n tujiw newtugwa'lugwej.
He/she usually works well when he/she is alone.

Pusgiweniet ta'n wigij.
He/she often forgets where he/she lives.

Ntul wejipusig sitmug aq eliaq qame'g.
My boat is leaving from the shore and going to town.

Pusitaq aq etlwanta'suatgeg ugta'gwesn.
He/she has already left and he/she forgot his/her hat.

Pustemit na e'pite'ji'j.
That little girl cries often.

Ta'n wen wenju'agut na negm teluet "pusu'l".
The French use "Bonjour!" for "Greetings!".

Pusu'lewugtuatl ta'n te'snnitl wenn pisgwa'nij.
He/she greets everyone that enters.

Pusu'l Puna'ne.translation: I wish you (singular) a Happy New Year!
example:
Pusu'leg Puna'ne!
We (plural) wish you a Happy New Year!
Pusu'loq Puna'ne!
I wish you (plural) a Happy New Year!

Pusu' Puna'ne.translation: I wish you (singular) a Happy New Year!
example:
Pusu'leg Puna'ne!
We (plural) wish you a Happy New Year!
Pusu'loq Puna'ne!
I wish you (plural) a Happy New Year!

Milamugsit pu'tai eig, alt apje'ji'jultijig aq alt mesgilultijig.
There is all kinds of bottles, some smalls ones and some big ones.

pu'talqanatl.translation: He/she feels the inside of...with his/her hands
example:
Wi'sisuwei malpale'wit i'pu'talqanaji wenj'tia'mug.
A veterinarian often feels the insides of cows.

pu'talqang.translation: He/she feels the inside of it with the hand
example:
Mali gesatg pu'talqang ugs'tuaqann.
Mary likes to dig inside her ears.

Elmaqe'ji'j eteg ga'qanigtug ta'n wej'pu'tapa'simg.
There is a hole in the door where you can peep through.

Sepei na gisputaqatl gulgwi'sl.
He/she butchered a pig this morning.

So'sep etlputaqiget magasang.
Joseph does the butchering at the store.

Ma'munputewisgwa's'g na ula ntijin sepei gaqsmap.
My thumb has blistered a lot since I burnt it this morning.

Nqon putewisgwa'sit.
My heel blisters.

Pu'tlaqan telialagweg ta'n etllugwej.
Wood shavings are scattered all around his/her work place.

Putmaianeg wela'gweg wejia'neg bingo.
I came out empty handed last night when I went to bingo.

Tami telue's'p etlnmi't put'p?
Where did you say you saw a whale?

Sepei gisigsite'm ntpitn, aq atel nige' poqjiput'pegiaq.
I hurt my hand this morning, and only now is it starting to swell up.

Nitap mu weleiug, teltasit put'pegiet.
My friend is not feeling well, he thinks he is swelling up.

Put'pe'j gigj'guatl uggwitl.
The young whale stays close to his/her mother.

Tmg putualatl epsinitl tap'tann gesgmnaq malqmagw.
First he/she blows on the hot potato before he/she eats it.

Put'p te's putuatamij na samqwan tewputuatg.
Everytime the whale blows he/she blows water out.

Ajipunaian gaqatepiatal wasoqonmaqann putuatmann.
On my birthday there will be plenty of candles for me to blow.

Ginita'jig putugtesultijig.
They are doing their best to dance up a storm.

Putuisgwa's'g ntijin aq gesnuguig.
My thumb is forming a blister and it hurts.

Wen qalipitew awti'j?
Who will shovel the path?

Ta'n telmatama'si gisgug amujpa qalipitm ntawti.
To get to the road I had to shovel my path out today.

Mu pugwelu'g galipu'g eswia'tijig gm'tginaq.
There are only a few caribu left in our territory.

Pie'l mawqalipu'sitalatl ugte'piteml.
Peter is extremely jealous of his wife.

Gesge'g qaliputi we'jites tu'sati'jigtug.
You will find the wide shovel in the shed.

Te's qalqwasiej, mi'watm ta'n telgelu'lg na'gweg.
On each sun set, I am thankful for a good day.

meanings: other side of valley or plain
example:
Qame'g wejia'p gisgug.
I was across the river today.

Qasawo'q melgignaq aq milwegeg.
Iron is strong and has many uses.

Ge' gltaqpile'n e'wmn qasawo'qapi.
Tie it using the wire.

Ula ntuom qasawo'qei.
My pot is made of iron.

Ne'wijig qasawo'qu'jg wega'tes siggnn ltu'n.
You will need four knitting needles to make socks.

qasgo'tg.translation: He/she takes or withdraws in small amounts
meanings: take or withdraw in small amounts
example:
Gaqo'tgeg ugsulieweimeg ge's qasgo'tg.
He/she finally used up his/her money, he/she has been withdrawing
in small amounts.

Qasgusi'g nigwejig gigjiw ta'n wigi.
Cedar trees grow near where I live.

So'qwiei aq natgwilm mesgi'g qasgusia'qamigt.
I'm going up the woods to look for a large cedar grove.

qasgwatalg.translation: He/she eats a little at a time
meanings: eat a little at a time
example:
Nuji'j gesatg gasgwatalg.
My grandchild likes to eat a little at a time.

Pas'g te'sigisg'g qasgweiwatl pgu'l, pgijeiwatal.
He/she only has a small amount of the fudge each day, he/she will
make it last a long time.

Ge' angamug na te'sipow pemqa'sgwit.
Would you look at that galloping horse.

Qataig negm wigit Listugujg.
He/she lives half-way in Listuguj.

Uliangweiu na qopisun.
Take good care of the infant.

Pa wijei aq plu'jaqamati, qospemg teliewipg.
It's just like a mirror, the water is so calm at the lake.

qoti.translation: Pole for hanging dried meat inside wigwam
meanings: pole for hanging dried meat inside wigwam
example:
Gis ge'gwistaqa'tm'g na pugwelg wius qotiigtug.
You can hang plenty of meat on a beam inside a wigwam.

Qwa'niej na qwa'nuijuwitelmaten.
A phoney will be considered a phoney.

Qwa'niejuei ta'n te's'g goqwei netuisgetas'g tet.
All the items for sale here are imitations.

Sa'l na maw gisue'g alnasguj wenji'guomg.
A shawl is nice and warm to wear around the house.

Sasewa'tu na salawapu, pilei samugwan iga'tu.
Change the salt water, put some clean water.

salawa'tat.translation: He/she adds salt to his/her food
example:
Mamuniw salawa'tat na ula nitap.
My friend uses lots of salt.

Gisigwsamsalawa'tuann ntwa'wml sepei.
I over salted my eggs this morning.

Me' gatu salawe'gig ula lgetu'g.
My these mushrooms are salty.

Tami eteg salawei?
Where is the salt?

Pas'g Nuelewumg to'q nitap salite'wa'tegetew.
Only at Christmas does my friend give to charity.

Salite'wit ugjit a's'tuo'guom.
He/she collects donations for the church.

Wenewei na salpo'l?
Who's sail boat is that?

Ulagu maqatui'siap salpolgu'j aq getapa'qapneg.
Yesterday I borrowed a small sailboat and it sunk.

Sama'latl witapal aq telimatl gesalul.
He/she touches his/her friend and then tells him/her I love you.

samamatl.translation: He/she gets a glimpse of someone
example:
Pas'g samamatl, gatu nenuatl ujjl smtug.
He/she just caught a glimpse of him, but he/she knew his/her father
immediately.

samapt'g.translation: He/she gets a glimpse of it
example:
Wejo'tg gisiangaptmn pas'g pas gis samapt'g
He/she tries to get a look but is only able to get a glimpse
of it.

Te's sama'toq na gaqsit.
Each time he/she touches it he/she burns.

Mu' eigtnug tami samqwan ajiwigapu'g aq Listugujg.
Nowhere is there better tasting water than in Listuguj.

P'tew samqwanapua'q, pe' gijga' siawoqse'n.
The broth is thin (watery), keep simmering it for a bit
longer.

Samqwani'j mu nnim wigigw samqwanigtug.
A toad doesn't live in the water much.

Ugjupega'l ta'n te'sit samqwano'q nemi't.
Fill every water container that you see.

Jaqalsamta'tl umisl aq wesmugwat.
He/she quickly taps his/her older sister and flees.

Pas'g samte'g nutepaqan aq siawa'sit
He/she slightly taps my car and keeps on going.

Gisisamtesg'g tuop'ti aq teminetesgeg.
He/she brushed against the window and it cracked.

Tlia' pas'g gijga' samtesgaj, guietew.
Even if you just brushes against him/her/it slightly, he/she/it will
topple.

Samuqwaniaq npugug aq nunji gesnuguig.
My eye is watery and I have a headache.

Njigun samuqwaniet.
I have water on the knee.

Sangew panta'tu ga'qan, mutt jaqalpisgwa'w.
Open the door slowly, don't go in quickly.

Sangewa'latl na ugti'l ta'n ela'latl.
He/she goes slowly with his/her pet to the destination.

Telo'tm na'gusetewei sangewa's'g gisgug.
I feel that the clock/time is slow today.

Telsangewa'sit tepna'tesnu pugjig.
He/she is going so slow we will catch up to him/her soon.

Lugowinu na sangewa'toq lgowaqan.
The worker slows down the job.

Sangewi'si glaman ns'tuwiten.
I speak slowly so I will be understood.

Nmijgamij sangewite'lmit ugjit e'wmuan ugtul.
My grandfather trusts me to use his boat properly.

Sangewite'tew goqwei gis nmitoq.
He/she will trust something if he/she has/can see it.

Sangew angita'sit ge's mu gelusigw.
He/she thinks slowly before he/she speaks

Wejo'tmap lugwatmn, gatu telo'tm newte' me' telsangewlugweg.
I tired to fix it, but I find it is still working slowly.

Geji'g sangewlugwet, pas'g ta'n goqwei gisa'toq mawmujgajewei.
I know he/she works slowly, but what he/she produces is the best.

Sangewewo'gwet nujigina'muet glamen ulins'tuaten.
The teacher speaks slowly so he/she will be well understood.

Ngij i'agnutmuip ta'n telsangewsewemg te'sipow e'wuj.
My mother used to tell me about how slowly one would plow
when using a horse.

Nti wetng nutepaqan aq sapa'lit metuguna'q.
My dog, by pulling the sled, got me through the storm.

Plamu'l sapalqata'tl e'w'g migwije'maqan.
He/she stabbed the salmon using a fork.

Telgneg tu'aqann elegetl lpa sapalqate'g tuop'ti ala wenji'guomg
eteg.
He/she threw the ball so far that he/she make a hole through the
window in the house (far away) over there.

Ngij eltoq sapann ugjit wela'gewei
My mom is making batter for supper.

sapa'qe'g.translation: It is an opening that goes through
example:
Mu' gelu'ltnug na gmu'j, sapalqe'g.
That stick is not good, it's got a hole through it.

Sa'qati'l e'watal sapaqqate'lit.
He/she will use a needle to stab me with.

Sapatis napuisit ujja.
Jean-Baptiste is named after his father (who is deceased).

Ninen sapa'tueg wenji'guom ugjit mu nu'gwa'n.
We save the house from burning.

Sapawsit gatu mejit newte' wela'gw.
He/she survived yet another night.

Tegen na'gweg gi'l telta'sin maw sape'wig?
What day do you think is most holy?

Sapo'nug na Sape'wig Gesp'teg.
Tomorrow is Holy Saturday.

Na'gweg ta'n Se'suso'q wesua'toqop ugtejgewei weloqotalultimg
na teluisig Sape'wig Ne'wowei.
The day that Jesus took his last supper is called Holy Thursday.

Pie'l tluenes na negm mawsape'winu
You would say that Peter is the most Saintly.

Sape'wit ta'n te'sit mimajuinu.
Every person is saintly.

Amujpa nigansa'pmn na mgegn gesgmmnaq gis'li'smu'n.
You have to pierce that leather before you can sew it.

Sa'pign e'w'tes gtu'li'smn m'gegn.
Use an awl if you are going to sew that leather.

Pe'l tlu'gine'n, sapo'nug na sapo'nugitew.
Be patient, tomorrow will be tomorrow.

Ta'n getu te's'g aligew nasgm, saptaqjin, telitge'g.
No matter how much clothing I wear, I'm chilled through, it's so
cold.

Amu gis sapta'tl mijua'ji'jl.
The bee stung  the child.

Amu gis sapte'lit npaqamg.
A bee just stung my back.

Ula nitap na mawsapun.
My friend is a contrary person.

Tetujima'munielpanigs'g amujpa saputalqatmeg ntawtinen.
The snow drifts are so high we must dig through them to get
out.

saputaqatg.translation: He/she lasts or stays through it
example:
Newtipug saputaqatg nipugtug.
He/she was able to endure staying in the woods all winter.

Tewjitge'g ula wenji'guom lpa ugju'sn saputa's'g.
This house is so cold the wind goes through.

Ntmaqaqjigeweim saputasgiaq ntisigng.
My big toe is penatrating through my sock.

Suel nugu' saputasgiet na lasqo'plaw.
At this point that board is almost sticking all the way
through.

Ngwis saputa'sit mesgi'gewei ginamasuti.
My son has succeeded at a university education.

saputawsit.translation: He/she recovers from an illness or an injury
example:
Saputawsit gatu, tetujiesp'teg wetnisiep.
He/she will live, after falling from such a height.

Telgina'sit ennmtestoq wa'qan suel saputeta'tl lasqo'plawl.
He/she put so much effort into throwing the knife that he/she
almost went through the wood.

saputete'g.translation: He/she pierces it through by a blow
example:
Newt eleget guntew aq saputete'g tuop'ti.
One throw and the rock passes through the window.

saputetelg.translation:
He/she penetrates or pierces through it with a bullet or an arrow or
compressed air/water
meanings: penetrate or pierce through (with bullet or arrow or compressed air/water)
example:
Lpa saputetelg msaqtaqt ge's etlwaqama'toq pe'sgewei.
He/she shot a hole right through the floor while he/she was
cleaning the gun.

saputeteluatl.translation: penetrates or pierces through him/her with a bullet or an  arrow
meanings:
penetrate or pierce through (with bullet or arrow or compressed
air water)
example:
Ttilsl petsaputeteluatl ge'sg etlwaqama'tog ugpe'sgeweim.
He/she accidently shot through a plank of wood while cleaning
his/her gun.

Te's eleget uggat na saputetesg'g wastew.
Every time he/she kicks, he /she kicks through the snow.

Lpa saputetesguatl la'taqsunn tegtesguateg.
He/she kicked a hole through the bucket when he/she kicked
it.

Maljewe'juiteg maja'sip, sa'q mu nemi'tulti'gw.
When he/she was young he/she left, they haven't seen each other
for a long time.

Pilei msigu ula tet etlsaqaliaq.
New grass is growing here.

Glapis gatu nmiti'sji'jm saqaliet.
Finally my little tree sprouts.

Milamugsijig saqalo'pi'g nasi'sasultijig magotigtug.
There are many different colored ribbons sewn onto the dress.

Ula saqama'j teluisit Sulian
This young man name is William.

Ala saqama'sgw alsutg mesgi'g wenji'guom.
That lady owns a large house.

Nei'ateja'sit, gispilsit, pa wijei aq saqamaw.
He enters (walks in), all dressed up, looking like a gentleman.

Wen ula tet etlsaqamawit?
Who is the boss here?

Ge' pustmui getu' saqamu'guei.
Would you give me a piece of gum, I want to chew.

saqaniaq.translation: The level of snow falls due to melting/thaw
meanings: falling level of the snow due to melting/thaw
example:
Ta'n tujiw siggw na maw gaqu'saqaniaq wastew.
The snow melts quickly in the spring.

saqanqapit.translation: He/she lies on the floor or the ground
meanings: lie on the floor or ground
sit on the floor or ground
example:
Gaqapei'gwigwilaq, ula saqanqapit msaqtaqtug.
I've looked all over the place, here he/she/it is lying on the floor.

saqanqateg.translation: It lies on the floor or the ground
meanings: lie on the floor or ground
sit on the floor or ground
example:
Ula wi'gatign saqanqateg gi'lewei?
This paper on the ground is it yours?

Ni'n sa'qati'g jipalgig, gatu gi'l?
I'm afraid of needles, what about you?

Telipgiteg newte' ntpitn, lpa sa'qati'ju'aq
My hand stayed in one place/position so long, it became numb.

Gisigu saqatuetesing msaqtaqtug.
The old man slips and falls on the floor.

Ge' jugwa'tui na sa'qawei.
Bring me the one that's old.

sa'qawejjuei.translation: It is old or worn out
example:
Sa'qaweijuei na ula nmagotm.
This is my old dress.

Mu' nugu' pugwelgtnugl saqawi'gann esgwiaql Listugujg.
There are not many old houses left in Listuguj.

Ms't saqpo'ltieg, telma'munlaq.
We are all wet, it is raining so hard.

Wesamsaqpejaq maqamigew ugjit milita'nenu.
The ground is too damp for us to play on.

Saqpejaqamig na ta'n wigi.
Where I live the ground is wet.

Poqjisqapiaq ula tet, tami etug wejiaq samuqwan?
It's beginning to get damp here, I wonder where the water is
coming from?

Ta'n tujiw gigpesaq, ngotm saputisaqpiet.
When it rains, my coat gets moist right through.

Ala ji'nm alpuguit saqpigjat.
That man standing there has a wet bottom.

Saqpigu'nl i'tlapsglaqal pempegiaqal mijua'ji'j e'nateg uggwitl.
Great big tears came flowing down when the baby lost (couldn't
see) his/her mother.

Ntus etltemit aq ni'n etlsaqpigu'niei.
My daughter is crying and my tears are flowing.

Apli'gmujg se'siala'sit ta'n tujiw saqpipsaq.
A snowshoe hare will wonder aimlessly during a wet snow fall.

Wasoqwa'tu na saqsigwemgewei tet tlnme'jugwetesnu.
Light that torch we will fish right here.

saqsigwet.translation: He/she hunts by light at night
meanings: fish with light or torchlight (at night)
example:
Tami etlsaqsigwet So'sep?
Where is Joseph fishing by torchlight tonight?

Gesisaqte'g na a'papi wesgweiat.
That rope you're handling is really flat.

Sasapaq apjiw peta'lugutitaq gisigwegewigu's.
Jellyfish usually arrive here in August.

Getu' sa'se'wa'latl gispisunn pas'g mu we'jiagul.
He/she would like to exchange the belt but can't find it.

sa'se'wamugwa'latl.translation: He/she changes the color of him/her
example:
So'sep nata'sa'se'wamugwa'latl napui'gign.
Joseph can change the color of the picture.

sa'se'wamugwa'toq.translation: He/she changes the color of it
example:
Gaqi'sg sa'se'wamugwa'toq na wiguow.
He/she changes his/her house color often.

Te's telta'si gaqa'tegei, natgoqwei sa'se'wa's'g.
Everytime I think I am finished, something changes.

Jaqalsa'se'wa'sit na ula nitap.
My friend changes (demeanor) very fast.

Magasang eliei aq sa'se'wa'tu ula tmi'gn.
I'm going to the store to exchange this axe.

Telpisgwa't aq smtug sa'sewgna'sit.
He/she comes in and immediatly changes his/her clothes.

sa'se'wi'gatl.translation: He/she changes the writing on him/her
example:
Sa'se'wi'g'g gnugwatign, jiptug me' nige' nenuaten.
I am changing the writing for this letter, perhaps now it will be
more recognizable.

sa'se'wi'g'g.translation: He/she changes the writing on it
example:
Ngwis apoqonmaq sa'se'wi'g'g wi'gatign.
I help my son to change the writing on the paper.

Sa'se'wi'sitaq ap, nige' pas'g wenjui'sit.
He/she changed languages again, now he/she is only speaking
French.

Getu' sa'se'wi ula malige'w, pewalg me' mesgilg.
I want to exchange this barrel, I want a larger one.

Nuji'j sa'se'wi'tatl ugtapsute'gann gaqi'sg.
My granddaughter changes the name of her doll often.

sa'se'wi't'g.translation: He/she changes the name of it
example:
Gi's gaqi'sg sa'se'wi't'g ugtul.
He/she has often renamed his/her boat.

Pas'g ni'n ta'n etlnmi'g sasgatu na Rocky aq Bullwinkle.
The only place I've ever seen a flying squirrel is on Rocky and
Bullwinkle.

Jugwa'tui sa'slji'j aq gapji'j.
Bring me the saucer and the cup.

Pitgmal na sasqa'gwiji'jit, ala plamuei eteg.
Fill up the small pot, there's the salmon meat.

Tap'tang wissugwalj ula sasqa'gwit e'w.
When you cook potatoes use this pot.

Sasqaiejijig mawimtue'gig ta'n telgetmenuj newt mesu'lg.
Crab lice are difficult to get rid of once your infected with
them.

Tami etligtanujig sasqale'sg?
Where do you fish for scallops?

Sasqapit naqsun gislega'luj.
The sheet is flat after it is spread out.

Ma'li maw sasqasitat.
Mary is very flat-footed.

Gisigsigawa'timg ta'n tujiw welsasqateg awti.
You can travel fast on a flat road.

sasqatesing.translation: He/she falls flat on the belly
example:
Ge's pemtugwi'meg, pesoqtesgmaieg aq sasqatesineg.
As we ran, we stumbled and fell flat on our stomaches.

Gi's gi'l nemi't sasqatu?
Have you seen a squirrel?

Anagwe'j mawsasqe'g ta'n te'si'tij nme'jg.
The flounder is the flattest of all fish.

Umugsng asgaiaji muta sasqigatat.
His/her shoes are uncomfortable because he/she is
flat-footed.

Gi's gi'l nemi't wen sasqitnat?
Have you ever seen any one who is pug-nosed?

Ntlamugsisaq Pie'lo'q pita'qasnigl usapunn aq telui'tusnag Pie'l
Sa'ugwat.
My (late) uncle Peter apparently had long hair and was called Pie'l
Sa'ugwat.

Telgispnet pas'g nugu' sawepit mutputigtug.
He/she is so tired that he/she is just slouched on the chair.

Nespne'n sa'wesl, getu' gigpesaq.
Bring along the rain hats, it's about to rain.

Tewjiwelma'ita'sit lpa unji saweteg.
He/she is so sad his/her head is drooped down.

sawiptn.translation: Deformed or crippled hand or arm
meanings: deformed or crippled hand or arm
example:
Newte'jit nitap na sawiptn.
One of my friends has a deformed hand.

sawiptnat.translation: He/she has a deformed or crippled hand or arm
meanings: have deformed or crippled hand or arm
example:
Metua'l'j ta'n telpanta'toq ga'qan muta sawiptnat.
He/she is having a difficult time opening the door because he/she
has a crippled hand.

Se'g gi'l lia.
Go somewhere else.

Gi's gi'l angamt na'gu'set segewa't ta'n tujiw gesig?
Have you ever watched the sun rise during the winter?

segewe'get.translation: He/she has an illegitimate child or children
example:
Segewe'gepnig amsgwesewe'l unjanual.
Their first child was illegitimate.

Segewei na mawigsalut.
An illegitimate child is really loved.

Pe'l tmg segg'pilgpnig ula nmugsng.
First of all I'm going to tie my shoes tighty.

Segg'pilg gulaman ma' ewe'ga's'tnug.
He/she ties it tightly so it won't come loose.

Na we'giseggw ula petaqan.
This pie is so sweet.

Mu nugu sismo'qon gisie'wmu, pas'g gatu eig seggwewei.
I cannot use sugar any more, but there is always sweetner.

Pilei ntsegi'gnm.
My sail is new.

Ms't wen segit.
Everyone urinates.

Metua's'g nugu' magasan ta'n seiegn etlintuisgetas'g.
It is difficult to find a store that sells yards goods
anymore.

Seiegnji'j weljewiag ugjit magot.
A piece of material is good for a dress.

Gi's gi'l nemitu'n pugweligan seioqiaq?
Have you seen a multi-floor building collapse?

Te's gisa'luj gi's ap seioqiet.
Everytime it is fixed it collapses again.

Mu' getu tlimawt goqwei seitun.
You don't want to tell a blabbermouth anything.

sepapjit.translation: He/she holds something in concealment in his/her hand
meanings: hold in concealment in  the hand
example:
Lpa sepapji ntsulieweim, muta gesgeltm.
I'm holding my money in concealment, because I'm reluctent to
part with it.

Ta's ajiet menja'si's'p sepei?
What time did you get up at this morning?

Sepigwa'sit aq a'sutmat.
He/she closes his/her eyes and prays

Etug apjinpat na ji'nm, te's elapa'si na sepigwet.
That man must always be sleeping, everytime I look over he has
his eyes closed.

Sepitja'ltijig aq sangew maja'tijig.
They grasp each others hands and slowly depart.

Sepitja'toq guljie'wei aq a'sutmat.
He/she grasps the cross and prays.

Malpale'wit sangew sepp'saqa'latl saqati'l ngatg.
The doctor gently puts the needle into my foot.

Lasqo'plaw me' sepp'saqapit sisguigtug ta'n etlnisiep.
The board is still stuck in the mud where it fell.

Sepp'saqita'qal, gatu mu' saputasgita'nugul.
They penetrate, but they do not go through.

Etug sepp'saqa'sitew ula sa'qati m'ge'gnigtug.
Will this needle penetrate through the hide.

Ala llutaqanatgwgul sepp'saqategl sisguigtug.
Those fence posts are stuck into mud.

sepuijjenatl.translation: He/she hides or conceals in hand
example:
Sepuijjenatl ugtapsute'gan aq teluet "ni'newei".
He/she conseals his/her doll in his/her hand and says "its mine".

sepuijjeng.translation: He/she hides or conceals it in the hand
example:
Ala epite'ji'j sepuijjeng ugsuitism, jipatg ugsua'tugsin.
That little girl conceals her candy in her hand, she's afraid that
someone will take it.

sepulgomit.translation: He/she holds something under the arm
example:
Sepulgomitl ugpojml.
He/she carries his/her pouch under his/her arm.

Suel gaqa'l'gig pijjaqang, pugjig sepusa'l'gig.
I'm almost finished the mittens, I will soon knit them to a point.

Ni'n aq ngij sepusa'tueg pilei a'su'n.
My mother and I are bringing the new quilt to a point.

sepusepilatl.translation: He/she closes him/her/it by tying with rope or string
meanings: close by tying with rope or string
example:
Go'qoli'gwejl sepusepilatl muntiigtug.
He/she tied the chicken inside the bag.

sepusepilg.translation: He/she closes it by tying with rope or string
meanings: close by tying with rope or string
example:
Sepusepilmeg nutapsunnen aq maita'ieg.
We tie up our belongings and leave.

Sepusepit na ugpojm?
Is your purse closed up?

Gsusgwate'gnn amujpa sepusetegl ta'n tujiw gigpesaq.
Tent flaps need to be closed up when it rains.

sepusi'satl.translation: He/she sews closed the gap of a pointed(animate) article
meanings: sew closed gap of pointed(animate) article
example:
Pas'g sepusi'satl lamqwann aq gaqa'tegetew.
He/she just has to seam the undershirt and he/she will be done.

sepusi's'g.translation: He/she sews closed the gap of a pointed article
meanings: sew closed gap of pointed article (as sock or mitt)
example:
So'sep sepusi's'g ugtisign.
Joseph is darning his sock.

Te'sinipg ala e'pite's alsesagi'tew.
Every summer that young woman will go around barefooted.

Jipji'j se'sa'laji ugpi'gunmg aq ginialteja'sit.
The bird spreads it's feathers and struts around.

Se'saltugwepit na ula nnjan.
My child here has messy hair.

Gsnugowaqan mawjaqalse'sa's'g.
A virus does spread quickly.

Nti gesgatesingaq, alse'sa'sit na nige' na'tami.
My dog is out of sight, he/she must be wandering somewhere
close by.

So'sep na gis se'sa'toq unpo'gon.
Joe the one who messed up his/her own bed.

Amujpa sesgwalatl ugwisji'tl ugjit nqa'sinin gesgmnaq awtigtug
iga'nigw.
He/she had to yell at his/her little boy to stop before he reached
the road.

Sesgwe'gig na ula maw lugutieg.
These two I work with are hard workers.

Se'sgwei aq teluei tepiaq.
I shout and say it's enough.

Se'siaqawe'l nuta'tes ta'n tujiw najisulumgwe'gen.
You'll need bird shot if you go goose hunting.

Ma'munse'sigwalatl, lpa gaqapeigwigwalatl!
He/she really spread it around alot, it is spread everywhere!

se'sigwatg.translation: He/she spreads it around by hand
example:
Se'sigwatg mlageju'mi pipnaqanigtug.
He/she spreads the butter on the bread.

Sespa'sit na ala e'piteji'j ge's uggwitl etliesgipa'j.
That little girl is restless while she waits for her mother.

Etllasgugutieg na maw sespoltieg.
When we are playing cards is when we are really noisy.

sespeiatijig.translation: They are fooling around with each other
example:
Ala gi's sespeiatijig, pe'gw tetujimaljewe'juipnig.
Those two are involved in a relationship even though they're so
young.

Sespeiwatl na utmaqann, miamuj natgoqwei sespete'tg.
He/She is constantly handling his/her pipe, certainly he/she must be
preoccupied with something.

sespematl.translation: He/she continuously bothers or disturbs by talking
meanings: continuously bother or disturb by talking
example:
Nujigina'muet sespematl mijua'ji'tl ugjit gina'masinin.
The teacher nags the child to study.

Sespena'q na ula wesgowa'sin.
It's noisy here where you're at.

Sespenoqsultijig gujmug etlmilita'jig, aq gisoltijig.
The ones playing outside are noisy, and they are having fun.

Sespeta'q na ula ta'n wesgowitaieg.
It very noisy where we are.

E'pitji'j sespete'lmatl ugtji'nmuml pastung etlugweni'tl.
The young woman is worried about her husband working in the
US.

Nugu' siwsespete'tg ta'n te's'g goqwei.
He/she is tired of worrying about everything.

meanings: loud sound(s) made with the voice
example:
Sespetoqsit na ula ap'tapegiejit.
This turkey is awfully noisy.

Sespewo'gwet na ula gitapenu.
Our friend here likes to blab on.

Sespilugweg na wesgo'tmn, talgis telginta'q?
That thing you're working with is noisy, why is it so loud?

Ula nitape'sgw mawigsatg sesplugwej.
My female friend really likes to work noisily.

Nmu'juit ta'n wen sespo'teget.
He/she who molests is a dog.

Gis swisga'toq gwitn ge's sespo'tg.
He/she broke the canoe, because he/she tampered with it.

sespumatl.translation: He/she often mentions someone who is away
meanings: often mentions someone who is away
often mentions someone who is absent
example:
Sespumaji witapa, miamuj musualaji.
He/she mentions his/her friends often, he/she must miss them.

Nitap wejiet qame'g aq sesputg ta'n teliaq na'te'l.
My friend just came from town and is fussing about what is
happening there.

Se'suguli etlne'po't'p guljie'weigtug.
Jesus Christ was killed on the cross.

Ge's pemiei mgumigtug, jiniw sesupa'lugwei.
As I walk along the ice, suddenly I slip.

Sesupe'g ula plamu muta tewjisgmoqonit.
This salmon is slippery because he/she has this slimy coating on
him/her.

Ma'li na Se'sus uggwitl.
Mary is Jesus' mother.

E'pites es'ta'latl ugtapsute'gann.
The young woman puts her doll aside.

Setamg na wen wejigsmoqja'toq ugtul.
One pushes ones boat from the stern.

Teluejig Se'ta'n na Ma'lio'q ugsugwist'pnn.
It is said that Saint Anne was the Virgin Mary's aunt.

Maljewe'juianeg na maw pugwelg'p mimajuinu pegising Listugujg
Se'tane'umg.
When I was young a lot people used to come to Listuguj for St.
Anne's Day.

Se'ta'nji'jg wejia'p ulagu.
I went to Fredricton yesterday.

Esgmate'n, pugjig na mgumi es'ta's'g.
Wait, the ice will soon move aside.

Gijga' seta'sin ula elg negm gispa'sitew.
If you move over a bit this person can sit down too.

Gi's gi'l nemi't seta'su?
Have you seen squid?

Pe'l na mutputi es'ta'toq.
First he/she put the chair aside.

sewa'tat.translation: He/she sweetens his/her food or drink
example:
Sewa'tai ta'n tujiw p'te'w'mai.
I sweeten (it) when I have tea.

Sewigna't na ula nitap.
My friend is not feeling good.

Ula te'sipow amujpa sewisga'l'g ta'n telipqa'luej.
I have to break this horse of his/her biting habit.

Gis suisga'tu gatu gislugwates.
I  broke it, but I can fix it.

Sewisgiaq na ula pilei a'su'n.
This new blanket is coming apart.

Tetujisa'qawei nugu' ntatla'im lpa sewisgiet.
My shirt is so old it's comming apart.

sewisgina'latl.translation: He/she rips or tears it apart
example:
Telialuamatl ugtnapui'gignml, sewisgina'latl.
He/she disliked the photograph of himself/herself so much, he/she
tore it up.

sewisgina'toq.translation: He/she rips or tears it apart
example:
Sewisgina'toq wi'gatign aq teluet "tepiaq".
He/she rips the paper and says "that's enough".

sewisgoqsit.translation: He/she/it breaks up the in fire
example:
Sewisgoqsit na wisqasaw pugtewigtug.
A pine cone will come apart in a fire.

sewisgoqteg.translation: It breaks up in the fire
example:
Tewji sa'q etlamgleg nugu' sewisgoqteg.
It's been burning so long by now it has burnt into pieces.

Sewistamit na ula nti.
My dog destroys things with his grawing.

Ngwis gis pejisuista'tl wasuego'ql ge's lamuguomg almila'sij.
My son accidently broke the flower vase while he was playing in
the house.

sewiste'g.translation: He/she pounds or hacks it to bits
example:
Sewiste'g pgu glaman gisimaqumatesnu.
I'm breaking the taffy into bits so we can eat it.

Gis sewistestoq utepaqan wela'gwe'g
He/she smashed his/her car last night.

sewisto'gweg.translation: It breaks up through the action of the water
example:
Te'sigisg'g sewisto'gweg mgumi, mu' sipu gisgep't'nug.
Everyday the water is breaking up the ice, the river can't freeze
over.

sewisto'gwet.translation: ...breaks up through the action of the water
example:
Sewisto'gwet a'pi muta wesamigsigawitg.
The net is breaking apart because the water is moving too quickly.

Sewl'gema'jig ula mlagejg.
This milk smells sour.

Sewlugowei mawwigapu'g pasgoqsign.
Jam made out of rhubarb is very delicious.

Nti pemsewtaqa'latl nnjann tepaqanigtug.
My dog is towing my child in a sled.

Ta'sisgegipunqeg etug ta'n sewtaqa'taqan giaspnmitas'g ula
Listugujg.
How many years has it been since a barge was seen here in
Listuguj.

Goqwei asoqo'mutaqan pemsewtaqa'toq?
What is the ferry towing?

Nitap sewtia't newtigisg'g.
My friend had a stomachache all day.

Etug me' na'tami nigwejig s'gepng?
Do you think that wild potatoes still grow here somewhere?

S'gepne'gatig wen najimittugwalt?
Who are you visiting in Shubenacadie?

Sgilminn msigue'l gisnigwetal ms't tami.
The grass seeds can grow anywhere.

Tami etligwet sginaqanmusi?
Where does a wild raisin bush grow?

Sgmugualaw na maw milwego't.
Spruce gum is used for many things.

Nitap'sgw teluisit Mali' wigit Sgnuop'tijg.
My friend Mary lives in Burnt Church.

Nenmn a'tugwaqan ta'n wesgumaji sg'te'gmujg?
Do you know a story that talks about ghosts?

Migwite'tmn goqwei gegina'mulg'p sgu'ligtug?
Do you remember what you were taught in school?

Ula wijigumg teluisit Pa'tlig, negm na sgu'taqa'm.
My brother's name is Patrick, he is an educated athlete.

Sguti na pas'g samqwan.
Urine is just water.

Mu ge'itu ula glusuaqan "sgweioq" Listugujg e'was'tn.
I don't know if this word "sgweioq" (female animal) is used here in
Listuguj.

Na sgwemegw waju'et nijinjig.
That female fish is full of roe.

Tegen sgwesmuj gi'lewei?
Which female dog is yours?

Sgwe'w na wela'gowei sapo'nug.
Fowl is for supper tomorrow.

siawa'latl.translation: He/she keeps on going with him/her
example:
Siawa'latl Ugpiganjig witapl.
He/she continues to Eel River Bar taking his/her friend.

Newt Gepeg iga'q, siawa's'tew Muliang?

Siawa'sit ta'n eliet aq mu apsgu'lapasigw.
He/she keeps on going and didn't look back.

siawa'toq.translation: He/she keeps on going with it
example:

He/she is continuing the work that his/her father was working
at.

Na'gu'setewei gisnisiaqap aq siawlugweg.
The clock had fallen and it countinues to work.

Siawlugwet na ta'n getu'tligisg'g.
He/she continues to work no matter what the weather.

meanings: to produce or deposit (eggs) as fishes or frogs do
example:
Te'sipunqeg plamu pegising natsiga'lat.

Tami sqolj tlnaqt'tew siga'law?

Wen na ajipuna't si'gewigu's?

Siggw pisgwa'q ulagu.

Siggwe'l snawe'g ignmugsitesnu snaweiapu.

Tami eteg na sign?

We'gwigewtaqsigi, mu signa'mu.

Gi's gaqi'sg wejiei Signigtewa'gig.

signt'g.translation: He/she uses it for the first time or baptizes it
example:

Pqojiuligisg'tetew ta'n tujiw si'gowigu's oqwa'j.

As'gom te's'gl sigsuti'l wape'gl pgwatele'n.

"Newt taqamatl aq sigta'tl", na teluisig ula wi'gatign.
"One strike and he is dead (he/she hits him/her once and kills

Pie'l pas'g gis sigteluatl tia'mul ulagu.

sigtesing.translation: He/she is killed by an accident
example:

He/she was accidently killed at his/her workplace in the United
States.

Nmu'j wegilat aq wegilat glapis sigtewa'lit.

meanings: killed by getting hit with something
example:
Suel sigto'gwet ta'n tujiw qasawo'g nisia'q.
He/she almost got killed when the piece of iron fell.

Sig'tonqeg.translation: River basin at Dalhousie, New Brunswick
meanings: river basin at Dalhousie, New Brunswick
example:
Ulagu wejia'p Sig'tonqeg.
I went to Dalhousie yesterday.

Ni'n sigua'l'g la'taqsun.
I empty the pail.

Siguap na ula nitap.
My friend is a widower.

Mutt ilie'wmu na siguapatign.
Don't reuse that rinse water.

Amuj na siguapji'j musualatl ugte'pitema.
The young widower must miss his wife.

Legla'nsl waju'aql siguaqs'te'gnn toqwa'q.
The barns are full of straw in the fall.

Siguaqs'te'gneieg ugtuleg getapa'qapneg.
His/her straw boat sank.

So'sep gesmi'sit aq we'gwisi'guatl Malial.
Joseph speaks with a heavy accent and it makes Mary very
uneasy.

Etlsigua'toq utepaqan gulaman gis waqamatew.
He/she is emptying out his/her vehicle so that he/she can clean it.

Ula wasuego'q sigue'g.
This flowerpot is empty.

We'gwisi'guig ula pilei nta'gusn.
My new hat really irritates me.

Sigun gaqa'tu'tip wiguow.
Last spring they finshed their house.

Sigune'ji'j na ula wapus.
This rabbit was born this spring.

Ntue'mji'j na siguniejtp wesua'lgeg.
My little dog was an orphan when I took him/her.

Sigunug mtoqwita'tesnu.
In the spring we will go down (into the valley).

Tami weja'tu'n sigupaqte'gn?
Where did you get the buttermilk?

Ngwis na te'sigisg'g apoqnmuatl ala sigu'sgwal.
My son helps the widow daily.

Tatuje'g na sigu'sgwe'j?

sina'latl.translation: He/she packs him/her/it down (to make more room)
example:

He/she packs down his/her flower pot.

sina'toq.translation: He/she packs it down (make more room)
example:
Ge' sina'tunej lagla'ns gulaman me' pugwelg msigu gispijotesnu.
Lets pack down the hay in the barn so that we can put more into it.

sineget.translation: He/she gulps down the remaining beverage
example:

Let me gulp down this tea and I'll leave immediately.

His/hers boat leaks so he/she has to bail it out.

Amuj espeg na ugtul, pas'g telugwet si'niget.
He/she must have a leaky boat, all he/she does is bail water.

Ge' jugwa'tui sinqamistaqanei.
Would you bring me the strainer.

Ala gujmug tlsinqamistega's.
I'll do the straining outside.

sintesmatl.translation:
He/she empties the glass or bottle by gulping the remaining
beverage
meanings: empty a glass or bottle by drinking the remaining beverage
example:
Newt poqjinsamuqwateg sintesmatl mese'nitl pu'tail gatu me'
niwipsguna't.

the whole bottle but was still thirsty.

sintestoq.translation: He/she drinks it in one gulp
example:
Pase'g newt esamuqwat aq sintestoq na Pepsi.

sinu'et.translation: He/she is back to his/her senses
example:

Mali'an sipelega'latl ugwesgitji'jml ugjit jaqalipiasinin.
Mary Ann spreads out her jacket to dry it out fast.

Pegijisiplega'toq na pata'utiawegn.
It's taking him/her a long time to spread out the table cloth.

Sipeliw eliei nipugtug nugu'.
I rarely go to the forest anymore.

Sipga'lg na ula atla'i etli's'g.

A'su'n etlitoq aq me' gatu sipga'toq
He/she is making a blanket and is he/she ever doing it slowly.

Me' gatu sipge'g na ji'nm.
My! that man is slow moving.

Sa'qawei nutepaqan poqjisipgilugweg.
My old vehicle is starting to slow down

Pile'sm lugowinu sipgilugwet.
The new worker works slowly.

Sipgi'sit muta angite'tg ta'n goqwei teluej.
He/she speaks slowly becuase he/she thinks about what he/she is
saying.

Tami epit na sipigi'taqan?
Where is that whetstone?

Me' talsipigpa'q gi'l gpaqam?
How flexible is your back?

Sipigpa't na atu'tuej algusualatl miti'sl.
That squirrel climbing the tree is flexible.

Tami weja'l't na sipistaqano'suti?

Pas'g gigto'qisma'sit umpo'qoneg, sipit, aq apajinpataq.
He/she just rolled over in his/her bed, stretched, and went back to
sleep.

Mesgi'g sipitaqan nuta'tesnu ugjit tia'muei m'gegn.

Nitape'sw Lorraine mawsipita'sit negm.

sipnma'latl.translation: He/she makes a point in knitting
example:
Alili sipnma'latl pijjaqann.
Lilly knits a point into the mitten.

sipnma'toq.translation: He/she makes a point in knitting
example:
Alili sipma'toq sign.
Lilly knits to the point on the toe of the sock.

sipnmi'get.translation: He/she joins together to make a point
example:

Siptaqa'latl a'papi'jl pas'g mu teptaqsinnigul.
He/she stretches the thread but it is not long enough to reach.

Mali' alsiptaqanatl ugtapsute'gan

Amujpa siptaqanm ula qasawo'qapi glaman ma' nisianug.

falling.

Siptaqa's'g, e'w'tes.
If it stretches, I will use it.

Nta'papim gneg elsiptaqa'sit.
My rope stretches a long way.

(N)atawisiptaqa'toq goqwei, we'gaw teliaqewei.
He/she knows how to stretch things, including the truth.

Ta'n we'gwigisipgwatoq siptaqising.
He/she is stretched out as much as possible.

Piel etlsiptaqo'latl pgu'l.
Peter is stretching the gum.

Getu' nisisugwi ala sipu.
I want to paddle down that river.

Gigjiw nignaq sipu'ji'j pemitg.
Near my house a brook flows.

Ango'ten na siputaqan, gi'g.
Be careful of the file, it is sharp.

Metue'g na ta'n telialasumtegemg sisguigtug.
It's difficult to walk/wade around in the mud.

Sisguapuigtug ala pemtugwi'g gigmenu!

Na we'gwisisguig ula awti!
My, what a muddy road!

Si'sign e'w'tes gtu'li'smn na m'gegn.
Use an awl if you are going to sew that leather.

Goqwei wettaqamoqwasij awti sisip?

Ge' ni'n sisla'gwa'lg'p na nme'j.
Let me fry that fish.

Sisla'gwa'taqan Mi'gmewei maw wigapu'g.
Mi'gmaq fry bread is the most delicous.

Tegen e'w'g, sisla'gwa'tegemgewei gisna lapue'l?

Wen gis sisla'gwa'toq ula pipnaqan?

Wesamtm'g sismo'qon mu' gelu'ltnug.
To eat to much sugar is not good.

Amujpa pugwelg sismo'qonapu mawo'tmg gesgmnaq gisitmm'g
sismo'qon.
First one has to gather alot of maple sap before one can make
maple sugar.

Sismo'qone'j na m'st tami eig.

Pa'qalai ta'n te'sulti'gw sismo'qonia'ti'gw.

Tewjiseggw ula p'tewei lpa sismo'qonima'q.

Sigue'g ula sismo'qono'q, tami me' we'jites?

Talgis sisqalpo'qiaq ula samqwan?

Sisqalpo'qiet na sqolj aln't.

meanings: pair or more of treys (in cards)
example:

Please bring the two pair of three's.

Sisua'qate'gn nutmn?

Eigl sisua'qi'gnn ta'n mawiwelta'ql.
There are chimes that are very nice to listen too.

Nemitu's'p sisuei wela'gwe'g teligsateg?

Ni'n wigi gigjiw sitmug.

Maw siwsitnigwimg ta'n tujiw tgeia'tamg.

meanings: straighten it out by hand with a tool
example:

Siwogtuaji wo'guma st'ge ta'woqwei.
He/she really misses his/her family.

Siwpmiei aq ula tet engopa'sit.

siws'tuatl.translation: He/she is tired of listening to him/her
example:
Amuj siws'tuatl na ugti'l, pas'g telugwet nmu'j wegilat.
He/she must be tired of hearing his/her dog, all it does is bark.

Slapn e'w'g pugsug alo'toq.
He/she uses a low-bottomed wagon to deliver his/her wood.

Slaps na gmu'j gisna pugsug?

There are many Mi'gmaq who are soldiers.

Wijig'tijig gitg sma'gnisuijig.
The siblings are both soldiers.

Ni'n telueg sma'tewulti'gw.

Smtug eliei, na'tel tliesgmali.
I'm going immediately, wait for me there.

Tapusijig snawe'g etligwejig ntiga'taqang.

Nipugtug palpu'te'get toqo tujiw sngatigna'teget sipuigtug.
He/she cuts pulp wood in the woods and then works the booms

meanings: one who gathers logs into booms destined for mill
example:
Pie'l  na sngatigna'tegewinu.
Peter is a rafter.

Ge' jugwasga'tui ala sno'pi eteg.
Can you please hand me that stern paddle over there.

So'gwistaqan nuta'tes ltu'n pipnaqan.
You will need yeast if you are going to make bread.

so'qiaq.translation: It goes up (to higher ground or level)
meanings: go to higher ground or level
example:
Ula awti so'qiaq qospemg
This road goes up to the lake.

meanings: go to higher ground or level
example:
Sapo'nug so'qiei nipugtug aq pugsuge'gei.
I'm going up the woods tomorrow and getting firewood.

Ala msigu'l ta'n etlpita'q gaqatepiet soqomgwewj telialiwnaqiet.
Over there where the grass is tall there is many a hopping
grasshopper.

So'qomu'j na wesgowa'sit qospemg.
The minnow lives in the lake.

Etug tele'g nte'pitm, te'siegsitpu'g so'qotemit.

Tlia' mtue'g, amujpa so'qotemu'n waqama'tmg.
Even if it's difficult, vomit must be cleaned up.

Pas'g soqpatl pgu'l.
He/she only chews gum.

Wesamsoqpultijig na pu'taig.
Those bottles are sitting too close together.

Ta'nugitew ap tepgunset soqqwaj?
When will the moon eclipse again?

Gi'l tluetes wenjitia'm soqtamit?

Na tu'sati'j wesamsoqteg ula wenji'guomg.

Soqte'geian tapuguna'q ma gisinugtmu ula.
If I chew (it) for two days I wouldn't  be able to soften this.

so'qwa'latl.translation: He/she takes him/her to higher ground or level
meanings: take to higher ground or level
take him/her/it up to the woods (Listuguj)
example:
Gtantegewinu so'qwa'latl uggwisl ag (n)ajigtantegejig.
The hunter takes his/her son up to the woods and they will go

so'qwa'toq.translation: He/she takes it to higher ground or level
meanings: take to higher ground or level
taking it up to the woods (Listuguj)
example:
Sapo'nug gesigewei mijipjewei so'qwa'toq.
Tomorrow he/she is taking the winter supply of food up (to the

Pilei sqana'gwei asoqomutaqan gisitu'tij.
They built a new steel bridge.

Ta'n te'sit sqapantiej amujpa gegina'mut.
Every beginner has to be taught.

Siggw na gaqatepiet sqolj nutut.
In the spring one hears many a frog.

Gi's gi'l nemitu'n sqoljui'gan?
Have you ever seen a toadstool?

Na tepgunset sqoljuigu's maw-weligisg'g.
There's very good weather in the month of May.

Sqolu'sguji'jl telialagwegl, miamuj gaqatepiaq ta'n goqwei
gisipe'sgas'g.
Bee bee pellets are all over the place, I expect many things were
used as targets.

Sqolu'sgw e'was'g pe'sgeweigtug.
Lead is used in a gun.

Pugwelg na squ ula qospem.
There are many leaches at this lake.

Telimit a'jelpuguin, aq tujiw s'tapugua'lit.
He/she said that I was standing in the way and then he/she moved
me aside.

Lgusuaqan a'ljelteg'p glapis es'tapugua'to'q
The ladder was in the way until he/she stood it to one side.

Gisgug st'ge aqantie'umg.
Today is like Sunday.

Stoqon na mawiweljemasit.
A fir tree is very aromatic.

Atla'wegn ta'n stoqonamu'g algwilm.
I am looking for cloth that is dark green.

stoqonamugsit.translation: He/she is the color of a fir tree
example:
Ula pilei natla'im stoqonamugsit.

Te'sipug getu'nuelewumg nipugtug najistoqone'ga'tieg.
Every winter before Christmas we go into the woods to find a fir
tree.

Suel gaqoqsmai nutepaqang.
I almost ran out of fuel in my car.

Msaqtaqt wigwomg geget gaqsugulegaq.
The floor at the camp is almost all rotten.

Lasqo'plaw nugu' gaqsugulegat.
The board is now completely rotten.

Lpa sugul'gma'q ula wenji'guom.
This house really smells rotten.

Sugul'gema't na mlagejuo'q.
That milk pitcher smells sour.

Magasang eliei, suitisl nattelmann.
I'm going to the store to buy candies.

Ta's'g suliewei wegetu'n?

Pie'l pas'g sulieweie'galatl witapal.

Sulieweie'gatg na maqamigew ignmut'p.

Tami tlwe'jiates ula sulieweie'j?

Nsugwis sulming pegwatelmaqapni.
I bought my aunt a rosary.

Etna gsatmug gisiwe'jituas sa'qawei sulnalji'j teluisig "Migmaoi
Solnaltjitj".
I would love to be able to find the old newspaper called the

Sulumgw na wigapugsit.

Wowg wejitasijig sumalgi to'q mawuloqsewejig.

Mu ge'itm'g su'nl e'was'gtn ugjit sunming amgwes.
It's not known for sure if cranberries were used as rosary beads at
one time.

Gis sune'wimg te'sipunqeg siggw.
One can fast every year in the springtime.

Pugwelg mimajuinu sune'wit te's siggw.
Many people fast each spring time.

Se'tane'umgeg pile'g sunming pegwatelmaqapni.
On Saint Anne's Day I bought him/her a rosary.

Suomann to'g seggul.
Beechnuts are said to be sweet.

Tami suomusi'g getu' iga'taqwaljig?
Where so you want to plant the beech trees?

Ge' jugwa'tui suppin te's'g gastio'mi.
Please bring me a dipper of molasses.

Najigasiptna'si aq suspanign e'wates.
Go wash your hands and use soap.

Tagalaltijig muta mu jigs'tati'gw.
They annoy each other because they don't listen to each other.

Ula nitap altagaliet ugjit mu goqwei.
This friend of mine is being angry for nothing.

Tagali'j na me' apjiw mesgilg aq sulumgw.
A domestic goose is always bigger than a wild goose.

Tagali'ji'j algwiluatl uggwitl.
The gosling is looking for it's mother.

meanings: creep along in the water like a lobster
example:
Ala put'p pemtajiga'q sitmug.

Nemi'g'pnaq pemtajiga'sit sitmug.

talawtig.translation: What is the cost of it?
example:

How much is this dress?

talawtit.translation: What is the cost of him/her/it?
example:
Talawtit na atla'i?
What does that shirt cost?

Tale'gtetew a's'gati'gw?

Tallugweg na napgetm'gewei?
How does that copier work?

Tallugwet ala nigantug wesgowa'sit?
What is the one at the front doing?

Taluegeg na ta'n goqwei, tetujiwi'guig?
What is that thing used for, it has such an odd shape?

Talueget na ta'n wen tetujiwi'guigit?
What is the purpose of that, it has such an odd shape?

Tal gis getu nmien?
How come  you want to go home?

Tami elien?
Where are you going?

Ge' tlimi ta'n eteg?
Please tell me where it is?

Tansiewe'l megnmn gisitu'n mpisun.
If you gather tansys you can make medicine with them.

Ta'nug ap apaita'toqs'p?

Ge' tlimi ta'n goqwei wesgu'tmn?

Ugsua'l ta'n pa tegen pewalt.

Ta'n te's eliei na'te'l natgoqwei piltuei nemitu.

Esgm'tesnu ta'n tlipgije'g wesua'toq.

Ta'n tujiw gismaja'siteg toqo tujiw migwite'tmap ta'n goqwei getu'

When he/she had already left is when I remembered what it was I

Ta'n wen teluisit Mali, qama'sij.
Whomever's name is Mary, stand up.

Toqongig tapi'g, nige' pas'g nata'e'w'g'sniga.
I own two bows, now if only I knew how to use them.

Amsgwes na me' pugwelg'p ta'n nata'te'g tapia'ji'jg.
