Tapia'ji'jgapi na maw melg'taqsit.
Fiddle string is a very strong.

Nmijgamijo'q gelu'sip tapia'ji'jge'j.
My grand father was a good fiddler.

Nsugwis na negm tapia'ji'jte'get
My aunt is the one who plays the fiddle.

Ge' jugwasga'tui tap'tang, tawjiulm'tu'n.
Would you be so kind as to pass me the potatoes.

Tap'tane'j we'jiates(g) ta'n tap'tang etlnigwejig.
You'll find potato bugs where potatoes grow.

Gi's ta'pu pipanimg ugjit epg'soqwa'tun na ga'qan.
I've asked him/her two times to close that door.

Tawjisa'q giaspnmitu'n tapuaigewei?
How long has it been since you saw a two dollar bill?

Newtaig aq newtaig...na tapuaigl.
One dollar plus one dollar...is two dollars.

tapuapjimgewei.translation: Tool or object requiring use of both hands
meanings: tool or object requiring use of both hands
example:
Ula mesgi'g t'mi'gn gistluetes tapuapjimgewei.
You can say this axe requires two hands to use.

Ge'l angapte'n, pas'g tapuapsgegl alawe'l iga'tuitl.
Look at that, he/she only put two peas there for me.

Jugwasga'l tapuapsg'sijig wenju'sugapung.
Pass me two turnips.

Ge' ignmui ne's'sijig ta'puaq.
Just give me three deuces.

Ge' jugwasga'tui na tapua'ql pugsugji'tl.
Pass me those two sticks of wood.

Ula tapu'gl a'gwesnn, ni'newe'l?
These two hats, are they mine?

Gi's tapuguna'q mu' mijjiw.
I haven't eaten in two days.

Daniel, nuji'j tapuipuna't.
Daniel, my grandchild is two years old.

Gi's nugu' tapuipunqeg mu' lugowaqan.
It's been two years and still no work.

Newtisga'q jel newt aq pesgunateg na tapuisga'q.
Eleven plus nine is twenty.

Tapuisga'qal wi'gatignn jugwa'tui.
Bring me twenty books.

Tapuisga'qewa'j newt ajiet jel a'qataig pisgwa'p.
The twentieth one came in at one thirty (the hour).

Tapuisgegsijig gis pe'talgig plamu'g wela'gwe'g.
I caught twenty salmon last evening.

Tapuitpa'q nipugtug tlne'p'titaq.
They will sleep two nights in the woods.

Tapunemi'g na wi'gatign ta'n eliaq ula tet.
There is two different kinds of paper that go here.

Ala ji'nm tapungl wiguwoml.
That man has two camps.

Tapunnaji wowg mesgilniji.
He/she has two large pots.

Pas'g tapuoqsijig pu'taig jugwa'tui.
Bring me just two bottles.

Na negm ta'puowa'j na'te'l wejimilesit.
He/she is the second one to get rich there.

Te's ta'puowei mijipjeweie'gei.
Every Tuesday I go for food.

Ula tapusijig, negmow wigijig Listugujg.
These two, they live in Listuguj.

Mut gluliw, muta altaqale'g gisgug.
Don't speak to me, because I'm being grouchy today.

Ne'wewa'j taqamatl na'newa'jl.
The fourth one hits the fifth one.

Lpa taqamoqigsma'latl awtigtug!
He/she actually pushes him/her across the road!

Lpa taqamoqigsma'toq utepaqn awtigtug aq na'te'l naqt'g.
He/she actaully pushed his/her car across the road and left it there.

Wen ta na gistaqamoqisma'sit, telia'jelpit.
Who is it that has laid down crossways, they are in the way.

Ula nmu'j lpa taqamoqpit ntawtig.
This dog is positioned across my path.

Me' gisgug taqamoqteg na utepaqn ugtawtig.
Today his/her car is still across his/her road.

Pasgoqsign wejitas'g taqate'lg maw wigapu'g.
Jam made with currents is very delicious.

Wigpatugunn, maqumapnn taqatu.
He/she must have liked it, he/she eat it anyway.

Taqawaja'latl naqalateg witapal.
He/she saddens his/her friend when he/she left.

Taqawajeieg gisgug, mu' gislugwewe'g.
We're sad today, we weren't able to work.

meanings: young salmon after its first return from the sea
example:
Taqawan na maljewe'j plamu.
A grilse is a young salmon.

Ge' e'wanej taqawanapi.
Let's use the grilse net.

taqawanji'j.translation: Grilse (returning salmon after single winter at sea)
example:
Taqawanji'jg na apjiw ugtejg wej'peta'jig.
Grilse are always the last ones to arrive.

Taqtaloq enmiaqui'pitaq guntewigtug.
The salamander has scurried into the rock.

E'e ni'n taqtmap na tuop'ti.
Yes, I hit that window.

Tio'tis pipanimg'p ta's'g pewatmn te'pisewei, teluet, pas'g ta's'g.
I asked Eunice how much pepper she wanted, she answered, just
some.

Ta'sipuna'n gi'l?
What is your age?

Nitap teluet "ta'sit mimajuinu eig na'te'l?".
My friend says "how many people are over there?".

Ta'sitpa'q gi's mu nepawun?
How many nights have you not slept?
I'ta'sitpa'ql ta'n lugwetes ula tepgunset?
How many nights at a time will you be working this month?

Pas'g ta's'ji'jg samuqwan lguta'tu.
Just pour a little bit of water.

Pas'g ta's'ji'jit qastulastu ignmui.
Just give me a bit of the cedar bough.

Ta'sugunit Gesigewigu'sg ajipuna'n?
What is the date of your birthday in December?

Ta'sunatl na telamusilitl a'papi'l?
How much of this kind of rope does he/she have?

Ta's ajiet maja'sin?
At what time are you leaving?

Mijua'ji'j teluet "ta'ta".
The baby says"daddy".

Tata't! Ge' nipugtug la'tinej.
Dad! lets' go to the woods.

Tatujein gi'l?
How old are you?

Te'sipowe'j tega'latl ugte'sipowml gesgmnaq masqwa'lagw.
The horseman cools off his horse before he puts him away (in the
stall).

Tmg tega'toq petaqanji'j toqosi'p mijjultieg.
First he/she cools off the pie then we eat.

Gisu'pilsi gisgug, tege'g.
Dress (yourself) warmly today, it's cold.

Pas'g tegele'jg sismo'qon pewatm.
I only want a small amount of sugar.

tegele'jit.translation: It is a small amount or number
example:
Tegele'jit plamu pegising ugjit ula wesgaqan.
Very few salmon have arrived for this fishing season.

Tegen pewatmn, megwe'g gisna maqtawiewne'g?
Which one do you want, the red one or the navy blue one?

Me' tegig gisgug.
It is still cold today.

Amuj tegigata't na ala'sit gujmug aq mu mg'sng.
He/she must have cold feet going around outside and no shoes.

Newt gesig iga'q te'sigisg'g tegigisg'g.
Once winter arrives everyday is a chilly day.

Tegiptnai, ma' gis sama'ulu pe'l.
My hands are cold, too cold to touch you yet.

Maljewe'jg gesatmi'tij tegismultimg.
Youngsters like swimming.

Lasup tegistoq, wasamp'teg.
He/she cools the soup, it is too hot.

Npuinu me' gatu tegit.
The corpse is very cold.

Tetujiwelpteg'pneg, lpa jini'w teglo'qiaq.
It was such a warm evening, then suddenly it  became chilly.

Telp'teg, ta'n te's'g goqwei tegniaq.
It's so hot, every single thing sweats.

Tetujima'munlugwet lpa tegniet
He/she worked so hard he/she sweats.

Te's aqantie'wumg tego'tgig.
They attend mass every sunday.

Tegpa'q samuqwan, me' ap epteg angua'tu.
The water is cold, add some more hot (water).

tegs'g.translation: It is blowing from the west
example:
Lpa gaqi'sg tegs'g ula tet.
Often the wind blows from the west here.

Mutt ugsamgigjeiwaw na te'sipow muta tegtesgewet.
Don't stay too close to that horse because he/she kicks.

Tegtesg'g gatu etug ma' gis saputetesgmug.
He/she kicks it but probably won't be able to kick it through.

Te'sipow tegtesguatl te'sipowejl.
The horse kicks the horseman.

Lasqo'plawl tela'gipulatl s'tge' gji'toq ta'n telugwej.
He/she saws the plank as if he/she knew what he/she was doing.

tela'gittoq.translation: He/she saws it in a certain manner
example:
Moqwa' gejiaq ta'n tela'gittoq, gatu teptesg.
I don't how he/she sawed it, but it fits.

telagumatl.translation: He/she is related to someone as such
meanings: related to someone in this way
example:
Umaqtaml na, na telagumatl.
He/she is his/her sister-in-law, that's how they are related.

telagutijig.translation: Related as such to each other
meanings: related as such to each other
related to each other in this way
example:
Na'talagutijig, pas'g mu' ni'n gejiaqig ta'n telaguti'tij.
Their related, but I don't know how they are related.

tela'latl.translation: He/she does him/her/it in such a way
example:
Mutt sespete'tmu, ajipuna'nij na wijei tla'latal.
Don't worry, when it's his/her birthday he/she will do the same to
him/her.

Jijuaqa wen tela'lsit ta'n teliaq ugtineg.
Sometimes its our fault to whats happens to us.

Telaplgigwa'sit etug nemiateg na tia'mul.
He/she must have imagined seeing that moose.

telapsgeg.translation: It is big and round or oval shaped
meanings: big and round or oval shaped
example:
Telapsgeg na ugpitn, tami etlnisqanana'tu'n?
That's a big bump on your hand, where did you get that bruise
from?

telapsg'sit.translation: He/she is so big and round
meanings: so big and round or oval shaped
example:
Ntgulgwi'sminen telmesgilg aq telapsg'sit.
Our pig is big and round.

Palpu't nugu' pas'g tela'q st'ge gi'gamgo'ng.
Now pulp wood is only as big around as boat push poles.

telasg'teg.translation: It is pointed in such a way
example:
Pewatas'g ms't goqwei lasg'ten oqwatnug, ala mnaq na
telasg'tenug.
Everything should be placed so that it is pointing north, that one is
not pointing in that direction yet.

tela'sit.translation: He/she behaves or acts in such manner
meanings: behave or act in such manner
example:
Ula nmu'j tela'sit ta'n telimuj.
The dog behaves as he/she is told.

tela'toq.translation: He/she does it in such a way
example:
Negm tela'toq ta'n telimut.
He/she does it the way he/she is told.

Telatuemgewe'l pile'l lugwatmnej.
Let's make up some new sentences.

Mu ge'itu ta'n telawtig, amuj gatu mego'tig.
I don't know how much it's worth, but it must be expensive.

Nana'igl telawtit nme'j tet.
Here the fish costs five dollars.

tele'g.translation: He/she is in such a way
example:
Lpa negm na tele'g
He/she is that way.

Teleiaq welqamigsit negm.
He/she seems to be nice.

teleiwatl.translation: He/she treats him/her in such a way
example:
Ne'gaw na teleiwatl ugti'l aq nige' welins'tatl.
He/she has always treated his/her dog that way and now the dog
understands him/her well.

Negm na telgisitunat, sipgi'sit
This is how he/she sounds, he/she speaks slowly.

Teliaq ta'n teluwej.
What he/she is saying is true.

Ne'gaw na teliatl pgu'l aq wigapusinitl.
He/she has always made fudge that way and it is delicious.

Nei'a'tui ta'n teligg na magot
Show me the shape of that dress.

Lpa teligit pa wijei aq miti's, ginisgwatpat aq maqigjat.
He/she/it is shaped like a tree, pointed head and a wide behind.

Teligsugg etug ma pgwanmueg.
It's so heavy I don't think we will be able to carry it.

Ula gulgwiji'j wijei teligsugulg aq ni'n.
This young pig weighs the same as me.

Telima'q st'ge sugulegaql wa'wul.
They smell like rotten eggs.

Na telima't ta'n tujiw etloqsij.
That is what it smells like when it is cooking.

Telimatl mutt nattesguaw.
He/she tells someone don't go after him/her.

telipgitqatg.translation: He/she stays such a length of time
example:
Telipgitqatg telta'siap pisgwiwsit.
He/she stayed so long I thought he/she was moving in.

Telisqatuatl, pa tlta'ig assumtl.
He/she obeys him/her so much, you'd think he/she owned him/her.

telistaqanewa'sit.translation: He/she hears things that are not there
meanings: hears things that are not there
example:
Pemjipaqa'sit aq mu gne'nug natgoqwei piltuei telistaqanewa'sit.
He/she is becoming fearful and every so often imagines that he/she
hears something different.

telitoq.translation: He/she makes it in such a way
example:
Negm na telitoq, musga'tltew.
That is how he/she makes it, he/she will show you how.

tellugweg.translation: It works in such a way
example:
Ula nutepaqan na tellugweg.
My car works in this way.

Nige' musga'tl ta'n tellugwet na a'papi.
Now I will show you how that rope works.

Telmnaqanaq, etug ma gnnmug.
It's so weak, I don't think it will hold.

Nitap telmnaqanat mugismnja'sigw.
My friend is so weak he/she can't get up.

teloqsas'g.translation: It is cooked in a such a way
example:
Lusgnign wijei gistloqsas'g st'ge pipnaqan.
Bannok can be cooked in the same manner as bread.

teloqsasit.translation: He/she/it is cooked in such a way
example:
Na teloqsasit ni'n wigp'g.
Cooked in that manner I like the taste.

Negm na teloqsatl na go'qoli'gwejl.
He/she cooks the chicken in that way.

teloqs'g.translation: He/she cooks it in such a way
example:
Nujj wijei teloqs'g lusgnign st'ge nugumijaq.
My father cooks bannok the same way my  grandmother did.

Teloqsit st'ge ula gawi.
It's circumference is the same as this procupine quill.

Negm na telo'tg ms't goqwei.
He/she treats everything the same way.

telpatl.translation: He/she gnaws on him/her/it in such a way
meanings: eat or gnaw on in such a way
example:
Apigji'j wijei telpatl a'papi'l st'ge' gopit miti'sl.
A mouse gnaws at a rope the same way a beaver gnaws at a tree.

Newte' lape'lis telpita'q.
It is a yard long.

Pie'l na telpitoqsit.
Peter is that tall.

Ma' na negm gis'nqa'masigw, muta lpa na telqamigsit.
He/she cannot stop him/herself, because that's way he/she is.

Tmg na telsatl toqo tujiw siawiugtaqapalatl..
First he/she cuts it this way and then continues to soak it.

tels'g.translation: He/she cuts it in such a way
example:
Ta'n tujiw magot etlitoq na tels'g.
When ever he/she is making a dress it is cut this way.

Tels'tm st'ge natgoqwei ge'gwe'g gis nisiaq.
I think I just heard something fall upstairs.

Atel gis tls'tmai wejgu'en, aq je gi' s eimn!
I just heard that you were on your way, and here you are already!

Tels'tuatl teluet jugu'wa.
He/she thinks he/she hears him/her say come here.

Nutepaqan lpa telta'q st'ge gaqtugwaw, teligsigawweg.
My car sounds like thunder, it's so loud.

Telta'siap tet tlia's'gatultitesnu.
I thought that we were to meet here.

telta'tl.translation: He/she hits him/her in such a way
example:
Tuaqann telta'tl st'ge mujgajewei tu'ewinu.
He/she hits the ball like the best real ballplayer.

Getu' musga'tuij ta'n negm telte'g pugsug.
He/she wants to show me how he/she cuts/chops  firewood.

telte'lmatl.translation: He/she thinks about someone as such
example:
Telte'lmgig sapo'nug pe'ita'taq.
I believe they will arrive tomorrow.

telte'tg.translation: He/she thinks about it as such
example:
Ni'n telte'tm qame'g lia's sapo'nug.
I think I will to town tomorrow.

telt'g.translation: He/she eats it in such a way
example:
Te'plmasewei telt'g st'ge apigji'j.
He/she eats cheese like a mouse.

Newt nutaj ta'n teltoqsit ma' wanta'siwun.
Once you heard what it/she/she sounds like you will not forget.

teltunget.translation: He/she uses that pattern of speech
example:
Wijei teltunga'tieg muta wijig'tultieg.
We have the same speech patterns because we are family.

Mui'nu'mi wijei teluegeg st'ge npisun.
Bear grease is used as medicine.

Mut wowji'j e'waw, la'taqsun telueget ugjit samqwan ewjo'tu'n.
Don't use a cooking pot, a pail is what you use to carry water.

Telta'siap teluet gisgug gisgatetew.
I thought he/she said it would be ready today.

Ula gjigan teluisig Campbellton.
This city's name is Campbellton.

Nte'pitem A'tli teluisit.
My wife's name is Audrey.

telui'tatl.translation: He/she calls him/her by such a name
example:
Ne'gaw telui'tatl "nsugwi'", telta'siap natalagutijig.
He/she always called her "aunty", I thought they were somehow
related.

telui't'g.translation: He/she calls it by such a name
example:
Negm na telui't'g na.
He/she calls it by such a name.

Jiglpugua'si, pugjig tema'gipulatl ula miti'sl.
Stand aside, in a moment he/she is going to saw  this tree
down.

Ala gmu'j elagweg amujpa tema'gittoq.
He/she has to saw that wood over there.

tema'latl.translation: He/she breaks...slowly in two by the hand
example:
Negm na gistma'latl lasqo'plawl ugpignigtug.
He/she can break a board in two with his/her hands.

temalua'latl.translation: He/she breaks off the tail or rear end
meanings: break off at tail or rear end
example:
Lpa temalua'latl jagejl toqo ignmuij ugsuguni.
He/she broke the tail of the lobster right off and gave it  to me.

temalua'toq.translation: He/she breaks off the tail or rear end
meanings: break off at tail or rear end
example:
Ge' temalua'tu ula ligpete'gnapi?
Could you please break off an end of this ash splint?

Temalueget na jagejuei ugsuguni gesgmnaq malqumagw.
He/she snaps off the tail of a lobster before he/she eats it.

temalueitesmatl.translation: He/she breaks off the tail end by slamming
meanings: break off at tail end (by slamming)
example:
Lpa temaluetesmatl nnuoqta'wl petnisegeteg.
He/she broke the tail off the statue when he/she dropped it.

Glitaq temapsg'saji gesgmnaq sewa'lagw.
He/she cuts the berries into chunks before putting sugar on them.

Temapsg'sg na wius gesgmnaq wissugwatmug.
He/she cuts it into chunks before he/she cooks it.

temaqjo'toq.translation: He/she tucks in flaps (in basket making)
example:
Newtigisg'g telugwet temaqjo'tasit.
He/she has been tucking in the flaps of baskets all day.

Tewjima'muniwgju's'g lpa miti's tema'sit.
The wind was so strong the tree broke off.

So'sep etltemasaqte'muet a'se'g.
Joseph is cutting hair in the other room.

tema'toq.translation: He/she breaks it slowly in two by hand
meanings: break slowly in two by hand
example:
Melgignat, lpa tema'toq guntew telgi'g st'ge wenju'su'n.
He/she is strong, he/she brakes a rock the size of an apple slowly
by hand.

Telte'lmg ne'gaw temawigna't, mu teltesinug.
I think he/she has always had a hunched back, it isn't from a fall or
accident.

Temeget gmu'j aq ejigleget.
He/she snaps the stick in two and throws it away.

temgwa'latl.translation: He/she breaks off the head by hand
meanings: break off the head slowly by hand
example:
Geget nugu' temgwa'latl na pu'tail, tewjigtu'samqwat.
He/she has just about taken the head of that bottle off, he/she
wants to drink so bad.

Gis gi'l nemi't ji'nm temgwe'g?
Have you seen a headless man?

Gajuewj tmg temgwepatl apigji'jl.
First the cat bites the head off the mouse.

Gijga' temgwesatl gawi'l gulaman sa'qati'l gis saputa'latal.
He/she cuts a bit of the top off of the procupine quill so he/she can
pass a needle through (the length of) it.

Temgwesm nige' ula wasueg muta gaqapiateg.
I cutting the top off this flower because its too dry.

Sapo'nug temgweta'tl na aputapegiejinitl.
Tomorrow he/she will chop the head off that turkey.

Tmg temgwete'g toqo tujiw sigua'toq.
First he/she chops off the top than he/she empties the container.

Ula qospem na mawtmig
This lake is very deep.

Atel temigle'm muta me' tapuisga'qal esgwiaqal na'gwegl glapis 
Pa'gewumg.
It's only Mid-lent because there are twenty days left until Easter.

temigatat.translation: He/she has a foot or leg cut off
meanings: have foot or leg cut off
example:
Ala wi'sis aliasga'sit etlite'lmg temigatat.
I think that limping animal over there has a severed foot.

Temina'latl ugtatla'iml aq ejiglegetl
He/she rips his/her shirt and throws it away.

Lpa temina'toq wi'gatign ne'sisgl mtijinn telpase'g.
He/she ripped a book three inches thick.

Temine'g napui'gign.
The photograph is torn.

Temipia'st mu telgi'gtnug nige' weja'toq st'ge amgwes.
Half a dollar dosen't buy as much as it used to.

temiptnat.translation: He/she has a hand or arm cut off
meanings: have hand or arm cut off
example:
Newte'jit ji'nm magasang etllugwet temiptnat.
One of the men working at the store has a severed hand.

Carol gisitemisgipegetl ugtapsute'gan gis etlmila'sij.
Carol accentally snap off her doll neck while playing.

Etlgi'gajeiwatl unjann, telimatl getu' tmisqona'latl.
He/she is teasing his/her child, he/she is saying that he/she wants to
break off his/her nose.

temisqona'toq.translation: He/she breaks it off at the nose end
example:
Suel temisqona'toq ugtul nasto'gweteg guntewigtug.
He/she nearly broke the nose off his/her boat when he/she caught
it in the rocks.

Lpa'tu'ji'j tempatl pgu'l aq newte' mussew masqwa'toq.
The little boy bites a piece off the gum and saves one piece.

Pilei pemsaqas'g gisiga'tu nignaq.
I put new partition in my home.

Je tmg temsatl a'papi'l aq teluet "nige' alo'pia".
He/she even cuts the rope first, and then says "now you can swing
around".

Gi's etltms'g ms't pipnaqan.
He/she is already slicing all of the bread.

Temta'tl a'papi'l aq ignmuitl a'qataig.
He/she chops the rope and  gives me the other half

Suel ugtluign temte'g ge's alapij.
He/she almost chopped his/her finger off because he/she was
looking around.

Na we'gwinqamasitmtesg!
It breaks in two very easily!

temtesg'g.translation: He/she breaks it by kicking or stomping
example:
Te'sipow gistmtesg'g llutaqan aq maja'sitaq.
The horse kicked the fence open and took off.

Lpa pisuiw temtesguatl na lasqo'plawl.
He/she kicked and broke that board for no reason.

Mg'snapi temtesing ge's wejo'tm mlg'pilan.
The shoelace broke as I tried to tie a strong knot.

Ge's etlmila'sij temtesmatl nnuoqta'wul aq nige' mesge'g.
While he/she was playing he/she broke a statue and now he/she is
sorry.

Te's maqata'g nutmi'gn na temtestoq lnaqanatgw.
Each time I lend him/her my axe he/she fractures the handle.

Mussew temt'g aq etug newtisg'g soqt'g!
He/she bites off a piece and must have chewed it all day!

Tepa'latl jagejl pata'wtigtug aq teluet ula gi'lewei.
He/she puts lobster on the table and says this is yours.

Gi's gi'l assutmn sa'qewei tepaqan?
Have you ever owned an old toboggan?

Pile'g nmugsng weltepaqapjig.
My new shoes are a good fit.

Tepaqategl na gwitnn gutepaqang?
Do the canoes fit on your vehicle?

Pegije'g we'gaw gisite'tg tepa'sin te'sipowl.
It was a long time before he/she could bring himself/herself to get
on a horse.

Tepa'toq lusgnign pata'utigtug aq teluet ula gi'lewei.
He/she puts the bannock on the table and says this is yours.

Gtu' gsigawlugwen amujpa ms't goqwei tepaw eteg.
If you want to work fast everything has to be handy.

Mego'tig, gatu tepawtig, muta wellugweg.
It's expensive, but it is worth the price, because it works well.

Ula nti tepawtit metla'saigl.
My pet is worth ten dollars.

Na'jipugtaqanejg na pas'g tepgig alaqsultijig.
Bats only fly around at night.

Tepgisa'l ula negmow muta ma' punsespeiu'g.
Separate these two because they will not stop making noise.

Apji'w newte'git ta'n tepgise'g i'tew.
There will always be one loner.

Tepgisitoq pipnaqan aq petaqan.
He/she makes the bread and the pie separately.

Ge' jugwa'tui na lo'gs ta'n tepgispit.
Bring me the log that is sitting apart from the other ones.

tepgisteg.translation: It is set apart from others
example:
Tepgistegl a'se'g iga'tu.
Put the ones that are set apart from the others in the next room.

Waju'et tepgunset nige'.
It is now a full moon.

Msqnwi'gen ta'n tujiw ajipuna'n, ala eteg tepgunsetewei.
Mark down your birth date, there's the calendar.

Tepiaql, ms't wen newtung.
There are enough, everybody has one.

Pas'g newte'jit la'sgw tepiet.
Just one card is enough.

Tetaqa'si, gi's etltepi'getoq plamuewei.
Hurry, he/she is already distributing the salmon.

Tepignaq ula gnnmn tapu'gl pituimtnaqanl ngatignn.
It is strong enough to hold two thousand pounds.

Nige' negm tepignat wissuignemin.
Now he/she is strong enough to overpower me.

Teplugwet gi's, enmigimanej.
He/she has already done enough work, let's send him/her home.

Etug tepimlge'g na gi'gamgo'n ma' tmegeun?
Is that boat pole hard enough so you won't break it?

Nugumijaq Llui'so'q mawmilie'w'g'pneg te'pineglewei.
My grandmother Louise would use vinegar in many different ways.

Psa'tes tepine's gesgmnaq nemiawt.
You'll smell a bedbug before you see it.

Nuji'j tepipuna't maja'sin.
My grandchild is old enough to leave home.

te'pisewa'tat.translation: He/she adds pepper to his/her food
example:
Tmg wettm mijipjewei ges mu te'pisewa'taw.
I first taste the food, before I add pepper to mine.

Salawei aq te'pisewei wije'tigl.
Salt and pepper goes together.

Etug tepi'timg gisgug?
I wonder if welfare is handed out today?

Ta'n te'sinitl te'pljl wesgijinuinnitl wisungewatl.
He/she gives a name to every single goat that is born.

Talamugsit na te'plji'j?
What color is the young goat?

Gaqismilamu'gl te'plma'sewe'l eltas'gl gisgug.
There are many kinds of cheeses made today.

Teplumatl ap sapo'nug ula'gw gitmuan a'tugwaqan.
He/she promises to again read a story to him/her tomorrow night.

Glapis Mali tepnatl ugtapsute'gann pata'utigtug.
Finally Mary is able to reach her doll on the table.

Getu' tepne'meg ntlugowaqanminen.
We want to catch up with our work.

Wasamiesp'teg, mu tepnnmu.
It's to high, I can't reach it.

Gi's gaqtepo'tas'g na pugsug, nma'tunej.
The firewood is all loaded up, let's bring it home.

Tepo'tasit utepaqang aq maja'sit.
He/she loads up his/her car and leaves.

Pugjig na teppilul ala gtul, aq e'wa's ula a'papi.
Soon I'm going to hoist you onto your boat and I'll use this
rope.

Gigjepugu'tg ms't goqwei ta'n telteppilg glaman ma mnja'qtnug.
He/she pays close attention to how he/she hoists everything 
aboard so nothings will fall off.

Teppit utepaqang aq teluet ap nmu'ltes
He/she is in his/hers car and says I will see you again.

Gi's nige' tal sa'q tepgatmoq?
How long has it been that you two are married?

Goqwei tepteg gutepaqang?
What is in your car?

Mimajuinu'g nenaqig ta'n gegguna'tiji nesisgegsniji te'puljig.
I know people who have thirty goats.

Te's nemiaj umisl natgoqwei tela'tegennij, negm elg wejo'tg
tla'tegen.
Every time he/she sees his/her older sister do something, he/she
tries to do it too.

Na te's'gl muntil pewatmann.
I want this many bags.

Te'sigisg'g egsitpugwiei.
I get up early everyday.

Ntlamugsisaq Tumao'q apjiw te'sipowl geggunapnn.
My late uncle, Tom, always had a horse.

Te'sipowa'qapnaq maja'siteg.
He/she was traveling on a horse when he/she left.

Apjiw te'sipowgumaqan e'wmuaten igatne'suinu'g.
A horse whip is always used on race horses.

Te'sipowji'j na apjiw gigjialulggwalatal uggwitl.
A foal will always closely follow his/her mother.

Tami wettelmnn na te'sipowmann?
Where did you buy those oats?

Te'sipug ula ji'nm asua'sit gp'te'snug.
Every winter this man travels to the south and back.

te'sipuna't.translation: He/she is so many years old
example:
Ulagu nesisga'q je si'st gis te'sipuna't.
Yesterday he/she turned thirty-three.

Te'sipunqeg Pastung eliei najimitugwei.
Every year I go to the United States to visit.

Ta'n te'sit wen teluisit Mali, pa'sij.
Every one that is named Mary, sit down.

Te'sitpa'q nige' na gajuewj etltoqsit ntllutaqanmg.
Every night now, that cat is howling at my fence.

Te'sitqwa'q amujpa gisgaja'lsimg ugjit gesig.
Every fall one must ready oneself for winter.

Sa'que'gi'g teluepni'g na Nnuweiei utqotaqane'gati i'teg'pneg
Te'sn'geg.
The old ones said that a Native burial ground used to be on Heron
Island.

meanings: have so many or so much
example:
As'gom te'sungtjig nmu'ji'jg.
We have six puppies.

Te'sunemi'g wenji'guom eltas'g Listugujg gisgug.
There are so many different kinds of houses made in Listuguj
nowadays.

Te'sunemigsit miti's, mgn ta'n tegen welampt.
There are so many kinds of tree, choose the one that appeals to
you.

te'sung.translation: He has so much or so many
meanings: have so much or so many
example:
So'sep te'sung suliewei.
Joseph has so much money.

Ge'l tet jugwa'tu na tma'gittaqan.
Would you bring that saw here.

Assma pemmaja'sit, tetapu na'tuen metete'get.
As he/she was leaving, it happened that someone knocked on the
door.

Malia'n getu' tetapua'latl ms't wenn.
Mary Ann wants to satisfy everyone.

Tetapua'tega ta'n we'gwisipgwatu'n.
Strive to do what is right.

tetapua'toq.translation: He/she does it the right way
example:
Angam ula ta'n tela'toq muta tetapua'toq.
Observe how he/she does this because it is the correct way of
doing it.

tetapuigsua'toq.translation: He/she takes it the right way
example:
Tetapuiwgsua'tu na ula?
Am I taking this the right way?

tetapui'satl.translation: He/she sews it (shirt) the right way
example:
Ta'nl tetapui'satl a'pi'l negm.
Donald, he sews a net the right way.

tetapui's'g.translation: He/she sews it the right way
meanings: sew the right way or correctly
example:
Tetapui'smeg nige' ma ap puwatas'tnug ili'sas'tnn.
If we sew it correctly now it won't be necessary to be sewn over
again.

So'sep na maw tetapu'qamigsit ji'nm.
Joseph is a properly behaving man.

tetapu'satl.translation: He/she slices it (turkey) the right way
meanings: slice or cut right way or correctly
example:
Ansue'g na mu' tetapu'sagul na lasqo'plawl.
It's to bad that he/she didn't cut that board correctly.

meanings: slice or cut right way or correctly
example:
Negm nata' tetapu's'g, nei'a'tltew ta'n telsm'g.
He/she knows how to cut it correctly, he/she will show you how
to cut it.

Nmlugwate'n glapis tetaputeg.
Work on it until it's correct.

Ge's Mali pemtetaqa'sit na nisiet.
While Mary was hurrying up, she fell.

Wesamtetaqe'g ugjit ula tetapua'tun.
He/she is in too much of a hurry to do this right.

Tetaqite'lmatl unjann apaja'sinin.
He/she is anxious for his/her child to get back.

Ta'n te'sit mijua'ji'j tetaqite'tg Nuelewumg.
All children can hardly wait until Christmas arrives.

Tetaqulguni na sisip awisiw etlnmu't ula gm'tginaq.
The Kingbird is not often seen here in our territory.

Me' gatu tetgueg ula ga'qan.
My! this door is in the way.

Pas'g altetguet aq mu' apoqnmuegw.
He/she is just in the way and doesn't help out.

Nmu'ji'j suel smtug te'tipja'latl mjegeio'ql.
The puppy rolls over the garbage can almost immediately.

Menaqa te'tipja'tu na gta'su'nml ta'n tujiw menja'sin.
Carefully roll up your blankets when you get up.

Pas'g enmite't'pjietaq ta'n etlnisqamigeg.
He/she just went tumbling down the slope.

te'tipoqja'latl.translation: He/she puts arm or arms around the waist
example:
Te'tipoqja'latl aq poqta'lugwejig.
He/she puts his/her arms around his/her waist and they begin to
dance about.

Tetpaqapugua'lajig ugtapsute'gang ta'n elmila'ij.
He/she straight him /her dolls where he /she playing.

Tetpaqapuguig gatu na gmu'g gisqama'toq.
Well that stick he/she stood up is standing straight.

Tetpaqapuguit nige', napui'g ge's mu ap nisiegw.
It is standing straight now, take the photograph before it falls again.

Malpale'wit tetpaqatl nnjann.
The doctor weighs my child.

Weltetpaqig na ula gtawtinu.
Our road is nice and straight.

Lasqo'plaw tetpaqigit gwilu, me' nqamase'gtetew ta'n telie'wuj.
Look for a board that is straight, it will be easier to use.

E'w'n tetpaqign ula engalj plamu.
Use the scale when weighting this salmon.

Amujpa amgwesewei lasqo'plaw tetpaqpit.
That first board has to be straight.

Nussaqiget tetpaqq wius ges mu iloqomoqwa'tug.
The sales clerk weighs the meat before wrapping it up.

Tetpaqqama'latl st'ge nnuoqta'wul.
He/she stands it straight like a statue.

Amujpa tetpaqqama'tu na amgwesewei llutaqanatgw.
I have to straighten that first fence post.

Tetpaqqamig gisna mu tetpaqqaminug, amujpa eteg na'te'l.
Standing straight or not standing straight, it has to be in that spot.

Tetpaqqamit ula nitap st'ge sma'gnis.
My friend is standing straight like a soldier.

Tetpaqqopit na ala sma'gnis etliesgmat.
That soldier who is waiting sits straight.

Gtu' tetpaqs'j na lasqo'plaw, e'we'n ula tma'gittaqan eteg.
If you want to cut that board straight, use this saw over here.

Giju' tetpaqs'g pipnaqan ugjit wela'gowei
Mother is cutting the bread straight for supper.

Tetpaqteg na gutepaqan?
Is your vehicle straight?

Nige' ula gisanguai, talgi'g tettul?
Now for these things I have shopped for, how much do I owe
you?

Ula nitap ma'munitettuet ms't tami.
My friend here owes a lot everywhere.

Tetujiguwisin lpa tetuipsguna'i.
I'm so hungry my stomach is rumbling.

tetuje'g.translation: He/she is so many years old
example:
Je gi's si'st tetuje'g ula ntinen.
Already our dog is three years old!

Tetujintage'g ta'n tujiw wen gelulj, megwe'saqa'sitaq.
He/she is so bashful that when anyone speaks to him/her, he/she
will blush.

tetutgi'g.translation: It is the same size as
example:
Ula wenju'su'n tetutgi'g st'ge ejgujg.
This apple is as big as a pumpkin.

tetutgilg.translation: He/she/it is the same size as
example:
Suel ugjignaml wijei tetutgilgig.
He/she and his/her younger brother are almost the same size.

Nuji'j tewa'gweitesguit n'npo'goneg wela'gwe'g.
My grandchild kick me out of my bed last night.

Pugwelg ta'n goqwei gelu'lg tewajjieget.
He/she is throwing out many good things.

Te'siegsitpu'g tewa'laji te'sipowg.
Every morning he/she takes the horses outside.

tewalqa'latl.translation: He/she take him/her out in the open
example:
Tewalqa'latl laplusang aq telimatl nmia.
He/she releases him/her from prison and tells him/her go home.

Tapu'gl ntluignn gistualqatesgl.
Two of my fingers were just dislocated.

Newte'jit tmoqta'w tewalqatesing muta wasoqotesg gisitqat'g .
One beam is dislocated because it has been struck by lightening.

Gisitewalqatesmatl ugjigunn.
He/she has dislocated his/her knee.

Lpa suliewei umaposmg wejtualqatestoq.
He/she actually shook money out of his/her pocket.

Tewalqa'toq newte' aq nasgwa'toq.
He/she takes one out and divides it in half.

Lpa tewalqe'g njigun.
My knee is actually dislocated.

meanings: spill out, stick out, or protrude
example:
Tetujiugju'aq lagla'ns lpa msigu tewalqiaq ms't tami.
The barn is so full of hay it sticks out everywhere.

meanings: spill out, stick out, or protrude
example:
Me' gnu' nasa'l'j atla'i ma tualqiegw.
If you put the shirt on more properly it will not stick out.

Ntue'm gaqi'sg getu'tua'lsit.
My dog wants to urinate often.

Tewa'lutewe'l najimawo'tunej.
Let's go gather dandelions.

Wen tewapit ala' wenji'guom?
Who is looking out from that house?

Mu' etug ata'wissugwatigegw, muta te'siula'gw tewatalg.
He/she must not know how to cook, because he/she eats out
every evening.

Mijua'jijg tewatejima'titl tilsl, wenji'guomji'j toqo eltu'tij.
The children drag out a long timber, they are apparently planning
to build a little play house.

Tewatejitoq sa'qawei utepaqan.
He/she drags it out his/hers old car.

Te'sigisg'g tewa'toq ugtmutputim aq tewgopa'sit.
Daily he/she takes his/her chair out and sits outside.

Wi'sitji'j pisgw'tugwi'g aq smtug ntinen tewattesguatl.
The small animal ran inside and our dog chased it out immediately.

Teweget waqantew ugjit ugti'l.
He/she threw a bone outside for his/her dog.

Tewegetl lasqo'plawl muta nugu' gaqalgannitl.
He/she throws out the plank because it is now thoroughly rotten.

Gesiegsitpu'g tewiet.
He/she goes out early in the morning.

Ula elsaqas'g telo'tm gijga' pemtewigiaq.
I find that this wall is curving outward a bit.

Ula miti's tewigiet awti'jigtug.
This tree curves out on to the small road.

Telmusa'taq pisgwa'n amujpa tewigsma'l'g'p.
He/she was so insistant on coming in I had to push him/her
out.

Ula ga'qan pas'g lugwetew tuigsma'tu'n.
This door will only work if you push it out.

Tewigt'tesgul na pugjig gi'l!
I'm going to kick you out soon!

tewipuna't.translation: He/she becomes of age to be independent
meanings: becomes of age to be independent
example:
Geg't nugu' tewipuna't na ngwis.
My son is almost of age to be independent.

tewitpaqatg.translation: He/she is married out off the community
example:
Newte'tnitl umisl tewitpaqatmnitl.
One of his/her older sisters is married outside the community.

Nitapinen apoqonmaqat tewiwsit wiguaq.
We helped our buddy moved out from his home.

Ntla'taqsunm tewje'g.
My bucket has a hole in it.

Ntus tewlugwet wiguaq.
My daughter works away from her home.

meanings: marry someone from outside of the community
example:
Pugwelg na gis tewmalie'wit ula gm'tginug.
Many have married out from our community.

Nqal newte'jit gawi tewoqpit.
Leave one porcupine quill sticking out.

Ula pusugl elamgo'tas'gl wesampugwelg tewoqteg
This piled firewood has too many sticking out.

Ta'n tujiw getu' uligisg'g na tujiw tu'pugua'sitew.
When the weather is going to be good, then he/she will step 
outside.

Tewpuguit aq elapij awti, etliesgmat.
He/she stands in the doorway looking out at the road, waiting.

Nmu'j tewuggwalatl ugtassusitml.
The dog follows him/her owner out.

Waspu lpa tewuggwatew pugtewulgw gta'nug.
A seal will follow a steamship out to sea.

Jigs'tmuj wen ugpnng amujpa sangew tewulamit aq sangew
wesuelamit.
When one's lungs are being checked he/she must exhale slowly
and inhale slowly.

Nuji'j tgeia'tat gisgug.
My grand child has a cold today.

Tgniewuti na apoqonmasg ta'n tujiw melglugwen.
Sweat helps you when you work hard.

Ewle'jit ula ala'ulet, tgnu waju'pet.
This poor person carrying stuff, he/she is soaked with sweat.

Tg'poq samuqwan na maw wigapu'g.
The spring water tastes very good.

Maw gaqi'sg ugju'sn tg'snug wett'g.
The wind blows from the west most often.

Tg'snugowa'j pejimittugwalugsieg, aq mijipjewei um'tgigewei
pegisitugsieg.
A male westerner is here to visit us, and he has arrived with food
from his homeland for us.

Tg'snugowi'sgw pejigtapegiewugsieg.
A female westerner is here to sing to us.

Tgu'g mesgilgig ta'n tujiw weju's'g.
The waves are big when it's windy.

Me' gatu tguig apaqtug!
My the waves are high in the ocean!

Maw wigapu'g samqwan ta'n tujiw weja'tmg tgupoqigtug.
The water you get from a bubbling spring is delicious.

Ge' angapte'n ula, tia'm pemaptoq.
Look at this, moose tracks.

Tami e'wmn tia'muapi?
Where do you use the moose strap?

Tia'muegn e'wmn na maw ulnug aligew gisitu'n.
You can make the softest clothing using moosehide.

Pugwelg tia'muei wejiaq newte'jit tia'm.
A lot of moose meat comes from one moose.

Ngwis tia'mugwet te's gesig.
My son hunts moose every winter.

Amujpa nata'tia'mui'sit wen getu' tia'mugwej.
One has to know his/her moose calls if he/she wants to sucessfully
hunt moose.

Masgwi e'wut tia'mui'suti eltmg.
Birch bark is used when making a moose caller.

Tia'mu'jg ugs'tqamultitaq siggw.
Calf moose are going to be born in the spring.

Amgwes na maw milie'was'g'p tia'mu'mi, we'gaw wasoqonmaqann
wejitas'g'pnn.
Once there were many uses for moose fat, even candles were
made from it.

Ugju'pega'l ti'g'tlo'q aq ugjaqama'tu samuqwan.
Fill the kettle and boil the water.

Ti'lsig pejo'lut'pnig, ugtejg elamgo'tasultijig.
The beams that were delivered, they're piled up in the back.

Nignen ti'lsi'gan.
Our house is made with planks.

Tapusijig e'pitjig nenaqig ta'n telui'tujig Titie's.
I know two women who are called Titie's.

Etna'gsatmug gis nutaqas ta'n teltoqsij ti'tigli.
I would really like it if I could hear the sound made by the great
horned owl.

Ta's'gl e'wmnn tlansu'l ugjit newtai'g?
How many quarters do you use to make one dollar?

Tla'sij, pe'l tlatalj.
Let him/her be, while he/she/it eats.

Tlawo'q pilei amujpa gwilug, sa'qawei nugu' gesp'g aq gaqatejiet.
We must look for a new knife, the old one is dull and at the end of
it's usability.

tlawo'qsatl.translation: He/she cuts him/her with a knife
example:
Etltlawo'qs'g plamu ugjit wela'gwewei.
I'm cutting the salmon with a knife for supper.

tlawo'qta'tl.translation: He/she strikes him/her with a knife
example:
Na'tuwen gis tlawo'qta'tl ula a'papi'l, mu nugu' gelu'sigw.
Someone was striking this rope with a knife, it's useless
now.

tlawo'qte'g.translation: He/she strikes it with a knife
example:
Telta'siap amaligsewei gat(u) teliangamgug pas'g tlawo'gte'gei.
I thought I was carving it but it looks like I am just striking at
something with a knife.

Ula wi'gatign tet tleiawig.
This paper belongs here.

Ula ji'nm Listugujg tleiawit.
This man is from Listujug.

La'tinej Qame'g, tlia' mtu'na'q.
Lets go to town, even if its stormy.

Mesgi'g eteg tli'sutigtug.
There is a lot in a language.

We'gwigaqi'smilamu'gl tma'gittaqann eltas'gl gisgug.
Definitely there are many kinds of saws made today.

Metua's'g nugu' magasan ta'n tmaqang etlintuisgetasi'tij.
These days it is difficult to find a store that sells pipes.

tmaqanigju'aq.translation: It is loaded to the brim
example:
Lpa nignen tmaqanigju'aq ta'n tujiw mawio'mi pemiaq.
My house is overloaded when a gathering is going on.

tmaqanigju'et.translation: It is loaded to the brim
example:
Aptapia'ji'jgewatpe'gei aq ntla'taqsunmg nige' tmaqanigju'ejig.
I went picking fiddleheads and now my pails are full to the brim
with them.

As'gom te'sijig tmato'sg tms aq pijega lasupigtug.
Cut six tomatos and put them in the soup.

Gis e'wmn tmawei ugjit a'sutman.
You can use tobacco for prayer.

Maw wininuip tmawignessu i'wigipnaq ula Listugujg.
A hunchback that used to live in Listuguj had a nasty
disposition.

Inaqaneg tmg elia, toqo tujiw patatujg.
First go right, then go left.

Enm'papga'timg jijuaqa nemu't tmgwatignej etliwsget gigjiw sitmug.
Going down the coast sometimes one can see a heron fishing for
food by the shore.

Tami eteg na tmi'gn?
Where is that axe?

Aqamoqe'l tmi'gnatgul maw uligpitapegsigl.
White ash axe handles last a long time.

tmi'gnta'tl.translation: He/she strikes him/her/it with an axe
example:
Negm tmi'gnta'tl miti'sl ta'n tujiw gewa'laj.
He/she uses an ax when felling a tree.

tmi'gnte'g.translation: He/she strikes it with an axe
example:
Wen gistmi'gnte'g npatawtim?
Who used an axe on my table?

Ge' tmletji'j te's'g guta'tui samqwan?
Would you pour me a glass tumbler of water?

Tmoqta'w mujgamesgilg tet e'waten.
The largest log will be used here.

Gisgug nata'tmoqta'we'gei muta nujj gegina'muip.
I know how to cut logs today because my father taught me how.

Pugwelg mimajuinu wigpa'tiji tmtmu'g esgoltnniji.
Many people like eating oysters raw.

Tami etegl na tm'tqi'gnn?
Where are the scissors?

Gitnmeiultew tnuanapi, tlia' pas'g newte'jit jileiaj.
A tendon will give you a hard time, even if you injure just one.

example:

Ulnuelewigw!

Ulnuelewultigw!

Who did you say has an older sister?

Ala e'pite'ji'j apjiw alulgwalatl umisl.
The little girl is always following her older sister around.

Lpa'tuj umsigwang pitoqsinijig.
The little boy's eyelashes are long.

Ms't tami nespnatl umtesann.
He/she brings his/her youngest child everywhere.

Gespe'gewa'gi Migma'gig nm'tginen.
The Gaspe'g territory in Migma'gi is our homeland.

E'pite'ji'j umugsnn gisie'natl.
The little girl has lost her shoe.

Umusti piptoqapsgeg pawijei aq tu'aqan.
His\her belly is as round as a ball.

U'n aq gigpesan wije'tigl.
Fog and rain go together.

Nnu' saqamaw aq unaqapeml pegisingig.
The native Chief and his\her councillor have
arrived.

Ms't na wen mi'walas ungi'gug.
Everyone should appricate their parents.

Negm ungi'gul najia's'guatal.
He/she will go to meet (pick-up) his/her parent.

Me' gatu u'niaq ula egsitpu'g.
My it's getting foggy this morning.

U'nig na lpa mu tami elapim'g.
When it is foggy one doesn't have good visability.

Mu geituaqal unjann ta'n teluisinij.
I don't know the name of his/her child.

Unjaqajewa'tegetes nitap!
Take it easy my friend!

Nitape'sgw unji gesnugaj.
My girlfriend has a headache.

Tami na eteg Unma'gi?
Where is Cape Breton?

Na jipji'j un'sqe'g megwe'niji.
That bird's wings are red.

upmejising.translation: He/she is laying on his/her side
example:
Upmejising ala ji'nm taluisit?
What's the name of that man laying on his side?

upmejisma'sit.translation: He/she lies down on his/her side
example:

He/she lies his/her baby on its side.

Gisgug we'tuguwig ntmepigajm.
My hip is bothering me today.

Sapo'nug ta'pu ajiet eliet najtmte'muj usapun.
Tomorrow at two o'clock he/she is going to get his/her hair cut.

Me' gatu ula qopisun mamuiusapunit.
This newborn has lots of hair.

Gigji'w usaqanigtug wejiaq wius mawwigapu'g.
Meat from close to the shoulder blade is very delicious.

Usgaqan wenaqiaq te's siggw.
The fishery begins again each spring.

Pugwelg na usgewinu ula Listugujg.
There are many fishers here in Listuguj.

Gunmie'win na usgijipnew ignmulg.
When you make communion you are given a host.

Gi's nige' asugom te'sisga'q je ugumujin te'sipunqeg wigi ula
usgitqamug.
It's been sixty eight years that I have been living on the surface of
this earth.

Wenjitia'muei usgun na mawwigapu'g.
Cow's liver is very delicious.

Mawigsatg usgus almila'sij.
A weasel likes to play around.

U't eteg, tami eliaq?
This (item) placed here, where does is go?

Tegen utan wigin?
Which town do you live in?

Nitap utapsun natnmisg'g.
My friend is here to get his\her belongings.

U'ta'qann tapu'gul wegetesg.
I will need two paddles.

So'sep pilei utepaqan.
Joseph has a new car.

Tio'tis pigsepinitl utmaqann.
There's smoke coming from Eunice's pipe.

Nemitu's'p nutmi'gn? Lpa mu tami we'jitu.
Did you see my axe? I can't find it anywhere.

Nitap utqotalatl ugtue'ml aq we'gwims'ge'g.
My friend is burying his\her pet and is remorseful.

Utqotamg na gisgug.
The funeral is today.

Utqotaqan nugumijewei algwilm.
I'm looking for my grandmother's grave.

Utqotaqane'gatig ela'ti'gw?
Are we (two) going to the graveyard?

Nti utqotatgeg ugwaqantemeg.
My dog has buried his\her bone.

Tami wigit wa'gw?
Where does a louse live?

Roger teluet, ugpugugl teliulamu'gl, pajaq waio'psgul.
Roger says, her eyes look so good, just like glass beads.

wajua'latl.translation: He/she fills it (bottle) up with non·liquid
example:
La'taqsunn wajua'latl aq poqtapilatl.
He/she fills the pail (with non-liquid) and carries it away.

Goqwei telue's'p waju'aq?
What did you say was full?

wajua'toq.translation: He/she fills it up with non·liquid
example:
Geget wajua'toq utepaqan.
He/she has almost filled his/her car.

Ntmiti'sm wajuegnepit.
My tree is full.

Nti waju'et ginigwejijg.
My dog is full of thistles.

Nutepaqan lpa wajuigneteg nipi'g.
My vehicle is full to capacity with leaves.

Tale'tew waju'pa'q ulo'nug?
What time is high tide tonight?

waju'pega'latl.translation: He/she fills him/her/it up with liquid
example:
Lpa emigju'pega'latl glapis paitapegienij.
He/she filled it until it overflowed.

waju'pega'toq.translation: He/she fills it up with liquid
example:
Waju'pega'toq enmaqqei samuqwan.
He/she fills the hole with water.

Wapus wigit etlwalgwe'g.
The rabbit lives in the hollow (in the earth).

Ala lpa'tu'ji'j maw walgwi'taqanat.
That little boy has a very hollow nape.

Etlwali'g ma' alam gaqamulqatmu.
It will take me a good deal of time to shovel the snowbank.

Pugwelg wali'j gisi'g't sepei.
We made many a snowball this morning.

waljigta'tl.translation: He/she hollows...out by striking with an axe
example:
Waljigta'tl miti'sl.
He/she hollowed out the tree.

waljigte'g.translation: He/she hollows it out by striking with an axe
example:
Ge' waljigte'map ula mgumi.
Let me gouge out the ice.

Teliangamgug walnoqsitat.
It appears that he/she has arched feet.

Gi's gi'l nemi't walqwan?
Have you seen a rainbow?

Telma'munisu'gweg na te'sipow ugpaqam pa tluwenes geget
walqwiet.
That horse is so sway backed that he looks like
he's about to cave-in.

meanings: wooden plate used in dice game
example:
Waltes jugwa'l aq laqatinej.
Bring the waltes plate and let's play.

meanings: round bones or dice used in dice game
example:
Ta'sijig e'w'jig waltestaqang ta'n tujiw mila'sin
waltes?
How many waltes dice do you use when you play
waltes?

waltestat.translation: He/she plays the waltes dice game
example:
Lpa newtiula'gw eltwaltestat.
He/she has been playing waltes all evening.

Waltesta'timg na mawgiso'qon.
Playing waltes is the most fun,

Wen pemwanna'sit?
Who is going up the mission?

Pe' wanne'g eli'piap.
I'm going to run up the mission.

wannoqs'g.translation: He/she carves a concave in it
example:
Wasamwannoqs'g ula, ma etug gisie'wmu.
He/she carved this concave too deep, I don't think I will be able to
use it.

Ma'munwannoqsit na ula waltes.
That waltes bowl is very concave.

Mu na netageiug, wantaqe'g na pas'g.
He/she is not shy, he/she just has a calm disposition.

Pana telqamigsit negm, wantaqilugwet.
This is his/her personality, he/she works calmly.

Pewatm'g wantaqo'ti.
Peace is wanted.

Wantaqpa'q'p wela'gwe'g.
The water was calm last night

We'guwantaqpegitg ula sipu.
This river flows calmly.

Glapis gatu wantaqpit, newtigisg'g telialtugwi'g.
He/she is finely sitting quietly, he/she has been running around all
day.

Na we'guwantaqteg, ms't wen etug nepat.
My it's quiet, everyone must be sleeping.

Sa'q ni'n wapaltugwai.
I've had white hair for a long time.

S'mtug we'jituates utepaqan, muta wapamu'g.
You'll find his\her car right away, because it's whitish in color.

Taluisit gti na wapamugsit?
What is the name of your dog that is whitish?

Goqwei na tewjima'munwapa's'g?
What is that turning so white?

Ta'n tujiw qopisun wapa'sij telwejig mu nemitug goqwei.
They say that when a newborn opens their eyes
they see nothing.

'Nti geswape'g.
My dog is very white.

Tami etegl na wape'jgl?
Where is the flour?

Tami epit na wape'jgo'q?
Where is that flour container?

Nutepaqanji'j wape'ji'jg.
My little sled is white.

Pilei ntue'm aq wape'ji'jit.
I have a new pet and he/she is small and white.

Ge' mgnanej ala wape'jit.
Let's pick the whitish one.

Wapg mnja'sia's aq gsistaqaneweia's.
At dawn I will get up and do the laundry.

Unji waju'aq wapgwan.
He/she has a headful of gray hair.

Wapgwat na ula gitapenu.
Our friend has white hair.

Nti teluisit Wapigat.
My dog's name is White foot.

Wapigle'wj na telui'tut napemegw plamu.
Wapigle'wj is what we call a male salmon.

Pana ne'gaw wapignegsit negm.
He/she has always been pale.

Gi's gi'l nemi't nmu'j wapinpat?
Have you seen a dog sleep with it's eyes open?

Siawpisgwa', mu nepagw, me' wapit.
Go on in, he/she is not asleep, his/her eyes are open.

Etug ma' wapn nmitug, gi's aqtatpa'q aq me' wapit.
I don't think he/she will see dawn, it's past midnight and he/she is
still awake.

Mnja'si, gi's wapnamugwiaq.
Get up, it's already daybreak.

Wapnapiap wela'gwe'g, na we'gwtugsi nige'.
I stayed up all night, I'm sleepy now.

Usgewinu'g wapngusultijig.
The fishers sleep until dawn.

Wapnintu'tijig, aq ms't wenn wels'tagwi'tiji.
They sang until dawn, and everyone enjoyed their singing.

So'sep gesatg wapntesing.
Joseph likes to dance until dawn.

Tapusijig wapoqq etligwengig nignaq.
I planted two moosewood bushes at my place.

Wapoqsit nugu' la ntatlaim, newt ewne'g'pnaq.
This shirt of mine is sunbleached, it was once blue.

wapoqteg.translation: It is whitened from the sun
example:
Nta'gusn etlwapoqteg gujmug.
My hat is getting sun-bleached outside.

Mawulp'sewet na wapsgw.
Coal makes a good heat.

Wap'staqapewit ula gis jipaqa'l't.
The person you scared is looking pale.

So'sep wap'staqe'g gesig.
Joseph is pale in the winter.

Pilei nutepaqan wap'stoqnamu'g.
My new car is pale green.

Ula wap'stoqonamugsit atlai gisnasguates.
You can wear this pale green shirt.

Gi's gi'l nemi't wapus wapa'sit?
Have you seen a rabbit turn white?

Wapusuegn gelu'lg pituega'taqan wejiaq.
Rabbit hide makes a good lining.

Wapusuei petaqan na ni'n mawintawitu.
I'm a good rabbit pie maker.

Na nutepaqan me nepe'g aq waqaiew.
My car is more sensitive than pus.

Ango'te'n, muta waqaiewiaq me' pgije'gt'tew ge's mu nijginug.
Be careful, becuase if it fills with pus it will take longer to heal.

Ejela'toq na nugu' waqaje'g, mu telignagw.
He/she can't help it anymore, he/she is not as strong.

Listugujg eteg newte' mesgi'g waqalusan.
There is a large fort in Listuguj.

Gujmug etlwaqama'latl plamu'l.
He/she is cleaning the salmon outside.

Gisuloqotalg na waqama'toq ugtpatawtim.
After his/her supper he/she cleans up his/her table.

Waqamei, muta pas gisapalsi.
I'm clean, I just washed up.

waqamitg.translation: It is a clean flowing water
example:
Waqamitg na ta'n wesgowa'sin.
Where you are the water flows clear.

Ula maljewe'j waqamnmat.
This youngster is neat and tidy.

Waqam'tgug, ula Gespe'gewa'gig, i'teg'pneg Nnue'gatieg.
Waqam'tgug (Bonaventure, Quebec), here in the Gaspe, used to
be a native village.

Ge' newte' wa'qan jugwasga'tui?
Please pass one knife to me?

Wenewei ula wa'qanji'j?
Who's jacknife is this?

wa'qansatl.translation:
He/she cuts him/her/
it with a knife
example:
Amujpana wa'qansatl na miti'sl.
S\he just had to cut that tree with a knife.

wa'qans'g.translation: He/she cuts it with a knife
example:
Amujpa wa'qans'g, muta mu we'jitug tma'gitaqan.
He/she has to cut it with a knife, because he/she can't find the saw.

Nme'juei waqantew na mawnugwe'g.
Fish bone is very soft.

waqantewatpat.translation: he/she has a head of bone
example:
We'gumaqatpat na waqantewatpat.
That's a large headed skull.

Maljewe'j ntue'm na mawaqasit.
My young animal is the wildest.

Oqwatnug na mawulnmitm'g waqatasg.
The Northern lights can be seen well towards the north.

Waqatignn tami eteg?
Where's the bait?

Mu etug nenmug na tli'suti, telwaqgaji'sit.
He/she doesn't seem to know the language well, he/she is such a
weak speaker.

Gesimgwe'g na wa'qi.
His/her skin is very red.

Waqjuig na ugtaptu'n.
His/her cane is crooked.

Wen giswaqjuiga'latl ntlawo'qml?
Who bent my knife?

Waqjuiga's'g pgisinn, na inaqaneg eteg.
When you get to the bend, it is on the right.

Waqjuiga'sit aq elaqpo'latl umugsnapi'l.
He/she bends down and laces up his/her shoe.

Telgina'sit ji'met lpa i'waqjuiga'toq ugtu'ta'qanm.
He/she is paddling so hard he/she keeps bending his/her paddle.

Waqjuigit na mitiji'j.
That little tree is crooked.

Mu gesatmug teppaqpij, gesatg waqju'pij.
He/she doesn't like sitting stright, he/she likes to sit crooked.

Waqju'teg na tuop'ti gisnasa'toq.
That window he/she just installed is crooked.

Waqqajgis'pugua'sit nugu'.
He/she is barely able to stand up anymore.

Ulwaqama'tu, mut esgwa'tu waqtian.
Clean it well, don't leave behind any entrails.

Na we'gwiwasapa'q ula sipu.
This river has crystal clear water.

Amujpa tmg nujgma'lut wasapeglaw gesgmnaq gisiamjaqa'lam'g
tami.
You will have to melt pieces of spruce gum before
it can spread anywhere.

Natgoqwei wasateg nemitu gmtnigtug.
I see something bright on the mountain.

Gesasijig gloqowejg wa'so'q wela'gw.
The stars shine bright in the heavens at night.

Wasoqonmaqan wasoqweg.
The candle is lit.

Ge' wasoqwaqtui na wasoqon.
Would you turn on the light for me.

Sosep wasoqonatl ugta'piml ge's etla'pigej.
Joseph keeps a light on his net while he's fishing.

Me' wasoqonewegl na pugsetal.
The embers still give off light.

Oqwatnugewei gloqowej me' wasoqnawet.
The North Star is still giving off light.

Apje'ji'jit wasoq wasoqong eptaqano'guom.
A small light bulb keeps the cupboard lit.

Wenewei ula wasoqonmaqan?
Who's candle is this?

Tio'tis i'wasoqota'tl ugpesmgeweiml.
Eunice polishes her religious metal.

Sa'qawei nasoqwa'taqan wasoqote'g.
He/she polishes the old ring.

Nemitu's'p wela'gweg telma'munwasoqotesg?
Did you see all that lighting we got last night?

Ala wasoqowi'j i'alwasoqotesing.
That firefly keeps flashing around.

Pas'g to'q na'tami tapu'gl tepgunsetl telipgitawsit wasoqowi'j.
Apparently a firefly lives only about two months.

Wen giswasoqwa'latl epsaqtejl?
Who lit the stove?

Mu geggunmuann wasoqa'taqann.
I don't have any rings.

Wasoqonmaqan wasoqa'toq.
He/she lights the candle.

Wasoqweg gisa'tu'n na wasoqwa'taqan.
You have made that ring shiny.

Sa'q giaspnmi'g waspu ula sitmug.
It's been a long time since I saw a seal down the shore.

Wastew apjiw mawuliangamgug atel gisipsaq.
Snow always looks really beautiful right after a snowfall.

Tewjitge'g lpa tuop'ti'l wastewt'gl.
It's so cold the windows are all frosted up.

Pe'l nte'pitem igmaqap wasueg.
I'm giving my wife a flower.

Nuji'j gi's wasuega'tat.
My grand daughter already menstrates.

Wasueg iga'tu wasuego'qigtug.
I'll put a flower in the vase.

Ulwasuej wenju'su'naqsi jiptug pugwelt'tal wenju'su'nl.
If the apple tree has many blossoms, hopefully there will be lots of
apples.

Pilei watapteg ntoqon.
I have a new yellow dress.

Nti ugpugug wata's'g.
My dog's eye is becoming cloudy with cataract.

Elugwatmut'pnn, muta gitg ugpugugl wate'g'pnn.
They were fixed/worked on, because cataracts were present in
both eyes.

Pe'gitnet aq pugwelgig wa'tugwaq tewita'nijig.
He/she is bleeding from his/her nose and there are many blood
clots coming out.

Gis'pessusi, gatu gi's wa'tugwawa's'geg.
I've cut myself, but it started clotting already.

As'gom te's'gl wa'wul ugjaqama'tu.
Boil six eggs.

Gi's wa'we'j pemiet?
Did the egg person go by yet?

Gaqi'sg wegaia'latl ugjignaml.
He/she angers his/her younger brother often.

Ms't na wen jijuaqa wegaig.
Everyone gets angry sometimes.

Wegaiugt'g utepaqan mu elugwenug.
He/she gets angry at his/her vehicle if it doesn't work.

Wegaiugtuatl ugta'piml mu pe'tugwegw.
He/she gets angry at his/her fishing net when he/she gets no fish.

Weget etegl, ge' a'se'g la'tu.
These here, please take them to the other room.

Nti wegilalatl nitape'sgwal.
My dog barks at my female friend.

Nti wegilatg ta'n tes'g tepaqan pemateja's'g.
My dog barks at every vehicle that goes by.

Wegla pualin tala'tun?
What do you want me to do with these?

Weglams'geg wela'gwe'g.
It was gusty last night.

We'gopegitg gaqamit nnuoqta'w Glusgap.
In Truro there stands a statue of Glusgap.

Sapo'nug eltaieg We'goqoma'q.
Tomorrow we are going to Whycocomagh.

Esgipe'i wegaw apaja'sian.
Wait for me until I come back.

we'gwamatl.translation: He/she watches him/her until he/she is out of sight
meanings: follow (with eyes) until out of sight
example:
Wanne'g elapit glapis ta'n we'gwamaj ugti'l.
He/she looks to the west end of Listuguj until his/her dog is out of
sight.

we'gwamgug.translation: Where the waterway ends at falls
example:
Mut gigja'siw we'gwamgug, nsanoqoig.
Don't go near the edge of the water fall, it is dangerous.

we'gwamgwe'get.translation: He/she poles a boat to a certain spot
example:
Matawe'g we'gwamgwe'get.
He/she poles his/her boat as far as Matapedia.

meanings: best in argument or duel of words
example:
Tiotis lpa we'gwa'muatl na pa'tlia'sl.
Tiotis defeated that priest in the debate.

Wela'gwe'g we'gwanqe'get nnjan.
My child sleep-walked last night.

Samqwan welamu'g we'gwapsgigtug.
The water looks nice at the falls end.

we'gwapt'g.translation: He/she watches it until it is out of sight
meanings: follow (with eyes) until out of sight
example:
Elapit glapis ta'n we'gwapt'g salpo'l.
He/she watches until the sailboat is out of sight.

we'gwa's'g.translation: It goes as far as there
example:
Tami we'gwa's'g ula awti'j?
How far does this path go?

So'sep teluep we'gwa'sitew qospemg.
Joseph said he would go as far as the lake.

Teliawana'gwi'tmat lpa we'gwata'lit te's tepa'lij na utepaqang.
He/she is such a bad driver he/she scares me everytime he/she
gives me a ride in his/her vehicle.

We'gwata'sip amgweseweieg poqtaqsingeg.
He/she was frightened the first time he/she flew.

we'gwiji'met.translation: He/she paddles or rows until (area, place)
example:
We'gwiji'met glapis Matawe'g.
He/she rowed until Matapedia.

We'gwistoqonig eliei sapo'nug.
I'm going to Eskasoni tomorrow.

Sqapa'tu'n goqwei jijgluewjuapiei weita'qt'tew.
If you wet a woolen item it will shrink.

Ntatlaim gisweita't.
My shirt has shrunk.

Muliang weiteja'latl ujjl.
He/she drove his/her father from Montreal.

Tami weiteja'tu'n gutepaqan?
Where did you drive your car from?

Tami weja'latl na gajue'wjl?
Where did he/she get that cat?

Nugumij wejamoqsualit te's nemi'lij.
My grandmother embraces me everytime she sees me.

Sepei Maltaneg wejanguaiap.
This morning I shopped at Martin's.

Gisiwjaqama'latl jagejl.
He/she has boiled the lobster.

Wasamiwjaqama'toq p'tewei.
He/she boiled the tea too long.

Gi's wejaqamiaq snaweiapu?
Is the maple sap boiling yet?

Gi's wejaqamiet na samqano'q?
Is that water container boiling yet?

Gesigawipsaq weja'tegemg wanne'g glapis Matawe'g.
It's snowing heavily from the cove to Matapidia.

Weja'tegemgeg mawmaljewe'juianeg migwite'tm na.
I remember that from when I was very young.

weja'teget.translation: He/she gets a spouse from there
example:
Tami weja'teget ggwis?
Where did your son get his spouse?

Utang weja'toq wilu.
He/she brought his/her food from town.

Mu gejiaqig ta'n goqwei wejeiati'tij.
I don't know why they are testing each other.

Sepei menjaiiteg ntus mes'ng'sneg wejgiemgewei.
This morning my daughter woke up with chicken pox.

Wejgiet, aq ejele'g, gesipiet.
He/she is scabby, and it can't be helped, he/she is itchy.

Nemitu'n na tepaqan wejgu'aq?
Do you see that vehicle approching?

Nitap wejgu'aqamit pugwelg suliewei.
My friend has lots of money coming to him\her.

Nmis wejgu'et.
My older sister is on her way here.

Wejgu'jing gatu mu wejgu'wegw.
He/she is bent towards here but he/she is not coming here.

wejgupuguit.translation: He/she is standing faced towards here
example:
Gaqapeigwigwilaq, u't ta wejgupuguis ne'gaw.
I looked for him/her everywhere, here he/she was standing here
facing me all along.

Gi's ap nnjan wejgutemit.
My child comes crying again.

Ge' angam nti teligit wejgutugwi'g.
Look at how funny my dog looks running towards us.

meanings: sit or set facing toward here
example:
Newtigisg'g wejgwajepit etliesgmalatl.
He/she has sat (facing toward here) all day waiting for him/her.

meanings: sit or set facing toward here
example:
Ala' wejgwajeteg patawti.
There's a table facing towards here.

Gi's ap ula wejgwa'latl tu'waqann.
Here he/she comes with the ball again.

Glapis gatu wejgupaneta'q, jiptug ulp'ttetew.
Finally the sky is clearing up, hopefully it will be warm.

Tale'tew wejgwapa'q ulo'nug?
What time is the incoming tide tonight.

meanings: something that one has a right to
example:
Mu assma geitu ta'n telgi'g wejgwapesij, gatu geitu tetut.
I don't know how much he/she has coming to him/her, but I do
know he/she is owed.

wejgwapit.translation: He/she is sitting facing toward here
example:
Nemi't na e'pit wejgwapit, nugumij na.
