Wen tana alpuguit ala awtigtug?
Who is that standing around at the road?

Nujintuisget wesama'muatl e'pinitl.
The clerk overcharged the lady.

Etug wesamatalultieg, lpa mu wen getu' maja'sigw.
I think we all over ate, no one wants to move.

Wasamelgl ula pgumann, etug ma' gaqimgnnmugul gisgug.
There are too many of these blueberries, I don't think we can pick
them all today.

Wesamgamit nugu' na nti.
My dog has gotten too fat.

Wesamgi'g na wenji'guom.
That house is too big.

Wesamgilg na tia'm ugjit ngeljistegetm.
That moose is too big for my freezer.

Wesamglu'lg nutepaqan ugjit nipugtug la'tun.
My vehicle is too good to take up into the woods.

Wasamgusi sepei.
I overslept this morning.

Wasamiapje'jgl ula, amujpa me' mesgi'gl gwilmu'gul.
These are too small, we have to look for larger ones.

Wesamjijigwe'jg na ga'qan, mu gisipisgwa'w.
That door is too narrow, I can't get inside.

Wesamisge'g na npata'wtim pilei.
My new table is too wide.

Wesamitqwaqji'jit mu gistepa'sigw utepaqan.
He/she is too short and can't get into his/her vehicle.

Mut ugsamla'muiw, muta ma' npaw ulo'nug.
Don't give (serve) me too much food, because I won't be able to
sleep tonight.

Ma' teptesinug ula, wasammaqoqsit.
This won't fit, it's too big in girth.

Wesamoqsatl na uggo'qoli'gwejml.
He/she has overcooked his/her chicken.

Ntgwe'ji'j apjiw wesamoqs'g pipnaqan.
My younger sister always overcooks bread.

Gigjepugu'tu, mu pualawjig gmu'jming ugsamoqsinew.
Pay close attention, you don't want the blueberries to overcook.

Ntwela'goweim wasamoqteg.
My supper is overcooked.

wesawa'latl.translation: He/she puts...on to boil or cook
example:
Pe'l wesawa'l'g'p na p'teweio'q aq p'teweie'matesnu.
I'll put the tea pot on to boil and we'll have tea.

wesawa'q.translation: It hangs over or on the edge
example:
Wesawa'q, jiptug ma' nisianug.
It is dangling over the edge, hopefully it won't fall.

wesawa't.translation: He/she/it hangs over or on the edge
example:
Lpa'tuj wesawa't paqse'gigtug.
The boy is hanging over the edge of the cliff.

wesawa'toq.translation: He/she puts it on to boil or cook
example:
Wesawa'toq samqwan gesgmnaq peltegewei egwijegegw.
He/she puts the water on to boil before he/she puts in the
porridge.

Mu mesgi'gtnug ula maqamige'j, pas'g wesawei.
This isn't a very large piece of land, it's just a point.

Newtinipg te'siula'gw ntjignam wesget.
Every night in the summer my younger brother fishes.

Wesgewei te's migwite'tm ta'n teliamassij na no'gmaw.
I laugh every time I remember how silly that relative of mine can
be.

Nitap wejgupuguit aq wesgewigwetutg.
My friend is standing towards me with a grinn.

wesgewina'q.translation: It is a happy, joyful or pleasureable place
example:
Wejo'tm na lien ta'n etlwesgewina'q ula nipnug.
I'm planning to go to a happy, joyful place this summer.

Wesgewinoqsultieg mawitaieg Nuelewung.
We are joyful when we get together at Christmas time.

wesg'g.translation: He/she goes that way, takes that road, path
example:
Sitmug wesg'g pemliet magasang.
He/she goes along the shore to go to the store.

Me' na pgijoqign wesgija's'g na malige'wigtug.
There is still a cover to go on that barrel.

Wesgija'tijig mujga'mesgi'gewe'l tu'gwesmunn.
The two of them got on top of the biggest pillows.

Megwe'nitl wesgijiama'latl wape'gigtug.
He/she spreads the red over the white.

Wesgijiama'toq mimei m'gegnigtug.
He/she spreads grease on the hide.

Ta'ns'p wesgijinuit Sano't?
When was Charlotte born?

Welamugsit na pilei wesgit.
That new vest looks good.

Sa'q mu nemiaq alwesgita'q.
It's been a long time since I've seen him/her wearing a vest.

Ge' angapte'n ala samqwan wesgitpega's'g mgumigtug.
Watch the water flow over on to the ice.

Ntla'taqsunm wesgitpega'sit.
My pail flows over.

Samqwan poqjiwesgitpegiaq ntiga'taqang.
The water is beginning to flow over my garden.

Pu'gowij tewjipugwelg, lpa wesgitpegiet lasqo'plawigtug.
There is so much sap, it flows on top of the board.

Naqsun wesgitpit mpo'qonigtug.
The bed sheet is on top of the bed.

Mimei na wesgitqo'qweg samqwanigtug.
Oil floats on top of the water.

Teliangamgug pugwelgig tu'aqang alwesgitqo'qutijig.
It looks like there are a lot of balls floating about.

wesgitteg.translation: It sits or is set on top
example:
Pp'ta'tu na gmu'j wesgitteg nutepaqang.
Take off that piece of wood sitting on my vehicle.

Nutepaqan wesgo'tas'g nige'.
My vehicle is being worked on now.

Gtu'apoqonmuieg, jugu'a, a'se'g wesgo'tmeg.
If you want to help us, come, we are processing it in the next
room.

Wesgowa's'g amalgewaqan.
There's dancing going on.

Ala sipu'ji'jg gopit wesgowa'sit.
A bever is busy at that little stream.

Wesgewigwa'sit te's migwite'tg um'tgi.
He/she smiles every time he/she remembers his/her homeland.

Ntus wesgumatl ugti'l.
My daughter is talking about her dog.

Ngwis na ni'n mawinta'wesgu'muit.
My son talks back to me often.

Nutaqap ulagu etliwsgu'tg ta'n i'tliaqap maljewe'juiteg.
I heard him/her talking yesterday about what it was like when
he/she was young.

Wen na wesgweiwatl na a'papi'l gujmug?
Who is handeling that rope outside.

La'sgug e'wapni wesigaliteg gisigui'sgw.
The old woman used cards to tell my fortune.

Tesigisg'g epa'sit, p'te'wmat, aq wesiget.
Everyday he/she sits, has tea and read his/her fortune.

Welamapnn gajuwe'jl aq wesmi'pulapnn.
He/she liked the looks of the cat and fled with him/her.

Geji'g na wesmi'putoq na wi'gatign etlgitg'p.
I know that he/she runs off with that book he/she was reading.

Unjuang wesmoqsuwalatji te'siula'gw.
He/she embrases his/her children every night.

Te's nti tewa'l'g na wesmugwat.
Every time I let my dog outside he/she runs off.

Pugwel na eig wi'sis ta'n wesmuit.
There are many horned animals.

Teluejig Pie'l mawweso'tg ugsulieweim.
They say that Peter conserves his finances.

Te'siegsitpu'g ntue'mg wespaiwijig muta pualijig mnja'sin aq
smman.
Every morning my pets disturbes my sleep because they want me
to get up and feed them.

wessmugt'g.translation: He/she is running away from it
example:
Gi's ap wessmugt'g ugtllugowaqan.
He/she is running away from his/her work again.

wessmugtuatl.translation: He/she is running away from him/her/it
example:
Nige' negm wessmugtuatl ugti'l.
Now he/she is running from his/her dog.

Mu na te's gisigjijiam'g ta'n wen westawi'sg.
It can't always be known who saves you.

Nmis westawitoq ntgijewei wenji'guom.
My older sister has saved my mother's house.

Teluejig na ginap maw westawlet.
It is said that a mythical hero is most gifted.

Ewi'tut gaqi'sg a'sutmaqanigtug westawu'lgw.
The Savior is often mentioned in prayers.

wesua'latl.translation: He/she takes a hold of him/her
example:
Lpa'tu'ji'j welamatl nmu'ji'jl aq wesua'latl.
The little boy likes the looks of the little puppy and takes a hold of
it.

Wesua'q na gigji'w iga'tu'n na'te'l.
If you put it too close to there it will sink in.

Mu geju'lnu na tlpuatmn, gatu telo'tmann wesuasgiagl.
I don't know if that is what you want, but I find they are sinking in.

Nitap wesuasgiet wastewigtug.
My friend is sinking into the snow.

Nitap wesua't sisguigtug.
My friend sinks into the mud.

wesua'teget.translation: He/she hauls in a pot (in a poker game)
example:
Etug i't'tew na'gweg wesua'tegei?
Will there ever be a day that I haul in the poker pot?

Ge's elisinij, wesuatejimatl.
While he/she is laying down, he/she pulls and drags him/her.

Wesuatejitoq na tepaqanji'j ge's welsesupe'g.
He/she is going to pull and drag the little sled while it's slippery.

Pas'g wesua'tu'tij ta'n goqwei wegetaq aq maita'jig.
They just take what they will need and leave.

Ge's wesuegej na papitaqan, nige' sewisga'to'q.
Because he/she kept jerking at the toy, now he/she has broken it.

Nige' pile'l a'pi'l wesuejo'qwa'latl.
Now he/she is going to tackle the new fishing net.

Egsitpu'nug pilei lugowaqan wesuejo'qwa'tueg.
Tomorrow morning we will tackle new work.

Nitap wesuelamit aq enmigtapetaq.
My friend inhales and dives into the water.

wesuepilatl.translation: He/she pulls him/her/it in by rope
example:
Gina'sit wesuepilatl ugta'piml.
He/she is working hard pulling in his/her fishing net.

wesuepilg.translation: He/she pulls it in by rope
example:
Wesuepilmi'tij ta'n goqwei gisimawo'tu'tij aq enmawlatmi'tij.
They pull together what they have gathered by rope and carry it
home.

Pilei legepilaqan wesuisepilas'g.
The new curtain that is gathered and tied.

Ala wesuisepilasit nta'pim gaqapijing.
My fishing net is hanging there gathered and tied.

Epite'ji'j wesuw'tqa'latl witape'sgwal aq poqt'tuwi'gi'g.
The little girl pulled her friend and they ran off.

Wesuw'tqanatl ugti'l, aq telmatl ge' nma'tinej.
While pulling at his/her dog, he/she tells him/her lets go home.

Wesuw'tqang ugtul ge's pemjajiga'sij.
He/she is pulling on his/her boat while he/she is going along the
shore.

Nemituap pemigsuw'tqa'tas'g utepaqan, miamuj natgoqwei
amsala's'tnutug.
I saw his/her vehicle being towed along, I assume something when
wrong (with it).

Ni'n wetagutm Pigie'laq
I'm related through the Vicaires.

wetagutijig.translation: They are related to one another through a common ancestor
example:
Wije'l pitu'ugmijual, na na'te'l wetagutijig.
They have the same great grandmother, thats how they are related.

Ji'nm pegising ga'qanigtug wetajigwet.
The man arriving at the door frowns.

Sa'n wetapaqamit Elsipugtug.
John is from Elsipugtug.

Tami wetapegsit Pie'l Pigie'l?
Where does Peter Vicaire decend from?

E'wmnej ula tmi'gn, me' wetapsunig.
Let's use this axe, it is more useful.

Ta'n te'sijig wetapsunultijig.
They are all useful.

Wen wetapulasnn nti'l, mu goqwei o'pla'tug.
Who scolded my dog, he does nothing wrong.

Etug gijga' wetaqama'si gesgmnaq mewlia'gwenug.
I think I'll have a little snack before lunch time.

Lpa'tuj pas'g wet'g suitis aq ejigleget.
The boy just tastes the candy and throws it away.

Weti'g gwiluanej toqo najiwsgetesnu.
Let's look for worms then we'll go fishing.

Nitap metua'l'j ta'n wetlamit.
My friend has difficulty with breathing.

Gaqisimilamu'g wetmamgewei gisgug eig.
There are many kinds of materials for smoking these days.

Gujmug i'tu'puguwait aq wetmat.
He/she keeps stepping outside to smoke.

Pipanima's ugtmein.
I will ask him/her if he/she is busy.

Wetmeiaqap nuji'j ulagu.
I kept my grandchild busy yesterday.

Pana pas'g alpuguit na ta'n wen aq wetmguet.
He/she just stands around in the way.

Wetmite'lmgig tapusijig apoqonmuinew.
I need two to help me.

wetmite'tg.translation: He/she has a need for it
example:
Gisigu wetmite'tg ugtaptu'n nugu'.
The old fella needs his cain now.

Wetmo'taqan na ula tet mattejuei.
A hammer is a useful tool here.

Mesgei wetmeiulnin, ge' apoqonmui?
I'm sorry to bother you, please help me?

Mu getu' wetmo'tmu na aptu'n.
I don't want to make use of that cain.

Ge' ugtmui?
Can you share a smoke?

Wetnasa'latl pile'l ugtatlaiml.
He/she tries on his/her new shirt.

Wetnasa'tuap na a'gusn getu'gji'tuap tepgmn.
I tried on that hat to see if it would fit me.

wetnasteg.translation: It is hooked or attached from
example:
Wetnasteg inaqaneg.
It is attached on the right.

Wetnatl ugwe'ji'jl aq telimatl wije'wi.
He/she pulls at his/her little sister and tells her to go with him/her.

Te'sipowl e'watl aq sangew wetng utepaqan.
He/she uses a horse and slowly pulls his/her car.

Wetpatl pgu'l aq we'gwiwigpatl.
He/she tastes the fudge and likes it immensely.

Gisgug wetqane'g.
It is mild today.

Me gatu wetqanigisg'g gisgug.
It's really mild today.

Pe' tmg wetqapalatl ugtatlaiml gesgmnaq gesistaqanagw.
He/she first soaks his/her shirt before laundering it.

Gesatm wetqapalsi.
I like to soak myself.

Tm'g ma'munjew wetqapatoq ligpenignapi gesgmnaq
poqjisgnewegw.
He/she soaks the ash splints thoroughly before he/she begins to
weave.

Wetqolugsi'gw lta'nenu na'te'l.
He/she forbids us from going there.

Mali wetqolsit mu wasamatann.
Mary keeps herself from over eating.

Ala Pie'leg na guntew wets'g.
That rock flew from Peter's place.

Mu gejiaqig ta'n wettaqie'tij, gatu geji'gig na'talagutijig.
I don't know their ancestry, but I know they are related.

Tami gugumij wettaqiet?
Where is your grandmother decended from?

Tami wettelg na anguowei?
Where did he/she buy that fur?

Wetteligeiap magasan ta'n atel gisgug gisipanta's'g.
I purchased from the store that just opened today.

Tami wetteluatl na ugti'l?
Where did he/she buy his/her dog?

Wettemit muta e'nata ugtia.
He/she is crying because he/she has lost his/her dog.

Wettemitl ugtapsute'gann, telta'sit e'nata.
He/she cries over his/her toy doll, he/she thinks he/she lost it.

wetteniaq.translation: The wind is blowing from such direction
example:
Gp'te'snug wetteniaq.
The wind is blowing from the South.

wettepna'tl.translation: He/she tries to catch up with him/her/it
example:
Gina'sit pemtugwi'g wettepna'tl witapal.
He/she is running trying hard to catch up with his/her friend.

wettepne'g.translation: He/she tries to catch up with it
example:
Gina'sit, gwitnn wettepne'gl.
He/she ties hard, trying to keep up with the canoes.

wett'g.translation: The wind is blowing from such direction
example:
Ugjipenug wett'g.
The wind is blowing from the east.

We'tunatl lapail, getu'gjijiatl ta'n wetspenij.
He/she feels around the tub, he/she want to know where it's
leaking from.

We'tung na gmu'j ta'n teligsug.
He/she can feel the weight of the piece of wood.

Wiaqiaqal na aligal, ge' tepgiso'tui.
Those clothes are all mixed, would you seperate them for me.

wiaqqatmu'tijig.translation: They are a variety of inhabitants
meanings: different or unrelated people living together in one place
example:
Maljewe'jg aq gisigu'g wiaqqatmu'tijig na'te'l.
Young and old live there together.

Nmu'ji'jg aq gajuewji'jg etlwiaqqiejig.
Puppies and kittens are mixed.

Ms't wen welaptmuaj wi'g ta'n teliulugwas'g.
Everyone like the way his/her house is decorated.

Wigamig ula wius.
This meat is lean.

Nti wigamit.
My dog is lean.

Wigapu'g na wigunapu gisitu'n.
That is good tasting bean soup you made.

Plamu na mawwigapugsit.
Salmon tastes really good.

Ge' jugwasgnnmui na pase'g wi'gatign.
Would you pass me that thick book.

Iga'taqanigtug llia aq nmisgu tapusijig wi'gatignipgwig.
Go to the garden and get two heads of lettuce.

Wi'gatigno'guomg wi'gatign etliesgmatmap oqwa'q.
The book I was waiting for has arrived at the library.

Gi's gi'l nemitu'n telpugwelg wigew?
Have you ever seen so much fat?

Wigewigu's na tujiw wi'sisg welwigewultijig.
October is when the animals are nice and fat.

Welwigewit wi'sis gisgaje'g ugjit gesig.
A well-fattened animal is ready for the winter.

Ala' pilei wi'gign pewalg.
I want that new pencil.

Nipugtug na wigit nitap.
My friend lives in the woods.

Wigji'jaqann etlmawo'tas'gl ligpenigenigtug.
The toys are all put into a basket.

Gi's nutmn na a'tugwaqan ugjit wiglatmu'j?
Have you heard the story about the dwarf?

Pastung eliei aq atnmi'gig nigmaq.
I going to the USA to visit with my relatives.

We'gwiwigpatl nme'jl gisla'mutl.
He/she really likes the fish that was served to him/her.

Ula na nitap mawwigpet.
This friend of mine really likes to drink (alcoholic beverages).

Ge' jugo'tui na wigpe'tlaqann, getuitu ligpenign
Bring me those basket strips, I want to make a basket with them.

Mu' nugu' te'sigw wigpi'g gniputminaq.
There are no longer as many elms in our forest.

Wigplasit plamu gispugana'tasij.
A salmon has smoke residue after it has been smoked.

Telmilpugana'teget lpa wigplateg ta'n wigij.
He/she smokes so much meat and things his/her house is coated
with smoke residue.

Mu geitu ta'n wejiaq, gatu we'gwiwigplatewma'q.
I don't know where it's coming from, but it smells really smoky.

Nti wejiet gigjiw pugtewigtug, nige' wigplatewma't.
My dog has been near the fire, now he/she smells smokey.

wigt'g.translation: He/she likes the taste of it
example:
Pie'l mawigt'g pilei pipnaqan.
Peter really likes the taste of fresh bread.

Wi'guamatl etliewsitutmnij.
He/she finds him/her amusing as he/she acts silly.

Nitap wi'guapt'g ta'n goqwei pemiaq.
My friend is amused by what's going on.

Wiguaq wesgowa'sit etllugwatg wiguow.
He/she is busy working at home working on his/her house.

Maw wi'gue'g na gisigu ala'tet wigit.
The old man who lives over there is very strange.

Mqatu'ltesg nutepaqan, pas'g na igantlimul, wi'gu'lugweg.
I'll lend you my car, but I'll tell you first, it works strangely.

Pie'l geji'g negm wigumat.
I know that Peter is a heavy smoker.

Pas'g gisjiglgimatl, nige' ap etlwigumatl.
He/she just sent him/her away, now he/she calling him/her back.

Gina'muo'guomg wigumgewigu's mijua'ji'jg apaita'jig.
Children return to school in September.

Wigumgusimgewei mes'nmu's'p?
Did you recieve an invitation?

Wigapu'gt's na wigunn, aq pilei pipnaqan aq p'tewe'ji'j nige'.
What would be delicious now is beans, and fresh bread and some
tea.

Na we'gwiwigwasamu'g wesgo'tg etlgna'toq.
It looks so lovely, that decorating he/she is working on.

Wigwasamugsit na guji'j.
Your grandchild is cute.

Wigwasapewit na e'pit etlagnutmaioq.
That woman you're talking with is very attractive.

Apjiw gjijiaten gigjiw ig, muta nutuaten alwigwa'smugwet.
You can always tell when he/she is close by because he/she can
be heard whistling.

Wigweliej na mawulnutut gatu metu'nmu't.
A whip-poor-will can be heard well but very hard to see.

Tewjigispnet, lpa etlwigwiet na'te'l.
He/she was so tired that he/she collapsed right there.

Eltu na wigwom nipugtug.
I'm going to make a wigwam in the woods.

Ula wasamgilg, wijei pewalg, pas'g me' gijga' apje'ji'jit.
This one is too big, I want the same one, but a little bit smaller.

Nipg na mawpugwelg wije's nemi't.
Summer is when you'll see a lot of flies.

Nuji'j ms't tami elwije'watl uggwitl.
My grandchild accompanies his/her mother everywhere.

Ugsisl elienij tami, smtug na getu wije'wet.
If his/her older brother goes anywhere, he/she immediately wants
to tag along.

Lisa wije'w'g utepaqan, ela'tas'g Muliang.
Lisa will accompany her car, it's being taken to Montreal.

Wijgwe'j ngatg we'gwigitnmeiwig.
The blister on my foot is hurting me.

Amjaqamn na ga'qia, wijgwe'jua's'tew.
If you rub that on your skin, it will blister.

Wijgwe'jua'sit nqon aq gesnuguit.
My heel is blistering and it is hurting me.

Sa'qawei geggung wijgwe'tlaqan, ngij ignmuipnn.
I have an old birch bark dish, my mother gave me.

Ula e'pijig wijig'tijig.
These women are siblings.

Pie'l toqllugwe'titl wijigumatl.
Peter works with his sibling.

Megwe'saqsigl wijinuann ula gujmug wejiet.
He/she has rosy cheeks from being outside.

Wijitgo'tmeg na nutepaqan glapis gisa'tas'g.
We're going to stay with my vehicle until it's fixed.

Ta'n tujiw liej Gepeg, wijitgweiwa's.
When he/she goes to Quebec, I will join him/her.

Nuji'j atel wili gismnja'q.
My grandchild's belly button stub just fell off.

Amujpa geltaqpilmutl wiliapi'l qopisun gisigs'tqamuij.
You have to tie off the infant's umbilical cord after the birth.

wilogamatl.translation: He/she catches full view of him/her
example:
Wilogamatl witapal wejgu'wenitl.
He/she catches full view of his/her friend approaching.

wilogapt'g.translation: He/she catches a full view of it
example:
Welta'sit, muta nige' wilogapt'g wiguow.
He/she is glad, because he/she now has full view of his/her home.

Gi's gismawo'tu'tij wiluwow ugjit gesig.
They already have gathered their provisions for the winter.

Eimu'tijig na wi'n mawwigtmi'tij.
There are those who really like the taste of marrow.

Winangiaq na gisiilego'tu'n npo'qon.
That bed you just made is wrinkled.

Atel gis jitnanqa'l'g ula ntatlaim, gatu teleiaq me' newte' telwinaqiet.
I just ironed my shirt, but I find it is still wrinkled.

Wen na ugti'l, telwinapewinitl?
Who's dog is that, it's so unattractive?

Amuj winapit na nmu'j, mu nemitug ga'qan ta'n tltu'etew.
That dog must see poorly, he/she can't see the door to get out.

Wi'nei waqantew na mawglu'lg ugjit npisun.
Marrow bons is excellent as medicine.

Ngwe'ji'j wingutaieg.
My younger sister and I are poorly shoed.

winigg.translation: It is ugly in appearance, shape or dress
example:
Amgwes telwinigg nutepaqan.
This is my first ugly vehicle.

winigisg'g.translation: It is a bad weather day
example:
Mawsiwa'lueg na pegijiwinigisg'g.
It's very tiresome when the weather is bad for too long.

winigit.translation: He/she/it is ugly in appearance, shape or dress
example:
Me' gatu winigit na apsute'gan!
My, that is an ugly doll!

Ta'n tujiw winigwa'sij na geji't mu wels'tmug.
When he/she scowls you know that he/she doesn't like the sound
of it.

winigwetuatl.translation: He/she makes a face at him/her
example:
Wijig'tijig winigwetatijig.
The two siblings make faces at each other.

winigwetutg.translation: He/she has a mean facial expression
example:
Magasane'j na we'gwiwinigwetutg.
That store clerk has a mean facial expression.

Gisigu'sm nugu' na nti, aq wininuit.
My dog is old now, and has a mean disposition.

Mu ni'n nata'wisugwatmu winisqi.
I don't know how to cook tripe.

winjig.translation: It is in a bad condition
example:
Winjig na ula wius pegisitu'n.
This meat you brought is in bad shape.

Winjit na a'pi etlie'w't.
That net you are using is in bad condition.

Mu eimug wi'sis ta'n winnmat.
There is no animal that is messy.

Ninnu gisi petm.
I accidently bit my tongue.

Amujpa winpasi ula egsitpu'g, wesamgneg ugtejg eim.
I have to hustle this morning, I'm too far behind.

Winpegijuig wejiei, apanguai.
I'm back from Bathurst, where I went shopping.

Mawiewlimut wen ta'n tuji'w winpnej.
People are downcast when they have a venereal disease.

Teluejig negm winqamigsit.
They say he/she has a bad character

Teluejig na ji'nmji'j maw winsit.
They say that, that young man acts very bad.

Wipit gesnuwaj.
His/her tooth is hurting him/her.

Nwis nige' wipitmit.
My son now has teeth.

Nipitoqoml gesnugwigl gisgug.
My gums are aching today.

Gisgug apigtantaqatijig, ms't wen wipsgunatl wapusl.
From today's hunt, everyone has (caught) a single rabbit.

wipsgung.translation: He/she has only one of it
example:
Wipsgung maqtawe'g magot.
She has only one black dress.

Jijuaqa na nte'pitem wisawaltugwat.
Sometimes my wife is blonde.

Wisawe'g nta'gusn algwilm.
I'm looking for my ochre brown hat.

Wisawgwesgl gelu'lgl ugjit mpisun
Golden thread is good for medicine.

Wisawimgwe'gl la pile'l pita'qaweiml.
My new pants are orange.

meanings: take a laxative, purgative, or aperient
example:
Malpale'wit telimt'pnn amujpa wisawinpisit.
The doctor told him/her he/she has to take a laxative.

Gi's gi'l gegunmn wisawow?
Have you ever had jaundice?

Wisawsuliewei na mawimgite'tas'g.
Gold is highly desirable.

Gisgaqsit aq ma'munwise'g nige'.
He/she got burned and now he/she has many scars.

Wi'segesit na njigun ta'n jileiaqap.
There is a burning sensation where I injured my knee.

Wi'segeteg ta'n etljileiap.
I have a burning sensation where I was injured.

Ta'n tujiw gelulg wius ma pugweltnug wisgaqan.
When the meat is good quality there is very little gristle.

Telo'tm gesima'munwisgaqanig ula wius.
I find this meat has way too much of gristle.

Pugwelg wisgipg gistuo'tu sepei.
I took out a lot of stove ashes this morning.

Ge natsigua'lates na wisgipgo'q, Tiotis?
Would you go and empty the ash bin, Tiotis?

Tlia' ugjo'tg mu tla'tegn, gijuaqa na wen wisguet.
Even when he/she tries not to be, sometimes one is envious.

Gisigui'sgw wisgu'patl uggisiguml te'siula'gw.
The old lady cooks for her husband every evening.

Na ji'nm etlwisgwia'teget, Unma'gig na tleiawit.
That man playing the bagpipes, he's from Cape Breton.

Wisigat na ula jile'g'p.
He/she is scarred from his/her injury.

Wisigwat na ji'nm wejgwipisgwa't.
That man coming in has a scarred face.

Amgwes na mawpugwelia'tipnig wi'sisg.
Animals were plentiful at one time.

Wi'sitji'jg pemita'jig, pemulgwala'titl uggwijual.
The little animals are going along, following their mother.

Wisnaw ma' atgilug aq gpitn.
A perch will not be any bigger than your hand.

Wisnuti we'jitu'n, na we'jiates tia'm.
If you find a moose trail, you will find a moose.

Wastew gisa'lig wisqaplgigwai.
The snow causes me to be snow blinded.

Gaqatepiet wisqasaw ula ntmiti'sminaq.
There are plenty of pine cones on this trees of ours.

wisqatesguatl.translation: He/she drops in on him/her suddenly and unexpectedly
meanings: drops in on someone suddenly and unexpectedly
example:
Mali pejimittugwet aq wisqatesguatl uggwitl.
Mary came for a visit and surprised her mother.

We'gwiwisqegl aloqomann mestmapnn ulagu.
The grapes I tasted yesterday were very bitter.

Angweiu na, mawinta'wisqegetl tu'aqann.
Be careful of him/her, he/she habitually throws the ball fast.

Amu wisqijiglsing.
The bee flies away quickly.

Mawwisqilue'wit na njignam.
My little brother is quick tempered.

Ejela'toq ta'n telwisqipgising, naqsipeita'pnig ms't.
He/she couldn't help arriving suddenly, they all arrived early.

Ntue'm gesatg wisqi'pij.
My horse likes to run at full speed.

Wisqoq na e'wut ligpnign eltmg.
Black ash is used when making a basket.

Ula wissei jipji'jg e'wmi'tij.
The birds use this nest.

Wowgwisewei wisse'j we'jituap.
I found a fox's nest.

Sepei wissugwalapnn go'qoli'gwejl.
This morning he/she cooked a chicken.

Giswissugwai ugjit mewlia'gwegewei.
I cooked lunch for myself.

Etug mgegn giswissugwatg, ula wius telmelgoqteg.
I think that he/she cooked some leather, this meat is so tough.

Wen sapo'nug wissugwatigetew?
Who will cook tomorrow?

Je'g wissuignematl umisl.
Jack overpowers his older sister.

Glapis gatu wissuignetgeg ta'n goqwei ne'gaw wesgweiaj.
He/she finally overcame what's been bugging him/her all along.

Gis sa'q mnaq nutmu na wisun.
I haven't heard that name for a long time.

Getu' wisungalatl ugtue'ml.
He/she wants to give his/her horse a name.

Ugtul wisungatg'p, nige' mu wels'tmug.
He/she named his/her boat, now he/she doesn't like the sound of
it.

Ulo'nug witapa mawtuatalultijig.
Tonight he/she is going out to eat with friends.

Taluisinitl Mali witape'sgwal?
What is Mary's female friend's name?

Wejgwita'jig na ta'n te'sijig nitapji'jg.
All my little friends are coming here.

Wittn asgaiatl.
His/her nostils are causing him/her pain.

Witu'l wape'gl nugu'.
His/her whiskers are white now.

Je'g aq Pie'l pusgiwitua'tijig a'lutasimg.
Jack and Peter are often partners while guiding.

Negm ugsisl witunnitl.
His/her older brother has whiskers.

Pas'g newte' apje'jijg wiu'ji'j pewatm.
I just want one small piece of meat.

Wigapu'g na wius gisoqsmn.
That meat you cooked tastes good.

Ula wiuse'j mawmujgajewei wius netuisgetoq.
This butcher sells the best meat.

Wo'gumal teluisinitl Mali.
His/her cousin's name is Mary.

So'sep aq Pie'l wo'gumatijig.
Joseph and Peter are related.

Gisigui'sgw wo'gwin gesnuwaj.
The old lady's backbone is sore.

Wowul jugwa'laj tet.
Have him/her bring the cooking pot here.

Wanne'g ala'sip wowgwis igtig'wela'gwe'g.
There was a fox roaming around up the reserve the other night.

Ango'te'n, mut pijiew na wowj.
Be careful, don't fall in that pit.
